Job Description:
Responsibilities
  • Develop review and implement HR strategies and policies that support business goals.
  • Involved in full recruitment cycle from posting of job advertisements to shortlisting and preparation of offer package.( posting of job advertisements scheduling job interview conducting pre-screening interviews and reference checks.)
  • Prepare employment contracts certification letters and other HR related letters.
  • Manage on-boarding and off-boarding activities
  • Maintain organisation's employees' database
  • Responsible in work pass application process
  • Organise activities and events to increase employee bonding and engagement.
  • Manage employee relations including grievances and disciplinary issues.
  • Assist in annual performance management process
  • Identify training needs and sourcing for relevant programs
  • Other ad hoc HR & Administrative functions as and when required
  • Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in Human Resource Management or equivalent.
  • At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
  • Preferably Senior Executive specialized in Human Resources or equivalent.

The Human Resource Assistant is responsible for handling the daily administrative and HR duties of an organization ensuring the efficient performance of the department. They assist HR Managers with record maintenance and provide clerical support to other employees.

A summary of the responsibilities of this position are and not limited to as follows:
  • Timely Data entry
  • Maintaining proper and accurate records.
  • Adhoc administrative duties assigned.


Qualifications And Requirements
  • Highly proficient in MS Excel and related business and communication tools.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to accurately follow instructions
  • Attention to details

Unveiled in 1989 Expressions is a recognized pioneer in the beauty industry. It adopts the philosophy of total wellness offering a wide range of facial and slimming treatment as well as spa therapy. All of which are supported by high technology equipment and service-excellence standards.

This position will be involved in the Company’s day to day HR and operations function by providing clerical and administrative support to the Human Resource Managers and Executives and acting as the liaison with employees regarding HR related matters.

Responsibilities
  • Provide direct support to employees on HR-related matters
  • Maintain all employee records such as employment status annual/medical leave records and any other employee benefits
  • Facilitate payroll processing by generating timesheet and tracking leave usage
  • Generate reports from point-of-sales system to calculate sales commissions
  • Assist in resolution of any payroll and commission errors
  • Process employee medical reimbursement
  • Participate in recruitment process by posting job advertisements processing job applications scheduling job interviews work pass applications preparing new employee file and filing of employment contracts and conducting orientation
  • Oversee manpower planning and coordination
  • Liaise with insurance vendor for employee insurance application and termination
  • Provide administrative support in application of government work grants and programme
  • Monitor and manage uniform stock and assign uniform to new and existing staff

This position (Trainee) reports to the Human Resources (HR) Manager in a rotation areas and interfaces with stakeholders in the function and HR staff. The Trainees will be on a 9 months rotation program within Field HR Talent Acquisition and Colleague Service teams (rotate every 3 months). The Trainees will be able to learn and understand basic knowledge and be able to practice HR professional tasks during the 9 months training program.

During the 9 months rotation program the Trainee will be involved in:
  • Talent Acquisition process
  • Hands-on in Hiring and Firing activities and documentation
  • Facilitate programs/ activities to drive employee engagement and performance
  • Employee orientation and training logistics and recordkeeping
  • Practice HR services policies and programs
  • Support line managers on all HR related matters

Requirements
  • Degree/Diploma in Human Resource Management or equivalent
  • Proficient in MS Office (PowerPoint and Excel)
  • Duration of traineeship: 9 months

Who Are We Looking For

We are looking for a Finance and HR Administrative superstar with a passion for office administration excellence. You are kind and positive. You have a meticulous attention to detail and love to keep things in order. You love to organise and keep a purposeful structure in all you do.

Your Current Mood

You have spent the past 3-5 years in a slow and bureaucratic workplace. You find it stifling and you are starting to feel that you can contribute more. You want to make an impact at work and make a dent in the universe. You want to be in a dynamic fun and energetic environment. You feel that you have talents in abundance but they are not recognised. You want to step up to the plate now. You want to bat for home run and help build up the office administration of a fast growing company - Hubble.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be in charge of the overall HR/Finance/Admin administration work at Hubble. We will give you exposure to client side administrative work whereby you will work with our Key Account Managers and Business Development Managers to help support client success. You will be given exposure to learn more about the business side of things and also client side exposure.
  • We will give you exposure to client side administrative work whereby you will work with our Key Account Managers and Business Development Managers to help support client success.
  • You will be given exposure to learn more about the business side of things and also client side exposure.
  • Overall in charge of all HR/Finance/Business Support administrative matters.
  • To provide day-to-day clerical and office administrative support to the team.
  • Exposure to client side administrative work such as supporting sales and key accounts department in updating CRM software client account set ups invoicing scheduling preparation of meetings and other business administrative work as required

What Hubble Will Give You

Hubble is built by a team of talented driven and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. We do not let history and traditions dictate and limit our dreams to shape the world. We adopt the same mindset with our hiring. We are looking for the best and we want to bet on you. If you mindset is right we promise you the ride of your life.

Who Will You Be Working With

If you connect with any of the description below please apply immediately:
  • Purpose driven
  • Hungry ambitions and self-motivated
  • Meritocratic results/performance > age/bureaucracy
  • Resourceful independent chart our own destiny
  • Determined perseverance and hard working
  • Creative innovative out of the box
Yes the above is everyone of us at Hubble.

What We Need From You
  • Good communication and organizational skills.
  • Good interpersonal skill and able to interact with all level of staff.
  • Able to work independently and multi-task efficiently.
  • Positive work attitude and display initiative in problem solving.

About Hubble

Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man Machine Material Money) resources.

Our solutions help digitise all your work processes and connect all key project stakeholders - developers consultants fabricators contractors and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform.

Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come.

Visit us at to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

Assist in Payroll processing

Undertake any ad-hoc duties when required

  • Full spectrum of HR and administrations including Recruitment Compensations and Benefits Performance appraisal Payroll Processing implementation of policies staffs discipline/ disputes and other HR related functions.

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
As part of our growth we are currently seeking a seasoned HR practitioner to join our HR Team based in Singapore.


Responsibilities

 

You will be the primary interface and strategic HR business partner for assigned business units.  You will work closely with the business supporting their needs across the full spectrum of Human Resources including talent acquisition compensation & benefits performance management learning employee relations and budgeting etc.  You will develop and strengthen partnership with internal and external stakeholders provide advice pertaining to HR issues as well as comprehensive HR solutions to organizational issues proactively.  You will also ensure HR policies are implemented according to established guidelines.

 

As a Manager you may be required to coach junior Human Resource partners in supporting other business units for the delivery of quality HR services.

 

In addition you are expected to lead and execute HR initiatives and programs effectively and be involved in continuous process review/ improvement projects.



Requirements

 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Human resources Management
  • At least 20 years’ broad HR experience gained in MNCs or large organizations
  • Experience in managing teams
  • Well versed in Singapore labour law
  • Ability to engage internal and external stakeholders and partners
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proactive takes initiative able to prioritise and multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Office applications and HCM tools

 

 

* Please apply with detailed resume stating current and expected salary.

* Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.

foodpanda is the leading on-demand food delivery company in Singapore bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture.

We are looking for an agile and highly-motivated Human Resource Executive who is passionate about people for our team in Singapore. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on exposure and have a direct impact then this may be the place for you! The ideal candidate will have a track record as a significant individual contributor – comfortable working independently whilst working closely with the rest of the stakeholders.

About The Job

This role will be based in Singapore and will report to the Human Resource Lead. As a Human Resource Executive you will be the liaison between the organization management and employees. This essential role helps ensure that employee needs are met and that every interaction is an opportunity to create a happy environment in the company!

Responsibilities
  • Manage daily HR administrative duties and point of contact on HR-related matters
  • Maintain employees’ data in Workday and digital P-files on a timely basis
  • Assist in HRMS migration efforts including data transfer and verification
  • Proactively recommend changes to current processes to ensure effective utilisation of HRMS
  • Conduct onboarding and offboarding processes
  • Ensure compliance with statutory reporting and filing requirements e.g. CPF IRAS MOM NS IRAS and all other government-related claims
  • Administer work passes application/issuance/renewal/cancellation
  • Handle work injury compensation and insurance annual renewal
  • Consistently review workflows and processes with an agile mindset to streamline for greater efficiency and effectiveness
  • Provide support to the HR Operations team in HR initiatives optimisation/innovation projects and strategies
  • Participate in the planning and execution of company events team-bonding activities and various HR initiatives
  • Any other HR projects and administrative duties as assigned


Requirements
  • At least 3-4 years of related working experience in a fast-paced/dynamic/agile environment
  • Possess Bachelor Degree in Human Resource Management
  • Must be well-versed in Singapore’s labour law and relevant legislation
  • Highly proficient in MS Office programs and Google applications
  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Possess good people and business acumen
  • Highly pragmatic approach to keep an overview especially under tight deadlines
  • Team player with excellent communication and prioritization skills
  • Enjoy working in a vibrant and fast-paced environment
  • Independent self-driven and meticulous
  • Immediate availability is preferred


What We Offer
  • Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve
  • Vibrant dynamic & international workplace
  • Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities
  • Tasty Thursdays
  • Birthday Leave
  • Work Anniversar(ies) Leave
  • Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company

Background

The Human Resource Division (HRD) in the Ministry of Law oversees and manages the Ministry’s HR functions in the areas of Manpower Planning Attraction Learning Development Performance Management and Talent Management. The Division is also responsible for Rewards Management Employees’ Well-Being. Officers can look forward to job rotation opportunities across the different functional areas based on competencies and area of interest.

1) Awards

Responsibilities

You will be part of the Human Resource Division and is responsible for the administration of Awards. Your area of responsibilities will include but not limited to the following:
  • Process Minlaw Staff Awards nominations
  • Ensure timely implementation of the Staff Awards and Recognition initiatives
  • Able to apply guidelines within a given context when administering staff benefits
  • Conduct periodic reviews to enhance the efficiency and rigour of the processes and work streams
  • Responsible for maintaining the archives as well as collection of data to support various management reports
  • Organise various staff recognition events and ceremonies


Requirements
  • Have 2-3 years of relevant working experience in administering Staff Awards
  • IT savvy and familiar with Microsoft office programmes like Excel and power point
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills to engage officers across all levels in the organisation
  • Ability to work independently and also a team player
  • Past working experience in the public sector is an added advantage

Neuron is the fastest growing micro-mobility operator in Asia Pacific and the leading shared e-scooter company across Australia and New Zealand. We partner with cities to connect people and places in a safe convenient and fun way. We are driven to help the world build a more prosperous and sustainable future through new ways of moving and connecting.

Neuron started the world's first scooter sharing platform in Singapore in 2016. We develop our own industry-leading e-scooters which are purpose built for sharing and safety. We also set the industry standard for technology that manages them. Neuron has launched an impressive range of world firsts particularly when it comes to safety. We currently operate in eight locations including Adelaide Brisbane Darwin Canberra Townsville and Auckland and will soon be expanding to the United Kingdom.

These are Neuron's Values:

Make it happen

We are driven by results make commitments with integrity and consistently make an impact.

Be proactive

We take ownership of tasks that help us build sustainable growth.

Trust facts over opinions

Whenever possible we make the logical choice based on data and known truths.

Stay curious

We embrace the habit of asking questions challenging assumptions and revisiting convictions.

Do more with less

Profit allows us to continue serving our users. We must be efficient and resourceful.

The Role
Reporting to the Regional HR Manager you would have the opportunity to be a critical member of the People Ops team and be involved in key strategic business-impacting decisions.

What you'll do:

  • Assist to set up the HR function including formulating policies and processes around performance management talent management and HR operations that suit the business
  • Drive implementation of initiatives related to overall people and business strategies
  • Daily operations across the HR functions including talent management onboarding compensation and benefits staff relations etc.
  • Assist in the performance and talent management process including managing the performance cycle and timelines across the region
  • Review formulate and update the HR staff handbook HR policies & procedures by keeping up to date with prevailing legislations and best practices
  • Ensuring accuracy and timeliness of payroll cycles statutory contributions and reports regionally
  • In charge of daily office operational needs for the Singapore office
  • Ad-hoc HR projects to grow the Company to the next stage


What you'll need:

  • 1-3 years of working experience in administrative or Human Resource function in a start-up environment preferred
  • Bachelor's degree in HR or Business Management or related
  • Ability to translate ambiguous problems into solutions
  • Ability to multitask be agile and keep up with the start-up high-growth phase
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Meticulous detail-oriented and highly organised
  • Knowledge about computing payroll as per Singapore employment regulations is advantageous
  • Exposure to software such as Justlogin (Payroll) and Xero (Finance) would be advantageous

If you are passionate about making a real-time impact and want the opportunity to play an instrumental part in our growth story we want you!

  • Neuron Mobility is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to making all employment decisions including recruitment appointment and promotion decisions on the basis of business needs individual qualifications and merit.

    • The company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are dedicated to the continued personal and professional growth of our employees. We protect all of our employees regardless of race nationality ethnicity politics sex sexual orientation gender identity social origin physical and mental disability religion or belief marital or domestic partnership status family or parental status and any other status recognised and protected by the law and regulations of where we operate.

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
Responsibilites:

  • Responsible for the full spectrum of HR & Admin support functions
  • Responsible for any issues e.g. staff enquiry / updates / system errors on SAGE Easypay
  • Maintain and update records relating to leave administration training & personnel records in Sage Easypay system
  • Manage recruitment process from advertising (through various job portals) to making interview arrangements
  • Prepare all HR related letters memos notices and office announcements to all staff
  • Updating and executing Training & Development programmes and records
  • Manage staff related insurance (WICA/Group policy)
  • Manage and facilitate processes for new hires including item issuance (e.g. shoes/laptops) arranging for Mentorship program
  • Facilitate performance appraisals and climate surveys every 6 monthly
  • Handles employee enquiries on HR Matters
  • Handles mandatory government related surveys
  • Filing Management raising PO Navision 
  • Updating organization chart monthly
  • Administer and maintain accurate HR database and up to date employee records
  • Update internal databases with new hire information
  • Submit CCL maternity/paternity leave NS WDA claims
  • Manage Staff transfer or change in allowance
  • Handle records of outsourced staffs
  • Manage Company Grab account
  • Assist in updating of Job Descriptions & Competency Matrix throughout company
  • Filing and archiving of documents for HR department
  • Prepare reports and documents for on-boarding/off-boarding process
  • Work closely with HR manager to ensure smooth operation in Human Resource Department and provide assistance for staff.
  • Promote a positive and open work environment where employees feel comfortable speaking up about issues
  • Any other HR Administrative duties assigned by HR Manager


Requirement

  • Bachelor/ Diploma in Business Managment with minimum 2 year of working experience
  • Strong drive and enthusiasm to becoming HR professional
  • Good language skill (both verbal & written)
  • Lively and out-going character

About Us

We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated omni-channel women's fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010 we have grown to 250 people strong proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong China Philippines and Australia New Zealand US Canada Macau Japan Korea Vietnam Thailand Myanmar Cambodia & Brunei).

We are taking our definition of new female retail global with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.

The Team

The Love Bonito team is a passionate dynamic innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers savvy marketers to tech whizzes we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer the Love Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact we could be the perfect fit for you!

The Role

People are at the heart of everything we do. With our rapid expansion it is becoming more important than ever that we do it right! We’re looking for a Talent Acquisition Partner to join our HQ team lead our Talent Acquisition vertical and help in building a best-in-class team for Love Bonito. Reporting into our Head of People & Culture you will spearhead all our efforts in recruiting a passionate and high performing team in a culture of openness learning operational excellence collaboration honesty and innovation.

You Should Have / Be
  • A Love Bonito ambassador with a good understanding of our culture
  • A general love for people and talent acquisition
  • A performance-driven attitude and a hunger and thirst for results and sales
  • Excellent communication and people skills
  • A high degree of professionalism judgment and discretion
  • Exceptional influencing abilities to create strong ‘voluntary’ buy-in by building strong relationships with stakeholders across all functions and levels
  • Superb planning project management multitasking and execution abilities
  • A charismatic influential yet relatable leader and team player
  • Charming and positive disposition self-starter attitude with an ability to communicate effectively with people of all levels
  • The ability to carry yourself extremely well - you will be responsible for establishing connections between aspiring candidates and the brand!


Main Responsibilities
  • Own the full recruitment cycle from end to end - across all areas and disciplines
  • Manage our employer branding by working with P&C Management as well as relevant internal teams to ensure LB remains top-of-mind as an employer of choice when one thinks female consumer retail in SEA
  • Identify screen and hire qualified candidates for our HQ and country teams across all functions particularly - Brand Commercial Technology & Finance.
  • Spearhead recruitment efforts across all levels from senior hires to campus and intern recruitment
  • Work with hiring managers to provide guidance expertise and collaboration to hire the best and most relevant talent for our teams
  • Proactively recruit high potential but passive candidates especially for mid-senior roles
  • Conduct screening of candidates based on job criteria and required competencies to create a pipeline of high calibre talent profiles for hiring managers
  • Maintain and constantly ensure a robust recruitment process that is relevant and supports internal teams while also ensuring that all prospective candidates get the most positive candidate experience no matter the outcome
  • Drive technology and optimize processes to enhance the overall recruitment process & efficiency
  • Leverage recruiting tools to get the job done better and more efficiently
  • Be innovative with the use of social media and other communication platforms in line with hiring trends to get the best candidates in the quickest way possible
  • Drive and execute internal and external talent sourcing activities such as talent referral program career fairs overseas recruitment remote hiring offshore teams etc.
  • Manage and facilitate employee onboarding including the conduct of first-day orientation as well as our monthly 2-day Experiential Onboarding programme
  • Track and analyze recruitment data such as candidate experience hiring sources turnaround time costs and trends with the use of our applicant tracking system


Requirements
  • 4-5 years of relevant talent acquisition experience
  • Experience with applicant tracking systems like Workable Greenhouse and tools like LinkedIn Recruiter
  • Experience with passive candidate sourcing
  • Experience headhunting hiring and motivating candidates
  • Experience with technical recruitment (e.g. software engineering product management data) will be a plus!
  • Strong understanding and grasp of social media alumni associations etc.
  • Good network with local universities (NUS NTU SMU SUTD Lasalle etc.)
  • BA/BS degree with specialization in Human Resource Management Marketing Communications or relevant fields


Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Benefits
  • Full corporate insurance
  • Staff discounts
  • A dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact

Job Title: Human Resources & Administration Professional - Attractive Salary + Excellent Benefits

  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Requirements:-
  • ‘N’ Level ‘O’ Level ITE ‘A’ Level Diploma Degree Master and other relevant qualifications
  • Meticulous and good analytical skills
  • Team player and positive working attitude
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills

Remuneration Will Commensurate With Qualifications And Working Experience.

Job Description

The Employee Experience team has a hand in every pie at Scoot crafting a workplace experience that authentically reflects the mission vision and values of the company; creating memorable meaningful and purposeful connections; building a team of service-minded stewards that work on behalf of the workforce; delivering tools and technology to enable seamless workflow and instilling enthusiasm if not excitement for the work at hand.

Your primary role will be to drive process reengineering initiatives including everything from preboarding to offboarding and everything in-between as part of the employee (office staff) lifecycle furthering the team’s objective of delivering a best-in-class employee experience.

Main Accountabilities
  • Advocate change and drive process improvement
  • Manage all aspects of office-based staff’s employee lifecycle
  • Main POC for HR-related queries for all office-based staff ensuring best-in-class support experience throughout lifecycle events (conversions confirmations renewals etc)
  • Maintain data integrity of all office-based staff (personal info leave admin bonus payments salary adjustments etc)
  • Work closely with Finance Payroll Business Partners and other specialist areas within the HR team on various HR support matters proposing and influencing solutions to reengineer processes
  • Ensure legal compliance and interpret employment laws & statutory requirements regulating C&B policies programs and administration
  • Company events planning & coordination
  • HR projects & initiatives

Relevant Experience
  • Degree holder in a relevant discipline
  • 2-4 years of relevant work experience
  • Passion in aviation a bonus

Key Skills
  • Strong work ethic
  • Detail-oriented
  • Excellent inter-personal skills
  • Possess a positive attitude; resourceful and self-motivated
  • Able to work independently with minimum supervision as well as in a team

Roles & Responsibilities
  • Handle full spectrum of HR function

About Us

We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated omni-channel women's fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010 we have grown to 250 people strong proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong China Philippines and Australia New Zealand US Canada Macau Japan Korea Vietnam Thailand Myanmar Cambodia & Brunei).

We are taking our definition of new female retail global with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.

The Team

The Love Bonito team is a passionate dynamic innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers savvy marketers to tech whizzes we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer the Love Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact we could be the perfect fit for you!

The Role

People are at the heart of everything we do. With our rapid expansion it is becoming more important than ever that we do it right! We’re looking for a Talent Acquisition Partner to join our HQ team lead our Talent Acquisition vertical and help in building a best-in-class team for Love Bonito. Reporting into our Head of People & Culture you will spearhead all our efforts in recruiting a passionate and high performing team in a culture of openness learning operational excellence collaboration honesty and innovation.

You Should Have / Be
  • A Love Bonito ambassador with a good understanding of our culture
  • A general love for people and talent acquisition
  • A performance-driven attitude and a hunger and thirst for results and sales
  • Excellent communication and people skills
  • A high degree of professionalism judgment and discretion
  • Exceptional influencing abilities to create strong ‘voluntary’ buy-in by building strong relationships with stakeholders across all functions and levels
  • Superb planning project management multitasking and execution abilities
  • A charismatic influential yet relatable leader and team player
  • Charming and positive disposition self-starter attitude with an ability to communicate effectively with people of all levels
  • The ability to carry yourself extremely well - you will be responsible for establishing connections between aspiring candidates and the brand!


Main Responsibilities
  • Own the full recruitment cycle from end to end - across all areas and disciplines
  • Manage our employer branding by working with P&C Management as well as relevant internal teams to ensure LB remains top-of-mind as an employer of choice when one thinks female consumer retail in SEA
  • Identify screen and hire qualified candidates for our HQ and country teams across all functions particularly - Brand Commercial Technology & Finance.
  • Spearhead recruitment efforts across all levels from senior hires to campus and intern recruitment
  • Work with hiring managers to provide guidance expertise and collaboration to hire the best and most relevant talent for our teams
  • Proactively recruit high potential but passive candidates especially for mid-senior roles
  • Conduct screening of candidates based on job criteria and required competencies to create a pipeline of high calibre talent profiles for hiring managers
  • Maintain and constantly ensure a robust recruitment process that is relevant and supports internal teams while also ensuring that all prospective candidates get the most positive candidate experience no matter the outcome
  • Drive technology and optimize processes to enhance the overall recruitment process & efficiency
  • Leverage recruiting tools to get the job done better and more efficiently
  • Be innovative with the use of social media and other communication platforms in line with hiring trends to get the best candidates in the quickest way possible
  • Drive and execute internal and external talent sourcing activities such as talent referral program career fairs overseas recruitment remote hiring offshore teams etc.
  • Manage and facilitate employee onboarding including the conduct of first-day orientation as well as our monthly 2-day Experiential Onboarding programme
  • Track and analyze recruitment data such as candidate experience hiring sources turnaround time costs and trends with the use of our applicant tracking system


Requirements
  • 4-5 years of relevant talent acquisition experience
  • Experience with applicant tracking systems like Workable Greenhouse and tools like LinkedIn Recruiter
  • Experience with passive candidate sourcing
  • Experience headhunting hiring and motivating candidates
  • Experience with technical recruitment (e.g. software engineering product management data) will be a plus!
  • Strong understanding and grasp of social media alumni associations etc.
  • Good network with local universities (NUS NTU SMU SUTD Lasalle etc.)
  • BA/BS degree with specialization in Human Resource Management Marketing Communications or relevant fields


Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Benefits
  • Full corporate insurance
  • Staff discounts
  • A dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact

As Director Human Resource Development you will define and implement corporate organizational development (OD) and learning and development (L&D) strategies plans and policies which are aligned with the delivery of the Organisation’s Strategic Plan.

You will also provide specialist expertise to the Divisional Director HR & Administration and the Senior Executive Team in the development of organisational culture competency planning talent management & succession planning leadership development employee engagement learning & development and all aspects of organisational change and development interventions.

You will lead and manage a specialist team of OD and learning practitioners in the development and delivery of aligned programmes including the provision of team and individual solutions across the organisation aligned with the Strategic Plan.

Other Key Responsibilities Include
  • Manage the implementation of OD TM and L&D Strategies Plans and Policies against agreed corporate time frames and budget and reporting based on agreed performance measures.
  • In partnership with the Divisional Director develop the corporate People Strategy and Operational Plan and support the Divisional Director in the management and development of the Division.
  • Lead the development and oversee the implementation of a culture of continuous learning and development aligned with the requirements of the company’s current and future strategies.
  • Lead the development of integrated systems to support learning needs analysis objective setting and development planning. Drive the development of effective learning for the enabling of objectives building capabilities and driving performance.
  • Design and lead Succession Planning and Talent management across the organization. Identify and strengthen bench strength for the critical positions. Identify and develop talent as well as build accelerated pipeline pathways including managed moves and targeted assignments.
  • Develop and implement the Leadership & Management Development Framework deliver key performance targets and key corporate objectives such as the implementation of learning and development solutions to support reflective leadership and management practice objective setting and personal development planning.
  • Lead and provide leadership for the development and implementation of the Organisational Capability Framework and ensure that all activities across the OD & Learning Plans are organised to ensure a coordinated approach to program delivery.
  • Lead and provide leadership for the development of a highly engaged workforce through holistic engagement strategies and an effective leadership culture.
  • Facilitate the delivery of executive coaching and high quality action learning to senior directors and service heads across the Organisation.
  • Design and facilitate the implementation of Values workshops gamifications and awards to foster and support the organizational culture. Embed and reinforce the culture through various HR processes and systems.
  • Work with the Director HRM to ensure that all implications of operational & organisational development activities are fully understood and that there is an integrated response to delivery across both functions.
  • Develop and embed an approach to the evaluation of organisational development and learning activities and ensure the delivery of key objectives and impactful or value add outcomes.


Requirements

  • Background in organizational development/organizational behaviour or psychology with minimum 6 years of experience working with organizational development for operations in a large organizational and/or functional business unit.
  • A strong people leader and developer; and culture catalyst
  • A team player with good communication and analytical skills
  • Good business acumen and excellent interpersonal skills
  • Strong organisational sensing and apt at systemic problem solving

Happiness Hero ( StartUp - Senior HR Manager )

“You need us as much as We need You”

We are offering an opportunity for a Happiness Hero to get in on the ground floor of an early StartUp with significant growth potential in the creation of a localise Gig Economy App for Singapore by Singapore by spearheading the various human resources functions end to end.

Requirements

 The Role

Our most valued asset is our human capital. That is why we are looking for a Happiness Hero to join our team. You’ll be the first HR hire and should be excited about contributing at both hands-on and strategic levels and have a proven track record of positively influencing teams and their leaders.

As our first HR hire you will have the opportunity and responsibility to shape our thinking to design our approach to HR to deliver on our responsibilities to our people and to make our team effective and productive.

The Happiness Hero will be responsible for our systems processes tools and compliance and will manage benefits and the onboarding and offboarding of new employees.

Most importantly together with the founding team you will create implement and promote a sustainable culture of a positive high performing environment.

The Successful Applicant

The Happiness Hero must be entrepreneurial pro-active and high performing Head of HR from an international service digital or technology organisation based in Singapore. You must have extensive HR Business Partner and Generalist experience and ideally have a blend of corporate and StartUp experience managing sizable and small teams. You should have experience setting up and developing People Strategy Operations and Projects from Scratch with excellent communication skills. Ability to navigate ambiguity and put in place an effective HR strategy operating in a strategic and operation HR lead position.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Working with the founding team to create and sustain a thriving performance driven culture that brings out the best in each employee and sets the highest expectations for the firm’s responsibilities and competitive performance
  • Autonomously lead the design implementation and iteration of new people programs as well as assess and improve current people programs.
  • Develop a compensation and benefits strategy that enables us to attract and retain exceptional talent and build a highly scalable business
  • Build best-in-class people programs in recruiting onboarding and learning & development
  • Lead effective and consistent implementation of performance management practices across the organization including leadership development accelerated development succession planning coaching talent reviews and terminations.
  • Direct the development and administration of proactive and progressive compensation and benefits programs to attract motivate incentivize and recognize effective performance.
  • Hire train and develop the HR team
What We Look For
  • A track record of increasing HR responsibility ideally at one or more growth-stage StartUp; you have helped scale a company from – 10 to 50-100 and can anticipate the challenges we’ll face as we grow and are willing to flex between strategic and hands-on when needed
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity in a start-up environment complex problem-solving capabilities and ability to prioritize effectively
  • Strong business acumen that can translate company priorities to HR priorities and in turn build operational excellence
  • A global mindset with the ability to balance creating consistent global processes with local requirements
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Willingness to drive results by rolling up your sleeves with a can-do approach to work
  • Bring expertise on HR best-practices (including compliance management) while driving continuous improvement for a scalable and sustainable model
  • Create and maintain effective organization of responsibility including training coaching recognition workflow patterns performance standards delineation of duties and responsibilities.
  • Exceptional planning skills and ability to manage multiple high-visibility projects simultaneously
  • Ability to deliver within deadlines and strength in facilitating change on a broad scale
  • Proven ability to deal with conflict and diffuse difficult situation
  • Strong thought leadership and best practices in HR Recruiting Performance Management Compliance and Talent Management/Development
  • Deep experience leading and scaling innovative organizations
  • A track record of investing in and developing talent on your teams
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Ability to build and maintain robust scalable systems and processes
Bonus Points
  • Familiar in WSQ ATO
  • Familiar with WSG schemes
  • Familiar with various SG Government grants
Next Steps
  • Prepare your updated resume (please include your current salary package with full breakdown such as base incentives annual wage supplement etc.) and expected package.
  • Apply through this application or send your resume to click apply in MS Word Copy
  • All shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

About Supernova

We are the fastest growing lifestyle & beauty omni-channel ecommerce company. We build iconic beauty and lifestyle brands for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach we connect with over 15 million women on social media every week. Headquartered in Singapore we currently have offices in Melbourne London LA and New Delhi. Our brands include Sand & Sky and Coco & Eve.

About Supernova’s Internal Engine

Together we create Superstars! Our three company pillars are guided by this motto: Our product and brands are of the highest quality and within the top five in their category; our customers are the focus of our actions and their lives improve with our products; our talent and employees grow and develop within Supernova.

This means that investing in hiring developing and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Living our core values of #MakeAnImpact #TalkAboutIt #SeekNewOpportunities #DelightAndSurprise and #MoveForwardTogether creates a unique culture across five different time zones and allows us to realise the enormous potential of this exciting industry. If you’re an ambitious smart natural collaborator who likes taking risks influencing and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment we’d love to talk to you about joining our team.

About The Job

We are looking for a smart fun and energetic People Manager based in Singapore who is looking to take the next step in their career in our global headquarters in Singapore! You’ll be challenged to push boundaries make a significant difference and recommend bold actions to solve tough business problems globally. A big part of your day-to-day will involve partnering the business on operational and developmental needs. You will get creative and be hands-on in overseeing all aspects of the employee lifecycle from Day 0 to exit ensuring that our people are set up for success in their roles while having an exceptional experience as a Superstar.

Reporting to the People Director this role provides tremendous opportunity for the right candidate: to capture the energy and rapid pace of a fast growing start-up while being responsible for a sizeable and growing part of our global footprint. If you have a solid operational foundation in People and are ready to break from tradition make your own mark and help shape Supernova for the years to come we are excited to hear from you.

Responsibilities
  • Develop and manage the compensation and benefits structure aligned to industry standards in all our key markets
  • Manage operational People policies that are compliant in all our key markets and aligned to business needs
  • Provide People guidance and support to the offices across a breadth of areas including talent management employee development performance management and employee relations
  • Manage Payroll operations including execution and management of payroll providers
  • Develop manage and implement successful and consistent People initiatives
  • Manage and maintain our Learning & Development initiatives to ensure that our Superstars are supported in their development needs
  • Regularly complete a training needs analysis and develop an annual training schedule
  • Manage employee engagement through our tool and recommend initiatives to achieve a highly engaged team
  • Assess the People implications of business initiatives and provide advice for improvement
  • Develop and implement people solutions to make teams more effective
  • Work with leaders and key stakeholders to create positive fun and productive workplace
  • Line management for People Operations


About You
  • 5+ years of progressive human resources generalist experience
  • Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources Management or related discipline
  • Proven experience with operational People performance management L&D employee engagement and compensation and benefits
  • Solid business acumen with a keen eye and interest in People analytics
  • Strong leadership skills ability to manage conflicting priorities in a fast paced environment. Be self directed and motivated. Proven interpersonal facilitation and negotiation skills
  • Experience in creative problem solving influencing change management and eliminating barriers at any organisational level
  • Ability to develop trusting relationships to gain support and achieve results at all levels of the organisation.
  • Experience in training and developing employees in a high performance culture
  • Highly adaptable hands-on and personable across all levels within the organisation
  • Prior experience in a start-up environment required
  • Experience in an online-based brand e-commerce or digital/tech firm preferred
  • Previous global exposure and experience strongly preferred

In return you will get
  • Be part of a revolutionary Social E-Commerce company
  • Competitive package
  • Access to a personal Lifestyle Spending Account
  • Extensive medical cover

This job has everything for the right applicant and is available immediately. All applications will be treated confidentially.

Job Title: Manager to Senior Manager| Human Resource Development
Job Description:
Purpose Of Job

You will be supporting STB’s Learning & Development (L&D) framework to identify competencies and training to support STB’s business strategies and staff development. You will also take the lead in developing and driving strategies as well as delivering initiatives to improve organisational health and support corporate transformation as part of Organisation Development (OD) in STB. You will be STB’s culture steward in championing a healthy work-life culture anchored on STB’s values. To perform in this role you will need to collaborate closely with internal stakeholders at all levels to have a thorough understanding of STB’s organisational culture and capabilities.

Main Responsibilities

Learning and Development
  • Identify learning opportunities within the Board and design and implement leadership development and e-learning initiatives.
  • Overall in charge of developing training interventions to develop STB's middle managers. These include identifying and rolling out a suite of programmes (e.g. training mentoring) to support their leadership development.
  • Play a partnering role to line units in understanding their business needs helping them identify competency gaps and curate relevant L&D interventions.
  • Monitor training takeup and budget utilisation and assess effectiveness of training delivery
  • Drive and implement strategies to strengthen the learning culture within STB
Organsational Development
  • Analyse and diagnose organisational health. Interpret relevant qualitative and quantitative data through means such as the organisational climate surveys to identify root causes of organisational challenges.
  • Work with management team and HR business partners to design review and implement effective OD initiatives to address challenges.
  • Develop and track metrics to keep pulse of STB’s organisational health index.
  • Deliver initiatives to strengthen staff engagement these include administering of the recreational club internal dialogue sessions townhall sessions and staff-related events.
Requirements

You should possess at least 6 years of relevant work experience in organisational development and/or L&D. You should be keenly aware of the latest learning technologies innovative learning solutions and best practices in L&D and leadership development.

To be successful in the role you need strong communications (written & verbal) stakeholder engagement analytical and facilitation skills. You should have a keen eye for details and enjoy project management/delivery. You need to be proactive adept at managing strong relationships with line units and driven to deliver in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You are able to work independently but should contribute to team synergy within the division. This is an individual contributor role with the opportunity to lead project teams where relevant.

HR & Office Executive

We are seeking an HR & Office Executive to join our team and support on day-to-day office and HR operations. You will be part of a team who is passionate dedicated and has fun in their work.

Responsibilities

Office Operations
  • Answer and screen phone calls
  • Mail and parcel delivery and distribution
  • Maintain and order office stationery and pantry supplies
  • Oversee repairs and maintenance of the office space and equipment
  • Ensure office safety and cleanliness
  • Organise internal training meetings and social events and external client meetings/workshops
  • Update office policies when required
  • Maintain and update company databases
  • Travel and hotel arrangement
  • Support the Managing Director with expense claims timesheets and calendar management
  • Various ad hoc duties as and when required
HR Support
  • Assist with monthly payroll preparation and to work with payroll vendor
  • Prepare employment contracts confirmation and all HR related letters
  • Handle employee immigration and work pass related matters
  • Create update and maintain confidential staff personal files HR data and the HR filing system
  • Administration of staff leave and medical records insurance enrolment/termination and claims
  • Complete various statutory surveys and reports required by MOM CPF Board etc
  • Co-ordinate set-up for new joiners and exit clearance for leavers
    Various ad hoc HR duties as and when required

Requirements
  • Must be able to start immediately
  • 2 - 3 years of relevant office and HR executive experience in a corporate environment
  • Solid knowledge of office procedures
  • Experience with MS Office (MS Outlook Excel and Word)
  • Strong organization skills with a problem-solving attitude
  • Able to work Independent and detailed-orientated
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job Title: #SGUnitedJobs Senior HR Executive/ Manager| Human Resource Management System
Job Description:
Job Description

As a Senior HR Executive/ Manager Human Resource Management System in the HR Solutions and Capabilities Division you will play a key role in supporting the digitalization of HR operations in MOE for operational efficiency and good user experience. You will be involved in maintaining the current HR Management System (HRMS) and will have opportunities to contribute to the development of the new HR and Payroll (HRP) system which will be rolled out in 2021.

Your Key Responsibilities Include
  • Understanding the business requirements and working with HR business units technical support team external vendors and other agencies to ensure that the HR system effectively supports HR operation and enables good user experience
  • Providing consultation and advice to HR business units on system solutions in policy and process implementation
  • Ensuring system performance through effective system maintenance including implementing patches managing the conduct of user acceptance testing and troubleshooting
  • Raising user capability and acceptance in the use of the system such as providing user training managing user enquiries and implementing change management
  • Driving good data quality in the system through data governance and management including facilitating data documentations providing support to data requests and managing data cleansing and conversion activities
Requirements
  • Prior experience and/ or training in IT system development and maintenance including managing and administering related data structures would be an advantage
  • Good interpersonal communication and writing skills
  • Strong organisation and analytical skills with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work well independently as well as in a team
  • Keen interest in HR

We are hiring a talented motivated team player to join our team. Reporting to the Head of Human Capital and Organizational Development this person is responsible for key aspects including learning management system employer branding employee relations employee engagement and the implementation of programs & initiatives for the business units. Ideal candidate must be fun comfortable with the digital environment and has the ability to work with all levels of diverse management and employee groups. 


As a Team Player in the department you will


Thrive in both digital and physical environment support the full spectrum of learning and organizational development activities including administration work and any other HR activities as follows:


Learning Management System

  • Administer and maintenance of the learning management system to ensure compliance to corporate guidelines such as user licensing usage reporting user profiles creation user rights administration cohorts and courses configuration etc.
  • Training the region on the operations of the platform and creation of new online courses.
  • Create online HR-related training contents and work closely with internal stakeholders for contents development and to ensure employees’ participation.
  • Work closely with external partners to ensure smooth operations of the system such as fault management and escalation of issues and change requests as well as any enhancements to the system.
  • Be the LMS champion for the region on any related queries.


Learning and Organizational Development

  • Co-ordinate and administer the duties for Leadership Academy.
  • Maintain the training records and training costs of the company ensuring claims are duly submitted and training budgets effectively managed.
  • Ensure prompt reporting to ecoTrack on company’s energy consumption.
  • Handle the ISO documentation as well as involve in internal and external ISO audit.
  • Maintain the HR Chatbot and involve in project-based work and/or change projects.
  • Provide support in administration and coordination of both in-house programs and external training activities working closely with internal and external training partners.   


 Employee Relations Engagement and Employer Branding

  • Handle employee onboarding process including completion of required paperwork welcoming new hire and conducting new hire orientation.
  • Handle all clearance for employment offboarding.
  • Prepare monthly manpower reporting and official surveys such as manpower survey compensation survey engagement survey etc.
  • Design and develop organization’s pulse survey.
  • Organize and coordinate employee communication session employee engagement activities as well as social and staff recreation programs / events.
  • Partake and present in employee communication session on L&D and HR activities and initiatives.
  • Support & participate in Company’s CSR initiatives.
  • Prepare and post contents in company’s social media platform such as LinkedIn.


General Administration & Other HR Duties

  • Liaise with building management on building maintenance.
  • Assist in freight arrangement. 
  • Manage and administer office stationery and pantry supplies.
  • Manage company’s contracts on expiry and renewal.
  • Ensure prompt and accurate update of employment data in all HR systems including but not limited to payroll CPF and tax.
  • Provide benefits and claims administration of medical dental insurance etc.
  • Perform any other ad-hoc duties and projects as assigned.


We’d Love to Hear from People With

  • An independent resourceful outgoing personality a team player and someone who possesses a high level of integrity.
  • Degree in Business Administration Human Resources Management or other related disciplines.
  • Knowledge of Moodle H5P and SurveyGizmo is preferred.
  • Prior experience with HRIS system is preferred.
  • Strong operational knowledge in a relevant industry will be advantageous.
  • Ability to multi-task and adapt in a demanding and fast paced environment.
  • Excellent communication presentation and problem solving skills.

Reference No: WD-0002324

What's the role?

We are looking for a people-oriented Human Resources Business Partner who is able to provide support on design and development of HR initiatives in support of the business area and HR strategies.

Who is Hilti?

If you’re new to our industry you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools technologies software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage built over 75 years and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and first-rate service. With 30000 people in more than 120 countries we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn grow and carve-out your career.

What does the role involve?

As a HRBP you will work in partnership with the business area to manage development of their people providing advice guidance and ad-hoc training on Personal Development Plans. You get to work with the business area to establish and introduce systems that identify employees with high potential develop career paths in consideration of key roles for succession planning and self-development. You will also take the lead on learning and development areas of Hilti team leaders in HR leadership training.

93% of our people say they’re proud to work for Hilti thanks to the quality of our products and the way we look after our people

What do we offer?

We’ll give you what you need to excel in your role including ongoing training from the start. Your responsibilities will be great and with them we'll give you the freedom and autonomy to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results.

Show us what you’re made of and we’ll offer you opportunities to move around the business – to work abroad experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It’s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you’re after.
On top of these we have a thorough people review process unlike any we know of in any other business. We screen everyone in the company in a yearly career performance matching process. It means we can pair talent with opportunities - developing our people in their current roles or challenging them to work in new ways or in new places. It’s how we find the right fit and further our teams personally and professionally.

Why should you apply?

We have an excellent mix of people which we believe makes for a more vibrant more innovative more productive team. So if you’ve never worked in construction that’s fine with us. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability no matter what your background.

What You Need Is
  • Degree in Human Resources Management or related discipline
  • 3-5 years of experience as a senior HR Professional in a commercially driven organization
  • Proven success in driving HR topics including: employee engagement employee relations talent management and recruitment
  • Strategic mind-set with ability to partner with key stakeholders in the business while leading business stakeholder from an operational perspective
  • Superior presentation and communication skills with ability to influence and interact across all levels of management
  • Proven experience working in a complex commercial organization and/or consulting role that requires detail orientation sound judgment and strong analytical skills
  • IT skills including MS-Office and related HR systems/databases
  • Ability to work successfully in a process driven organization with courage to challenge the status quo
  • International mobility for longer term career progression


By submitting your resume you confirm and agree that Hilti Far East Pte Ltd and its related companies worldwide (collectively “Hilti Group”) may collect use and disclose your data for their recruitment purposes. This may include selecting evaluating and recruiting candidates for roles or positions that differ from the above job description but for which we believe that you may be interested in or appropriate for.
We look forward to receiving your application and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Let’s shape a better world through technology. Join us to lead the change.

Note to Recruitment Agencies

In sourcing for candidates for particular roles the Singtel Group works only with a panel of selected recruitment agencies expressly engaged under written agreements. Even then these agencies are only activated from time to time for specific recruitment exercises for particular roles under instructions expressly issued by a member of the Singtel Talent Acquisition team.

Except under such circumstances no agency shall source or attempt to source any candidates for the Singtel Group. The Singtel Group will not pay nor be obliged or liable to pay any recruitment fees of any kind whatsoever to any agency where candidate CVs are submitted to the Singtel Group by such agency on an unsolicited or speculative basis.

The Singtel Group reserves all rights to directly contact any candidate to which such CVs relate without any obligation or liability whatsoever to the agency concerned (including without limitation any obligation or liability to pay any recruitment fees of any kind).

Company Background

Thunes mission is to enable businesses and their customers to participate in the global economy by providing them fast and affordable cross-border payments. Interconnecting mobile wallet operators corporates merchants money transfer operators payment service providers and banks to facilitate seamless payments we unlock opportunities for millions of people and businesses in emerging and developed markets.

Our Mission

To enable a world where emerging and developed markets have seamlessly interconnected cross-border payments.

Our Values

Our team is committed to think big work hard and smart and do the right thing. Above all we love what we do and we have fun!

Our Solutions

We act as a trusted neutral aggregator in a deeply fragmented industry. Without a trusted neutral and interoperable aggregator the partners of a payment transaction would waste time and costly resources developing their connections to multiple systems. Multiple connections would also mean that these actors have to charge higher prices which could prohibit financial inclusion and the spread of financial services.

We offer key payment solutions to tackle the speed cost-efficiency and accessibility challenges for emerging markets:
  • Remittance processing
  • Corporate mass payouts
  • Digital payment services
  • Business Payments (International Trade Invoice Payments)


Context of the role

Reporting to the CFO the HR Director will lead the HR strategy within a dynamic and growing global company. This leader will need to understand what it takes to move a successful rapidly growing company from good to great. We’re looking for a HR Director who thinks big and has proven experience within a rapidly scaling company.

Leading a team you will be responsible for providing solid HR business partnering advice and solutions driving strategies to attract develop and keep our talent. You’ll be an advocate of our culture and values partnering with senior leaders in the business to drive the people agenda and make sure all people decisions are based on data.

  • Management of key metrics and action plans in areas of retention talent and employee engagement
  • Provide expertise in execution planning and facilitation for all employee relation efforts
  • Maintain knowledge of industry trends employee legislation and ensure company’s compliance.
  • Apply the broad perspective of the business strategy back to the HR team to ensure alignment and relevancy of HR initiatives within the business
  • Plan the HR budget lead the HR team and effectively manage and monitor resource allocation

What we are looking for

Qualification

Experience And Skills
  • 15+ years of related HR experience with at least 7 years’ proven experience in a similar role within a high growth technology company
  • International exposure in a HR role is a must with responsibility of EMEA APAC and Americas
  • This person must have the ability to think strategically a willingness to dive deep into details and execute at a high standard

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
Purpose of job


Reporting to the Director of Human Resources the Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP) help to oversee the entire HR operations and systems with main emphasis in the areas of learning and development and compensation and benefits strategy.


The HRBP must be able to develop a leadership and succession planning strategy and also to enhance the competencies of employees by designing and conducting learning programs that will boost employees work performance/leadership skills and career development in line with the company’s vision. The person will be responsible for performing training needs assessments designing and delivering learning programmes and for managing all phases of learning and development including measurement of the training effectiveness and success.


The HRBP will also be involved in designing and implementing the compensation and benefits strategy and structure that are competitive with market and aligned with TLL’s objectives culture and philosophy so as to attract and retain valued employees.


Job responsibilities:


  • Conduct training needs analysis (TNA) with respective department and creates a Total Company Training Plans (TCP) in consultation with the stakeholders and the HR Director
  • Translate requirements into trainings that will upskill and prepare employees for the next step of their career path
  • Design and delivery of all soft skill training programmes that include performance management communication leadership as well as core competency skills
  • Mentoring those needing support either in training content leadership and communication skill or in embedding newly learned skills
  • Review the Training Policy and make improvement as needed.
  • Design and Implement HIPO talent management programme and a career development programme
  • Create online platform for the training and coaching programmes
  • Create tools and measuring metrics to assess the training and development effectiveness
  • To work closely with stakeholders in promoting a high-performance culture for the organisation - identify train engage reward and retain top talent.
  • Participate in reviewing and creating a fair equitable and competitive total compensation and benefits package that fits and is aligned to the company’s strategy and business goals.
  • Analyse data on manpower cost budgeting variance reports turnover rates and cost per hire etc. Evaluate the competitiveness of the organisation’s pay structure against the industry and assess how the organisation can improve its practices or policies.
  • Oversee communicate guide and administer performance appraisal and compensation processes


Snapshots of our ideal candidate:


  • BS degree in Education Training HR or related field
  • At least 10 years of strong HR learning and development and comp and ben experience
  • Strong knowledge and experience in designing and conducting leadership and core softskills programmes
  • Strong knowledge of talent management and succession planning programme
  • Strong knowledge of job evaluation job analysis and job and career development structure.
  • Strong knowledge in salary and benefits survey and anaylsis and familiar with various types of incentives and benefits programmes
  • Strong knowledge of learning management software HRIS and Microsoft Office.
  • Strong leadership and organizational skills responsible and a strong team player
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and tough deadlines.

  • Applying Govt paid leave subsidy
  • Perform other HR & Administration duties such as but not limited to compensation & benefits payroll administration insurance employee relations and engagement and general office management staff grievance and discipline and fleet and facility administration.

Job Title: Talent Manager - Visual Effects Singapore| Singapore
Job Description:
Description

Job Summary:

Position at Industrial Light & Magic

The Talent Manager is responsible for managing the artist and production support groups of Industrial Light & Magic Singapore. This involves consulting with Management Producers and discipline leads to effectively manage the capacity of the studio through managing crewing up-skilling and development of artists and production support in delivering exceptional and efficient work for the completion of shows and long term growth of the studio.

Primary Responsibilities


  • Partner with HR & Recruiting to define and communicate ongoing recruitment requirements and strategies.
  • Lead and motivate the artists through managing their performance development and career plans including working with training to plan for upcoming show training requirements and ongoing individual up-skilling
  • Plan and manage crewing across designated disciplines for both current and future shows taking into consideration artist capability and development capacity and overhead aligned to fiscal plan.
  • Manage and facilitate the End of Show Performance Reviews for artist and align to the delivery of annual performance reviews.
  • Manage artist’s contract renewal in partnership with producers and HR taking into consideration capacity and crewing requirements.
  • Proactively manage stakeholder expectations and accountabilities including conflict management and working relationships to ensure the smooth management of studio productivity and performance.
  • Partnering with production to ensure financial management on shows including effective management of time card entry and leave.
  • Partner with studio leadership to forecast studio capacity and skill requirements based on current challenges and future studio requirements based on input from Production.
  • Support and promote ILM Singapore best practices across the shows.
  • Support ILM’s documentation and dissemination of best practices developed on shows.
Education / Experience

  • Minimum 8 to 10 years of related experience preferably in production and/or Human Resources
  • Experience with people from a variety of cultures and in remote locations a plus.
  • Significant experience with Microsoft office.
  • Experience with FileMaker Pro Power Point Keynote desired
  • Experience building and maintaining high performance teams
  • Experience managing a team
  • Demonstrates the ability to implement new ideas
  • Understand the ILM pipeline and its implication on workflow.

Required Skills / Competencies


  • Strong verbal & written communication skills; proven ability to interact effectively and professionally throughout an organization.
  • Ability to practice diplomacy discretion and reliability in approach to work
  • Must be a self starter and be able to handle a variety of tasks in an efficient manner while meeting deadlines
  • Demonstrate strong leadership qualities: functional expertise; integrity; forward-thinking; collaboration; hard work; compassion; excellent communication skills; mentor; leading by example.
  • Demonstrates the ability to implement new ideas.

This position is with Lucasfilm Entertainment Company Ltd. LLC which is part of a business segment we call Industrial Light & Magic. Lucasfilm Entertainment Company Ltd. LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age race colour religion or belief sex nationality ethnic or national origin sexual orientation gender reassignment marital or civil partner status disability or pregnancy or maternity. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow innovate create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

Job Description

 

We are looking for a Human Resource Manager to lead our Human Resource department as insurer of the functions and tasks being carried out by the HR team. He/ She is often seen as the link between an organization’s management and its employees. He/ She assists and support the Management to drive HR culture in the organisation. This position also includes filling positions in the company by sourcing viable candidates through various channels assessing their suitability to the company and oversee the full-cycle recruiting. It is also the HR Manager responsibility for ensuring that current employees are satisfied with the company. He/She is also responsible for the employees' skills gap meeting their KPI and planning their training schedule.


1) Manpower Planning Sustaining and Acquisitions 

  • Manage and analyse headcount and cost implications resulting from strategic workforce and recruitment plan
  • Uphold the culture of the company which is of utmost importance able to work with culture committee members
  • Organise yearly employee appreciation day other cohesive events and activities
  • Maintain the attrition rate of the company as a whole.
  • Manage recruitment; advise on job specs and work within the recruitment budget to hire the best talent
  • Support Business Units in planning their employees training pipeline requirements to achieve business strategy
  • Initiate execute and monitor recruitment activities
  • Develop and update Job Descriptions & competencies
  • Track and analyse recruitment and retention data propose actions to enhance
  • Conduct end-to-end recruitment activities including interview selection offer and acceptance
  • Establish and maintain close rapport with agencies tertiary institutions by collaborating in career fair/ internship/ learning tour as an effort of company branding
  • Review on the on-boarding plan and pulse check morale
  • Coordinate and delivering induction program to new hires and ensure smooth on boarding procedures and termination guidelines.
  • Research and apply government grant if any.


2) Support Role to HR Team 

  • Support in issuing employment contracts taking into account all relevant statutory terms and benefits
  • Assess feasibility of proposals to improve internal workflows and develop SOP if necessary
  • Review and update HR policy Compensation & Benefits constantly to ensure stay relevant
  • Review organisation employees’s skillsets plan training schedule for the employees follow up and track on their KPI whether meeting the requirements of what set by their superiors.


Skills:

  • Excellent organisation follow up communication and coordination skills
  • Results driven with Business acumen
  • Positive mind-set & perseverance personality
  • Employment Act knowledge
  • Excellent Coaching Counselling and Presentation Skill
  • Professional Business Writing
  • Ability to multitask
