Company Name: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA)
Job Description:
You will lead the team in the HR Planning & Services department and play a key role in the formulation and implementation of policies and programmes to support HR initiatives. You will be accountable for the Compensation & Benefits Performance Management and HR Shared Services functions within the HR Division.

You will be responsible in formulating and implementing competitive Compensation & Benefits policies to ensure that MPA is competitive to the market. As part of Performance Management you will be required to oversee the annual performance review cycle to ensure that it is rigorous fair and objective. Under HR Shared Services you will oversee and administer the organisation’s payroll to ensure timely payment and compliance with all government regulations. You will also be responsible for the review and implementation of the full spectrum of HR shared services to support the HR division. This includes the management of daily operations in payroll and benefits administration management of overseas travel as well as Emergency Planning. Where appropriate you will also lead the team in reviewing the existing policies formulate and make recommendations to ensure that our policies and guidelines remain relevant and support the organisation’s aim of being a Choice Employer.

You should possess 10 years of relevant HR planning and operational experiences (minimum of 8 years of experience in a similar role especially in the areas of compensation and benefits and performance management. You should be a team-player with strong analytical skills demonstrated ability to make good judgment call and effective negotiating skills. You should also be adept in leading and managing internal stakeholders as well as direct and indirect reports.

About Taiger

Headquartered in Singapore TAIGER is a fast-growing Artificial Intelligence (AI) company with a global footprint. Our mission is to help organizations optimize operational efficiencies by automating complex cognitive tasks. We are a market leader and the pioneer of Knowledge Work AutomationTM. The solutions we provide offer unparalleled accuracy in information extraction for industry leaders across the financial services government sectors and more. TAIGER is recognized as a Gartner Cool Vendor. Find out more about us at www.taiger.com and www.linkedin.com/company/taiger/.

Traineeship Title: Finance / HR Executive Trainee

The 6 to 12-month traineeship program is designed based on future skills development to enhance employability where progressive growth at both personal and professional levels through departmental rotation leadership opportunities and empowerment.

Summary of key areas of responsibility
  • Finance
      • Keep financial records and perform financial procedures(e.g. Payment requests)
      • Assist the organization and management of internal and external audits

      • Work closely with Sales and Project Managers to issue invoices to customers including online submission in GeBiz for government customers
      • Accurate and timely operation of payroll data/staff expense claims
  • People / HR
      • Manage all work pass applications (application renewal appeals) and ensure that all company and employee information are updated accurately with MOM
      • Responsible for filing of government wage reimbursements (childcare/maternity/paternity leave reservist IMDA etc)
      • Maintain update company records and compile statistical reports concerning personnel-related data such as hires transfers performance appraisals and absenteeism rates. Develop and run HR reports as needed by the People team
      • Process and follow up appointments reassignments promotions and other HR decisions which generate personnel administration actions in a timely and thorough way being sensitive to the human dimensions involved and tailoring actions accordingly.
      • Provide administrative support to the deployment and execution of core and annual HR processes including employee on-boarding and off-boarding
      • Prepares HR reports including those required by Government bodies
  • Office Management / Administration
      • Maintain office efficiency - establishing standards and procedures; measuring results against standards; making necessary adjustments.
      • Maintains office services by organizing office operations and procedures; designing filing systems; reviewing and approving supply requisitions; assigning and monitoring clerical functions.
      • Maintain inventory of office supplies and own re-ordering processes. Inventory management and IT equipment management
      • Manage specific meetings or events inside and outside of the office

  • Strong organizational and administration skills; attention to detail
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
  • Positive attitude
  • Strong interest in Finance/HR

A*STAR Human Resource (HR) Division’s vision is to develop all staff to their fullest potential and to help them make meaningful contributions to the organisation and to Singapore. TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.


TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles New York London Paris Berlin Dubai Mumbai Singapore Jakarta Seoul and Tokyo.


About the Team

If tackling challenges in a fast-changing industry does not scare you work with us and challenge yourself to move the world!

Cialfo is a global company that connects communities. Around the world students counselors parents college representatives use Cialfo to hope dream and collaborate. It’s one-stop solutions brings together people software and data to simplify career counseling and college admission workflows. We’re on a mission to make higher education accessible for 100 million students by 2025.

We are looking for our next In-house Recruiter (TA) Specialist to join us in growing our team our mission and our culture. You will be entrusted with an ongoing quest to discover talent build a strong employment brand and ensure great relationships with both candidates and employees. Our culture is the north star that guides how we work together and with our partners. Your future colleagues are some of the most talented people in the industry whose ideas have resulted in many features and initiatives being adopted and executed on. They are everyday problem solvers who run fast and drive Cialfo to the forefront in the EdTech landscape.

What is a In-house Recruiter (TA) Specialist?

To excel as an In-house recruiter Specialist we expect you to be experienced in full-cycle recruiting and employer branding. You should have a sharp eye for talented people and a steady commitment to help them find success in Cialfo. You know if they will be a fit into Cialfo and the culture we are building. You have a generalist experience recruiting across the spectrum (technical and non-technical) roles across some of the countries that we have a presence in (Singapore US India China and Pakistan).

Responsibilities
  • Understand the current staffing needs and the hiring plan for the next two quarters (Technical hires - full stack back end front end)
  • Comfortable with both technical hires and non technical hires
  • Develop and enhance talent acquisition strategies across different roles and geographies
  • Compensation structure and benchmarking is your jam - you enjoy digging into the details for Cialfo to be market competitive in the countries it operates in.
  • Perform sourcing to fill open positions and anticipate future needs
  • Plan and conduct recruitment and selection processes (interviews screening calls etc.)
  • Take steps to ensure positive candidate experience - we're always looking to improve cause honestly change is the only constant. Agreed?
  • Supervise recruiting personnel to prevent any bottlenecks to the recruitment process
  • Organize and/or attend career fairs assessment centers or other events
  • Data is fun! Use metrics to create reports identify areas of improvement and drive our recruitment timelines.


Requirements
  • Proven experience an in-house recruiting specialist ideally with 3 to 5 years experience
  • Has recruited for both technical (software engineers) and non-technical roles (sales marketing etc)
  • Experience in full-cycle recruiting sourcing and employment branding
  • Understanding of all selection methods and techniques
  • Proficient in the use of social media and job boards to meet hiring needs
  • Has an existing network in one or more of the countries that Cialfo operates in to tap on or enhance.
  • Ability to understand the duties and competencies of different roles and whether the candidates will be a culture fit in Cialfo
  • Working knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) (we use BambooHR) and databases
  • Excellent communicator and cultural carrier
  • Proficient in Excel - we are being very fond of that tool tbh.
  • Well-organized and able to juggle multiple openings at any single time
  • BSc/BA in human resources or relevant field is a bonus

Apply: https://cialfo.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=87

HR Leader Southeast Asia

The role

The HR Leader Southeast Asia reports to HR Executive Vice President Global Logistics and leads 5 country HR operations teams of 20 members to ensure effective and efficient delivery. This is a strategic role responsible for HR leadership to Toll businesses across Southeast Asia cluster with 2000 employees.

As HR Leader Southeast Asia you will be:

  • Enabling significant business growth expected in the cluster over the next 3-5 years
  • Leading a large operational team while supporting implementation of global initiatives such as the new Talent Acquisition model and integrated Talent Review process
  • Strengthening organizational and leadership capabilities in key growth markets within the cluster
  • Leading and setting priorities for HR within Global Logistics and Global Forwarding businesses in Southeast Asia partnering global HR team HRBPs and COEs
  • Coaching Business Leaders to drive and sustain changes in culture compliance talent management and capability building to deliver organisation goals
  • Facilitating key programs designed to build People Leadership capabilities (e.g. Manage My Team performance review cycles and feedback)
  • Supporting M&A integration realignment and global HR projects

Job Title: HR Business Partner (9 months fixed term contract)
Job Description:
Job Description

Rolls-Royce is now hiring for a HR Business Partner to join the team as a People Partner on a 9 months fixed term contract. The position will be part of the country HR team supporting our business across Civil Aerospace and Defence within Singapore and Australia.

At Rolls-Royce we pioneer the power that matters to our customers to society and to the planet.

Every great product needs a great business behind it. Our work is complex innovative highly challenging and rewarding and it takes a range of professionals to do it. Having the right people means we can deliver excellence to our customers and pioneer the power that matters.

Key Accountabilities
  • Work with the leadership team in developing a plan around the business setting the strategy and business plan bringing HR insights to the process
  • Ensures the development of a Strategic Workforce Planning plan to support the business strategy and plan
  • Coach the leadership team in handling sensitive or complex HR issues and in their own personal development including meeting Rolls-Royce leadership expectations
  • Provide effective employee relations advice given the context the business area is working in
  • Bring challenge and perspective to the business agenda particularly talent development and an environment that allows people to be at their best
  • Diagnosing business problems from an Organisation Development perspective using tools to identify the levers which will maximise organisation performance.

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in HR business partnering along with strong foundation in HR Operations with particular experience in local regulations within Singapore and Australia
  • Ability to analyse and challenge business strategy and develop people implications
  • Experience using Organisation Development to enhance business/organisational performance
  • Well-developed customer and relationship management skills including credibility and influencing skills and senior levels
  • Broad change management skill set combined with the ability to apply project management principles to deliver and support organisational change
  • Ability to coach senior leaders and their teams to deliver business strategy and drive performance and capability improvement within their teams
  • Sensitive to language and cultural differences
We offer excellent opportunities to develop along with a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus employee support assistance and employee discounts.

Pioneer beyond tomorrow. Join us and you’ll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.

Beyond tomorrow

We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realize their full potential.

You can learn more about our global Diversity and Inclusion strategy here .

At Rolls-Royce we also support requests for flexible working arrangements wherever possible

Assistant Manager – Human Resources & Administration

Who are we?

At EZ-Link we are more than just the people behind a card.

We are the enablers of connecting people creating smoother journeys for the young and old.

For eighteen years we’ve been a trusted part of Singapore’s fabric and we continue to punch above our weight. Having issued 40 million cards charms and wearables our products are widely used for shopping dining private transport government services and community services at more than 30000 acceptance points across the island. We are also not just in the business of micro-payments but also creating smart motoring solutions for road tolls and carpark payments.

The department

As an Assistant Manager you will supervise the Senior Admin Officer and work closely with the HR team members. Reporting to the head of HR & Admin and working alongside a team of HR professionals you will be in charge of Office Admin and HR Governance budgeting and other operations related matters. .

You will be part of contributing towards achieving results in your day-to-day role.

You Will

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Work with HR Head to drive and manage HR Governance:
    • Support HR Head in Enterprise Risk Management
    • Manage and update HR Guidelines (such as retirement re-employment extension of employment for silver talent declaration policy disciplinary actions grievances process etc.)
    • Manage and update Employee Handbook to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements
    • Keep abreast of regulatory changes and implications on EZL
    • Be the EZL Safe Management Officer (including monitor the attendance rate safe distancing measures in office sanitization etc.) as well as COVID-19 advisories from government authorities
    • Manage internal and external audits
    • Manage regulatory surveys
  • Lead and manage HR Budgeting
    • Develop internal work plan to ensure deliverables and timelines are met
    • Manage expenses within budget
    • Provide timely reporting to Finance
  • Manage and coordinate internal/external Audits
  • Lead and manage HR Data Analytics
    • Review and recommend data analytics that support HR strategic and programme planning
  • Manage Workplace Safety & Health
    • Review and keep updated on the Workplace Safety & Health Act
    • Ensure the organization is in compliance with the Act’s requirements
    • Communicate and education staff on the Act’s requirement to continually drive awareness
    • Part of WSH Committee
    • Fire drill conducted by building management
    • Workplace risk assessment
    • Promote staff awareness of workplace safety and health communicate and educate staff on the Act’s requirement to continually drive awareness
  • Manage and supervise the Office Admin Function
    • Overall in charge of Office & HR Administration function (such as office rental office work space allocation wellness programme season parking staff pass etc)
    • Manage the budget for Office and HR administration
    • Work with and supervise the HR & Office Admin Senior Officer in supporting the office and vendor management
  • Manage Long Service Award Programme
  • Manage Annual Corporate Events
  • Manage Overseas Travel (from staff application to approval)
  • Provide HR advice to employees

    • Why EZ-Link?

    We work hand in hand with the nation to build a truly smart and digital home and have embarked on a digital transformation to reinvent ourselves bringing about enhanced user experience and strengthening our capabilities for future business growth. At the forefront our app continues to lead our new initiatives and collaborations that excite our users.

    If the above energizes and motivates you come join us and embark on this exciting journey. Come and help us make a positive impact and have a say in the daily journeys of Singaporeans.

    An ideal candidate should have the following
    • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Business Studies or Business Administration
    • At least four years of relevant experience (specifically in HR Governance people risk management HR budgeting and Office Administration) and amongst which 2 years in a people management role
    • Work experience in a Technology environment is a plus
    • Good knowledge of local employment laws and regulations
    • A strong communicator with excellent interpersonal and influencing skills
    • Resourceful independent meticulous with a strong desire to learn and be able to work in an agile environment
    • Able to work independently with integrity under minimal supervision and collaboratively within and across teams

    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

The Senior Manager Human Resources oversees all aspects of employee engagement and interaction with the organization including recruitment and selection; training and development; performance management; payroll and benefits; disciplinary and grievance procedures; and relations with the union.

The Manager Human Resources Is Responsible For
  • developing and directing Human Resources (“HR”) strategy and policies;
  • advising the Group Director Development and Shared Services on personnel and/or HR implications of his/her decisions and organizational development matters;
  • ensuring the availability of talent to support Montfort Care’s operations plan; and
  • ensuring that all HR practices are compliant with relevant legal and statutory requirements
HR plans
  • To work with the Group Director Development and Shared Services to execute mid- and long-term HR strategies for the organization that are aligned with the overall goals of the organization and direction of the Board of Directors
  • To manage HR for the realization of the strategic plan and achievement of long-term strategic goals and objectives
  • To execute with guidance special projects for the organization which may include
    • Group-level outreach and engagement activities
    • Organizational improvement activities
  • To supervise the monitoring of various key performance indicators for the organization as a whole
Recruitment and Selection
  • To monitor and ensure that the organization has a robust succession plan
  • To ensure that recruitment activities are compliant to local laws and fair employment practices
  • To supervise the selection process for appropriate candidates including but not limited to interviewing reference checking and testing if necessary
  • To develop and maintain a recruiting testing and interviewing program; counselling managers on candidate selection conducting and analyzing exit interviews
  • to supervise and ensure the objective deployment of staff (either new hires or internal transfers)
  • To manage the availability of talent to support Montfort Care’s operations plan
Training and Development
  • To prepare the organization training plan taking into account career progression succession planning and operational requirements
  • To forecast and manage the training budget
  • To manage learning and development of employees to develop different levels of employees; including induction on the job training internal and external courses and workshops compliance training supported external study coaching and mentoring
Performance Management
  • To manage the performance management system incorporating elements such as regular feedback meetings performance appraisals and processes to manage underperformance
  • To manage consistency of effective individual and departmental target setting

Payroll And Benefits
  • To supervise the administration of the organisation’s payroll systems
  • To conduct regular benchmark studies to ensure market competitiveness
  • To develop with guidance a non-salary rewards and benefits system that recognizes the contribution employees make in their role. This includes both tangible (bonuses allowances etc.) and intangible benefits (positive culture and climate flexible work practices etc.) which contribute to an employee's motivation engagement and retention
  • To manage the linking of performance management systems to rewards and benefits systems such that employees feel that their contributions have an impact on their rewards
Disciplinary and Grievance Procedures
  • To develop disciplinary procedures to maintain a conducive respectful and harmonious environment
  • To supervise programmes that uphold organizational values and maintain in employee morale
  • To develop with guidance grievance procedures to create an open and honest climate with effective two-way communication between staff
Workplace Health and Safety
  • To manage compliance with legislation relating to an employee's safety in the workplace
  • To manage activities and initiatives that contribute to employees’ overall wellbeing
  • To develop with guidance health and wellbeing programs to improve the organization’s employment brand
Research
  • To conduct and manage research into new/leading HR practices and to disseminate this information throughout the organization
Employee Engagement
  • To plan and manage employee engagement events such as sharing sessions town halls or retreats
  • To inform senior management on employee-relations policies as needed to facilitate and ensure alignment with company strategy
  • To communicate regularly with employees on HR matters
  • To ensure HR practices are in compliance with employment laws and regulations
HR advice to the Group Director Development and Shared Services and senior management
  • To provide advice and support to senior management and/or its sub committees on matters relating to any issue within the remit of Human Resources
  • To implement and manage succession planning initiatives as determined by leadership
Personnel Management (of HR team)
  • Provide orientation and ensure staff receive the required training
  • Provide regular feedback on staff and team performance
  • Conduct performance appraisals regularly and in a timely manner

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible usable and valuable to everyone. Splunk is a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. We’re committed to our work customers having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role

As a HR Consultant at Splunk located in Singapore you have knowledge and experience in the key functional areas of HR with an emphasis on Employee Relations (ER). Strong communication and interpersonal skills will help you work successfully on a broad spectrum of employee issues and projects. You are a champion of our culture and ensure treatment of employees is fair respectful and consistent with our values core competencies leadership and conduct expectations.

Splunk's People Operations Team (SPOT) is chartered to provide both proactive and reactive support for HR Programs and the employee lifecycle. We are a relatively new team and you will have the opportunity to contribute to the build out of the HR shared service function. Your ability to balance between dedicated projects and urgent response is important for success in this role.

Responsibilities
  • Manage ER issues that are highly sensitive and often need to be completed with limited time such as workplace investigations meaningful interventions performance management and coaching
  • You will support dedicated HR Programs that improve the employee and manager experience
  • You will act in a Subject Matter Expert capacity for any one or more of the following HR functional area(s) line(s) of business or HR Program(s)
  • You will collaborate with business leaders HR Business Partner teams and HR Centers of Excellence to create and maintain positive ER using standard methodologies
  • You will develop and deliver training modules in conjunction with our Learning and Development team
  • You will help design collect and analyze multiple levels of employee feedback
  • You will partner with others to engage in continuous improvement in communication vehicles and practices
  • You will analyze diagnose and provide input to the design of HR programs policies and practices

Requirements
  • You have at least 7 years of direct experience in ER labor relations or labor/employment law
  • You are able to build trust and rapport in the context of daily interactions and investigations understanding the “art” of ER is the ability to elicit relevant facts and perspectives while applying the “science” of a strong process and set of standards
  • You hold a Bachelor's degree; advanced degree or other specialized training in labor/ER
  • You have a proven understanding of employment & labor laws in multiple countries within the region
  • You have designed and delivered successful training programs
  • You are technically proficient in MS Word Excel and PowerPoint

Your work will also include initiating a large-scale competency assessment across LTA and leveraging on metrics and data to analyse development needs of staff and identify effective interventions to address competency gaps. Dataiku allows enterprises to create value with their data in a human-centered way while breaking down silos and encouraging collaboration. One of the most unique characteristics of our product Data Science Studio (DSS) is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to technical and non-technical users. Through DSS we aim to empower people through data and democratize data science.


We are looking for an HR Business Parner to oversee HR operations in the APAC region. You will report directly to our Director HRBP based in Paris. This role focuses on ensuring the smooth execution of all HR processes for our employees starting right after the onboarding. This role will be based in the company’s office in Singapore and will include travels to other Dataiku locations in the area (mainly Australia for the time being).


The successful candidate will be interested in working in the HR field and has worked as an HR generalist or HR administrator ideally in a fast-paced and international company. We are looking for a dynamic detail-oriented partner who can help us champion Dataiku in the APAC region. This candidate will be an integral part of the HR team yet should feel comfortable working autonomously.


In this role you'll help the team:

  • HR Operations: Be the first point of contact for general HR queries from managers and employees in the APAC region
  • Support and manage HR processes (onboarding off-boarding employee life-cycle processes etc.): including laptops purchase & set up
  • Preparation of HR documentation (employment letters immigration contracts etc.)
  • Payroll & Admin: Run payroll and oversee benefits
  • Audit and improve - if need be - all benefits scheme for the regions (health insurance pension etc)
  • Facilitate international mobilities by coordinating relocation locally with our providers according to the company policy(including but not limited to immigration and tax topics)
  • HR projects: As the local HR representative and as part of the global HR team you will play an active role in transversal HR projects (career paths campus management etc.. )


You may be a good fit for the team if you have:

  • 4+ years of experience in HR ops or admin ideally in a international company
  • Previous successful experience working with remote management
  • Previous experience working with other countries in Asia (Korea Japan especially) and with Australia a key asset. 
  • Willingness to dive in and assist with whatever is needed 
  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical evaluative and research skills
  • Polished and professional interpersonal communication writing and presentation skills.
  • Discretion around highly sensitive information e.g. salary and benefit information
  • Previous experience in a fast paced environment a plus


To fulfill its mission Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019 we achieved unicorn status went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. Spanning from Sydney to Frankfurt Denver to London geography doesn’t stop Dataikers from working closely together and sharing experiences. Collaboration is key within our product and culture. We strive to create a sense of belonging and community while fostering diverse thinking by encouraging cross-team cross-office interactions like our annual company offsite or Paris onboarding. Fly over to Twitter LinkedIn and Instagram to read stories about our culture people and success. 


Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs without regard to race ethnicity gender identity or expression sexual orientation religion age neurodiversity disability status citizenship veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring compensation benefits performance promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment.

A rare opportunity to join this funded start-up and shape this HR Executive role

Your new company
 Our client is a fully funded start up looking to establish their HR procedures in Singapore. With an established business in other parts of Asia their strategic growth in Singapore is vital and they are already seeing success on an ongoing basis.

Your new role
 This is an HR Executive role reporting into the HR Manager and will include all aspects of HR Operations including boarding dealing with HR queries assisting with establishing best practice and building an employee handbook. You will be solely responsible for the payroll of approximately 80 staff including both casual and fixed salaries.

What you'll need to succeed
 You'll be immediately available and have experience in running the payroll ( this is essential) . Additionally you'll be a strong communicator who is willing to get involved in various HR projects and understand that various procedures will rely on a dynamic-thinking HR team

What you'll get in return
 As mentioned this is an opportunity for the right candidate to not only ensure the payroll and other HR duties run smoothly but for someone who is keen to make a difference and gain the experience that only a startup can deliver. Your ambition and focus will be rewarded with plenty of opportunities to learn new skills that a large organisation may not be able to offer.

About AxiomSL

Axiom Software Laboratories combines deep industry expertise with an intelligent data management platform to deliver regulatory liquidity capital & credit operations and trade & transaction reporting. Our global footprint spans 70 regulators across 50 jurisdictions surveilling more than 4000 regulatory filings. We currently serve national regional and global financial institutions with more than $39 trillion in total assets.

Founded in 1991 AxiomSL is headquartered in New York City with regional offices worldwide. We are the industry leader in providing enterprise- wide data and risk management solutions for our clients all around the world. We are continuously seeking great talent to help us continue to surface new ideas deliver excellence in innovation and provide our clients with one of the most comprehensive data and risk management solution on the market.

We are looking for a Human Resources (HR) Generalist to undertake day-to-day operations as well as administration of the HR policies procedures and programs. You will facilitate the coordination of HR functions such as hiring on-boarding training benefits reports creation payroll and liaising with govt. agencies etc. Your role also involves performing tasks with a focus to grow our company’s talent pipeline and improve our sourcing tactics. The ideal candidate will have a broad knowledge of Human Resources as well as general administrative responsibilities. You will be able to work autonomously and efficiently to ensure the end-to-end running of HR projects and operations. Successful candidate will have experience of working in a fast-paced environment knowledge of various HR systems and tools. She/he would enjoy interacting with the teams ensure support to staff and be the advocate of HR policies and processes.

Responsibilities
  • Respond to internal and external HR related inquiries or requests and provide assistance
  • Maintain records of personnel-related data (payroll personal information leaves turnover rates etc.) in both paper and the database and ensure all employment requirements are met
  • Liaise with other departments or functions (payroll benefits etc.)
  • Support the recruitment/hiring process by sourcing candidates performing background checks assisting in shortlisting issuing employment contracts etc.
  • Assist supervisors in performance management procedures
  • Coordinate training sessions and seminars
  • Perform orientations on-boarding and update records with new hires
  • Produce and submit reports on general HR activity
  • Assist in ad-hoc HR projects like collection of employee feedback Labour market surveys benefits comparison
  • Support other functions as assigned
  • Liaise with regional teams on HR related activities


Requirements
  • Minimum 5 years of experience as HR generalist having worked in a matrix organization
  • Knowledge of human resources processes and best practices
  • Strong ability in using MS Office (MS Excel and MS Powerpoint in particular)
  • Experience with HR databases and HRIS systems (e.g. Kronos SAP Peoplesoft)
  • Ability to work with ATS software (e.g Workable)
  • In-depth understanding of sourcing tools like resume databases and online communities
  • Familiarity with social media recruiting
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to handle data with confidentiality

  • BSc/BA in Business Administration or relevant field; additional education in Human Resource Management will be a plus

Job Title: AVP| Talent Acquisition Specialist| Group Human Resources
Job Description:
Business Function

Group Human Resources has the important role of attracting retaining and nurturing talent to ensure that DBS continues to be a competitive employer in Asia. With a well-established team of HR partners we support and deliver effective people-based solutions and services across businesses. Our goal is to build a high-performance organisation by empowering and engaging our employees. Because we believe that banking is about people.

We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist with passion and ambition and with the right attitude and ability to employ creative and innovative methods to help us find the next generation of technology talent. Reporting into the Talent Acquisition Team Lead you will work closely with key stakeholders from the technology lines of business HR business partners HR specialists etc to be responsible for the technology recruitment strategy. You will take ownership of your allocated portfolio on the full recruitment life cycle from active sourcing to offer.

Perseverance proactivity and personality will be your trademarks. Experience in hiring into the banking and finance and/or technology industry would be a huge advantage and you may have earned your stripes either through in-house or agency experiences.

Your Responsibilities Will Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Partnering with HR Business Partners Department Heads and Hiring Managers to understand specific talent needs through a consultative approach and advising accordingly
  • Managing a portfolio of positions simultaneously across the technology businesses
  • Building our knowledge of key markets and developing passive candidates and future talent
  • Evaluating screening and testing candidates’ skills experience and cultural fit
  • Developing and advocating the employer brand and penetration into key talent markets across Asia region and other geographies
  • Managing ad hoc HR related projects


You Will Need To
  • Possess a relevant degree (e.g. Technology/Engineering Human Resource Management Business Administration or equivalent).
  • Have at least 5 years’ background in a technology or resourcing and/or researcher role
  • In-house recruiting experience would be an added advantage.
  • Have prior knowledge of hiring in the region and be familiar with local labour laws.
  • Be comfortable managing volume recruitment as well as ad-hoc projects specifically in technology recruitment.
  • Review and improve recruitment methods to ensure selection techniques and recruitment programs are effective.
  • Ensure positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.
  • Manage recruitment administration and maintain accurate candidate records and data management in the relevant systems.
  • Have a sense of ownership and be a self-starter with initiative enthusiasm and drive.
  • Thrive on change and enjoy the challenge and rewards of working in a fast paced dynamic and growing environment.
  • Have strong planning and time management skills.
  • Be an effective communicator with good written and verbal skills.
  • Possess strong stakeholder management skills ensuring a strong cadence of communications and provide a high-level partnership with the hiring managers.
  • Be curious and eager to learn adapt unlearn and develop.

With a well-established team of HR partners we support and deliver effective people-based solutions and services across businesses. Our goal is to build a high-performance organisation by empowering and engaging our employees. Because we believe that banking is about people.

Responsibilities
  • Actively participates in all phases of the Workday lifecycle assisting stakeholders with support and leveraging the Workday application.
  • Responsible for the requirement gathering analysis design scheduling construction and delivery of the Workday solution based on business requirements.
  • Understand different various regional specific regulatory and statutory requirements and how these can be met with.
  • There is an HRIS operations side and a project side to this role depending on the needs or year-end cycles of HR.
  • Implement change requests by configuring Workday and at times also check the configuration of another team member to ensure quality assurance is met.
  • Demonstrate the configurations through the iterative development of prototypes.
  • Provide subject matter expertise regarding key business process decisions related to industry and/or functional areas Possess a solid understanding of HCM solutions.
  • Execute day-to-day project activities throughout all phases of the project and ensure all documentation associated with the project are in accordance with DBS project management methodology.
  • Promote Self-Help through searchable knowledge base/error database.
  • Identify and push for automation and streamlining processes across HRSS.
  • Explore and harness new technologies to drive digitalization and transformation of HRIS/HRSS to deliver a High-Impact Sustainable and future ready work force.
  • Ensure business requirements specified by process owners are accurately represented and understood by the applications development team.
  • Develop scalable solutions with a consistent user-friendly customer experience that is intuitive and easy to use and that can be used (and adapted where necessary) across the entire DBS Group.
  • Ensure operation issues are properly tracked to closure with documented resolutions/workaround in accordance to SLA.
  • There is also plenty of opportunity to be exposed to other non Workday HR systems in order to cross skill and grow your expertise in different domains like LMS Recruitment Chatbots RPA/IPA and new HR innovations.

Requirements
  • Degree (and above) in Information Technology or a technical related course
  • At least 5 years-experience implementing/supporting HR systems related solutions cloud experience
  • Preferably 3-5years experience in implementation and configuration of HCM Workday solution
  • Strong risk and control Operations knowledge. Understand HR regulatory policies and audit procedures for HRIS security
  • Good knowledge and understanding of HR practices and processes.
  • Possesses and displays good verbal written communication presentation interpersonal skill and ability to influence stakeholders and partners across vendors and teams
  • Meticulous and independent worker. Ability to multi-task and still deliver quality outcomes.
  • Analytical resourceful and possess great problem-solving skills.
  • Customer- and results-oriented.

NetVirta is a fast-growing venture-backed software start-up in the emerging field of 3D scanning computer vision & graphics. Founded by two MIT graduates and located in the heart of Boston we offer a precision 3D body scanning mobile app and technology platform that enables brands to seamlessly offer their customers a personalized shopping experience either through suggesting the best fitting apparel/footwear or offering custom-fit products.

Imagine being able to scan your foot and knowing which shoe fits you best or scan your body and order a custom fit suit/dress. We work with companies across a wide variety of industries and applications NetVirta’s mission is to help brands and retailers usher in the next generation of customization and personalization during the buying experience.

About The Job

Our PeopleDev team works hard to ensure every Googler has access to the resources they need to become their best personal and professional selves. We leverage tools technology and innovative formats to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers — from Noogler Orientation to manager training to leadership development and more. We have four key beliefs about learning — that it is personal social a process and happens in real life — and we infuse these beliefs throughout the wide array of learning and development opportunities at Google. As a PeopleDev team member you'll always be thinking about new ways to help others grow and you share a passion for empowering Googlers to unlock their full potential.

As a Talent and Organizational Development Consultant you will support critical sites leaders and talent. You will be responsible for the acceleration of regional critical talent as well as designing and delivering high quality organizational development solutions aligned to client People Plans and broad Organizational Development strategies. You will work flexibly across many client groups and will demonstrate breadth of expertise across all practice areas.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler refining our core programs developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse accessible equitable and inclusive Google through our hiring promotion retention and inclusion practices.

Responsibilities
  • Lead diagnosis scoping and delivery of complex talent and organizational challenges for Google in the region/market.
  • Make recommendations and influence decisions about the People Operations market Talent and Organizational Development portfolio.
  • Be informed on market insights and priorities including Google-wide business strategy as it relates to market opportunities and challenges.
  • Partner with market/site leads Market HR and the Talent and Organizational Development teams to drive global talent strategy in regions and support critical regional talent needs.
  • Build credibility and be seen as an expert and thought partner to People Operations Directors VPs and Business sponsors in these markets.

Vertex Holdings is a Singapore-based venture capital investment holding company with assets under management of over USD 3.5B. It is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Temasek Holdings and provides anchor funding and operational support to a global platform of venture capital partnerships and funds in key innovation hubs around the world. Each Vertex network fund operates independently with separate local investment teams in Shanghai Beijing Shenzhen Jakarta Bangalore Singapore Tel Aviv Palo Alto and San Francisco. The Vertex family of funds invests in technology and healthcare opportunities in the early and growth stages with over 200 active portfolio companies today and a track record of growing disruptive transformational companies into global champions.


This position reports to the Human Resources (HR) Managing Director and interfaces with company managers Vertex portfolio companies and HR staff.


You will be part of the global/ HQ human capital function which is responsible for the entire employee life cycle with Vertex and will also provide talent acquisition support to the organization.


Our team understands the importance of facilitating not just our network funds but our portfolio companies as well in their growth journey and we are dedicated to helping them source strategic hires from a diverse talent base.

Job Title: Human Resources - Consumer Senior HR Advisor - Senior Vice President
Job Description:
Job Description

The Human Resources (HR) Advisor Senior Lead is a senior level position responsible for leading the delivery of day-to-day HR support in coordination with the Human Resources team. The overall objective of this role is to provide a broad range of HR services to client groups within an assigned organization.

As the Senior HR Advisor for Singapore Global Consumer Banking and International Personal Banking this person will be the senior human resources business partner for the Consumer businesses in Singapore.

This organization consists of over 2000 employees in Singapore.

The Senior HR Advisor will partner closely with senior management of GCB and IPB to drive a robust human capital agenda for the business.

The role also will partner closely with key functional counterparts such as HR Professional Services (HRPS) Recruiting Compensation Talent Learning & Development Employee Relations to assess complex issues structure potential solutions and drive to resolution.

Demonstrated experience and success in change management processes and practices is critical.

Responsibilities

Partner with business leaders and HR Specialist areas (e.g. Compensation Resourcing Learning and Development) to design plan and implement broad HR programs policies and procedures to achieve desired HR goals

Partner with Senior Leaders in recommending developing and/or executing Human Capital strategies to achieve business goals

Coach seniors leaders on how to improve their individual leadership skills focus on talent differentiate performance embrace diversity and

Strengthen the culture of assigned business groups

Assess current organizational talent and ensure employee performance is differentiated and appropriately recognized

Align people resources with appropriate business strategy

Assess identify and diagnose business problems and opportunities

Create implement and measure the effectiveness of initiatives that promote organizational/leadership capability

Develop new approaches policies and procedures to encourage continual improvements in business and HR efficiency/effectiveness and lead change management initiatives

Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup its clients and assets by driving compliance with applicable laws rules and regulations adhering to Policy applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior conduct and business practices and escalating managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications

12+ years of relevant experience

Experience in training

Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication

Education

Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience

Master’s degree preferred

Company Name: EQUATORIAL MARINE FUEL MANAGEMENT SERVICES PTE LTD
Job Description:
The HR Executive supports the Human Resources Division in the full spectrum of Human Resources function.

:
  • Assisting with day to day operations of the HR functions and duties
  • Support and manage company’s recruitment activities (including preparation of s/job evaluations etc)
  • Manage company’s onboarding and offboarding activities including liaising with IT Department
  • Assist with submission of necessary government manpower surveys/claims/grants
  • Compile and update employee records
  • Assist in organising company bonding activities/events
  • Administer employee welfare benefits programme and employee engagement activities
  • Maintain and update employee training record
  • Assist in HR Department’s digitalization project
  • Assist in upkeeping company’s Safe Management and Risk Measures
  • Office administrative duties
  • Manage company’s facilities and liaise with contractors as necessary
  • Any other duties as assigned

Job Requirements
  • Diploma in Human Resource Management or equivalent
  • Minimum 2 years of HR Generalist experience
  • Well versed with Employment act and relevant legislations
  • Detailed meticulous with good organisation skills
  • Team player with a positive attitude able to work in a fast paced environment
  • Experience in a shipping industry would be a distinct advantage

About Us

We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated omni-channel women's fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010 we have grown to 250 people strong proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong China Philippines and Australia New Zealand US Canada Macau Japan Korea Vietnam Thailand Myanmar Cambodia & Brunei).

We are taking our definition of new female retail global with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.

The Team

The Love Bonito team is a passionate dynamic innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers savvy marketers to tech whizzes we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer the Love Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact we could be the perfect fit for you!

The Role

People are at the heart of everything we do. With our rapid expansion it is becoming more important than ever that we do it right! We’re looking for a Talent Acquisition Partner to join our HQ team lead our Talent Acquisition vertical and help in building a best-in-class team for Love Bonito. Reporting into our Head of People & Culture you will spearhead all our efforts in recruiting a passionate and high performing team in a culture of openness learning operational excellence collaboration honesty and innovation.

You Should Have / Be
  • A Love Bonito ambassador with a good understanding of our culture
  • A general love for people and talent acquisition
  • A performance-driven attitude and a hunger and thirst for results and sales
  • Excellent communication and people skills
  • A high degree of professionalism judgment and discretion
  • Exceptional influencing abilities to create strong ‘voluntary’ buy-in by building strong relationships with stakeholders across all functions and levels
  • Superb planning project management multitasking and execution abilities
  • A charismatic influential yet relatable leader and team player
  • Charming and positive disposition self-starter attitude with an ability to communicate effectively with people of all levels
  • The ability to carry yourself extremely well - you will be responsible for establishing connections between aspiring candidates and the brand!


Main Responsibilities
  • Own the full recruitment cycle from end to end - across all areas and disciplines
  • Manage our employer branding by working with P&C Management as well as relevant internal teams to ensure LB remains top-of-mind as an employer of choice when one thinks female consumer retail in SEA
  • Identify screen and hire qualified candidates for our HQ and country teams across all functions particularly - Brand Commercial Technology & Finance.

Xero is a beautiful easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. 


At Xero our purpose is to make life better for people in small business their advisors and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference and when millions of small businesses are making a difference the world is a more beautiful place.


About the Team


The Talent Experience team here at Xero play an integral role in working closely with both the business and the wider talent community to ensure we are attracting assessing and engaging exceptional talent in line with the Xero Values. We get to play an exciting role at the forefront of our continued global growth. While having a bunch of fun and a few laughs along the way.


About the Role


We currently have a 9 month contract available for a Talent Specialist to join the Talent Experience team here at Xero. As Xero’s next Talent Specialist you will be responsible for owning and managing end-to-end talent acquisition functions for specified teams across our Asia business.  You will achieve this through….


- Planning and executing recruitment activity sourcing top talent from both active and passive candidate markets

- Educating and advising hiring teams on best practice hiring techniques

- Leveraging your recruitment experience alongside the Xero brand to engage talent communities for both current and future hiring requirements

- Utilising your existing networks alongside your creative sourcing strategies to cultivate top talent and build talent pipelines

- Giving all candidates an awesome experience through professional and timely communications with Xero

- Working closely with the People Experience (HR) team across the globe to provide great employee experiences 

- Organising and attending events to build further awareness of Xero vacancies and the profile of Xero as an employer

- Contributing to global Talent and Brand projects of interest


About You


Overall we are looking for someone who is passionate about an excellent candidate experience and wants to continue to learn and grow their talent acquisition skillset.


Ideally you will also see yourself as someone who possesses: 

- Excellent stakeholder management skills

- The ability to network and build relationships with external parties and community groups

- Very good communication influencing and negotiation skills 

- Excellent organisational and time management skills with the ability to juggle multiple tasks at one time

- The ability to exercise effective judgment sensitivity and creativity to changing needs and situations within the business

- A passion for innovation and a logical process driven mindset

- A great work ethic


What you'll bring with you


It will also be a bonus if you also have experience in : 

- Managing a dynamic and diverse portfolio preferably in an inhouse Talent Acquisition team

- Attracting high quality active and passive candidates 

- Working in a fast growth global business

- Utilising recruitment systems and technology and sourcing platforms (we use Lever)

- Contributing to a variety of talent projects





Why Xero?


At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package which includes shares and life insurance plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology too.  


Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses including ours to better understand and serve customers attract top talent and innovate successfully. So from the moment you step through our doors you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
Expanding organisational capabilities…… Engaging and Transforming the Workforce……

 

As a key member of the HR team you will assist Director of HR to strategise plan and develop the workforce capacity and capability to achieve organisation goals now and for the future proactively identifying and managing the impact of workforce risks to JTC collaborating with stakeholders to develop oversee and monitor solutions to close the gaps.



Job Responsibilities

As the Head of Talent Development Department you will:

  • Develop a capable workforce through competency modelling to ensure the right capabilities are being developed for now and future;
  • Develop and implement career development strategies frameworks and programs for our people to thrive in meaningful careers that support their individual aspirations and growth as they journey through the organisation; balancing JTC’s unique needs values and the changing aspirations of our employees;
  • Develop and execute strategic talent management framework to identify develop and retain talents for pivotal and leadership roles within the organisation to ensure the long term success of JTC; and
  • Develop and implement career transition strategies in anticipation of future workforce trends and needs providing opportunities for reskilling and organisational renewal; ensuring staff are appropriately supported in the process.



Job Requirements

To be effective in your role you should:

  1. Be competent and experienced in the HR areas mentioned to bring the relevant skills and knowledge to the job
  2. Possess excellent skills in engaging and managing various stakeholders
  3. Exhibit strong leadership skills to manage and develop your team
  4. Be digitally savvy to analyse talent data to generate insights and foresights in supporting decision making
  5. Be self-motivated with a positive attitude to lead and navigate through the journey
  6. Be a team player who is able to thrive in a fast-paced environment

This is a true generalist role focussing on timely delivery of a range of HR support and expertise to our internal stakeholder groups. Utilising your strong communication and stakeholder management skills you will partner with diverse range of managers and employees on HR matters.

This role will see you be highly involved in HR matters relating to talent acquisition onboarding employee benefits data management HR systems compensation reviews & benchmarking salary proposals performance reviews co-ordination of L&D and engagement programs employee relations and ad hoc projects.

Responsibilities
- Provide support for the day to day HR Operations for the Regional Office
- Guide managers and employees on all HR employment practices and policies
- Create and update employee records and manage data and reports in the HRIS and TM1 cube timeously
- Manage employee onboarding monthly induction sessions and offboarding
- Work closely with the Talent Acquisition team on recruitment needs for allocated client groups. Conduct interviews as required
- Support line managers to ensure deadlines are met for annual performance and compensation reviews
- Responsible for co-ordination of internal mobility including relocation assistance for employees transferring within and into the region
- Assist with compensation benchmarking and salary proposals for new hires or internal moves
- Liaise with payroll to ensure timely and quality documentation provided for employees
- Act as a point of contact for all HR administration issues relating to the employees within your allocated client group
- Assist in employee enquiries first tier of support
- Provide data and information for monthly quarterly and annual reports as required
- Coordinate participation in learning and development initiatives including liaising with the Talent and Development team on initiatives.
- Make recommendations and source appropriate training programs
- Contribute to ad hoc queries and projects as required

HR ASSISTANT (PAYROLL)

Responsibilities
  • Support full spectrum of payroll related function.
  • Responsible for accurate and timely payroll computation and processing.
  • Assist in the compensation and benefit functions.
  • Assist in tax clearance monthly CPF submission annual income tax submission and other government related grant application/submission.
  • Administer and update information in HRIS.
  • Assist in the preparation of all employment related letters.
  • Assist in Employees’ leave administration in the e-leave system.
  • Support timely processing of insurance claims & monthly employee claims.
  • Provide support in ad-hoc HR related tasks/projects.


Requirements
  • Minimum Diploma in Human Resource Management or equivalent.
  • Minimum 1 years of working experience in similar job scope experience in handling payroll is a must.
  • Knowledge of employment practices and Employment Law in Singapore.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
  • Experience in using Timesoft is preferred.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast pace environment.

All applications will be treated in strictest confidence.

Job Title: Human Capital - Talent Acquisition Coordinator (1-year renewable contract)
Job Description:
About PwC

A career at PwC is more than “just” a job. It’s about being part of a purpose-led firm that builds trust in society and solve important problems. We help our clients to make informed decisions and operate effectively within them. At PwC we are committed to making a difference for each other our clients and our community — by empowering you to be the best version of yourself and investing in your growth. You’ll be able to develop as a leader be well-connected work in a great environment explore our benefits and make a positive contribution.


With PwC you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a strong coaching and people-oriented culture our Flex policies (Flex Space Flex Dress and Flex Time) innovative learning and development programs (training programs digital upscaling) as well as mobility opportunities. If you would like to be connected to like-minded individuals outside of work we highly encourage you to be part of our people clubs and committees such as the Sports and Recreational Club Toastmasters Club and more!


A career in Human Resources within internal firm services will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference at PwC by helping to fully leverage the skills and talents of all our people. You'll work closely with the recruiters hiring managers interviewers and candidates to help the local offices in driving the Firm's people strategy creating a unique people experience for each individual.


It takes talented people to support the largest professional services organisation in the world. Our Recruiting team works to identify and attract talent for the. You'll support end to end TA operations playing and important role in creating seamless candidate experience. Our team actively recruits for full time employees at all levels from experienced to executive as well as fixed term contingent and flexible talent and supports the internal movement process between roles.


How will you value-add?

As a Talent Acquisition Coordinator you play an important role to ensure efficiency experience and ultimately outcomes of most of the recruiting efforts. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:


  • Ownership of the general recruitment team mailbox interview scheduling providing exceptional and timely responses interactions and overall experience to candidates
  • Facilitate the talent acquisition process from requisition through to offer generations via recruiting systems.
  • Coordinate offer and closing process for offerees 
  • Utilize recruit tracking system for data entry event management and reporting in a timely & accurate manner
  • Support and participate in the team’s recruiting initiatives and projects
  • Enjoys a highly collaborative working relationship with Experienced Hires and Graduate recruiters in Singapore firm


Please note that this position is on a 1-year renewable contract basis.

*Only shortlisted candidates will be notified due to the high number of applicants for this role.

About Doctor Anywhere

Doctor Anywhere is a regional tech-led healthcare company headquartered in Singapore with offices in the region. With a strong network of established healthcare providers and experienced doctors our digital platform and mobile app enable users to manage their health easily where they can consult a licensed local doctor anytime anywhere and get medication delivered to their doorsteps within hours. 


Under the DA Network clinics users also have access to an island-wide panel of general practitioners specialists and allied healthcare providers. Complementing this ecosystem is our DA Marketplace where users can shop for a wide range of health and wellness products and services all in one place. 


We now serve more than one million and growing users and our aim is to increase healthcare accessibility and provide affordable health care for everyone. Join us to help everyone lead happier and healthier lives!


Our Team and the Role we are hiring for

We are looking for an experienced People & Culture Business Partner to partner with our teams in Customer Service Operations and Medical Services based in Singapore.


You thrive in a fast-paced operational environment and have a passion for partnering with managers to deliver impactful talent solutions and culture for this workforce. You will work closely with business managers across multiple teams and sites in Singapore to ensure HR deliverables are met. 


You must be skilled at designing HR practices for Customer Service or Medical Services workforce strong in influencing and mentoring others and great at building strong relationships at all levels. We need a business partner who can balance the need to be strategic along with the ability to demonstrate empathy and roll up your sleeves attitude. You are passionate about providing excellent internal client support and driving HR operational excellence along with the People & Culture team.


This role reports directly to the regional Director People & Culture. 


Responsibilities

  • Is a trusted advisor and operates with a strong business mindset and understanding of business needs to execute people-related strategies together with leaders and managers.
  • Design and deliver people programs and solutions to creatively solve business challenges in areas such as employee engagement workforce planning cultural change compensation review and change management for Customer Services Operations and Medical Services teams.
  • Guide and coach people managers on how to appropriately manage and resolve minor and complex people issues (e.g. performance management conflict management retention etc)
  • Partner closely with the Talent Acquisition team and People Operations to provide positive employee experience from hiring and onboarding development to offboarding of employees driving HR operations excellence throughout the employee lifecycle.
  • Promote a culture of feedback and open communication among managers and employees across DA.
  • Have a data driven mindset to provide insights to leaders to drive business outcomes.


Requirements

  • 6-8 years of progressive HR experience in a high growth environment.
  • A collaborative and thoughtful HRBP who sees the big picture and is comfortable getting into the details.
  • Demonstrates empathy and ability to connect with team members from Customer Service Medical Services and Operations.
  • Demonstrated client-service orientation with a clear approachable and friendly communication style with a positive solutions-focused attitude.
  • Tech savvy and comfortable with any HRIS (preferably Workday) GSuite especially Excel skills.
  • Genuine curiosity and strong desire to continuously learn grow and develop others.
  • Comfortable with open communication and giving and receiving open constructive feedback respectfully.
  • Proven ability to work collaboratively to develop and execute programs.
  • Not afraid to roll up their sleeves and get involved in all aspects of the role.
  • Unquestioned integrity and a confident presence to effectively resolve sensitive issues.
  • Experience in driving cultural change in mergers and acquisitions is a plus.

This is an opportunity for an experienced HR Manager to join an established market leader to support a business unit of approx. 400 staff. Responsibilities span tactical HR operations (from onboarding to offboarding) as well as strategic HRBP work such as HR reporting employee engagement project management and senior stakeholder management.


To qualify for this role you will need at least 8 years of HR Operations combined with HR Business Partnering experience. Familiarity and comfort working with a hands-on approach will be crucial to succeed in this position.   


Interested applicants please email your CV to AudreyN@charterhouse.com.sg

Job Title: Senior Associate| Human Resources (Performance & Rewards/ People Analytics/ Talent Management)
Job Description:
RGE (Royal Golden Eagle) manages a group of resource-based manufacturing companies with global operations. Our work ranges from the upstream comprising sustainable resource development and harvesting to downstream where our companies create diverse value-added products for the global market.


RGE was founded by Sukanto Tanoto in 1973 as RGM. The assets held by RGE companies today exceed US $20 billion. With more than 60000 employees we have operations in Indonesia China Brazil Spain and Canada and continue to expand to engage newer markets and communities.

People Analytics and Planning

﻿Performance and Rewards

Job Title: 2021 Mastercard Launch| Associate Specialist - Human Resources
Job Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive digital economy that benefits everyone everywhere by making transactions safe simple smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks partnerships and passion our innovations and solutions help individuals financial institutions governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient or DQ drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths views and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

2021 Mastercard Launch Associate Specialist - Human Resources

Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded a technology innovation lab and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless priceless possibilities.

The Mastercard Launch program is aimed at early career talent to help you develop skills and gain cross-functional work experience. Over a period of 18 months Launch participants will be assigned to a business unit learn and develop skills and gain valuable on the job experience. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets and rotate for a duration of 2 x 9 months each for a total of 18 months.

Role

People & Capability Team (Human Resources)
  • Working as part of the HR Business Partner Team accountable for human resources management in support of a business or geography
  • Partners closely with business leaders to implement HR Strategy
  • Partners with specialized HR teams (Talent Acquisition Total Rewards Internal Mobility Employee Relations) HR Delivery and the HR Business Partner team to ensure processes and initiatives are successfully implemented and effectively developed
  • Develops and Applies knowledge of local laws and regulations to provide high-touch employee–facing support in the areas of talent management employee relations total rewards recruitment and development
  • Supports the HR BP Team to implement HR strategies and talent initiatives for a function or local market. This may include involvement in Talent planning Leadership development Performance management Rewards/Compensation planning and Change-management processes.
  • Involved in the delivery of HR projects and programs working closely with internal HR team and engaging with business stakeholders.
  • Participates in the day-to-day delivery of local HR operations and engages with employees to support on regional HR inquiries
  • Involvement in data collection and reporting to apply quantitative and qualitative data to HR process improvement and development
Education

All about you:
  • Graduating seniors - Class of 2021
  • Students pursuing a Masters/bachelor’s degree (all majors welcome to apply)
Key Competencies
  • Degree in HR or other people related field. Internships within HR preferred
  • Passionate about people with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Driven to develop experience in building relationships and collaborating with other key stakeholders
  • Strong analytical skills. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint.
Languages
  • English required
  • Additional languages a plus
Application end date will be on: October 31 2020

Due to COVID-19 most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.

Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender gender identity sexual orientation race ethnicity disabled or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

: Office Cum HR Manager

Report to Director/BDM
  • Overseeing the daily operations
  • Responsible in employment matters including recruitment
  • Develop implement and ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements and company’s policies procedures and guidelines
  • Liaise with relevant stakeholders/contractors for the renewal of the contracts for office and training administration supplies and equipment purchase of fixed assets maintenance of facilities and renovation of the premises

  • Enjoy working independently as well as a team
