About Us

Fullerton Fund Management (“Fullerton”) is an Asia-based investment specialist with capabilities that span equities fixed income multi-asset and alternatives including private equity.


Prior to its establishment Fullerton’s investment team operated as the internal fund management division within Temasek a global investment company headquartered in Singapore.


The firm was incorporated in Singapore in 2003 and is a subsidiary of Temasek Holdings (“Temasek”). NTUC Income a leading Singapore insurer became our minority shareholder in 2018.


Fullerton provides investment solutions for institutions such as government agencies pension plans insurance companies endowments and sovereign wealth as well as for private wealth and the retail segment. With 15 years of experience in Asian financial markets Fullerton builds on its heritage to provide clients with investment solutions that are long term research-based and conviction-led.


Headquartered in Singapore Fullerton also has associated offices in Shanghai London Tokyo and Brunei. Fullerton is licensed under the Securities and Futures Act and regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.


Job Description

This role will report directly to Head of Human Capital.


The selected candidate will be responsible for human resource duties and responsibilities as described below.


Key Duties and Responsibilities

  • Support HR data analytics to interpret data and information
  • Managing on-boarding and off-boarding process
  • Initiate and monitor onboarding process with new hires including due diligence background checks onboarding forms and related matters
  • Work with other department to ensure new hire/leaver’s access office assets and equipment are properly arranged and set up/inactivated
  • Ensure the relevant checklists are completed and signed off
  • Assist in the recruitment process by tracking candidate pool updating recruitment status/stages and maintain candidate database/pipeline
  • Assist in the maintenance of accurate HR records in employee files and HR system to ensure data accuracy
  • Assist in the maintenance of employees’ training log and tracking receipts of completion certificates
  • Assist in compilation of HR data and statistics
  • Participate in ad-hoc HR projects and other related assignments including identifying and implementing process improvements
  • Other related HR duties as assigned from time to time


Education Qualification

  • Diploma in any discipline preferably business or human resource


Experience and Skills

  • 2 to 3 years’ experience in HR prior experience in data analytics and function will be preferred
  • Advanced Excel skills including VBA and macros
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality integrity and professionalism
  • Self-driven with a positive attitude willing to speak up and challenge status quo
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Strong follow-through and ownership over tasks and issues
  • Good team player embrace a collaborative and open working culture
  • Good written and verbal communication
  • Ability to work under pressure and timeline

We are looking for a result oriented passionate and enthusiastic individual to join our dynamic Human Resources team. A People’s person with a positive can do attitude and aptitude to manage recruitment drives. An organized and meticulous initiator who is able to work independently and also a team player who is committed and able to contribute to the department and organizational needs.

Talent Acquisition
  • Manage the end-to-end recruitment process which includes sourcing interviewing and engaging suitable candidates coordination and facilitation of interviews for/with the hiring managers and the candidates employment offer and negotiation of salary package.
  • Must be highly driven and able to handle large volume of backend and frontline hiring as requested.
  • Formulate and implement strategic recruitment plans and initiatives to meet urgent manpower needs.
  • Weekly / regular tracking and reporting of recruitment updates to the management.
  • Handle on-boarding of new hires and conduct induction programme.
  • Participate in all assigned recruitment activities such as career fairs site recruitments and manage internship program.
  • Perform all administrative duties related to the recruitment role.
  • Support all other HR related initiatives/ad-hoc administrative tasks as necessary.


Qualifications
  • Diploma in a HR-related discipline with at least 1-3 years of relevant experience preferably in the setting of recruitment agency or in-house recruitment.
  • Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to speak fluently and write well in both English and Chinese in order to work with our Chinese speaking associates in overseas offices.
  • An outspoken and energetic individual who is able to thrive under extreme pressure and proactively seek out opportunities to hire.
  • Proficient with MS Office (Words Excel PowerPoint).
  • Available immediately/within short notice is highly preferred.
  • 6 months contract with the opportunity for conversion to permanent employee subject to performance and organization’s requirements.
  • Only SINGAPOREAN need to apply.

Job Scope
  • Work with the hiring managers on recruitment and internship functions which cover sourcing screening of candidates through selection interviews pre and post interviews co-ordinations and administrative follow up;
  • Job postings on recruitment portals and social media;
  • Ensure proper documentation of HR processes in compliance with audit / procurement requirements;
  • Collate monthly recruitment statistics / survey returns;
  • Facilitate and participate in career events;
  • Other ad hoc duties assigned.


Requirements
  • Work experience as a HR recruiter or similar role;
  • Good written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills;
  • Pleasant personality and able to work independently in a fast paced environment;
  • Meticulous and be ready for voluminous work;
  • Knowledge of latest trends in HR technology;
  • Savvy in IT and social media platforms.

Job Title: Chief Human Resource Officer| JurongHealth Campus
Job Description:
The Chief Human Resource Officer (CHRO) is responsible for strategic HR planning driving progressive HR practices optimal development and deployment of manpower resources and cultivating an inclusive and open culture to retain an engaged and committed workforce on JurongHealth Campus (NTFGH JCH and JMC).  This role reports to the Group CHRO and has a matrix reporting to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of NTFGH.

 

Job Responsibilities

 

1. Leads in strategic HR planning in alignment with JurongHealth Campus’ goals and Group HR Strategic Workplan. 

a. Leads and/or participates in discussions with JurongHealth Campus senior management team and Group HR or specific committees/work groups on strategic HR-related issues.

b. Develops executes enforces and/or guides HR strategic plans goals and outcomes.

c. Establishes and oversees HR governance and systems streamlines HR services processes and operations.

 

2. Oversight of manpower planning and development to ensure sufficient numbers of the right talents are placed in the right roles. 

a. Strategises and executes the manpower needs of the organisation and its resource demands in line with overall strategic directions from JurongHealthCampus senior management and Group HR.

b. Ensures manpower planning and deployment policies and practices are effective and fair to meet organizational needs whilst balancing interests and strengths of individual employee.

c. Drive manpower productivity initiatives

 

3. Drives talent management initiatives in collaboration with Group HR to grow a robust talent pool for succession planning.

a. Collaborates closely with JurongHealth Campussenior management team to identify top performers and high potentials.

b. Reviews talent and leadership developmental needs and oversees the implementation of an effective development plan to build capability at organizational and individual level.

c. Identifies possible succession gaps and opportunities and put in place plans systems and processes to facilitate effective and timely leadership succession.

 

4. Builds an engaged and committed workforce through active employee engagement and communications.

a. Establishes the employee engagement and communication strategy.

b. Evaluates and determines the appropriate communication channels and messages for different employee groups.

c. Manages stakeholder responses to build an inclusive culture to boost employee morale and commitment.

 

5. Cultivates an inclusive and open culture for JurongHealth Campus.

a. Builds trust in system through open and effective communication strategies.

b. Ensures alignment of policies to OneNUHS values.

c. Manages diversity of workforce and ensures fair distribution of resources and opportunities.

d. Drives the alignment of OneNUHS organizational culture.

At Deloitte we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do

To take the lead in this dynamic world with constant disruption the future of HR demands major shifts in mind-set roles capabilities and digital enablers with reinvention at the core. From the C-suite to the junior desks Deloitte’s Human Resources Transformation services are designed to reimagine and revitalize how HR enables the organization and empowers its people.

Whether the enterprise is in business industry government or higher education our teams across the world and in Southeast Asia work with clients to develop and implement overarching global HR strategies to transform how HR delivers services to better support the enterprise and its people. This includes transforming HR operations and payroll with leading HR cloud technologies (Workday HR SAP SuccessFactors) and other analytic and mobile solutions that enhance service delivery enable innovation and reenergize the experience of the people you serve from frontline staff to leaders employees to gig workers administrators and faculty to students.

Deloitte Southeast Asia is rapidly growing their HR Transformation practice to meet increasing client demands in the Asia-Pacific region. We want YOU to join our team and take advantage of these massive opportunities and grow your career!

You Will

As a Manager in our HR Transformation Consulting team you’ll build and nurture positive working relationships with teams and clients with the intention to exceed client expectations.
  • Play a key role in how we deliver our services to clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research analytics technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide strategic and business-focused solutions to our clients.
  • Support our clients in defining their HR strategy and advise our clients on the design and implementation of (global) HR transformation programmes
  • Analyse and revise current HR processes to more efficient ways of working and contribute to the design of a delivery model for their HR services
  • Consult with clients to increase effectiveness and reduce costs of HR service delivery through improved processes and technologies; global shared services solutions participate in the selection design and implementation of technology-enabled business and HR solutions for clients
  • Be part of a team that loves collaborating taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. Job Title: Associate HR Business Partner - MediaMonks Singapore
Job Description:
Description

MediaMonks is looking for an experienced Associate Human Resources Business Partner that thrives in fast-paced environments (think agencies and startups) while staying fun and positive. You'll be able to make an impact and work with some of the most talented individuals across the globe.

The Low-down
  • Working as part of our global HR department based in Singapore you’re responsible for supporting HR in APAC from employee administration and case management to benefits and training.
  • You act as an all-round point of contact handling incoming requests from both our staff and senior management.
  • As the hotline between Singapore and our Amsterdam HQ you support our local leadership as our APAC business grows bigger with new Monks and monasteries.
  • Reporting to our Global HR Director you work largely independently taking care of everything related to HR and more.


Key Responsibilities

The whole shebang when it comes to HR managing the whole Monk Experience from start to finish:
  • Managing our HRIS tool including performance management PTO tracking and employee changes (including raises promotions etc.);
  • Becoming the HRIS aficionado as well as the point person for employee questions;
  • Setting up contracts and welcome packages for new Monks;
  • Manage the annual benefit enrollment process and maintain relationships with external vendors;
  • Managing employee files;
  • Ensure compliance with all local state and federal regulations for HR;
  • Support immigration procedures alongside with our Global Mobility Monk;
  • Assist in the recruiting process be it helping in compensation analysis guidance on hiring best practices/compliance etc.;
  • Participating in Diversity and Inclusion initiatives;
  • Preparatory work for payroll;
  • Managing special projects as needed;
  • Compiling HR reports for senior management;
  • Other duties and projects as assigned.

Please address the role and requirements for this position in a custom cover letter making clear why you're the right Monk for the job.

Requirements
  • For this full-time position we’re looking for someone with at least 5+ years of relevant HR experience.
  • A degree in Human Resources Management Administration or a related field would give you a clear edge.
  • You’re very precise socially skilled and reliable.
  • You’re able to successfully juggle various tasks and switch between them seamlessly.
  • You’re hands-on but keep a helicopter view of things at all times.
  • You can think ahead and establish priorities even during stressful times.
  • You have a great personality that easily collaborates with all levels of employees.
  • Must be very proficient in the full suite of office software with proficiency in Google Suite office applications preferred.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • We don’t even have to tell you when discretion is required.
  • Experience with ADP WorkforceNow and/or Workday is an awesome “nice to have”.


Benefits

At MediaMonks you’ll join a successful and crazy-ambitious company creative people would clamor to work for. You’ll be part of a truly global company operating as ‘one office in 20+ locations’ with an incredible in-house team of 2500+ Monks and counting. Stressful moments are part of the job but so is our casual company culture. If you meet and exceed this profile we’d love to welcome you into our fold of fun which includes a benefits package with health insurance and karaoke.

Job Title: Human Resources Senior Executive / Assistant Manager / Manager #SGUnitedJobs
Job Description:
Job Description
  • Work with management to strategically plan HR initiatives that will benefit the organisation and contribute to the development of HR department goals objectives and systems.
  • Manage the hiring and selection process with line managers such as sourcing of candidates via online job portals and recruitment agencies shortlisting conducting first round of interviews co-ordinating of interviews selection and salary negotiations.
  • Overseeing onboarding of new employees and exit processes for outgoing employees.
  • Work with line managers on training plans to enhance the performance and career development of employees by identifying relevant courses and training providers supported with grants.
  • Liaise with internal and external parties for the end-to-end administration of programmes such as internships from educational institutions and career support programmes from WDA including applications and submission of relevant documents for grant disbursements.
  • Assist with the organisation of our Employee Performance Management exercises including employee engagement surveys and 360 degree feedback.
  • Conducting annual salary surveys relating to compensation and benefits.
  • Timely completion and submission of reports as required by manpower-related statutory boards and government agencies.
  • Handle payroll administration and to ensure that payments are in compliance with statutory requirements.
  • Undertake any other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Requirements
  • Minimum Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Human Resource Management.
  • Prior experience in the healthcare industry will be an advantage.
  • Conversant with regulatory and labour laws.
  • Positive working attitude with strong organizational analytical and interpersonal skills.
  • Proactive resourceful and dependable.
  • Able to multi-task and adaptable to changes.

Job Responsibilities


HR Operations

•      Manage and oversee HR Shared Services team to ensure smooth operations relating to employees’ life cycle from on-boarding to off-boarding processes employee benefits payroll administration and office administration etc.

•      Ensure compliance to Employment Act legislation changes and update policies and manpower reporting requirements by government.

•      Assess and review current processes to seek continuous improvement.

•      Motivate HR team to think of innovative ways to run HR programmes.

*Due the current Covid 19 situation this role will be required to manage and lead the operational issues concerning to Migrant Workers of the company

 

HR Costing and Manpower Reports

·        Prepare reports on welfare costs levy savings Core Trade statistics headcount and manpower costs requested by Division Heads and/or NatSteel Leadership Team.

·        Run simulations for review of HR policies and practices (e.g. company bus review)

 

Compensation & Benefits

•      Prepare Year End remuneration Review for NatSteel group of companies

•      Responsible for the annual manpower planning and budgeting process for Singapore office.

•      Review staff benefits and propose recommendations.

•      Participate in salary surveys and do market benchmarking.

•      Conduct Job Description & Job Evaluation exercise and work with Mercer.

•      Track and initiate contracts renewal for Employee Group Insurance scheme and Payroll vendor.

HR System & Analytics

·       Work closely with HR IT partner as the project manager to drive improvements to have an effective and efficient HR system.

·       Leverage on system and technology to deliver consistent timely and reliable reports to support business units.

·       Troubleshoot problems on time and attendance module in eMPower and liaise with HOD.

 

HR Audit

·        Audit on HR data and system and ensure data integrity is maintained.

·        Attend to internal and external audit requests

 

 

Pre-requisites

•            Degree in Human Resource Management or any other relevant discipline

•            Minimum 8 years relevant experience in HR with 2 to 3 years’ experience leading a team.

•            Preferably with experience in manufacturing / marine / oil & gas / engineering industries and in a matrix organisation.

•            Process-oriented

•            Good analytical skills

•            Able to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task effectively.

•            Able to provide guidance while still being hands-on when necessary.

•            Customer-oriented mindset.

•            Good interpersonal skills and able to manage various stakeholders from c-suite to workers’ level.

•            Good planning and execution skills.

•            Strong knowledge in local labour laws and regulations (e.g. Employment Act Retirement & Re-employment Act etc).

 

Personal Characteristics & Behaviours:          

                                     

  • Detailed with sound analytical skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrates strong logical thinking capabilities
  • Resourceful and innovative
  • Patient and able to work under pressure

Job Title: 2021 Human Resources Analyst Development Program - Summer Analyst (Singapore)
Job Description:
Our greatest asset is our people – all 250000. And at JPMorgan Chase we consider recruitment training development and retention a top priority. Join our Human Resources team to find out what it’s like to build and develop successful teams for a top global firm.
You’ll learn various Human Resource practices including recruiting talent and development employee relations and more while building the foundation for your career. You’ll have the opportunity to build your network expand your professional skills and gain experience in a diverse environment.
 
Working here means joining a collaborative supportive team. We want your diverse perspective to help us innovate the next wave of products and solutions for our clients. We’ll give you what you need to succeed including training mentoring access to senior leaders and projects that engage all your skills.
What to Expect
Our summer analyst program is expected to run for around 10 weeks from June to August (although this may be subject to change). The program kicks off with orientation and training providing in-depth knowledge of our global Human Resources function. After training you'll have the opportunity to apply your knowledge while gaining hands-on experience in our different lines of business (Asset & Wealth Management Consumer & Community Banking Commercial Banking and Corporate & Investment Banking) or Corporate functions. The program is designed to give you insight into talent management competencies and specialties including Compensation Benefits & Wellness Workforce Analytics Recruiting Development and more. Top performers may receive a full-time offer at the end of the summer program.
You’ll make an Impact by
- Contributing to cross-firm projects including diversity performance management training and development
- Developing recruiting and diversity initiatives
- Working with business partners on strategic HR initiatives
- Shaping policies motivating staff and collaborating on succession planning
About you
We're looking for highly motivated individuals with a passion for cultivating human capital. Our summer internship program is a pipeline for future graduate opportunities. Based on individual achievements those who successfully complete the program may receive offers of full-time employment with the firm in 2022. If you require immigration sponsorship after completing your degree you do not meet the requirements of this internship role. 
Key Attributes and Qualifications include
- Pursuing a degree qualification with solid academic background and an expected graduation between September 2021 and July 2022
- Available to start full-time employment from July 2022 onwards
- All majors considered; Human Resources Psychology Organizational Development/Management or Marketing focused majors are a plus
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
- Exceptional critical thinking and problem solving abilities
- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced collaborative work environment
- Working knowledge of MS Office (Excel Word PowerPoint Outlook)
- Relevant internship experience and leadership in school or community organization
Application Period:
7 November 2020 (2359 SGT)
 Join us
At JPMorgan Chase we’re creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you’re passionate curious and ready to make an impact we’re looking for you.
 
What’s next?
Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.  
After you confirm your application we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications. 
If you are advanced to the next step of the process you’ll receive an email invitation to complete a series of 12 games through the Pymetrics platform. Pymetrics will allow you to showcase your potential beyond what you tell us in your resume and application form. It’s an additional data point that helps us gain a better understanding of who you are as an individual. It should take no longer than 25-35 minutes to complete. If you have already completed the Pymetrics games you will have the opportunity to submit your gameplay results for this specific application without having to replay the games.
Following completion of Pymetrics you’ll receive another email invitation to complete a video interview powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.
Both Pymetrics and HireVue are required and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed them. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible since programs will close as positions are filled.
JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified diverse candidates and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.
Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events career advice our locations and more.
Reasonable Adjustments
J.P. Morgan is an inclusive employer of choice. If you require any adjustments to enable you to perform the essential functions of your job please do not hesitate to contact your recruiter.
If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially please contact your respective recruiter.

Job Description:

Recruiter: KWAN KIN KENNY PUN

The HR Business Partner partners with the Site/Regional/Global HRBP(s) and works with business managers across multiple units within a business region function or site to ensure HR deliverables are met. He/She represents HR in business decisions; provides input into HR programs initiatives and service delivery strategy based on business needs. He/She provides support in the deployment and delivery of HR initiatives and works with the Site/Regional/Global Business HR team on the HR strategic plan creation alignment and implementation.

Responsibility 1: Partner with Site/Regional/Global HRBPs and leaders on people strategy and initiatives while maintaining strategic alignment with organizational priorities and HR

  • Partner with HRBP(s) to be the voice of the customer to HR and the face of HR to the customer - ensuring successful program & process development and deployment with HR Functions
  • Partner with HRBP(s) to bring the business back to HR - increase visibility to business; align HR team globally to business priorities and deliver relevant and impactful HR solutions to the business
  • Learn leverage and influence HR best practices across Business HR team
  • Partner with HRBP(s) to drive discussions related to workforce and organization design changes and provide recommendations
  • Participate and represent HR in strategic business plan development and advise on implications of decisions
  • Partner in the development and implementation of the organization's HR strategies and programs in alignment with global/regional/site objectives. Translate local business requirements into HR goals and actions in line with the HR agenda and regulatory requirements
Responsibility 2: Partner with HR functions to provide HR solutions to meet business needs

  • Be the voice of the customer to HR and the face of HR to the customer - ensuring successful program & process development and deployment with HR Functions
  • Bring the business back to HR - increase visibility to business; align HR team globally to business priorities and deliver relevant and impactful HR solutions to the business
  • Learn leverage and influence HR best practices across Business HR team

Responsibility 3: Partner with HRBP(s) on the implementation of HR strategies programs and solutions

  • Partner with site regional and global HRBP(s) to drive discussions related to workforce and organization design changes and provide recommendations
  • Participate and represent HR in strategic business plan development and advise on implications of decisions
  • Partner in the development and implementation of the organization's HR strategies and programs in alignment with business objectives. Translate local business requirements into HR goals and actions in line with the HR agenda and regulatory requirements
  • Partner with Business HR team(s) to enable alignment of HR solutions
Responsibility 4: Champion change initiatives organizational values and culture; Enhances organizational leadership and effectiveness

  • Counsel senior business leaders on talent matters
  • Model and instill the Micron culture and organizational values within the business
  • Identify business needs help lead organizational change initiatives and communication

Who We Want
  • Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.
  • Strategic thinkers. People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning forecasting advising budgeting reporting or sales opportunities.

  • Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations.


What You Will Do

The Talent Acquisition Manager East Asia will play an important role in shaping the TA practices and delivery for East Asia. As a strategic talent advisor you will build partnerships with business leaders hiring managers HR Business Partners and diverse recruitment sources while maintaining excellent relationships across TA. The primary focus is building and delivering a highly capable internal recruitment function for East Asia. This includes handling the day to day operations of the recruiting in Singapore and Hong Kong and partnering with local HR teams to develop recruitment strategies and delivery in Korea Malaysia Thailand and Vietnam. The goal is to deliver phenomenal client experiences through results and credibility while enabling future organizational growth. In addition to driving a culture of continuous improvement and development you will inspire peers and stakeholders to achieve greatness lead projects/initiatives that propel our capability and deliver flawless execution to the business. As the Talent Acquisition Manager you will own the recruiting strategy for East Asia as part of the APAC TA Leadership Team.

What You Need
  • 8+ years of Talent Acquisition experience
  • 2+ years significant multi-country recruitment experience in Asia
  • Proven ability to drive programs lead people through change and reduce third party agency usage to meet deliverables in a complex environment
  • Demonstrated excellence in customer relations and building strong and influential relationships at all levels within an organization; problem solving and proactive service orientation.
  • Must have knowledge of recruiting best practices strong business acumen excellent project and change management skills
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines and in a rapidly changing regulatory and business environment
  • Must thrive when working on complex challenges identifying and implementing solutions
  • Must have the ability to train coach and mentor while building organizational capability
  • Proven experience influencing people at all levels in the organization as well as remote colleagues with a strong focus on operational excellence
  • Excellent ability to collect organize analyze interpret and communicate information in clear and concise executive level ready format to derive useful and actionable insights
  • Strong written verbal communication and presentation skills in English (additional languages a plus)
  • Ability to travel regionally (approximately 25%) and globally (less than 10%)


Preferred Qualifications
  • 8+ years of end-to-end recruiting experience
  • 2+ years of experience significant influencing and change management within HR/Recruiting
  • Preferred candidates will have a mix of agency and corporate recruitment experience
  • Global exposure and/or US multinational experience is preferred.
  • Experience recruiting within the medical device life sciences bio-tech pharmaceutical or related industries a plus
  • This role doesn’t have direct reports right now but might in the future. Previous experience leading a team of recruiters would be beneficial

Job Description

The Human Resource Executive will support the daily functions of the Human Resource (HR) department including recruitment performance management benefits administration payroll employee relations as well as administration and maintenance of employee records. The role will also work on employees’ development to enable them to fulfill their potential as well as work on employee engagement to increase employee motivation satisfaction performance and overall well-being. Reports directly to Manager Human Resources.

A Day In The Life

Assist HR Manager on the day-to-day operations which includes and is not limited to:
  • Point of contact for all HR-related matters as well as provide HR support and guidance to managers
  • Monitor and ensure businesses’ compliance with local employment laws regulations and applicable policies and work closely within HR and with business to resolve non-compliance
  • Handle end-to-end recruitment and selection processes
  • Handle onboarding & transfer administration for all staff movements (e.g. new hires promotions transfers re-designation resignations/terminations etc.)
  • Handle employee’s Training & Development programs and application of Training Grants.
  • Handle and administer employee’s compensation & benefits
  • Monitor upkeep and ensure security and accuracy of employees records and documents in HRIS and physical employee personnel files
  • Monitor and ensure timely and accurate employee Work Pass applications renewals and cancellations
  • Monitor and ensure timely and accurate submission of government related pay claims (e.g. NS Claim Childcare Leave Claims and etc.)
  • Manage and work with businesses to ensure appropriate resolution of employees’ grievances and performance issues
  • Maintain any additions/deletions of employees for insurance coverage and point of contact for all insurance claims matters including issuance of LOG
  • Maintain and update employee handbook guidelines policies and process flows.
  • Process payroll accurately
  • Prepare and perform letters generation e.g. Confirmation Letter of Employment Variable payout Merit Increase & all other required letters etc.
  • Plan organize and make arrangements for company events and employee welfare measures.
  • Submission of Manpower surveys
  • Assist with HR vendor management and invoice accruals
  • Participate and contribute towards implementation of HR projects strategies and initiatives e.g. HR policies documentation processes automation and implementation/roll-out of new HR Systems or Initiatives
  • Other ad-hoc tasks as assigned
What You Need
  • Diploma in Human Resource or equivalent
  • At least 2 years of experience in HR
  • Knowledge and experience in HRIS payroll system (SAGE Easypay) would be an advantage
  • Proficient in MS Office and MS Outlook 365
  • An individual who is highly motivated and takes initiative to take up new challenges
  • Friendly cheerful and confident disposition interactive and engaging
  • Team player who works well in a team
  • Detail-oriented and meticulous
  • Versatile able to multitask and meet changing deadlines in a fast paced environment
What We Offer
  • Centrally located office in Shenton Way connected to Tanjong Pagar MRT
  • Flexi working hours for employees with commitments
  • An office environment that is designed to be comfortable
  • Regular company and team outings
  • Accommodative time off program
  • Comprehensive Medical coverage
Why g&m

We believe that happy employees are the most productive employees. And that has always been our motto for the office environment.

Our client is a profitable tech company that pioneered 3D technology in fashion design and e-Commerce. This role is ideal for a strategic hands-on and highly energetic HR leader who is ready to lead the people agenda in a hyper-growth business as they move HQ operations to Singapore.

Corning is one of the world’s leading innovators in materials science. For more than 160 years Corning has applied its unparalleled expertise in specialty glass ceramics and optical physics to develop products that have created new industries and transformed people’s lives.

Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D a unique combination of material and process innovation and close collaboration with customers to solve tough technology challenges.

Role Scope

Provide overall HR leadership for the HR function in the Asia region.

Role Purpose
  • Provides functional HR leadership
    • has the right number and type of talent required to execute business strategy and achieve desired results;
    • realizes required levels of employee productivity and performance excellence required to execute business strategy and achieve desired results;
  • Ensures all locations establish and maintain a positive work environment and operate as “One Corning” in support of Corning’s Values across the region;
  • Assists in achieving or beating budgetary objectives in support of top quartile performance objectives while maintaining appropriate level of HR service delivery;
  • Scales the type and level of HR service provided to client groups in anticipation of the specific needs of the business portfolio and in conjunction with the business strategy;
  • Ensures successful implementation of global HR business processes and statutory compliance across the function in Asia.


Key Responsibilities
  • Identifies and prioritizes current and future talent requirements which could affect achievement of functional objectives
  • Partners with regional functional leaders and business team to identify and implement a compelling employee value proposition that enables them to attract and retain the number and type of talent required to close talent gaps
  • Ensures statutory compliance and HR process standardization across the region
  • Partners with HR Directors to take actions required to address talent gaps ensuring the division has the right people in the right place at the right time
  • Partners with client groups to identify and implement targeted group and individual development plans that address targeted talent gaps in a timely manner
  • Effectively deploys performance management and rewards processes/practices within client group to drive required levels of employee accountability for desired performance results and ensure retention of top performers
  • Holds client managers and leaders accountable for establishing and maintaining positive work environment
  • In partnership with HR Directors identifies the client group’s human capital priorities over the next one to two years and the type and level of support required from HR to effectively address these priorities
  • Supports the deployment of corporate HR strategy
  • Collaborates closely with HR Directors/Managers across Corning’s businesses to ensure standardization and ensure that the type and level of services fully support achievement of business objectives
  • Coaches client management in development and implementation of required programs and processes to establish and maintain a positive work environment


Performance Metrics
  • Achievement of client groups’ stated performance results (cost quality delivery productivity)
  • Client feedback
  • Timely placement of qualified candidates for key client group jobs (time to fill)
  • Climate Survey Results:
  • Degree to which employees perceive they are being supported in their professional development;
  • Succession plan hit rate for key client group jobs
  • Key player retention – Achieve Targeted Percent retention rate of key talent
  • People Review – completion of defined talent management actions within stated time frames
  • Performance against HR budget
  • Performance against agreed objectives


Competencies (knowledge Skills And Behaviors)
  • Developing Direct Reports & Others
  • Interpersonal Savvy
  • Self Development
  • Business Acumen
  • Organizational Agility
  • Problem Solving
  • HR Service Orientation (BUHR)


Required

 Experiences/Education:
  • Bachelor degree with HR specialization
  • At least 5 years of HR experience (generalist/specialist)
  • Successful track record of performance in a corporate HR Consultant/Manager role with an MNC
  • Successful track record in the deployment of global HR business processes or programs
  • Work experience in designing and implementing effective organization structures and work processes that improve client group ability to achieve desired results
  • Work across national borders
  • Proficient in verbal and written English language skills

Job Description:
Lombard Odier is a leading global wealth and asset manager. For 222 years and through 40 financial crises the Group has combined innovation and prudence to align itself with the long-term interests of private and institutional clients. The Group is solely owned by its Managing Partners has a highly liquid balance sheet and is very well capitalised.


We provide a complete offering of wealth services including succession planning discretionary and advisory portfolio management and custody. Asset management services are offered through Lombard Odier Investment Managers (LOIM).


The Group had total client assets of USD 262 billion at 31 December 2018 (USD 299b in 2019). Headquartered in Geneva since 1796 the Group has 27 offices in 23 jurisdictions and employs 2400 people. In Asia we have been present since 1987 with offices in Hong Kong Singapore and Tokyo.


Lombard Odier Asia’s Human Resources is a team of three who work closely with our specialists in Switzerland. The team covers our offices in Singapore Hong Kong and Tokyo and supports Lombard Odier Growth Strategy from a Human Resources perspective.


Within this context and given our fast growing business in Asia we are looking for an Intern for a period of 9 months.

Are you an experienced HR manager just wanting a change or looking for the next step within your HR career? We are looking for a dynamic and engaging HR professional to lead the Asia side of our business.

MMR is an independent global consumer and sensory research agency specialising in food drink personal and household care research. We are industry leaders guiding best in class innovation for our clients - partnering with over 50% of the top 100 global food and drink brands

Our team of over 420 highly engaged multi-disciplined employees are primarily dynamic research professionals sensory experts and data scientists. We're a diverse bunch with backgrounds in R&D insight marketing sensory science data sciences and psychology. We also boast a true global reach with offices in the UK US China Singapore Mumbai Thailand South Africa Columbia and Brazil

We are a "people first" company that prides itself on collaboration honesty and mutual trust. A company who obtained some fantastic feedback for company engagement and team spirit in a recent employee study with 80% of employees stating they're happy and proud to work for MMR.

And one more thing we work with 50% of the world's food and drink brands so the chances are the last time you went to the supermarket you bought something that we've influenced on its way to the shelves.


MMR is expanding and this is being driven by our fantastic people across the globe. As a HR Manager - Asia you will be an extension to our global HR team who are centred in the UK. As a business we recognise that our people are everything and we genuinely care about our employees and this is proven by the excellent feedback we have received across the business.


You will be part of an exceptional team who offer unprecedented support while still operating in a truly autonomous manner. Integral to the regions development you will be working in partnership with territory leads to further expand and develop the people strategy. As such you will be truly motivated by getting things done and fully prepared to take on all the tasks that will see this happen.


As a HR generalist you will be motivated by variety and will gain exposure to the full HR spectrum including but not limited to employee relations recruitment payroll welfare policy and procurement compensation and benefits and all associated admin needs along the way.


You will be driving strategy that supports the business across Singapore China Thailand and India. The needs for each division can vary considerably and you will work in partnership with divisional leads to instil real confidence and support with regards to the HR initiative.



What you will be doing:








  • You will be the first point of contact for all employees and managers based in Asia providing expert advice on all day to day HR generalist matters in the region.
  • Providing comprehensive working knowledge of employment law across Asia most notably Singapore and China to provide full guidance on governmental compliance and industry trends in the region.
  • Comfortable managing and developing people from differing cultures and successfully processing all visa and work permit requirements.
  • Working in partnership with managers to ensure that employees are adequately inducted and trained to carry out their roles while working collaboratively with other divisions.
  • Working in tandem with the Global HR team to implement HR initiatives locally.
  • Prepare and process payroll successfully.
  • Support the Company's Managing and Appraising Performance (MAPS) process to ensure employees have a clear view on their development and career progression.
  • Taking a lead on the recruitment of new talent by sourcing viable candidates through various channels assessing their suitability to the company and oversee the full recruiting cycle.
  • Providing unprecedented assistance and support to managers to drive and uphold the culture of the Company and interaction between staff and managers.
  • Providing an independent approachable and confidential welfare service to staff and managers.
  • Remain abreast of existing policies and procedures and develop new ones as and when required in line with company administration needs and ISO requirements.

Requirements:

You know you're right for this role if...



  • You have strong knowledge of and experience with a wide array of HR programs and practices including recruitment performance management compensation coaching employee relations and organizational development in Singapore and China.
  • You have a proven ability to influence and drive change with executive teams: being a self-starter and demonstrating assertiveness and confidence.
  • You possess a strong affinity to data and analytics.
  • You demonstrate a strong understanding of traditional HR tools.
  • You have excellent communication skills are articulate and possess and drive for true credibility and integrity.
  • You can demonstrate both English and Mandarin language capabilities.
  • You have an approach which is adaptable positive engaging and a true desire to get things done. You really are prepared to roll your sleeves up and are happy to do all the tasks needed to produce great work.
  • You have a proven 5+ years' experience in HR in a generalist role - you really must have working appreciation of all fields within HR.
  • You are educated to degree level (with a Human Resources degree being desirable but not essential).

Who We Are

Airwallex is a technology company that revolutionises the way businesses operate globally. Our financial infrastructure provides a modern technology stack for businesses of all sizes to operate internationally without the challenges of the current global financial system.

Businesses use Airwallex as their end to end global financial services platform. Whether it’s making or receiving payments from customers domestically or internationally Airwallex saves businesses time and money by offering real-time reliable and cost effective financial solutions. Our web and API solutions support businesses of all sizes from small companies to large enterprise.

In this fast-changing digital world that is increasingly becoming borderless our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes to grow in their own markets and around the world and by doing so contribute to the global economy.

Founded in 2015 Airwallex has since grown to over 400 employees across ten offices around the world. Airwallex has raised over $360 million USD in venture capital funding supported by top-tier investors including DST Global Sequoia Capital Tencent Hillhouse Horizons Ventures Salesforce Ventures ANZi Ventures and Mastercard. In March 2019 Airwallex was valued over $1 billion USD after its Series C financing and became one of the fintech unicorns in APAC. The company was also named one of the world’s top 50 fintechs in KPMG’s 2019 and 2018 Fintech100 reports.

As the Learning & Development Manager you are expected to influence the Management Committee and leaders at all levels to adopt and support effective approaches to learning and development. You will also be involved in designing in-house learning programmes (classroom and e-learning) and managing budgets. Ultimately you will help our company succeed by training and developing its people.


The role is both a strategic and operational role. Hence you will be required to meet with the senior management on a regular basis in this standalone role. You will also need to liaise with them to align the overall learning and development strategy with the broader business goals of the company including leading the process requirements for e-learning module implementation at regional scale. You are expected to deliver the leadership training and building functional learning academy with functional leaders. 


Key Responsibilities

  • Planning creating implementing and improving learning solutions that support business goals and strategic objectives through systems frameworks processes and tools
  • Evaluate organizational development needs create and execute learning strategies and programs to address those needs
  • Develop and deploy numerous concurrent learning programs that demonstrably improve our leaders’ abilities to build high-performing teams coaching culture and drive results
  • Implement various learning methods region and country wide (e.g. coaching job-shadowing online training)
  • Design coordinate and deliver e-learning courses workshops and other trainings
  • Assess the success of development plans and help employees make the most of learning opportunities
  • Identifying opportunities for development developing business cases and championing initiatives
  • Ensure consistent learning methodologies are designed and scaled across the spread of the workforce
  • Coordinate engaging training and development programs through a combination of learning methods
  • Explore and stay current on opportunities to introduce and expand digital learning
  • Maintain track and report L&D KPIs with all Country HRBPs 


Key Responsibilities

  • Tertiary qualification in Human Resources Organizational Psychology or certification in training coaching and development. Professional certification in Coaching (e.g. CPLP) is a plus
  • A strong understanding of coaching and development techniques and delivery across a global organization
  • Solid understanding of learning principles digital learning experiences and working cross- culturally
  • Track record in learning cultural change at organisational level; experience in identifying needs developing strategies and implementing L&D initiatives and programs with the ability to build a flexible approach to meet diverse needs
  • Consultative and collaborative approach to end-to-end Learning & Development across global teams with stakeholders at various levels
  • Experience of coaching at a senior level in a complex matrixed organisation.
  • Demonstrable experience of managing projects and delivering successful outcomes.
  • Demonstrable experience of thought leadership and the development of innovative approaches to complex problems.
  • Proven capabilities as a senior leader and manager with a proactive flexible and inclusive style appropriate to the complexity and diversity
  • Able to proactively develop team dynamics and performance ensuring quality standards are achieve
  • Excellent training delivery skills techniques communication and negotiation skills
  • Proficient in MS Office and Learning Management Systems (LMS)
  • Passionate and focused around delivering results in an ever changing and demanding global environment
  • Excellent organisational skills: Ability to deliver projects to plan and cost and quality.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Strong work ethic and willingness to continuously upskill


Only shortlisted candidates will be notified

About us

Do you enjoy working in a team environment providing strategic counsel and advisory services to leaders on business- and people-related issues? Do you take an energetic and influential approach to bring challenge and perspective to a business agenda? Would you get job fulfillment by playing a pivotal role in making sure our environment is the best possible workplace for our associates? Do you have a high regard for personal accountability and fully understand why integrity trust and customer focus are essential qualities to display within the Human Resources function?

If so DHL Supply Chain has the opportunity for you.

We’re looking for top notch HR Business Partners to provide outstanding customer service to our business leaders at distributions centers and regional offices across the country. We need people who thrive in a fast-paced environment who are looking for a good challenge and who are dedicated to creating and developing superior customer relationships. You’ve got to be sharp and you must be on your game every day… because you will be an essential part of everyday life.

Responsibilities

ome of our distribution centers are free-standing. Others are on-site with customers. No matter where we are we’re part of their team we’re invested in their success and our operation is fully transparent. DHL Supply Chain is a world-class company and we hire only world-class people. People who aren’t afraid to work hard – in fact people who want to work hard.   In this HR Business Partner role you will need to:

  • Partner with the Business to proactively identify and solve issues to achieve business goals

  • Act in both strategic and tactical capacities providing full life-cycle Human Resources support

  • Work closely with business leaders to evolve and embed the people element of the business strategy

You won’t find a HR opportunity like the one you’ll find with DHL Supply Chain. If you're an exceptional HR expert with a can-do attitude who's passionate about doing things the right way the first time join us – the world is waiting for you. Now here’s what we need from you:

Job Title: Stakeholder Engagement Unit Career Consultant [Career Services Division]
Job Description:
Overview Of Position

The Stakeholder Engagement Unit (SEU) Team Member works with both employers and Careers Connect registered job seekers in matching talents to suitable job openings. Your role will be to analyse plan engage and advise employers on suitable candidates. On the jobseekers’ front you are a trusted partner in their career journey helping to identify suitable opportunities and opening doors for them to pursue putting them favourably in front of prospective employers. In doing so close partnership with both jobseekers and employers would be critical. Hence employer relationship management and client account servicing are crucial skillset. You will be in position to influence and advise employers on progressive and effective hiring practices in order to attract the right talent.

With your human resource recruitment expertise or vast industrial experience you are determined and passionate in bringing together mutually beneficial opportunities for both the employer and jobseeker. To achieve this you seek to understand and improve the nature of talent acquisition and recruitment processes today. As part of the Careers Connect network across Singapore you will join many like-minded individuals like yourself in delivering professional career services to our jobseekers and employers.

Tasks And Duties At This Level Includes

Be an advocate for Jobseeker
  • Identify jobseekers’ unique selling proposition and their suitability vis-à-vis targeted employers/jobs.
  • Prepare and brief shortlisted candidates for job opportunities and selection.
  • Collaborate within the SEU team to identify job opportunities and achieve synergy in serving the jobseekers and employers.
  • Leverage talent or job-matching technologies to support and manage candidates from our database of jobseekers.

Employer Engagement and Relationship Management
  • Plan and customise employer engagement and marketing strategy for the Careers Connect brand and services.
  • Engage and establish relationship with employers to understand and address their recruitment and hiring needs.
  • Profile and document job vacancies hiring requirements crucial to making quality candidate referrals and job-fit.
  • Partner with internal divisions and external public agencies to engage employers through joint programmes.


Jobs Labour Market Information and Trends Analysis
  • Conduct job analysis and/or other methods to support employers in writing quality job descriptions to better reflect actual hiring needs and requirements by hiring managers.
  • Provide up-to-date information on labour market trends and occupational insights.
  • Provide advisory on WSG programmes and schemes to support employers.


Essential Selection Criteria Include
  • Tertiary qualification
  • 3 years’ working experience in business development human resource or recruitment is preferred
  • Confident in at least one industry domain and knowledge.
  • Self-directed resourceful enterprising and persuasive.
  • Possess strong business acumen interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Demonstrated commitment towards helping Singaporeans on their career journey raising their employability level and achieve job placement.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience in service excellence or customer relationship management (CRM) will be welcomed.
  • Certificate of Employment Intermediaries (CEI) will be advantageous.
  • The ability to converse in Mother Tongues will be advantageous.

The Job
  • Assist in the selection and curation of training programmes in the annual corporate training calendar
  • Roll out corporate training programmes according to schedule
  • Ensure training workshops and employee's training records are updated in learning management system
  • Manage both in-house and external training programmes certification programmes and professional examinations
  • Handle enquiries according to company's Learning & Development policies
  • Conduct learning needs analysis at the organization division and department level
  • Source for training programmes to address learning needs/requirements as per FutureReady framework and competencies outlined in Career Books
  • Coordinate with learning partners on the roll-out
  • Oversee the coordination of new hires' orientation programme; Update and review relevance of orientation programme contents
  • Track training evaluation and take action on feedback provided to enhance subsequent programmes and selection of training partners
  • Track and report training budget utilization


Key Requirements
  • Sound knowledge of company's Learning & Development Policies
  • Familiarity with government funding and subsidies for learning programmes
  • Familiarity with competencies and Skill Future Framework
  • Minimum two years’ experience in a similar function


Technical Skills & Competencies
  • Employee Communication Management
  • Human Resource Practices Implementation
  • Learning and Development Programme Management
  • Stakeholder Management
  • Business Acumen


To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

The incumbent is responsible for full spectrum of HR in the capacity of HR Business Partner (HRBP) as well as deputy Country HR (Singapore) to achieve business goals in the short and long term and in alignment with Global HR strategy. This includes employee communication talent management quality and timely recruitment performance management equitable compensation and benefits programs learning and development needs assessment and career development employee engagement change management employee relations succession planning and other global HR initiatives/Programs. Specifically


As HRBP

• Be the trusted advisor for assigned Global Functions to support the team with organization changes communication employee relations career progression employee engagement grievance handling for Singapore based employees and work with respective country HR for employees based outside Singapore

• Drive employee engagement process program and facilitate employee engagement improvement discussion and action with global functional heads; and track progress. Coach support line and functional leaders to ensure positive engagement scores

• Manage employee relations and schedule communication sessions to ensure 2-way communication to positively engage and motivate employees

• Ensure implementation of target selection or HSO interview tool including EPICA assessment and hiring process is followed so that quality hires meeting job specifications on functional and leadership competency as well as cultural fit are hired to improve organization competency. Ensure timely and good quality recruitment as per plan

• Conduct coach and support leaders in annual organization capability review by site global functions or department to ensure that we capture the right capability map. Ensure implementation of developmental actions and report the development on quarterly basis so as to ensure a strong pipeline of quality


As Deputy Country HR

·  Ensure HR daily operations (onboarding and life cycle management) are smoothly end efficiently run to support the daily business activities

• Supervise HR Ops team in developing in review and update of HR policies

 and procedures

• Work with line leaders to develop annual and quarterly manpower plan and labor cost budget rolling up to Singapore P&L. Track progress and explain variance. Consolidate global headcounts by function and location for action and reporting

• Prepare and attend to audits internally and externally

• Ensure implementation of HRIS modules with training and change management.  

·  Ensure HR Ops team maintain up-to-date and accurate employee records in file and databases.

• Ensure legal compliance on all labor matters under Singapore jurisdiction


As a member of GHQ HR team

• Lead/contribute to projects/initiatives/programs as assigned by Senior Director Global HR


Education

• Bachelor’s degree in HR PHR and/or SPHR accreditation or equivalent


Experience

• Requires a minimum of 8-10 years of HR generalist experience in matrix environment. 


Skills

• Requires excellent interpersonal and communication skills and at ease in dealing with people at all levels

• Possess a high degree of integrity initiative and self-motivation

• Hands on and tenacity; highly agile and role model for HSO values

• Continuous learning attitude and instills the same in others

• Fluent in both written and spoken English and Chinese


Travel Requirement

Able to travel 10% of the time mainly in APAC

• Minimal to have a degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Computer Engineering or relevant Information Technology domain
• Must have at least 3 years of SAP SuccessFactors working experience
• Must have working experience in Singapore with clients for SuccessFactors
• Should have good implementation experience on SAP SuccessFactors modules stated above
• Should be proficient in Business Analysis Business Knowledge Testing HCM Architecture Knowledge
• Presales experience will be added advantage
• Consulting experience is most preferred
• NO VISA sponsorship for this position
• Heavily involved in either on SAP SuccessFactors modules especially on Learning Management Goal Management and Performance Management

About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries we offer Strategy and Consulting Interactive Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients people shareholders partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Role Summary

The Asia Pacific (APAC) HR Employee Service Delivery Team Lead is responsible for providing HR administration services to the designated client through the ongoing day to day operational work to support client employee across the APAC region.

Main Responsibilities

Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online in the classroom or in collaboration with teammates. Description


ARCADIS is the leading global Design & Consultancy firm for natural and built assets. Applying our deep market sector insights and collective design consultancy engineering project and management services we work in partnership with our clients to deliver exceptional and sustainable outcomes throughout the lifecycle of their natural and built assets.

We are 27000 people active in over 70 countries that generate more than €3.4 billion in revenues. Within Asia we can call upon the skills and resource of over 4000 professionals based throughout the region. We support UNHabitat with knowledge and expertise to improve the quality of life in rapidly growing cities around the world. Arcadis. Improving quality of life.

The Human Resources Business Partner will provide professional HR support in the development and delivery of the People Promise transactional elements of HR and interventions to get the right result for internal clients.

The role will directly report into the Market Head Singapore and have a dotted report to the Head of HR Operations Asia.

Main Purpose of the Job
  • Act as focal point of HR to Business leaders to provide strategic and operational people initiatives to positively influence business objectives
  • Line management responsibility for an HR team to support daily HR operations covering the entire employee life cycle including induction performance management reward review exit interviews etc. ensuring that the HR plan is delivered consistently and in line with best practice and legal requirements
  • Working alongside line managers to ensure the optimal workforce structure and reporting relationships are in place to deliver business objectives
  • Proactively support guide coaching and build capability in line managers to manage performance management talent identification and succession planning
  • Takes ownership of the Diversity and Inclusion Program to ensure initiatives are delivered according to the action plan
  • Research market best practice and review and analyze HR processes and practices to continuously make improvements
  • Work closely with regional mobility team to provide support in international mobility and staff relocation including design of remuneration packages and relocation support
  • Provide due diligence and up to date advice on local labour legislation to business leaders and line managers
  • Analyze feedback received either verbally or through engagement surveys to implement adjust
  • Lead all HR change initiatives including but not limited to digitalization of the HR function new ways of working etc
  • Develop and ensure the delivery of an efficient and timely HR service to our people
  • Enhancing performance excellence and ensuring all HR operational activities are driving business objectives
  • Responsible for partnering with business leaders in the specific client group as key stakeholders to deliver the People Promise
  • Provide direction on people issues establishing action plans focusing on vital opportunities to provide HR solutions that add value or mitigate risk
  • Responsible for the transition of all HR administration including payroll to the Global Shared Services
  • Work closely with the Regional Centers of Excellence such as HR Ops C&B L&D Talent Acquisition etc to ensure the implementation and delivery of global and regional initiatives and best practice
  • Support develop and coach HR team with their personal and professional development to ensure an HR succession plan
  • Additional ad-hoc projects and duties as required.

Qualifications


Job Specification
  • Degree in Human Resource or related discipline
  • More than 6 to 8 years' experience working in an MNC organization
  • Solid generalist HR experience gained across HR Ops C&B L&D etc
  • Ability to effectively address and influence key stakeholders at all levels
  • Good attention to detail good organizational planning and decision-making skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to coach advise and challenge business leaders and line managers
  • Self-driven independent proactive and a good team player
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize work load
  • Proficiency in both spoken and written English
  • An ability to demonstrate commercial and cultural awareness and understanding of the business and its operations and translate this into practical processes that can be practically utilised
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel Word PowerPoint
  • Experience of using HR software such as Oracle

Why Arcadis?

At Arcadis you will have the opportunity to build the career that’s right for you. Because each Arcadian has their own motivations their own career goals. And as a ‘people ﬁrst’ business it’s why we’ll take the time to listen to understand what you want from your time here and provide the support you need to achieve your ambitions.

We believe that by working together diverse people with different experiences develop the most innovative ideas. Equality diversity and inclusion is at the heart of how we improve quality of life and we work closely with our people across six ED&I Workstreams- Age Disability Faith Gender LGBT+ and Race. A diverse and skilled workforce is essential to our success.
