Established in 2020 the Singapore Studio is Riot’s second international game development studio. Working together with our Hong Kong Studio Riot has been expanding our footprint in Asia and accelerating our talent growth to develop games that deliver great experiences to our players. Our mission is to “scale Riot’s games to hyper-serve players.”

We partner with our LA headquarters on game development for League of Legends Teamfight Tactics and Legends of Runeterra. We’re also building teams for VALORANT and Project L our take on a fighting game. The Singapore Studio is seeking talented passionate Rioters with backgrounds in all areas of game development to build games that make it better to be a player.

We’re focused on working together to promote individual autonomy ownership collaboration and inclusivity so every Rioter can be their best while we boldly pursue games.

That’s where you come in.

Riot’s People team exists to help Rioters make better decisions around its talent. We bring our expertise to all of those typical HR activities such as hiring on-boarding training and development diversity and inclusion performance management benefits perks compensation big events labor relations off-boarding so that all Rioters can flourish.

As Director People reporting to our Head of People & Operations you will support the Hong Kong & Singapore (HKSG) Studio through a time of high growth. You will work directly with senior leadership to develop strategic talent plans aligned with Riot’s top company and studio priorities. You will thoughtfully integrate essential elements across the Rioter (employee) lifecycle (recruitment performance development compensation) and develop culturally-appropriate Rioter engagement and retention strategies.

Responsibilities
  • You will serve as a strategic business partner to the HKSG studio's executive team to develop lead and own the studio's long-term holistic organization & talent management strategy and goals.
  • You will build lead and coach a team of HRBPs recruiters and People Program Managers ensuring that they have a high level of business insight and deliver high-quality results.
  • You will be the strategic partner to our HQ People Team in LA todrive alignment on the People requirements for our studio and to execute on both global and regional People Programs. Assess and understand changing business needs market trends and adjust the studio's People strategy accordingly. You will build and leverage industry relationships & networks to learn best practices share Riot's thought leadership and build relationships to support talent acquisition (e.g. with universities gaming organizations etc.).
  • Partner with HKSG's leadership team to provide strategic guidance for organizational planning and talent development initiatives that support the studio's key business strategies. Lead the change management to guide Rioters through the process of implementing new People programs.
  • Develop and drive talent management programs including performance management talent review and calibration Rioter retention and total rewards (compensation & benefits) programs.
  • Champion Riot's values and a high-performing culture by executing best practices to promote Rioter engagement including employee events special people initiatives and recognition programs.
  • Identify Learning and Development (L&D) training needs for teams and individuals and develop holistic curriculums.
  • Champion diversity & inclusion (D&I) through Asia-specific programs (e.g. Women@Riot) and promote corporate social responsibility.
  • Use people analytics to inform people strategies including the Global Riot Survey (GRS) to identify engagement drivers and work with leaders to manage their action plans.
  • Responsible for organization compliance with country legislation pertaining to all People matters. Provide counsel in conjunction with Legal as needed to employees and management on employment issues.


Required Qualifications
  • Bachelors degree in Human Resources Organization Business or related field required.
  • 15+ years experience of Human Resource Management; with 4+ years in HR leadership position managing a geographically distributed team.
  • Experience as the general manager of the human resources function with broad expertise in all areas (e.g. talent acquisition compensation) and managing across multiple functions in the HR space.
  • Experience advising and directly supporting senior executives across multiple functions with a consultative style.
  • Experience developing compelling data-driven business cases and building culturally-appropriate programs and plans designed to empower people and influence senior leaders to act.
  • Comfortable working through ambiguous situations; manages change in a positive attitude shows resilience and high level of emotional maturity.
  • Experience in tech gaming entertainment and/or creative industry working directly with creative and production teams.


Desired Qualifications
  • Master’s degree highly desirable.
  • Managed HR teams for Asia regional offices. HR experience in Singapore with knowledge of local SG labor / employment laws.
  • Mandarin speaker a plus.


Our Perks
  • Full relocation support
  • Full health insurance for you your spouse and children
  • Open paid time off
  • Retirement benefits with company matching
  • Life insurance parental leave plus short-term and long-term disability
  • Play Fund so you can broaden and deepen your knowledge of our players and community through games
  • We will double down on your donations of time and money to non-profits


Don’t forget to include a resume and cover letter. We receive a lot of applications but we’ll notice a fun well-written intro that shows us you take play seriously.

Position Overview

The purpose of this role is to define and execute the Learning and Development strategy for BIG closely aligned with business strategic priorities. The job holder will be responsible for designing required development programs and learning interventions to support the development of leaders at all levels in line with business needs for now and for future.

This is a thought leadership role which will include setting up and leading Learning & Development COE supporting all BIG countries. The design of learning strategy and programs will be done in close partnership with business stakeholders functional capability teams BIG HR Directors and country teams to ensure close alignment with business needs effective execution of learning interventions to foster continuous competency enhancement and to create continuous learning culture. The role has a budgetary responsibility of managing central BIG L&D budget. This role will report into the Talent & Development Director for Bottling Investments Group.

Key Responsibilities
  • Design and implement L&D strategy for Bottling Investments Group
  • Set up Learning & Development Center of Excellence and lead BIG Learning Community of Practice
  • Work with BIG Business Leaders Capability teams and HR Directors to identify the learning needs and ensure the same are aligned to the L&D strategy & business plan.
  • Partner with Global TCCC Learning COE to define the design and content of BIG Group development programs
  • Be a custodian of all L&D process & programs and ensure a common theme or customized solutions as appropriate
  • Ensure the quality of delivery of BIG programs across the territory.
  • Partner with country teams to help solve issues / problems pertaining to specific L&D processes and work towards the improvement of the same.
  • Track the effectiveness of the delivered programs and build analytics to take informed decisions regarding required enhancements to address current/future needs.
  • Manage external service providers to ensure that best learning solutions are designed and delivered at maximum throughput.
  • Digitize the learning Content & modules introduce technology related solutions to maximise scale of learning at appropriate cost investments.
  • Bring in thought leadership on world class Learning and Development practices from the market and represent BIG best practices in external industry forums.

Scope

Geography: 15 countries of Bottling Investments Group including: India Philippines Singapore Malaysia Brunei Vietnam Cambodia Myanmar Sri Lanka Nepal Bangladesh and 4 BIG Gulf countries – UAE Oman Bahrain & Qatar

What You Need To Be Successful
  • Bachelor’s Degree required. Masters or Post Graduate Degree in Leadership Development organizational Psychology HR Management preferred.
  • 12+ work experience in the area of learning and development
  • Work experience in multinational/matrixed organisation
  • Experience in designing and delivery of training interventions at various leadership levels
  • Knowledge/certification of development tools (e.g. MBTI DISC learning effectiveness Measuring ROI Learning Management systems
  • Proven consulting experience in working with executives and senior leaders. Experience working in a variety of Leadership Development roles is desired.

Travel Requirements

The role will involve travel to Business Units that the incumbent is not based out of (3-4 days/ month)

Our Growth Culture

One of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years is having a company culture that supports and rewards behaviors that lead to growth. Our “Growth Behaviors” as we call them are ways of being and working that help to make us successful. Think about how you can bring this to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

Curious

Regional HR Partner Group Human Resources


Who We Are

Cityneon is a global experience entertainment company specializing in unique immersive and large-scale experiences. We partner with billion-dollar studios large corporations and various government entities globally to create truly immersive experiences. Our group of subsidiaries – BIG LAB Animax Designs Victory Hill Exhibitions and CNeX powers our core capabilities of Content Creation Engineering & Logistics Intellectual Property Management and M.I.C.E & Project Management such that we are able to design and create highly anticipated experiences all around the world all year round.



The Position

We are seeking a Regional Human Resources Partner (HRP) to drive the development and implementation of Group HR strategies in support of our businesses globally.


You will partner closely with Business Leaders and in-country HR teams to develop customise and execute HR strategies that foster growth drive results and increase organisational effectiveness. With strong commercial acumen you are able to understand and anticipate business priorities and curate people agenda that supports the business. You are pivotal in reviewing and leading organisational design and structure change leadership and culture assimilation. You will also be responsible for implementing annual HR programs such as workforce planning performance reviews compensation benchmarking and succession planning for the regional offices aligned with overall business priorities and long-term goals.


In this role you will have the opportunity to participate in regional projects such as setting up pre- and post-legal entity integrating global processes and policies building diversity & inclusion as well as supporting global mobility. The unique mix of job responsibilities allow you to partner with Business Leaders and HR teams dynamically to have a broader perspective towards understanding business priorities and shaping HR strategic efforts.

   

This role will be based in Singapore (Global Headquarter) and report to the Group Head Human Resources.


Who You Are

You are someone who influences your own development pursues your interests across functions and geographies and understands that a job title is not the final definition of who you are but a starting point.


You should ideally possess at least a Degree in Human Resources or related field with at least 10 years of regional and/or global business partnering experience in a complex and fast paced organisation in high growth mode. Driven by strong commercial acumen you have strong communication and influencing skills coupled with the ability to build relations effectively across levels and cultures. You are resourceful innovative and pragmatic in implementation and delivery and focus on the impact rather than the process. You are independent self-starter driven willing to experiment and shape your role.


Apply online with your full resume current and expected salaries by 5 November 2020. Shortlisted candidates will be notified within 4 weeks from the application date.

With its new Global Leadership team Biocon Biologics strives to transform patient lives through innovative and inclusive healthcare solutions expanding access to an innovative class of therapies to patients globally.

S/He shall collaborate with the business leaders and HR leaders to develop HR strategies and approaches to attract develop and retain talent in the business. The candidate should have a mix of strong business acumen organization development and human resources expertise coupled with consulting skills required to aid in guidance and development of human resources functions within the business.


Designation: Senior Director / General Manager

Location: Singapore


OPEN FOR SINGAPORE NATIONALS ONLY

  • This role is also a highly collaborative one where the incumbent collaborates with other HR colleagues and leadership in developing and executing a lifecycle approach to people management focused on forecasting staffing development on-boarding performance management retention succession planning talent movement and leveraging workforce insights and analytics

About Us

FMC is an agricultural sciences company that advances farming through innovative and sustainable crop protection technologies. From our industry leading discovery pipeline to unique application systems to modern biological products we are passionate about bringing new solutions to farmers around the world. For more than 130 years FMC has been rooted in agriculture and innovation.

 

Our six Core Values define who we are and how we do business: Integrity Safety Sustainability Respect for People Agility and Customer Centricity. Collectively these values guide us as individuals and as a team of 6500 people around the world.

 

At the Asia Pacific regional headquarters in Singapore you become part of an inclusive team that works together to bring value to growers across the region through differentiated sustainable and innovative crop protection and nutrition solutions. With an Asia Pacific organization comprising around 2500 employees spread across 17 countries you will be joining a truly diverse international team.

 

About the Role

As a HR Generalist you will provide support for the full spectrum of HR operations activities: including administration rewards payroll talent acquisition HR communication employee engagement performance management and employee relations to help drive business initiatives.

 

More specifically your responsibilities include:

  • Support full end-to-end recruitment and selection process
  • Prepare new employee orientation requirements including pre-onboarding and onboarding; and employee offboarding activities
  • Responsible for payroll and benefits administration
  • Is the main liaison for leave administration related matters

  • Provide support for annual processes such as performance management leave reconciliation IR8A YA2021 data collation and compensation review

  • Provide input for business surveys mandated by the local statutory boards
  • Ensure all required information and employee data are accurately maintained and updated promptly in HR SAP and employee personnel files
  • Provide support for the HR Modernization Project
  • Support all HR activities related to the set-up of the Singapore Technical Center

 

About You

The key to success in this position is a strong drive for results and the agility to be able to switch gears at the drop of a hat. You have a core foundation in the many functions of Human Resources and are able to wear many hats throughout the day and stay on track with your everyday responsibilities.

 

We also imagine that you have:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Must be well organized meticulous and possess good planning skills
  • Maintains confidentiality in all situations

 

What We Offer

  • Exciting opportunities to learn and grow within a dynamic results-focused and growth-oriented international business where your education and professional experience are valued and put to use from day one
  • A diverse and inclusive work environment where you can bring your whole self to work

Accounting/Finance - Payrolls Analyst

Job Description

The successful candidate will be part of Finance Division Payrolls Department. He/She will be responsible for the submission of budget forecast and variance analysis of payroll costs for management reporting. In addition he/she will be involved in the review of overseas’ stations payroll process and perform trend analysis on overseas stations’ payroll cost. He/She will also ensure prompt and accurate reporting of personal tax for Directors to Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore and ensure that provisions for staff related payments/schemes etc. are made accurately and in compliance with accounting standards.

Key Responsibilities
  • Preparation of budget forecast and variance analysis of payroll costs as part of the management reporting process.
  • Review overseas’ stations payroll process including evaluation of changes in outsourced payroll vendors and perform trend analysis for overseas station payroll cost.
  • Follow up with departments/ stations to ensure payroll suspense accounts are cleared promptly.
  • Ensure accurate and timely monthly payment of funds to the outsourced vendor for senior management payroll.
  • Report personal tax via IR8A and IR21 for directors to Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore.
  • Quarterly submission of wage bill crew gratuity and defined benefits breakdown for reporting purposes.
  • Ensure that the required provisions for gratuity AWS EAP unutilised leave and any overseas state-mandated schemes etc. are made accurately in the appropriate period.
  • Any other projects as assigned.
Requirements
  • Good Degree in Accountancy or an equivalent professional qualification recognised by ISCA or ACCA qualifications. Knowledge of SAP FICO or SAP HR/Payrolls systems will be an advantage.
  • Good attention to details.
  • Good analytical skills.
  • Effective time management skills.
  • Effective communications skills.

Description

Amazon is looking for an exceptional Human Resource Business Partner (HRBP) to drive the development and implementation of the HR strategy in support of our Amazon Web Services (AWS) team in ASEAN.

In this position you will partner with multiple business leaders along with their respective leadership teams to develop and execute the Organizational and HR strategies that foster growth drive results and increase organizational effectiveness. You must be able to understand business priorities and translate them into a people agenda that supports the business. You will also be responsible for implementing annual HR programs such as performance reviews promotions compensation planning and succession planning as well as action plans resulting from talent reviews as well as employee/manager feedback with your client groups. You will partner with your clients throughout the planning and execution of these programs tying them back to the business priorities and long term goals. You will also work to review and advise on organizational design and structure provide change leadership and management coaching as well as design and deliver organizational interventions and management training. The individual in this role will play a key role in building up the remote ASEAN AWS sites. In this role you will have the opportunity to participate in regional projects and in the development and implementation of internal processes policies and programs as they may relate to benefits/compensation employee engagement career development and employee/manager development.

We are looking for a Human Resource professional who has the ability to diagnose issues use data and insights to develop appropriate solutions and influence outcomes. The individual in this role must be able to interface effectively with leaders peers and employees at all levels of the organization. You will need strategic thinking business acumen excellent communication and influencing skills strong problem solving skills the ability to think and plan for the long term.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
  • Applied business knowledge to work with management team and the HR team to develop and drive organization and people strategies solutions and plans
  • Partner with business on organizational design workforce planning succession planning talent management and competency development to optimize for business objectives and global/market expansion.
  • Sets HR strategy and goals integrating HR/Amazon organization wide-priorities.
  • Partners with the business to lead both annual and mid-year review processes which focus on talent development and performance management.
  • Provide management coaching to business leaders and help drive leader/manager onboarding in line with Amazon’s Leadership Principles.
  • Assess business’ people training needs and facilitate group training sessions as appropriate.
  • Review and analyze business and people metrics including data on retention and employee experience in order to recommend systemic improvements.
  • Provide compensation counsel and support including salary planning review and approval of salary actions promotions and job re-leveling.
  • Work with leaders line managers and employees to address all types of employee relations issues fairly representing all interests.
Basic Qualifications / Experience

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Degree or certification in Human Resources Management or related field.
  • Candidate should have at least 15-20 years of experience in a HRBP role
  • Broad knowledge and experience in human resource management
  • Experience partnering with multiple business leaders in a complex and fast paced business setting which is in high growth mode
  • Strong business partnering skills and HR acumen including problem solving skills critical thinking abilities coaching skills project management abilities
  • Knowledge of employment law in Singapore and various ASEAN countries
  • Ability to influence and partner with different levels of the organization and across countries to achieve results
  • Excellent communication (verbal written and listening) and presentation skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Able to travel as appropriate. This is not extensive.
Preferred Qualifications / Experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience working in a high-tech environment
  • Experience delivering and facilitating training
  • Team building and team development capabilities
  • Change management capabilities
  • HR Experience in ASEAN would be a plus

The Singapore Public Service is operating in a significantly different environment than in the past. Technological disruption global uncertainties demographics shift resource constraints restructuring and transformation to meet diverse needs of varied complexity are some of the challenges faced. The public sector needs to be future-ready with public officers being efficient and effective in meeting the needs of our stakeholders in a changing environment.HR is one of the key enablers of workforce and workplace in public sector organisations. Within PSD the Chief HR Officer’s Office (CHROO) serve to professionalise HR in the Public Service and provide thought leadership to some 2700 HR leaders and officers across the Public Service. CHROO’s vision is to position the Public Service as “The Employer of Choice” to attract manage and develop our officers to contribute towards building a “Trusted Public Service with Citizens at the Centre”.

[The Programme]

Under This Programme Successful Applicants Can Look Forward To a Development Programme Consisting Of

The Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) in PSD is targeted at jobseekers who are keen to develop themselves in the Human Resource (HR) sector.
  • Orientation and foundational programmes that provides a solid understanding of HR and its function in the public sector context.
  • Domain-specific training including in-house programmes and courses to develop professional competencies in functional HR areas and to prepare applicants to attain IHRP certification at the end of the programme.
  • Hands-on experience in HR functional areas and projects including attachments to other agencies in the public sector to deliver on HR outcomes.
At the end of the WSIP you will be equipped with in-demand HR skills and will be ready to pursue more job opportunities in both the public service and the private sector.

[Key Responsibilities]

These May Include But Are Not Limited To

You may be assigned to a range of HR functions during your stint.

Recruitment
  • Support recruitment function to advertise screen and shortlist job applications according to the recruiting requirements.
  • Support recruitment events related logistics and employer branding initiatives.
  • Scheduling of interviews and supporting the onboarding for employees.
  • Work closely with HR Shared Services on processing appointment records maintain employees’ e-pfile and submit inflow requests for onboarding of employees.
Analytics
  • Maintain existing HR data i.e. recruitment training and staff statistics to report to senior management.
Beyond maintaining of HR data you are expected to do simple data analysis when necessary using excel functions and formula.

[Competencies Required]
  • [People & Service Champion] Ability to anticipate the needs of stakeholders to deliver people-centric HR.
  • [Communications & Relationship Management] Ability to communicate effectively and collaborate with stakeholders.
  • [Recruitment] Ability to implement recruitment processes (sourcing assessment and selection) effectively using various platforms to assist where required.
  • [Analytics] Ability to gather and process data apply fundamental data analytics to derive generic trends and identify discrepancies and gaps.
[Other Requirements]
  • Retrenched or mid-careerists with the right attributes but no requisite experience may also apply
  • Interest in shaping the development of the Public Service HR sector
  • Good foundation in excel functions including pivot tables basic functions lookup conditional formatting etc would be advantageous.
  • Meticulous with an eye for detail.
  • Team player self-starter and can work independently in a dynamic environment
Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date.

Successful candidates will be offered a role on contract basis.

About Us

At Cloudflare we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers trillions of requests per month. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware installing software or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare have all web traffic routed through its intelligent global network which gets smarter with every request. As a result they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was recognized by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer and named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

What You Would Do Here

Our focus is getting the best people to work at Cloudflare and then allowing you to do your best work. You will work closely with other Recruiters our People Team Business Partners Coordinator and business leaders across Sales and Engineering to build capability across the organisation.
  • Design and execute customised candidate recruiting plans partnering closely with hiring managers to achieve the best results possible
  • Act as an experienced trusted advisor to hiring managers; providing guidance insights and best practice on their hiring strategies
  • Identify and engage unique and qualified candidates through creative techniques coordinating interviews as needed
  • Regularly manage pipeline activity and maintain data integrity proactively share data-centric updates with internal stakeholders
  • Partner with hiring teams to improve attraction and hiring of diverse candidates
  • Collaborate with others on the recruiting team on initiatives and/or hiring needs that may spike in other areas.


Examples Of Desirable Skills Knowledge And Experience
  • Extensive full-cycle recruiting experience for technical and non-technical roles
  • Experience independently partnering with senior leadership on hiring initiatives
  • Ability to effectively influence and drive toward results in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to identify bottlenecks or issues before they arise
  • Creativity in problem-solving resourcefulness across all stages of the hiring cycle
  • Experience in driving diversity within the recruiting process
  • Demonstrated ability to be detail-oriented and have strong organisational skills
  • Experience in compensation and general HR requirements as related to hiring
  • Ability to work effectively in a highly team-based environment


What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We’re not just a highly ambitious large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016 we have partnered with Path Forward a nonprofit organization to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child parent or loved one.

1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy policy and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their or any other person's perceived or actual race color religion sex gender gender identity gender expression sexual orientation national origin ancestry citizenship age physical or mental disability medical condition family care status or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to changing the application process providing documents in an alternate format using a sign language interpreter or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco CA 94107.

Based in our office in Singapore working alongside the Talent Acquisition and HR team you will support the talent acquisition efforts across East Asia region.
As a Talent Acquisition Advisor your primary role will be responsible for producing the highest calibre of candidates:
  • Partner with internal stakeholders to ascertain and design the job profile of positions.
  • Drive recruitment innovations to achieve market leadership in talent attraction.
  • Be creative in international sourcing and target mapping through the ability to use a variety of tools including on-line portals social media marketing media and other modern research methods of candidates sourcing to ensure cost effectiveness.
  • Manage the end to end talent acquisition activities from job placement to phone interviewing and screening to arranging interviews and managing the job offer and negation process following through with assisting the onboarding of new joiners.
  • To build a healthy talent pipeline at all levels not limited to roles from internships / graduate recruitment; current vacancies strategic positions and potential roles in professional engineering related functions and the energy industry.
  • Generate manage and convert candidate leads to potential hires.
  • Involved in branding and promotional activities partnership with education institutions and networking/career seminars and relevant associations to promote the company and our employee value proposition.
  • Manage both active and passive candidates and ensure a positive candidate experience.
  • Maintain and develop a key talent database as part of our valuable assets of the company.

  • Strong communication listening negotiation and presentation skills.
  • Proficiency in a third language (Japanese or Korean) is desirable.

  • Able to build relationships at every level.
  • Experience in both tactical recruitment delivery and targeted strategic searching.
  • International or regional recruitment experience in engineering and energy sectors.
  • Good knowledge of hiring practices across the region.
  • A team player who is agile flexible and willing to learn.

What You’ll Learn & Achieve
  • Develop and drive tailored recruitment strategies to meet our talent needs
  • Work with hiring managers to define job requirements and develop knowledge of internal customer groups to effectively target recruitment efforts in a cost-effective and efficient manner
  • Utilize creative sourcing techniques to identify top active and passive talent for a variety of positions within the organization.
  • Articulate and represent UL’s value proposition to candidates through clear and compelling messages about our mission and values.
  • Handhold candidates through the recruiting process ensuring a best in class candidate experience
  • Ensure compliance by maintaining candidate activity in the Applicant Tracking System
  • Act as a trusted advisor to hiring managers providing counsel on the talent market hiring decisions and offer negotiations
  • Stays up-to-date on the latest recruiting industry trends and tools and shares best practices with the HR team
  • Enable data driven decision making through analysis of recruiting data
  • Support relevant projects related to talent acquisition and beyond

What Makes You a Great Fit
  • University Degree in Human Resources Business Administration or a related discipline plus generally 5+ years of recruiting experience in a corporate environment or as an agency recruiter
  • Candidate must have recruiting experience to be considered
  • Proven ability to identify and recruit talent in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated success utilizing social networks pro-actively to source candidates
  • Ability to alternate sourcing techniques to find potential candidates
  • Strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated experience building relationships with employees at all levels of an organization
  • Working knowledge of labor law and how it applies to interviewing selection recruitment and placement
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to effectively coordinate multiple jobs projects and administrative duties simultaneously

What You’ll Experience Working At UL

Mission For UL corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.

People Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here and you’ll almost always hear “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best.

Interesting work Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live work and play. And as a global company in many roles you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.

Grow & achieve We learn work and grow together with targeted development reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages including a technical training track for applicable roles.

Learn More

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do visit UL.com

Job Title: Corporate EPP and Education (China and RPAC) Segment Account Manager
Job Description:
Summary
The Corporate EPP program is a great opportunity for employees or large companies (or via third parties) to own Apple products at a special price through personalized stores. The priority is to work across Apple with Enterprise the Business teams to lead opportunities to identify new and grow existing accounts in the portfolio. Partnership with the GC and RPAC Geo lead is critical for inclusion strategic opportunities with key segments such as banks and others.


This is an excellent opportunity for you to establish and grow the Corporate Employee Purchase Program in GC and RPAC (AU JP KR SG TW CN HK) working with Apple’s major Business Customers. In addition this role will support Retail Online’s focus on the Education Segment within GC and RPAC region. The main objective is to establish and grow the CEPP program in the region through managing with Apple’s largest Business Customers and working with personnel from HR administration Marketing and potentially IT systems. Once the program is established within an Account this role will provide ongoing Account Management support and demand generation to ensure the program is appropriately positioned and marketed to the company’s employees.


Education continues to be a key focus for Retail Online and in this role you will be building the best experiences for GC and RPAC’s students and educators to be successful with Apple’s products and services working with a cross functional team across demand generation merchandising affordability marketing and partners to build amazing experiences for students and educators.


Key Qualifications
Excellent communication skills including exceptional written and verbal skills. Must be fluent in Chinese and have strong English level aptitude


Skilled at developing interpersonal relationships with strong presentation and organizational skills


Ability to identify new CEPP opportunities and articulate the benefits as well as manage relationships with existing CEPP customers and growing these accounts.


Skilled at building managing and maintaining relationships across multiple organizations


High energy self starter who is excited to maintain and grow the CEPP and Education business within China and RPAC


Ability to lead and influence others


Attention to detail and robust execution


Analytical skills to construct and present performance for detailed management reporting


Description
The Account Manager will have responsibility for developing signing and rolling out and maintaining the Corporate EPP program to GC’s and RPAC’s major business customers


Evaluation and prioritization of the business potential when bringing on-board new customers in GC and RPAC


Evaluation and determination of potential third party provider opportunities to promote the program in this region


Develop a strong working understanding of Apple’s products and services to where they can by dynamically communicated to a Company’s leadership and employees


Works with the WW CEPP team to develop processes and detailed reporting to track and control performance


Establish relationships with Apple Enterprise Account Executives in GC and RPAC and share Enterprise sales opportunities


Work with regional Legal team if a customer requests or has questions around Program agreements


Work with the WW Retail Online Education team to support improvements to the Education segment shaping experience and with partners


Ability to work in a fast paced environment where priorities can change


As our ideal candidate you are dynamic results-driven and enjoy a faced paced high-change commercial environment. You will have the ability to drive innovative thinking and have a passion for developing sales programs that will create a second to none customer experience and meet business goals. You will be highly commercial and data driven with a strong analytical mind very detail oriented coupled with insatiable curiosity and an innate understanding of how to seek out opportunities solve problems and make things happen.

Job Title: AVP| Talent Acquisition Specialist| Group Human Resources
Job Description:
Business Function

Group Human Resources has the important role of attracting retaining and nurturing talent to ensure that DBS continues to be a competitive employer in Asia. With a well-established team of HR partners we support and deliver effective people-based solutions and services across businesses. Our goal is to build a high-performance organisation by empowering and engaging our employees. Because we believe that banking is about people.

We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist with passion and ambition and with the right attitude and ability to employ creative and innovative methods to help us find the next generation of technology talent. Reporting into the Talent Acquisition Team Lead you will work closely with key stakeholders from the technology lines of business HR business partners HR specialists etc to be responsible for the technology recruitment strategy. You will take ownership of your allocated portfolio on the full recruitment life cycle from active sourcing to offer.

Perseverance proactivity and personality will be your trademarks. Experience in hiring into the banking and finance and/or technology industry would be a huge advantage and you may have earned your stripes either through in-house or agency experiences.

Your Responsibilities Will Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Partnering with HR Business Partners Department Heads and Hiring Managers to understand specific talent needs through a consultative approach and advising accordingly
  • Managing a portfolio of positions simultaneously across the technology businesses
  • Building our knowledge of key markets and developing passive candidates and future talent
  • Evaluating screening and testing candidates' skills experience and cultural fit
  • Developing and advocating the employer brand and penetration into key talent markets across Asia region and other geographies
  • Managing ad hoc HR related projects
You will need to:
  • Possess a relevant degree (e.g. Technology/Engineering Human Resource Management Business Administration or equivalent).
  • Have at least 5 years' background in a technology or resourcing and/or researcher role
  • In-house recruiting experience would be an added advantage.
  • Have prior knowledge of hiring in the region and be familiar with local labour laws.
  • Be comfortable managing volume recruitment as well as ad-hoc projects specifically in technology recruitment.
  • Review and improve recruitment methods to ensure selection techniques and recruitment programs are effective.
  • Ensure positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.
  • Manage recruitment administration and maintain accurate candidate records and data management in the relevant systems.
  • Have a sense of ownership and be a self-starter with initiative enthusiasm and drive.
  • Thrive on change and enjoy the challenge and rewards of working in a fast paced dynamic and growing environment.
  • Have strong planning and time management skills.
  • Be an effective communicator with good written and verbal skills.
  • Possess strong stakeholder management skills ensuring a strong cadence of communications and provide a high-level partnership with the hiring managers.
  • Be curious and eager to learn adapt unlearn and develop.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job Title: Senior Associate| HR & Organisation Development (2-year contract)
Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced HR professional to join the Human Resources & Organisation Development Division. This individual will bring along years of experience in the HR operations space and preferably with experience dealing with disciplinary and conduct cases and being able to manage sensitive conversations in a tactful manner. This is a newly created role which will provide the individual an opportunity to further develop their experience in the HR through working closely with the safe management taskforce in overseeing the employee relations of our safe distancing ambassadors and inspectors.

Job Scope

This Includes

Work closely with the safe management taskforce in ensuring proper implementation of HR related matters for our safe management ambassadors and inspectors.
  • Close monitoring and management of performance and conduct of safe management ambassadors and inspectors. This would include disciplinary and investigation cases which may arise from time to time;
  • Support and management of recruitment partners in the engagement and employment of our safe distancingambassadors and inspectors;
  • Provide advisory and corrective actions in managing disputes and ensuring adherence to MOM guidelines;
  • Support training and upskilling efforts procurement and any other people related support for the safe management taskforce.
Requirements

Should have at least 8 years of experience in HR operations (including benefits payroll and learning & development matters). Candidates should possess the ability to deal with disciplinary and conduct cases (including conducting both internal and external investigations) with familiarity on the Employment Act. Candidates with prior supervisory experience in managing large operations teams or in dealing with union matters for the above areas would be preferred.

Associate Director - 12 month Contract

 Organisation & People – Talent Acquisition

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
Description:

Extraordinary people. Extraordinary results. With more than 20000 employees in more than 40 countries worldwide Mercer is a leading global provider in talent health retirement and investment consulting. Mercer works with clients to solve their most complex benefit and human capital issues designing and helping manage health retirement and other benefits. At Mercer we say we Make Tomorrow Today.

In order to support our team and strengthen the growth of our business in Singapore we are looking for:

REWARDS CONSULTANT - HR Consulting Team

What can you expect?

  • Lead rewards consulting projects as a project manager
  • Work independently and mentor analysts to deliver rewards consulting projects
  • Give advisory to Mercer clients across all rewards domains/topics
  • Harness point-of-view on new developments in total rewards and present point-of-view as an expert in conferences
  • Facilitate senior stakeholder presentations to present proposed solutions and strategies
  • Work with clients across a variety of industries and countries (consultants will be given the opportunities to lead consulting projects across ASEAN region)
  • Conceptualise and lead your very own “passion project” with the aim of developing new products or solutions to bring to market

What is in it for you?

  • Great team culture and work environment
  • Flexible work arrangement
  • Exposure to multiple domains in rewards including advanced rewards projects such as Sales Incentive Plan design and Specialist Job Architecture design
  • Ability to learn from HR experts across Mercer
  • Working with the largest rewards consulting firm in Singapore
  • Employee benefits i.e. Dental and vision care TCM gym membership insurance coverage
  • Opportunities to fly and work in the ASEAN region for client projects
  • Opportunity to build your personal brand by speaking at HR conferences and client sessions

We will count on you to:

  • Be responsible for identifying leads from the consultants in the Career business in Mercer Singapore and sharing the best proposal to the client across different sectors/industries
  • Be a strong individual contributor by developing a point of view for the big project proposals from a total rewards perspective
  • Be responsible for meeting the sales targets for the Rewards Consulting business
  • Be responsible for the coordination and completion of rewards projects including the establishment of project plans milestones and deliverables.
  • Allocate the duties of the project teams to ensure that all tasks and deliverables are proceeding according to schedule.
  • Review regular progress reports from the team and liaison with the client on a regular basis
  • Facilitate and lead decision-making processes required to move projects along to completion and make steady and agreed upon progress on assigned programs/projects.
  • Develop enhance and monitor project management methodologies ensuring that a streamlined process exists and provides evidence that all projects are implemented and successfully delivered to meet standards and requirements.
  • Build relationships with project analysts as well as to resolve issues associated with project implementation
  • Identify implement and ensure that consistent standards of delivery excellence are disseminated leveraged and continuously improved across the organization.
  • Identify training and development of analysts in relation to projects and procedures.

What you need to have:

  • Project management capabilities
  • Stakeholder management
  • Presentation skills for presenting proposals point of views project outcomes etc. to external clients
  • Ability to work in cross-functional teams
  • Domain knowledge in Total Rewards across salary structure grade levelling job evaluation applications incentive pay design etc.
  • Excellent communication and business partnering skill

What makes you stand out:

  • Experienced in compensation benefits pay structure design for minimum 5 years in a consulting role (preferably)
  • Experienced in stakeholder management
  • Passion in HR
  • Good at conducting and reviewing analysis using various tools & techniques commonly applied in the rewards domains

SCDF – THE LIFE-SAVING FORCE

We are part of Singapore's Home Team. Our mission - to protect and save lives and property for a safe and secure Singapore. When you join us you join the ranks of an elite team of professionals entrusted to safeguard the stability of our nation. You make a difference in the lives of our citizens.

Responsibilities

The Contract Positions (11-month) will be required to perform basic administrative duties. You may also be required to do data analysis and present the findings. Working closely with other functional members you will be part of a dynamic team of SCDF officers that deliver mission critical support and ensuring high levels of performance and availability.

Minimum Requirements
  • Basic computing skills (Microsoft Word Excel PowerPoint)
  • Good command of English
  • Good interpersonal analytical planning and organisational skills
  • Meticulousness in the completion of tasks
  • Team player who can work under pressure pro-active and result-driven
  • Preferably with Accounting Business Studies or Human Resource related disciplines fresh graduates are also welcomed.
If you are shortlisted for the position(s) you should hear from us within 30 days of the closing date of the advertisement.

Job Title: Senior Manager/Manager (Capability and Organisation Development) - Contract
Job Description:
As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public you will find your niche in our big family.

Corporate Development

We have a strong corporate development team to engage our staff and support our business operations. There is a wide range of job opportunities from Finance Audit Strategic Planning Risk Management to Human Resource and Organisation Development. If you are meticulous enjoy planning and implementing internal policies to help meet organisation objectives this is the job for you.

Responsibilities
  • Plan and implement employee engagement strategies with a focus on engagement communication
  • Support management by aligning staff to corporate directions and engaging them via communication channels such as Intranet forums and social media
  • Provide internal communication advice to management and other departments
  • Carry out internal communications during a crisis
  • Map out communication themes and schedule
  • Create corporate communication materials including writing and editing articles developing concepts and storyboards for videos slides etc.
  • Carry out ground-sensing so provide management with feedback on selected issues
  • Lead a team of 2 to manage the intranet and implement engagement communications initiatives.


Requirements
  • An excellent command of English and able to write in a clear and engaging manner
  • Ability to tell a story in words and visuals
  • Experience in writing for the web
  • Be an independent officer who is able to multi-task
  • Ability to process information and repackage it for easy understanding
  • Photoshop and video-editing skills preferred
  • Supervisory skills preferred
  • Candidates are required to submit at least one sample of their communication work (e.g. articles videos) along with their resume.

    • Find out more at CPF Careers page

    TRUST. Everything We Stand For.

Traineeship Description

This position reports to the HR Manager (Continuous Improvement & Technology) and will be required to manage the development and maintenance of HR systems in SIAEC and be the local IT support for HRD. He/she has to liaise with internal stakeholders (e.g. staff HR function owners ITD) and external stakeholders (e.g. SAP/Technical Support team).

Responsibilities
  • Work with relevant stakeholders (e.g. HR function owners staff) for timely resolution of system-related HR issues and conduct troubleshooting as and when required
  • Manage projects and collaborate with HR function owners to implement HR Information System (HRIS) enhancements or digitalise/automate existing processes for the purposes of supporting new policies or improving efficiency respectively
  • Local IT Coordinator for HR: Raise and review access rights in accordance to requirements and ensure there are no violations with company guidelines
  • Manage the IT assets under the division
  • Provide IT support for HRD staff e.g. set up of workstation (PC phone etc) for new HR staff


Technical Skills and Competencies Trainee will acquire during SGUnited Traineeship Programme:
  • How to manage projects (Agile methodology)
  • Gain experience with HRIS
  • Gain understanding of employment practices HR policies and processes
  • Active participation in issue troubleshooting and resolution
  • How to engage different stakeholders professionally


Education Requirements
  • Degree in any field preferred.


Duration Of Traineeship
  • 9 months


Eligibility Criteria

  • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident; and
  • Graduated or graduating in calendar year 2019 or 2020 from ITEs polytechnics universities or other educational institutions (e.g. private universities and overseas institutions); or
  • Graduated earlier from above institutions and completed National Service in 2019 or 2020.

Job Title: Regional HR Business Partner/ Manager| HR Business Partner
Job Description:
The HR Business Partner partners with the Site/Regional/Global HRBP(s) and works with business managers across multiple units within a business region function or site to ensure HR deliverables are met. He/She represents HR in business decisions; provides input into HR programs initiatives and service delivery strategy based on business needs. He/She provides support in the deployment and delivery of HR initiatives and works with the Site/Regional/Global Business HR team on the HR strategic plan creation alignment and implementation.

Responsibility 1: Partner with Site/Regional/Global HRBPs and leaders on people strategy and initiatives while maintaining strategic alignment with organizational priorities and HR

  • Partner with HRBP(s) to be the voice of the customer to HR and the face of HR to the customer - ensuring successful program & process development and deployment with HR Functions
  • Partner with HRBP(s) to bring the business back to HR - increase visibility to business; align HR team globally to business priorities and deliver relevant and impactful HR solutions to the business
  • Learn leverage and influence HR best practices across Business HR team
  • Partner with HRBP(s) to drive discussions related to workforce and organization design changes and provide recommendations
  • Participate and represent HR in strategic business plan development and advise on implications of decisions
  • Partner in the development and implementation of the organization's HR strategies and programs in alignment with global/regional/site objectives. Translate local business requirements into HR goals and actions in line with the HR agenda and regulatory requirements

Responsibility 2: Partner with HR functions to provide HR solutions to meet business needs

  • Be the voice of the customer to HR and the face of HR to the customer - ensuring successful program & process development and deployment with HR Functions
  • Bring the business back to HR - increase visibility to business; align HR team globally to business priorities and deliver relevant and impactful HR solutions to the business
  • Learn leverage and influence HR best practices across Business HR team
  • Anticipate and address HR related trends and issues impacting the business and provide insights recommendations plans tools and solutions

Responsibility 3: Partner with HRBP(s) on the implementation of HR strategies programs and solutions

  • Partner with site regional and global HRBP(s) to drive discussions related to workforce and organization design changes and provide recommendations
  • Participate and represent HR in strategic business plan development and advise on implications of decisions
  • Partner in the development and implementation of the organization's HR strategies and programs in alignment with business objectives. Translate local business requirements into HR goals and actions in line with the HR agenda and regulatory requirements
  • Partner with Business HR team(s) to enable alignment of HR solutions

Responsibility 4: Champion change initiatives organizational values and culture; Enhances organizational leadership and effectiveness

  • Coach and influence Leaders – help leaders be great
  • Counsel senior business leaders on talent matters
  • Model and instill the Micron culture and organizational values within the business
  • Identify business needs help lead organizational change initiatives and communication
  • Enable collaboration between leaders and team members

Overview
  • Assist HR Manager in all facets of Human Resources & Administration including Recruitment & Selection Compensation & Benefits Employee Relations Performance Management Payroll Processing benefits with compliance to Singapore laws
  • Assist HR Manager in development implementation and improvement on HR & Administrative policies and procedures and ensure that payroll is processed in a timely and efficient manner for all staff
  • Back up HR & Admin team members when necessary


Responsbilities

Manage Full Spectrum Of HR Duties
  • Recruitment & Selection
  • Onboarding & Offboarding
  • Employee Relations
  • Performance Management
  • Learning & Development
  • Expatriates Management
  • Orientation & Induction
  • Government grants
  • Payroll Administration
  • HR Administration
  • Work pass application renewal & termination;
  • Claims : NS Childcare and government related;
  • Surveys: MOM and government related;
  • submit IR21 IR8A;
  • Update monthly Organisation Chart and email to Management; and
  • staff and Access Pass etc
  • Timely and accurate update of employee records into HR systems (HQ master database and local HR Software)
  • Assist Department Managers / Group Managers in Human Resources planning
  • Promote safety and security in organization
  • Participate in organising company staff activities
  • Back up / take over the HR & Admin Officer’s role:
  • Assist in event coordination
  • Required to undertake ad-hoc projects/ duties which can be assigned from time-to-time.

Requirement
  • Diploma/Degree with relevant qualification preferably HR related
  • Minimum 5 years hands-on HR Generalist experience
  • Strong knowledge of Singapore labour laws and legislations
  • Self-driven meticulous analytical able to work under pressure. Can do and make a difference attitude
  • Team Player-Receptive and adaptable in New Norm
  • Willing to back up Admin tasks
  • Hands-on Payroll experience in Timesoft Payroll Software an advantage
  • Expatriates management experience will be an added advantage

  • Be responsible for the coordination and completion of rewards projects including the establishment of project plans milestones and deliverables.
  • Allocate the duties of the project teams to ensure that all tasks and deliverables are proceeding according to schedule.
  • Review regular progress reports from the team and liaison with the client on a regular basis
  • Facilitate and lead decision-making processes required to move projects along to completion and make steady and agreed upon progress on assigned programs/projects.
  • Develop enhance and monitor project management methodologies ensuring that a streamlined process exists and provides evidence that all projects are implemented and successfully delivered to meet standards and requirements.
  • Build relationships with project analysts as well as to resolve issues associated with project implementation
  • Identify implement and ensure that consistent standards of delivery excellence are disseminated leveraged and continuously improved across the organization.
  • Identify training and development of analysts in relation to projects and procedures.

What You Need To Have
  • Project management capabilities
  • Stakeholder management
  • Presentation skills for presenting proposals point of views project outcomes etc. to external clients
  • Ability to work in cross-functional teams
  • Domain knowledge in Total Rewards across salary structure grade levelling job evaluation applications incentive pay design etc.
  • Excellent communication and business partnering skill

What Makes You Stand Out
  • Experienced in compensation benefits pay structure design for minimum 5 years in a consulting role (preferably)
  • Experienced in stakeholder management
  • Passion in HR
  • Good at conducting and reviewing analysis using various tools & techniques commonly applied in the rewards domains

Primary Purpose of the Job:


As the Lead HR Systems Project Manager you will be responsible for IT Program/Project Delivery and Maintenance and Support related to the Human Resource domain. You will be responsible for the evaluation and selection of various HR systems and subsequently in managing the full suite of the Human Resource related systems. These include smooth implementation of module enhancements provision of IT support conducting system user training as well as safeguarding system integrity by ensuring accurate setting up and maintenance of user authorisation profiles. You will also provide support in the area of reporting and statistics and be involved in the automation of HR work processes.


You will work closely with the HR users’ community external vendors and other stakeholders. To succeed in this role you need to have in-depth knowledge of end to end HR processes and have successfully implement an end to end HR system project starting from conceptualisation to post-implementation review. 


Key Accountabilities:


•  Work closely with HR business partners functional leads and business stakeholders in reviewing and streamlining HR business processes;

•  Analyse HR systems and processes data flow between HR systems and other systems outside HR;

•  Lead HR systems integration efforts;

•  Lead project working groups and collaborating with multiple stakeholders in the implementation of HR systems;

•  Document system requirements and specifications;

•  Coordinate functional testing test scenarios planning and User Acceptance Testing;

•  Initiate projects and managing business process integration with current practices in HR systems;

•  Ensure compliance to personal data personal act in data transfer; 

• Responsible for HR systems security access;

• Provide support on HR system issues working closely with IT support team to resolve reported issues;

• Develop HR reports and providing analysis reports required to support the business Requirements



Qualifications / Experience:


•  At least 5 years of HR systems implementation experience including systems evaluation implementation enhancement and maintenance;

• Solid implementation experience across multiple sites/geographies (China Singapore Malaysia Cambodia etc);  

• Degree in Information Technology HR or relevant discipline;

• Ability to analyze business process requirements good understanding of end to end HR processes and translate into HR system requirements;

• Proficient in project documentation and reporting;

• Project management certification a plus;

• Possess strong interpersonal and communications skills;

• Meticulous with an eye for detail

Job Title: Senior Associate/Manager| Human Capital Division (1+1 contract)
Job Description:
About EDB

The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business innovation and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development and work with international businesses both foreign and local by providing information connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore.

For more information on EDB please visit www.edb.gov.sg

About The Human Capital Division

The Human Capital Division creates and implements solutions to ensure a sustainable cutting-edge workforce to drive current and future growth industries in Singapore. This include influencing national manpower polices and strategies developing a conducive education and capability development ecosystem to build an industry-ready workforce creating tools and initiatives to enhance talent development across sectors and collaborating with EDB’s industry divisions to shape sectoral resource optimisation and talent strategies.

The impact of Covid-19 on Singapore’s workforce and talent landscape is wide-ranging. The Human Capital Division is looking for individuals with strong analytical ability to supplement the team to analyse these changes and make relevant recommendations for EDB and our industries.

As part of the team your responsibilities include but not limited to:
  • Independently partner advise and co-develop industry/firm-level solutions with EDB’s industry divisions to address talent and capability development interests and/or needs.
  • Engage and work closely with other government agencies and tertiary education institutions on policies and initiatives to augment the workforce.
  • Manage and review talent development products such as training grants. This involves development and review of guidelines advisory on use of product and review of product policy through engagement with stakeholders analysis of product data etc.
  • Analyse workforce data so as to facilitate policy development and enhancement.

To meet the challenges of this role you must have/be:
  • A degree in any discipline
  • At least 2 years of relevant work experience; preferably exposure to consulting capability development corporate/regional HR experience or related areas
  • Independent inquisitive open-minded and resourceful
  • A strategic thinker with strong analytical ability
  • Good language and writing skills
  • Familiarity and interest in the areas of education training and human capital development would be advantageous
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage both internal and external clients
  • Singaporean

Applications are screened on a rolling basis and applicants may expect to receive an application outcome within 8 weeks of application date.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Title: Manager/Senior Manager| Learning & Organisational Devt (2-yr contract)| OHRFA
Job Description:
About Us

Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work plan organise and play together - building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.

Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare competitive compensation packages and generous professional development opportunities - all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder then that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.

Job Description
  • This position is for Office of Human Resources and Faculty Administration (OHRFA).
  • Organisational Development
    • Contribute ideas good practice research and analysis to the development of the L&OD strategy to ensure integration and alignment with strategic goals of the University and HRFA department.
    • Design deliver and evaluate assigned OD and change management strategies processes and interventions to support continuous improvements and a high performance and learning culture.
    • Collaborate with the L&OD team HRFA teams and relevant partners to ensure effective communication consultation coordination and data-driven evaluation of change initiatives.
    • Actively participate contribute to and/or create platforms to drive sharing of best practice knowledge and information across the University.
  • Performance Management
    • Collaborate with L&OD and HRFA teams and a diverse range of stakeholders to ensure targeted communication capacity and capability-building programmes in performance management process to enhance the people management/performance management practice across the University.
    • Design and undertake internal diagnosis process/system design and reviews and engage in research to identify good practice and opportunities. for performance management.
    • Contribute to the development and execution of talent management career progression and succession planning framework for non-faculty staff.
  • Learning & Development
    • Collaborate with the team business and HR colleagues in the organisational learning needs analysis to identify mission critical skills aligned with SMU’s strategy and performance needs.
    • Contribute to the design implementation and management of initiatives in the areas of leadership and talent development employee development digital transformation and sustainable workforce capabilities programmes.
    • Commission manage provide operational support and evaluate internal or external L&D interventions in order to ensure cost-effective delivery of agreed learning and organisational development initiatives.
    • Contribute to the development of coaching mentoring and ‘job rotation’ schemes to support staff development career progression and the achievement of Individual Development Plans.
    • Lead on the development of a staff skills/success profiles learning and knowledge database in order to maximise the diverse talents of the organisation and support effective deployment to strengths.
    • Design implement manage and facilitate in-house learning programmes and workshops.
  • Operational Management
    • Design improve and administer L&OD systems and processes and budget (where assigned); including maintaining accurate records and reports for decision-making and operational effectiveness.
Qualification & Skills
  • Degree qualified preferably in HR Psychology or Education or must have a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience in HR with preferred specialisations/experience in Organisational Development Learning & Development or Performance & Talent Management.
  • Knowledge and understanding of people management theories/ principles change management and developing organisational culture.
  • Preferably have at least 3 years of experience in conducting and analysing organisational audits and assessments [HR-related] learning needs analysis and competency/skills gap analysis etc.
  • Competence in the use of standard Microsoft Office Suite applications; experience of SAP HR excel dashboards and reporting tools preferred.
  • Familiarity with HRIS tools that support Performance Management and Learning processes/activities; conversant in web-learning technologies learning management systems virtual collaboration tools (e.g. Sharepoint Zoom MS Teams etc) and Microsoft Office Applications.
  • Experience in the following areas would be advantageous
    • Training facilitation and courseware/curriculum development
    • Management of 360-degree feedback processes in a multi-cultural and complex environment.
    • Designing and implementing digital transformation capabilities framework and plans.
  • Effective project management skills; possesses accountability detail-oriented and results-focussed.
  • Excellent ability to identify and diagnose issues/problems generate ideas and implement solutions to achieve results.
  • Able to plan organise coordinate multi-task and prioritise under pressure with minimal supervision.
  • Strong interpersonal skills communications and collaboration skills to influence and sustain relationships at all levels of the organization to achieve results.
  • Strong numeracy and ability to gather analyse and present quantitative and qualitative data to drive actions.
  • Able to present or facilitate confidently.
Other Information

Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.
