Job Description

Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for an Executive Search Principal Recruiter within the Johnson & Johnson Corporate Services organization to be located in Beijing Shanghai or Singapore.

Caring for the world one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $76.5 billion in 2017 sales Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products as well as a provider of related services for the consumer pharmaceutical and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 126500 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Thriving on a diverse company culture celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Executive Search Principal Recruiter will support one of J&J sectors and be responsible for designing and conducting research and execute searches for Senior Director and above roles.

You will not only personally execute the searches across the designated business groups but also select and partner closely with retained executive search partners to ensure that we have the leadership bench strength to drive effective and efficient succession management. You will have the opportunity to work with the Executive Search Leadership Team the Talent Management teams Total rewards hiring managers and senior HR team and play a key role in building out the Executive Search delivery model. At this level you will have a greater degree of impact on the implementation of strategies of the Executive Search model.

This position reports directly to the Executive Search Lead and located in either Beijing Shanghai or Singapore.

Responsibilities
  • Understand the business strategy its talent pipeline and guide the overall aligned talent strategy to deliver on the executive recruiting strategy and talent needs.
  • Design and conduct search strategies to attract highly skilled and credentialed candidates. This includes identifying talent gaps in partnership with hiring managers developing job descriptions search strategies and target lists.
  • Prepare for search kick-off meetings including crafting a drafted target list researching industry and relevant products and preparing “get smart” materials.
  • Set and lead the research strategy by identifying and keeping the potential candidate pipeline filled throughout the search process.
  • Cultivate a professional reputation among the senior executive community through deep market expertise and vast professional network.
  • Lead and execute talent market surveys to identify potential external successors for key executive positions.
  • Screen potential candidates and recommend in writing prospects who should be interviewed by the hiring team.
  • Enter all research generated for each search into the search management database. Assist in the preparation of written documentation to internal clients and candidates.
  • Network assess and build trusted relationships with senior industry leaders strengthening your personal network and employer brand.
  • Partner with HR leaders to assist with transition and onboarding for new executives.
  • Embrace an agile mindset and maintain understanding of creative recruitment tools technologies and the best methodologies.


Qualifications

Qualifications
  • Has a required minimum of a Bachelor’s degree and preferably a masters’ degree with a concentration in Industrial/ Organizational Psychology Human Resource Management and/or Business.
  • Has a minimum of 8 years relevant and recent experience in recruiting executives in either a retained search firm agency or corporation is required.
  • Has necessarily a track record in developing and executing creative candidate identification strategies that result in identification and delivery of high-caliber highly compensated executives.
  • Demonstrates a required ability to recruit diverse individuals and ability to negotiate and advise on complex compensation packages is required.
  • Has required strong Microsoft office knowledge (Word Excel and PPT) applicant tracking systems (i.e. TALEO) and search management systems (Encore Filefinder or Avature etc).
  • Has ideally excellent communication (both written and verbal) influencing and negotiation skills.
  • Has required experience in full life cycle executive recruitment from sourcing to closing required.
  • Has ideally strong analytical and critical thinking skills with thorough attention to detail required.
  • Has excellent talent assessment and interviewing skills.
  • Has strong business acumen with a thirst for business knowledge required.
  • Has strong project management skills with the ability to multi-task and make decisions in a business context is required.
  • Has experience in consumer medical device pharmaceuticals or corporate functional recruiting is preferred.
  • Possess knowledge and experience in a search firm preferred.
  • Has background in influencing senior business leaders HR leaders and candidates

Roles And Responsibilities

  • Traineeship Description

    This position reports to the HR manager and supports recruitment process appraisal process and HR projects.

  • Specific Responsibilities

    Trainee To Be Involved In
    • Employee recruitment & selection (e.g. shortlisting interviewing extending offers) and orientation process
    • Involved in annual appraisal process
    • Provide support on HR projects – such as Job Description (JD) exercise salary benchmarking career progression and company-wide HR initiatives and projects


  • Competencies to Learn
    • Recruitment & selection process
    • Compensation process: JD exercise salary benchmarking career progression
    • How to engage stakeholders in gathering requirements
    • Appraisal process (via Human Resource Management System)
    • Project management skills – planning executing of projects


  • Education Qualifications Required for the Traineeship Role
    • Degree in Business or Human Resource Management or related discipline
    • Good communications and interpersonal skills
    • Analytical and good problem solving skills
    • Sound organizational skills
    • Familiar with MS office application


  • Eligibility Criteria

    SGUnited Traineeship
    • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident
    • Graduated or graduating in calendar year 2019 or 2020 from universities or other educational institutions (e.g. private universities and overseas institutions);
    • Graduated earlier from above institutions and completed National Service in 2019 or 2020

    SGUnited Mid-Career Pathways Programme
    • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident
    • Minimum 2 years working experience

As part of the HR team you will play a strategic and operational role to formulate implement and re-design communications of HR policies in the Ministry so as to foster a motivated and engage workforce and optimise the use of manpower resources to achieve the Ministry's goals and values.

You will be part of the Human Resource Management team and can expect to:
  • Act as single point of contact for end-to-end needs of business units in the Ministry
  • Consult with line management to manage resourcing needs of business units
  • Provide day-to-day guidance on HR policies and processes
  • Be a part of the employer branding project team to re-design and enhance HR communications and outreach efforts
  • Partner the Public Service Division and other government agencies to review and implement HR policies

Depending on your experience you may be assigned other HR functions such as Workforce Planning and Resourcing Employee Service Conditions and Benefits and HR Data Analytics.

Requirements
  • Forward-thinking with a passion for people matters a desire to serve people and a commitment to excellence
  • A team player and possess strong analytical ability excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage people at all levels
  • Skills/experience in copywriting and graphic/video design and simple storyboarding will be an advantage.

• Execute HR strategies and plans in support of the corporate vision strategy and culture.
  • Coordinate and perform other HR functions such as Manpower Planning Performance Management and Industrial Relations.
  • Execute policies and procedures that are in compliance with the current labour legislations and HR practices.
  • Prepare HR reports Management reports and Employees Engagement activities at KOM level.
  • Serve as a HR business partner to the departments.
  • Review the work processes to enhance efficiency and productivity.
  • Liaise with government authorities and internal consultants on human resources matters.
  • Maintain a harmonious industrial relations climate.

About Zilingo

Zilingo is making the fashion supply chain Fair Connected and Transparent using Technology Data and Financial Services. We are working to improve the entire supply chain for fashion from the cotton farm to the closet. Our business model has three main pillars: Commerce Services and Sustainability.
  • Commerce. We operate a global technology-enabled sourcing business and the largest B2B marketplace for fashion in South and Southeast Asia which connects yarn mills fabric mills factories brands and merchants through a discovery and transaction platform.
  • Services (Saas MaaS Fintech). We develop and deploy Software as a Service to factories and brands to help improve operational efficiency; help brands and factories enhance branding Marketing as a Service; and use technology to connect makers and merchants with access to working capital.
  • Sustainability. We provide brands with transparency into the sustainability of their supply chain. We also bring sustainable fabric and are launching a Sustainability Fund which enables factories to improve sustainability with investment.


Role Overview:

As a HR intern you will get a close look at and contribute to our HR practices. You will be working on HR data management reporting policies communication and providing support to the overall global HR function while increasing your exposure to various facets of HR.

Responsibilities:
  • Update our internal HR databases
  • Support monthly payroll exercise
  • Coordinate training programs
  • Coordinate recruitment related activities
  • Coordinate on-boarding of employees
  • Support EP / LOC applications and renewals
  • Prepare HR-related reports as needed
  • Respond to staff inquiries regarding HR policies employee benefits and other HR-related matters.

Responsibilities

You will be part of the Human Resource Division to play an active role in optimising manpower resources to support the strategic objectives of improving HR system processes. In the HR systems management process you will engage and work with multiple stakeholders to implement systems enhancement as part of project management portfolio and propose recommendations to improve system functionalities to boost user friendliness and cross collaboration across divisions.

The Job Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Management of HR systems:
  • System administrator for yearly declarations
  • Data generation to assist in survey analysis and reporting
  • Troubleshooting and assisting both external and internal users in queries relating to HR Systems
  • Managing transition to a new HR system
  • ensuring complete data transference
  • undergoing training for system familiarity
  • Management of the Ministry’s intranet including
  • Creating and maintaining divisional webpages
  • Creating surveys and registration links when required
  • Maintenance and updating of employee data

Requirements
  • Relevant work experience in managing IT systems
  • Project management competencies
  • Competent in Sharepoint Administration skills & work experience as a Webmaster
  • Comfortable with working in a fast paced environment
  • A self-driven individual with proactive and resourceful qualities will likely succeed
  • Prior experience in working with Public Service IT systems would be preferred
  • IT skills including programming work and knowledge of HR systems will be an added advantage

This position (Trainee) reports to the Human Resources (HR) Manager in a rotation areas and interfaces with stakeholders in the function and HR staff. The Trainees will be on a 9 months rotation program within Field HR Talent Acquisition and Colleague Service teams (rotate every 3 months). The Trainees will be able to learn and understand basic knowledge and be able to practice HR professional tasks during the 9 months training program.

During the 9 months rotation program the Trainee will be involved in:
  • Talent Acquisition process
  • Hands-on in Hiring and Firing activities and documentation
  • Facilitate programs/ activities to drive employee engagement and performance
  • Employee orientation and training logistics and recordkeeping
  • Practice HR services policies and programs
  • Support line managers on all HR related matters

Requirements
  • Degree/Diploma in Human Resource Management or equivalent
  • Proficient in MS Office (PowerPoint and Excel)
  • Duration of traineeship: 9 months

As part of the HR team you will play a strategic and operational role to formulate implement and re-design communications of HR policies in the Ministry so as to foster a motivated and engage workforce and optimise the use of manpower resources to achieve the Ministry's goals and values.

You will be part of the Human Resource Management team and can expect to:
  • Act as single point of contact for end-to-end needs of business units in the Ministry
  • Consult with line management to manage resourcing needs of business units
  • Provide day-to-day guidance on HR policies and processes
  • Be a part of the employer branding project team to re-design and enhance HR communications and outreach efforts
  • Partner the Public Service Division and other government agencies to review and implement HR policies

Depending on your experience you may be assigned other HR functions such as Workforce Planning and Resourcing Employee Service Conditions and Benefits and HR Data Analytics.

  • Forward-thinking with a passion for people matters a desire to serve people and a commitment to excellence
  • A team player and possess strong analytical ability excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage people at all levels
  • Skills/experience in copywriting and graphic/video design and simple storyboarding will be an advantage.

Job Description:
About Supernova


We are the fastest growing health & beauty social e-commerce company. We build health and beauty products for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach and offices in London LA Singapore New Delhi and Melbourne we connect with over 12 million women on social media every week. Our brands include Sand & Sky BodyBoss SkinnyMint and Coco & Eve.

About Supernova’s Internal Engine


Together we create Superstars! Our three company pillars are guided by this motto: Our product and brands are of the highest quality and within the top five in their category; our customers are the focus of our actions and their lives improve with our products; our talent and employees grow and develop within Supernova.

This means that investing in hiring developing and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Living our core values of #MakeAnImpact #TalkAboutIt #SeekNewOpportunities #DelightAndSurprise and #MoveForwardTogether creates a unique culture across five different time zones and allows us to realise the enormous potential of this exciting industry. If you’re an ambitious smart natural collaborator who likes taking risks influencing and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment we’d love to talk to you about joining our team.


About The Job

We are looking for a smart fun and energetic People Manager based in Singapore who is looking to take the next step in their career in our global headquarters in Singapore! You’ll be challenged to push boundaries make a significant difference and recommend bold actions to solve tough business problems globally. A big part of your day-to-day will involve partnering the business on operational and developmental needs.

You will get creative and be hands-on in overseeing all aspects of the employee lifecycle from Day 0 to exit ensuring that our people are set up for success in their roles while having an exceptional experience as a Superstar.

Reporting to the People Director this role provides tremendous opportunity for the right candidate: to capture the energy and rapid pace of a fast growing start-up while being responsible for a sizeable and growing part of our global footprint. If you have a solid operational foundation in People and are ready to break from tradition make your own mark and help shape Supernova for the years to come we are excited to hear from you.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and manage the compensation and benefits structure aligned to industry standards in all our key markets
  • Manage operational People policies that are compliant in all our key markets and aligned to business needs 
  • Provide People guidance and support to the offices across a breadth of areas including talent management employee development performance management and employee relations
  • Manage Payroll operations including execution and management of payroll providers
  • Develop manage and implement successful and consistent People initiatives
  • Manage and maintain our Learning & Development initiatives to ensure that our Superstars are supported in their development needs 
  • Regularly complete a training needs analysis and develop an annual training schedule 
  • Manage employee engagement through our tool and recommend initiatives to achieve a highly engaged team
  • Assess the People implications of business initiatives and provide advice for improvement
  • Develop and implement people solutions to make teams more effective
  • Work with leaders and key stakeholders to create positive fun and productive workplace 
  • Line management for People Operations


About You

  • 5+ years of progressive human resources generalist experience
  • Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources Management or related discipline
  • Proven experience with operational People performance management L&D employee engagement and compensation and benefits
  • Solid business acumen with a keen eye and interest in People analytics
  • Strong leadership skills ability to manage conflicting priorities in a fast paced environment. Be self directed and motivated. Proven interpersonal facilitation and negotiation skills  
  • Experience in creative problem solving influencing change management and eliminating barriers at any organisational level
  • Ability to develop trusting relationships to gain support and achieve results at all levels of the organisation. 
  • Experience in training and developing employees in a high performance culture
  • Highly adaptable hands-on and personable across all levels within the organisation
  • Prior experience in a start-up environment required
  • Experience in an online-based brand e-commerce or digital/tech firm preferred
  • Previous global exposure and experience strongly preferred


In return you will get

  • Be part of a revolutionary Social E-Commerce company
  • Competitive package
  • Access to a personal Lifestyle Spending Account
  • Extensive medical cover


This job has everything for the right applicant and is available immediately. All applications will be treated confidentially.

 

Supernova is an equal opportunity employer. Our values define the working culture and environment we strive to create – fair diverse respectful and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. We promote harmonious working relationships and encourage a learning and development culture. We welcome applications from talented people coming from all cultures countries races genders sexual orientations disabilities beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment discrimination and retaliation.

Job Title: Human Resource Executive (Welfare| Compensation and Benefits)
Job Description:
Summary

We believe that our employees are the core of our business and for that to happen we need an individual who will be mainly responsible in administering employees immediate health care need and provides assistance to the company’s appointed panel clinics in attending to employee's overall health related issues.

Principal Responsibilities And Authorities
  • Review company health and well-being program.
  • Administration of Company’s medical benefits/claims.
  • Manage employee’s claim enquiries.
  • Maintains proper HR records relating medical/claims for all employees.
  • Schedules and implements annual/ periodical/special examination of employees.
  • Manage employee disciplinary and grievance matters.
  • Assess employee's examination results and refer to company physician for management; monitor recommendations and follow through until illness is cleared.
  • Maintain file and update accurate employee data in various platforms used by the organisation.
  • Consults and coordinates with various departments to assess plan implement and evaluate employee care plans.
  • Track and monitor HR metrics.
  • Handle company accommodation matters.
  • Liaise with vendors of existing and new health initiatives.
  • Ensure compliance with labor regulations.
  • To undertake any additional reasonable duties at the request of your Line Manager.
  • To undertake any training and development activities at the request of your Line Manager.
Requirements
  • Diploma holder who is keen to work with people.
  • Fresh graduates may also be considered.
  • Computer literate in the use of Word Excel and Power Point.
  • Effective communications skills both in writing and verbally;
  • Attention to detail and the ability to organise tasks in a structured and logical way;
  • Legally aware of the business obligations and liabilities under the various laws and guidelines concerning Employment of both local and foreign employees.
Safety And Company Responsibilities
  • To adhere to all Tower Transit policies and procedures.
  • To take care of your own safety and the safety of others at all times by complying with your responsibilities particularly in relation to Work Safety and Health Act.
  • To report to your Line Manager or a Supervisor any injury collision of dangerous occurrence in which you may have been involved or are aware of having taken place at your work location or any concern you have about health and safety issues.

Job Title: HR Manager - 4 month Contract convertible to perm
Job Description:
HR Manager - 3-month Contract convertible to perm

About Our Client

Our client a renowned urban lifestyle company is currently seeking talented People and Culture to join their established team. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a creative team and an industry-leading group within a team management role. This is a sole contributor role. This is a permanent role based in Singapore.

People Manager

Reporting to the CEO the firm is looking for an experienced and strategic leader responsible for providing clear directions to the different functions in the HR Division. The role will be a vital role for the expansion of the company

You will be tasked to manage and grow your HR team to drive progressive people practices across the company.

The mission is to improve how our people work behave engage and grow with the first through robust human resource policies and programs that will help weave the overall cultural fabric within the firm and lead to an employee experience that attracts and retains the right talent.

Key Roles & Responsibilities

  • Lead and manage the HR function managing end-to-end responsibilities in a generalist role including driving HR operations employee relations C&B learning & development performance management and talent acquisition
  • Develop and direct strategies for workforce planning to identify the strategic manpower needs and to optimise resources for firm's emerging business needs (especially in technology agenda) and outcomes.
  • Review formulate and implement HR policies and procedures that remains a progressive and competitive employment
  • Review the existing HR policies and compensation strategy and steer the direction for change where needed e.g. salary benchmarking and review.
  • Develop and direct strategies for talent management to attract and build a strong pipeline of talents and succession for key positions.
  • You will act as a champion for the company culture and will support the company executives and team leaders allowing the company to develop and grow quickly improve the recruiting testing and interviewing programs; counseling managers

    • on candidate selection; conducting and analyzing exit interviews; and recommending necessary changes

  • Develop the training roadmap to equip staff in the organization on the range of competency requirements.
  • Champion and promote culture of workforce agility and employability through structured and unstructured learning and development strategies and programmes.
  • Lead the development of an integrated learning and development framework policies and system including development of training roadmaps to strengthen and build capabilities in the organisation for current and the future.
  • Steer the design development and implementation of structured leadership development programmes to build the effectiveness and capacity of officers in supervisory roles.
  • Ensure compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource

    • requirements conducting investigations maintaining record

  • Advance human resource staff job results by counseling and disciplining employees; and planning monitoring and appraising job results

    • Job Requirements

  • Experienced Human Resource Manager who has been in a sole contributor role preferably with strong credentials in the tech industry
  • At least 6 years of relevant experience in a leadership capacity with the ability to engage inspire and develop high-performing teams.
  • Confident communicator with strong stakeholder management experience to drive changes and innovation.
  • Adept in being customer focus and strong attention to details analytical and resourceful.
  • Highly adaptable and demonstrate agility to thrive in a fast pace & evolving environment.

Company Overview

Hire Digital connects businesses to a curated network of the top freelance marketing design and technology talents. Our clients include fast-growing startups SMBs as well as Fortune 500 enterprises. Job Summary

The Talent Acquisition Specialist at Hire Digital would be responsible for prospecting pitching screening closing and onboarding highly qualified candidates. If you think that working on and perfecting both technical and soft skills screening and helping to build and improve a data driven methodology in talent acquisition is fun we welcome you to apply.

This is a remote position. We welcome candidates from any location. Resumes are to be submitted in English. We do not provide visa sponsorship at this moment.

Responsibilities And Duties

  • Methodically source candidates using many different software applications and talent platforms.

  • Implement candidate onboarding and technical and qualitative performance evaluation.

  • Maintain the highest standard of data integrity.
  • Maintain a very close relationship with the recruiters and hiring managers you are working with.

Qualifications And Skills
  • Have a highly analytical and data driven mind-set.
  • Consistently be able to hit targets and goals.
  • Entrepreneurial mind-set.
  • Experience in HR or recruiting or other relevant experience in closing candidates is preferred. Candidates with growth experience at a startup are also welcome to apply.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Are you someone who is continually inspired by helping people learn new skills and seeing the results of that learning in how they perform? Are you looking for an opportunity to creatively apply your strengths in consulting coaching team development delivery and measurement in an environment that is continually changing and never boring? Do you have a passion for moving fast learning from feedback and iterating your approaches to maximize impact? Love working in a diverse and challenging company that is making a difference in the world every day? If these are true for you the L&D Partner role may be the right fit for your next role.At Facebook we believe that the keys to personal growth & success are rooted in how you leverage your strengths to have an impact. Like performance learning is a continuous iterative process and is primarily shaped by the opportunities available on-the-job rather than what might traditionally be learned in the classroom. For this reason we work as a small consulting team and we partner with business and HR Business Partners to identify needs and coordinate the adoption of learning solutions that make our people better over time. The critical focus areas of L&D in Facebook are team leadership and management development core cultural programs and Diversity & Inclusion.To support this mission we are hiring a Senior Learning & Development Partner to be based in Singapore with a primary priority being across all functions in APAC and a secondary priority across the International (Non-North American) geography in a specific learning focus area. Essential Mindsets
  • You will need to be able to handle continuous change and ambiguity and make decisions based on incomplete data. We are building and scaling simultaneously!
  • To be successful you will need to roll up your sleeves and get things done quickly. You will need to be both effective in articulating complex strategies/concepts well and be reliable and effective in personal execution. You need to be able to deliver and iterate not focus on perfection.
  • You must have strong strategic and operational L&D/OD experience and be experienced in letting go of rigid traditional L&D classroom learning and of control. Our mission is to connect people who have something to teach with those who are ready to learn and to scale learning organically.
  • You should not take yourself too seriously we want you to do fabulous work but also to enjoy the journey be authentic and have fun.

    • Deliver clear learning strategies. Partnering independently with senior leaders supported by key cross functional partners (HRBPs Diversity Business Partners other learning organizations) to diagnose organization leadership team site & individual needs and create clear learning strategies that leverage available resources address root cause leadership/team gaps and can scale across other functions and geographies.
    • Own/Drive/Scale the change management needed to optimize learning impact by co-creating (w/ L&D central design teams cross functional partners and the business) and executing thoughtful go-to-market plans for new solutions consulting on how to embed content models frameworks and language into the day to day of the business and driving consistent effective communication to reinforce messaging.
    • Diagnose design and deliver facilitated team effectiveness and leadership development.
    • Measure success using data from relevant analytics teams to provide insights content redesign and to influence priorities of key stakeholders.
    • Partner with both the Global and International L&D team to execute on the L&D strategy and vision. Be the connective tissue between L&D and the business.
    • Experience in creating sustained impact in a senior L&D/OD role in a highly matrixed multinational organizations where ambiguity due to rapid optimization/change in terms of scope role and processes are the norm.
    • Experience in creating delivering and adapting scalable and sustainable learning strategies that address current and future business needs across multiple functions and geographies.
    • Experience in creating and sustaining impact-focused relationships with org and regional leaders / senior internal stakeholders (including coaching contracting influencing and presenting).
    • Experience in Intact team / leadership development including diagnosis coaching consultation design and facilitation.
    • Experience in facilitation and adapting content and conversations to meet the needs of your audience.

Neuron is the fastest growing micro-mobility operator in Asia Pacific and the leading shared e-scooter company across Australia and New Zealand. We partner with cities to connect people and places in a safe convenient and fun way. We are driven to help the world build a more prosperous and sustainable future through new ways of moving and connecting.


Neuron started the world’s first scooter sharing platform in Singapore in 2016.  We develop our own industry-leading e-scooters which are purpose built for sharing and safety. We also set the industry standard for technology that manages them. Neuron has launched an impressive range of world firsts particularly when it comes to safety. We currently operate in eight locations including Adelaide Brisbane Darwin Canberra Townsville and Auckland and will soon be expanding to the United Kingdom.


These are Neuron’s Values:

Make it happen

We are driven by results make commitments with integrity and consistently make an impact.

Be proactive

We take ownership of tasks that help us build sustainable growth.

Trust facts over opinions

Whenever possible we make the logical choice based on data and known truths.

Stay curious

We embrace the habit of asking questions challenging assumptions and revisiting convictions.

Do more with less

Profit allows us to continue serving our users. We must be efficient and resourceful.


The Role

Reporting to the Regional HR Manager  you would have the opportunity to be a critical member of the People Ops team and be involved in key strategic business-impacting decisions. 


What you'll do:

  • Assist to set up the HR function including formulating policies and processes around performance management talent management and HR operations that suit the business
  • Drive implementation of initiatives related to overall people and business strategies
  • Daily operations across the HR functions including talent management onboarding compensation and benefits staff relations etc.
  • Assist in the performance and talent management process including managing the performance cycle and timelines across the region
  • Review formulate and update the HR staff handbook HR policies & procedures by keeping up to date with prevailing legislations and best practices
  • Ensuring accuracy and timeliness of payroll cycles statutory contributions and reports regionally 
  • In charge of daily office operational needs for the Singapore office
  • Ad-hoc HR projects to grow the Company to the next stage


What you'll need:

  • 1-3 years of working experience in administrative or Human Resource function in a start-up environment preferred
  • Bachelor's degree in HR or Business Management or related 
  • Knowledge about computing payroll as per Singapore employment regulations is advantageous
  • Exposure to software such as Justlogin (Payroll) and Xero (Finance) would be advantageous
  • Ability to translate ambiguous problems into solutions
  • Ability to multitask be agile and keep up with the start-up high-growth phase
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  • Meticulous detail-oriented and highly organised 


If you are passionate about making a real-time impact and want the opportunity to play an instrumental part in our growth story we want you!

Dataiku allows enterprises to create value with their data in a human-centered way while breaking down silos and encouraging collaboration. One of the most unique characteristics of our product Data Science Studio (DSS) is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to technical and non-technical users. Through DSS we aim to empower people through data and democratize data science.


We are looking for an HR Business Parner to oversee HR operations in the APAC region. You will report directly to our Director HRBP based in Paris. This role focuses on ensuring the smooth execution of all HR processes for our employees starting right after the onboarding. This role will be based in the company’s office in Singapore and will include travels to other Dataiku locations in the area (mainly Australia for the time being).


The successful candidate will be interested in working in the HR field and has worked as an HR generalist or HR administrator ideally in a fast-paced and international company. We are looking for a dynamic detail-oriented partner who can help us champion Dataiku in the APAC region. This candidate will be an integral part of the HR team yet should feel comfortable working autonomously.


In this role you'll help the team:

  • HR Operations: Be the first point of contact for general HR queries from managers and employees in the APAC region
  • Support and manage HR processes (onboarding off-boarding employee life-cycle processes etc.): including laptops purchase & set up
  • Preparation of HR documentation (employment letters immigration contracts etc.)
  • Payroll & Admin: Run payroll and oversee benefits
  • Audit and improve - if need be - all benefits scheme for the regions (health insurance pension etc)
  • Facilitate international mobilities by coordinating relocation locally with our providers according to the company policy(including but not limited to immigration and tax topics)
  • HR projects: As the local HR representative and as part of the global HR team you will play an active role in transversal HR projects (career paths campus management etc.. )


You may be a good fit for the team if you have:

  • 4+ years of experience in HR ops or admin ideally in a international company
  • Previous successful experience working with remote management
  • Previous experience working with other countries in Asia (Korea Japan especially) and with Australia a key asset. 
  • Willingness to dive in and assist with whatever is needed 
  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical evaluative and research skills
  • Polished and professional interpersonal communication writing and presentation skills.
  • Discretion around highly sensitive information e.g. salary and benefit information
  • Previous experience in a fast paced environment a plus


To fulfill its mission Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019 we achieved unicorn status went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. Spanning from Sydney to Frankfurt Denver to London geography doesn’t stop Dataikers from working closely together and sharing experiences. Collaboration is key within our product and culture. We strive to create a sense of belonging and community while fostering diverse thinking by encouraging cross-team cross-office interactions like our annual company offsite or Paris onboarding. Fly over to Twitter LinkedIn and Instagram to read stories about our culture people and success. 


Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs without regard to race ethnicity gender identity or expression sexual orientation religion age neurodiversity disability status citizenship veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring compensation benefits performance promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment.

Company Name: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA)
Job Description:
You will lead Learning and Development efforts in MPA and drive a range of learning strategies and interventions aimed at upskilling the general workforce competencies and leadership competencies to prepare MPA officers for future job roles and leadership demands.

To achieve this you will play a key role in the Learning & Development function starting from competency gap analysis learning needs analysis to design and execution of organisation-wide learning interventions. These interventions should meet current workforce learning needs as well as those identified in MPA’s Strategic Workforce Plan. You will engage and consult line divisions and HR stakeholders to identify learning needs and work with third-party training vendors to develop and deliver creative and cost-effective learning solutions. In addition you will also review and formulate development roadmaps for various job families and at the same time establish competency frameworks necessary for deepening the key domain areas of expertise of MPA. You will also be involved in leadership development a key focus area and enabler to lead the organisation into the next phase of transformation.

To be successful in this role you will need to be attuned to the latest learning and development trends and incorporate technology in learning interventions. You should possess at least 8 years of relevant experience in designing developing and executing customised learning programmes in all areas namely at the organisation-wide level leadership-related specialist/technical and other niche development areas. You must be a good team player while being a strong independent executor with excellent interpersonal and communication skills. As this is a fast-paced job you should be able to handle working under tight deadlines.

Job Title: Employee Relations and Investigations Partner| People Operations
Job Description:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Experience establishing cross-functional relationships at all levels and geographies.
  • Experience conducting investigations and advising on local disciplinary and investigation processes.
  • Experience in APAC employment law and in one or more APAC market.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with stakeholder management in a global organization.
  • Experience consulting directly with employees and management.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity and complexity and apply an intersectional lens to work.
  • Ability to operate with empathy and diffuse/de-escalate difficult conversations and situations.
  • Ability to collaborate across teams regions and time zones.
  • Excellent communication analytical influencing and writing skills.


About The Job

People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be an advocate of Google's culture and values partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching our clients on how to lead their teams navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers you are exceptionally focused on putting them first and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.

As an Employee Relations and Investigations Partner you will rely on your expertise of applicable employment laws and best practices to interpret and apply Google policies to address workplace concerns.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler refining our core programs developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse accessible equitable and inclusive Google through our hiring promotion retention and inclusion practices.

Responsibilities
  • Conduct fair thorough and timely investigations into allegations of violations of Google’s HR policies or local law and policies to ensure fair treatment of all employees.
  • Consult with partner teams on local investigation processes and advise on local disciplinary processes for non-HR policy violations.
  • Advise on and help to resolve other workplace concerns to determine the appropriate approach and to ensure fair treatment of all employees. De-escalate and resolve matters as appropriate using listening and conflict resolution skills.
  • Review complex performance management situations and fairness of decision making and local processes for reorganizations and restructuring exercises.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know by completing this form .

Job Title: HR Senior Manager South East Asia
Job Description:
WELLA - Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) South East Asia and Korea

About Wella

“Wella” is one of the world’s leading professional and retail hair companies. It is a beauty collective with a mission to enable consumers to look & feel like their true selves. Its love brands which include beauty icons such as Wella Clairol OPI and ghd (all together “Wella”) are co-created by & designed for the beauty junkies of today & tomorrow. Following the signing of an agreement with global investment firm KKR for the divestiture of Coty’s Professional and Retail Hair businesses “Wella” is on its way to becoming a fully independent standalone company with its own management team and operational structures. In closing our new company will have a presence in over 100 countries and an estimated annual net revenue of $2.3Bn. “Wella” and its brands are and will remain committed to a range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. For additional information about “Wella” please visit www.wellacareers.com

THE ROLE

As the Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) you will be responsible to partner with business unit leaders and all functional heads in the organization to build the People strategy in the day-to-day matters and integrate the new business model changes into the future organization plans. HRBP plays a crucial role in strategizing and improving the complex business model with an aim to be closer to the business in order to develop more effective and relevant HR solutions. This role reports to global HR with a dotted line to Business Unit Leader

Key Responsibilities
  • Understand business goals and recommend new approaches policies and procedures to effect continual improvements in business objectives productivity and development of HR
  • Leads the incorporation of change leadership and organization effectiveness for major structural shifts
  • A true hands-on approach as well as the ability to successfully monitor the "pulse" of the employees to ensure a high level of employee engagement
  • Translates current and future business needs into an integrated strategic workforce plan.
  • Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (e.g. coaching counseling career development disciplinary actions).
  • Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships build morale and increase productivity and retention.
  • Manages complex and difficult HR Projects cross-functionally
  • Champion and embody our culture mission and values
YOUR PROFILE

You thrive at building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions. You are committed conscientious and always lead with integrity. You recognize the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization. You believe in the value of teamwork. You bring a high level of knowledge and know-how plus creativity and enthusiasm to your work and to everything you do.

Key Requirements
  • University or comparative degrees
  • 5+ years of increasing professional Human Resources or comparable experience including at the Business Partner level.
  • Strategic Thinking: Able to combine great people intuition business judgment and discretion in your decision-making
  • Collaborative: Able to work multi-functionally and build trust-based relationships with executives managers and employees
  • Strong business and people acumen with the ability to influence at all levels
  • Someone who inherently believes in the potential within people but also recognizes problems and doesn’t shy away from ‘tough love’ messages to help them grow and succeed
  • The ability to be comfortable with high volume workload and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves"
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented able to prioritize
  • Bias for action strong work ethic and desire to achieve excellence
  • Experience in talent management leadership development and performance management
  • Experience with Mergers & Acquisitions preferred.
  • A deep love for beauty and willing to live change every day

What You Can Expect From Us

BENEFITS OF WORKING FOR WELLA
  • Attractive salary package
  • Continued learning and growth opportunities
  • Truly international and diverse environment where you can be your true self
We offer equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals without regard to race religion color national origin age gender disability marital status veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We comply with national federal and state disability laws and make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities.

This is a true generalist role focused on timely delivery of a range of HR support and expertise to our internal stakeholder groups. Utilising your strong communication and stakeholder management skills you will partner with diverse range of managers and employees on HR matters.

This role will see you be highly involved in HR matters relating to talent acquisition onboarding employee benefits data management HR systems compensation reviews & benchmarking salary proposals performance reviews co-ordination of L&D and engagement programs employee relations and ad hoc projects.

Responsibilities

  • Provide support for the day to day HR Operations for the Regional Office
  • Guide managers and employees on all HR employment practices and policies
  • Create and update employee records and manage data and reports in the HRIS and TM1 cube timeously
  • Manage employee onboarding monthly induction sessions and offboarding
  • Work closely with the Talent Acquisition team on recruitment needs for allocated client groups. Conduct interviews as required
  • Support line managers to ensure deadlines are met for annual performance and compensation reviews
  • Responsible for co-ordination of internal mobility including relocation assistance for employees transferring within and into the region
  • Assist with compensation benchmarking and salary proposals for new hires or internal moves
  • Liaise with payroll to ensure timely and quality documentation provided for employees
  • Act as a point of contact for all HR administration issues relating to the employees within your allocated client group
  • Assist in employee enquiries first tier of support
  • Provide data and information for monthly quarterly and annual reports as required
  • Coordinate participation in learning and development initiatives including liaising with the Talent and Development team on initiatives.
  • Make recommendations and source appropriate training programs
  • Contribute to ad hoc queries and projects as required

Qualifications

Essential:

  • Tertiary qualifications in HR or related field
  • 3 - 5 years HR experience
  • Sound knowledge of Singapore employment legislation
  • Experience managing end to end HR processes
  • Advance in MSWord Excel and PowerPoint
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Ability to take initiative work both independently and as part of a team
  • An eye for detail
  • Must be able to work under pressure with multiple deadlines

Desirable:
  • Insurance Industry experience
  • HR Qualification would be advantageous

Job Title: Senior Manager/ Manager/ Assistant Manager (Human Resource and Organization Development) (1 Year Contract with Part-Time Work Arrangement) - Singapore
Job Description:
Senior Manager/ Manager/ Assistant Manager (Human Resource and Organization Development) (1 Year Contract with Part-Time Work Arrangement)

The National Arts Council champions the arts in Singapore. By nurturing creative excellence and supporting broad audience engagement our diverse and distinctive arts inspire our people connect communities and profile Singapore internationally. We preserve our rich cultural traditions as we cultivate accomplished artists and vibrant companies for the future. As a statutory board in the Ministry of Culture Community and Youth our support for the arts is comprehensive – from grants and partnerships to industry facilitation and arts housing. The Council welcomes greater private and corporate giving to and through the arts so that together we can make the arts an integral part of everyone’s lives.

At NAC we have a team of creative and dynamic staff who share this common vision.

If you have a strong passion for the arts we welcome you to join us for a challenging and fulfilling career.

You will assist in the learning and organisation development (OD) initiatives to achieve NAC’s mission and goals.

Principle Accountabilities
  • In the L&D role you will implement learning and leadership development initiatives so as to build the capabilities of the organisation to meet the needs of the future workforce promote a culture of learning and increase staff engagement and take up rate for e-learning.
  • In the OD role you will work closely with departments to identify and spearhead OD initiatives to support the organisational transformation journey enhance employee engagement and strengthen corporate culture.
Requirements
  • At least 2 years of working experience in the human resource development and/or organisation development; with experience in facilitation managing stakeholders negotiation and conducting needs analysis. Experience in change management efforts in the Public Service is not necessary but will be ideal.
  • Good analytical communication stakeholder engagement skills
  • Good facilitation skills and comfortable facilitating in both physical and blended meetings and events
  • Highly adaptable to change have great problem-solving skills and is able to manage ambiguity.
  • A proactive and independent worker yet able to work well with teams.
  • As this is a part-time position you are expected to work 2 days a week on a 1-year contract.
  • Applicants who require work passes need not apply
Interested applicants are to submit resume.

If you do not hear from us within 2 months from your date of submission you may assume that you have not been shortlisted. In the meantime please track the status of your application on Careers@Gov.

  • Be responsible for the full spectrum of employee lifecycle and HR operations
  • Manage a team to ensure data accuracy and integrity in employee records in the HRIS related to onboarding; employment changes and off-boarding administration.
  • Process documentation and prepare reports relating to HR activities (onboarding new employee data training performance management.

  • Determine and lead in employee relations activities employee surveys and communications grievance and investigations liaison with government agencies and external service providers.

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

The role supports the Regional Compensation and Benefits team in the review and implementation of C&B policies and processes working closely with the local country HR. At Deloitte we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do

To take the lead in this dynamic world with constant disruption the future of HR demands major shifts in mind-set roles capabilities and digital enablers with reinvention at the core. From the C-suite to the junior desks Deloitte’s Human Resources Transformation services are designed to reimagine and revitalize how HR enables the organization and empowers its people.

Whether the enterprise is in business industry government or higher education our teams across the world and in Southeast Asia work with clients to develop and implement overarching global HR strategies to transform how HR delivers services to better support the enterprise and its people. This includes transforming HR operations and payroll with leading HR cloud technologies (Workday HR SAP SuccessFactors) and other analytic and mobile solutions that enhance service delivery enable innovation and reenergize the experience of the people you serve from frontline staff to leaders employees to gig workers administrators and faculty to students.

Deloitte Southeast Asia is rapidly growing their HR Transformation practice to meet increasing client demands in the Asia-Pacific region. We want YOU to join our team and take advantage of these massive opportunities and grow your career!

You Will

As a Director in our HR Transformation Consulting team you’ll build and nurture positive working relationships with teams and clients with the intention to exceed client expectations.
  • Play a key role in how we deliver our services to clients across a breadth of industries. You will have the opportunity to leverage leading research analytics technology and industry insights to impact the future of work and provide strategic and business-focused solutions to our clients.
  • Support our clients in defining their HR strategy and advise our clients on the design and implementation of (global) HR transformation programmes
  • Analyse and revise current HR processes to more efficient ways of working and contribute to the design of a delivery model for their HR services
  • Consult with clients to increase effectiveness and reduce costs of HR service delivery through improved processes and technologies; global shared services solutions participate in the selection design and implementation of technology-enabled business and HR solutions for clients
  • Be part of a team that loves collaborating taking on challenges and exceeding expectations. No two days are ever the same but here is a sample of some of the work you might do in this role: build the foundation for new HR capabilities like process automation and employee experience; deliver engagements that advance strategic HR transformation for clients; develop and maintain client relationships and lead projects from planning through execution
  • Oversee and provide directions to the project teams in undertaking HR/ HRIS assessments critically examine alignment of technology elements against key business priorities develop recommendations and advise on appropriate strategies governance architecture and innovations to optimize client operations.

In leading teams to deliver impact to clients through the project you will:
  • Employ a business-oriented mindset and use data-driven solutions to drive transformation agenda and achieve results
  • Leverage expertise in a functional domain to enable client’s strategic agenda
  • Consider opportunities and threats related to end-user adoption when developing recommendations

Your role as a leader

In Addition To Living Our Purpose Director Across Our Firm Are Expected To

At Deloitte we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values challenging themselves everyday to identify issues that are most important to our clients our people and the communities and to make an impact that matters.
  • Lead and act as an exemplary role model for leaders at all levels whilst continuously promoting a sense of loyalty and energizes others to act.
  • Build and sustain a high performance culture by cultivating and amplifying individual and team strengths.
  • Develop and sustain long-term trust-based relationships with stakeholders clients and team.
  • Manage the sustainable development of a strong pipeline of talent for current and future success by driving a talent experience that differentiates Deloitte.
  • Lead behavioral and cultural change through a supportive collaborative and highly inclusive environment where team members feels supported respected and engaged.

We are looking for a motivated self-starter to provide administrative support to the Technical Director and the growing team of consultants engineers whilst also being responsible for the daily office activities to ensure things runs smoothly. This role will also provide support to accounts and payroll as required. There is always something to do or improve on so a proactive can-do attitude is a must!

 

About the Role

 

The role includes:

 

  • Day to day general office duties and administrative support including preparing collating information and formatting fee proposals capability statements and legal documents data entry purchasing of office supplies booking travel and accommodation
  • Daily communication with the close-knit team in regards to weekly deliverables and ensure the Technical Director is informed of the progress
  • Daily management of the online Project document control / scanning / filing and cataloguing
  • Assist with HR duties including preparing employment contracts and HR correspondence coordinate visas posting job advertisements coordinating interviews conducting reference checks new starter and departure administration maintain staff records organise training coordinate administration of staff reviews OHS and fire warden duties etc.
  • Manage phone calls and inward/outward correspondence (e-mail letters packages etc.)
  • Manage agendas travel arrangements appointments etc.
  • Provide support and act as a back-up with accounts invoicing and payroll when required
  • Day-to-day maintenance of financial system database to ensure the accuracy and timely recording of invoices credit notes employee reimbursements
  • Ensure the office is presentable at all times by maintaining office cleanliness
  • Liaise with intercompany office external providers and statutory bodies as required
  • Assist the team in the ongoing design development and delivery of marketing documents
  • Assist in the ongoing maintenance of the group's filing and organisational procedures for soft and hard copy documents
  • Assist colleagues in different areas of the business as required
  • Other tasks as assigned


Qualifications


Skills and Experience

 

  • Proven experience as an Administrative Officer or similar role
  • Experience in accounts / bookkeeping
  • HR knowledge and experience
  • Strong Microsoft Word skills and basic Microsoft Excel
  • Highly self-motivated reliable enthusiastic positive and dedicated
  • Excellent attention to detail and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to prioritise in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Ability to work autonomously and in a team environment
  • High level of confidentiality
  • Bookkeeping and HR knowledge an advantage


Additional Information - How to Apply 


Please upload your Resume Cover Letter and any other supporting documentation where asked within your application. Ensure you consider the skills and experience needed for this role and include in your application.
