Job Title: Senior HR Professional| Financial Services - Based in HQ Singapore
Job Description:
Job Description:

  • Responsible for people topics involving career planning performance management data analysis compensation and rewards employee relations learning and development recognition programs and strategic development in a financial service unit of business
  • Responsible for regulatory practice required in HR operations HR recruitment and HR onboarding in a financial service business unit
  • Own HR Policies and their implementation. Handle the HR Audit and regulatory reporting and requirement
  • Build relationships with senior business leaders to offer thought coordinate and execute on people-related project for business unit
  • Establish effective communication channels to ensure the smooth information flow and promote corporate culture and employee engagement

 

Requirements:

  • At least 3-5 years of HR experience in financial institutions
  • Good university degree
  • Strong communication skills
  • Highly motivated energetic positive working attitude and a quick learner
  • Able to work both with ambiguity and work independently

Job Purpose

The HR Operations Manager originates and leads Human Resources practices and objectives that will provide an employee-oriented and high-performance culture that emphasizes empowerment goal attainment quality productivity and ongoing development of a superior workforce. The HR Operations Manager is responsible for the development of processes and metrics that support the achievement of the organization's business goals.


Major Accountabilities

  • Develop an employee-oriented culture that emphasizes quality continuous improvement key employee retention and development and high performance.
  • Develop and administer HR policies procedures and guidelines aligned with company’s strategic goals.
  • Lead and develop a highly effective HR operations team with focus on: payroll employee data management reporting; HR services supporting HRBP and HODs; administrative support for Training Compensation and Benefits and other HR areas.
  • Develop HR KPI through HR Analytical tools to form better people decisions.
  • Act as a specialist for all mobility related questions in Singapore and first contact for the global mobility team in Asia.
  • Execute on-time and effective budgeting process.
  • Ensure periodical (monthly / annual) exercises such as annual merit adjustment bonus payout reporting payroll and training audits are well coordinated and completed.
  • Act as a consultant to managers and staff regarding HR policies and procedures.
  • Resolve employee grievances; conduct investigations and counsel employees with supervisors.
  • Ensure legal compliance with existing governmental labor laws and government reporting requirements.
  • Ensure HR Intranet and organizational charts EDM HR Reports are up to date.
  • Oversee HR projects and ad-hoc assignment from time to time.



Key Performance Indicators

  • HR Policies Guidelines and Procedures are updated and implemented
  • HR KPI are satisfactorily met (turnover rate recruitment speed EES results etc.)
  • HR team are well developed to meet performance requirements


Part V: Job Specific Requirements

Education :

Bachelor’s degree in HR Business Administration or related fields

Experience:

  • At least 8-10 years’ experience in HR management / operations with 2-3 years on a leadership role preferable in an MNC manufacturing environment
  • Experience in mobility/international assignment management

General Competencies


Team leadership

  • Support collaboration promotion of strong functioning teams
  • Own role-appropriate integration into team possibly Leadership and development of a virtual team

Professional depth and width

  • Own area of work own product and technology world
  • Adjacent technologies professional assessment capacity controversial examination of technical issues

Change leadership

  • Search require implement innovations and optimizations scrutinize existing processes etc.
  • Manage change processes demand changes handle fears

Ability to deal with conflict

  • Identify and appropriately broach conflict potential no avoidance of conflict
  • Strive for win-win solution to conflict without hasty compromises

Analytical Skills

  • Analytical course of action when tacking problems utilization of methods and instruments
  • Identification and development of correlations and consequences of decisions

Build collaborative relationship

  • Work cooperatively with others across the organization to achieve shared objectives
  • Represent own interests while being fair to others and their areas

Decision making skill

  • Make sound decisions even in the absence of complete information
  • Consider all relevant factors and use appropriate decision-making criteria and principles

Knowledge in labour related legislation

  • Understand both letter and spirit of prevailing labor related laws
  • Keep own self updated with legislative changes

Job Scope
  • Sourcing candidates from websites job boards and social platforms.
  • Follow up on existing and potential candidates
  • Schedule and coordinate interviews.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Requirement
  • Must possess at least Bachelor's Degree/ Post Graduate Diploma/ Professional Degree in any field
  • No work experience required

Job Title: Director| Talent Management & Organization Development| SEATW & India
Job Description:
Position Summary

Reporting to the Senior Director of Talent Management and Organizational Development this role is at the forefront of significant organizational change.

The Director of TMOD is responsible for initiating designing leading and implementing talent strategies and programs that aim to develop retain measure and actively accelerate our organization's talent within SEATW and India.

The Director of TMOD will work closely with Senior Leaders and HR teams to develop and implement plans aligned with the Region/Global Talent strategies to build an enduring deep and diverse pipeline of future leaders and increase mobility of exceptional talent for Thermo Fisher Scientific and support the delivery of business objectives..

The incumbent will also be an active member of the APAC TMOD Leadership team contributing to setting the strategy for Talent Management in our region delivering on regional initiatives and elevating the overall impact of the TMOD team. The role would also be provided opportunities to Lead the APAC EM region in domain areas such as L&D Talent Management and Early Talent on a rotational basis.

Using tools created in the Talent COE to build communicate and actively monitor SEATW and India’s workforce plan to systematically and proactively prepare for leadership and capability requirements to achieve short term and long-term business objectives.

Key Responsibilities
  • Partner with HR and Business leaders to develop Talent strategy solutions and workforce plans that deliver impact
  • Partner with regional and global talent partners to deliver on key initiatives relating to the country talent
  • Provide expertise in areas of leadership and team development organizational design and culture in partnership with HR & Business leaders that enable achievement of business’s goals.
  • Drive talent management processes such as annual succession planning reviews and performance reviews to ensure effective identification of talent for key roles and overall pipeline of talent. Use insights from the process to implement impactful solutions to trending development needs and succession gaps.
  • Lead the assessment and ongoing organizational design efforts to supporting optimisation and alignment of our org structure to business goals.
  • Act as an internal consultant by finding establishing and achieving innovative talent management and organizational change interventions.
  • Design a variety of approaches for executive leader & high potential leadership development solutions and services including a range of experiences and exposure opportunities across our operating companies.
  • Develop and implement integrated talent management strategies tools and processes to drive a culture of career growth talent mobility performance accountability and leadership transition.
  • Initiate and contribute to overall Talent platform projects and new initiatives focused on building future capability.
  • Initiate and lead programs focused on developing strong talent pipeline for current and future business needs.
  • Build regional early talent strategy and lead design and execution of specific programs for SEATW and India.
  • Lead TMOD team within countries and contribute to overall TMOD team development and success.
  • Lead and be the thought leader in the region for a domain area. Specifically for this rotation period in the Early Talent space.
Frequent Contacts

Internal
  • Business leaders and Managers
  • HR team members
  • Employees with a primary focus on key talents
  • APAC TMOD team
  • Corporate / Division Talent Management leaders
  • Talent Acquisition team
External
  • Vendors and training providers / consultants

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications
  • Undergraduate degree required (Business Psychology HR) / Master or MBA also welcome.
  • 10+ years of Talent Management and Organization experience with track record in strategy building and execution of talent plans in a large complex organization.
  • Track record in initiating and executing on complex change initiatives and building organisational capability especially for Singapore Taiwan and India
  • Experience in driving the Talent growth for commercial manufacturing and operation space in R&D as well as IT especially in Singapore Taiwan and India would be an advantage.
  • Track record partnering with senior leaders to shape and execute their business strategy
  • Experience in operating in a fast pace environment and leveraging global matrix structures to deliver results
  • Demonstrated success in developing and implementing workforce planning and talent strategies to proactively identify develop and move talent to align with overall business priorities.
  • Superior analytical and problem-solving skills evidencing the ability to think and act strategically including executing on strategic plan
  • Strong business acumen with the ability to link talent priorities to key business initiatives and ensure learning and development and mobility spend is targeted towards initiatives with highest return on investment for SEA Taiwan and India.
  • Strong ability to collaborate flex build relationships and influence at all levels and types of organization including commercial manufacturing and operation leaders.
  • Must have deep experience and knowledge of the business economic culture and talent environment of Singapore Taiwan and preferably India and South Asia.
  • Exemplary ethics and ability to drive and maintain a high -morale environment.
  • Experience facilitating senior leadership team meetings and effectiveness in designing developing and deploying leadership management and professional development solutions to accelerate the Talent strategy.
  • Proven success in developing strategies and plans aligned with Talent COE in building Talent pipeline strengthening bench strength and accelerating succession Talent pools to drive business growth and plans for Singapore Taiwan and India.
Skills & Attributes
  • Strategic thinker able to conceptualise strategies and initiatives whilst also delivering on them
  • Business acumen drive to impact business success
  • Robust project management skills results driven and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Able to solve complex problems and execute with speed
  • Ability to partner influence and communicate with multiple internal and external stakeholders demonstrates excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Curious passionate and driven by the area of Talent Management and its impact
  • Comfortable working within a matrix environment with a high level of ambiguity
  • Sets high standards for themselves demonstrating highest standards of integrity and confidentiality
  • A leader and a team collaborator

Other Job Requirements
  • Adhere to OHS policies and procedures and ensure a safe and healthy workplace environment

"There is no love sincerer than the love of food ” - George Bernard Shaw

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.

foodpanda is the leading on-demand food delivery company in APAC bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest people as we continue to grow our regional footprint across food groceries and much more.

We are looking for a highly-driven Senior HR Business Partner (APAC) who will partner with our foodpanda business teams to deliver excellent employee experience develop and execute the organizational agenda and people plans with the ultimate goal to achieve business results and employee experiences. You rapidly build relationships and are able to synthesize business priorities and are a catalyst to identify and deliver people programs to support these priorities. With support from the Regional People Team you will inform the regional people strategy identify and execute people programs encompassing performance and talent management organizational development and change workforce and compensation planning employee engagement and retention and end-to-end employee experiences. Y ou are comfortable working with data and people metrics to deliver deep talent insights that support business decisions.

You will be the change advocate for the rollout of people initiatives ensuring business adoption and engagement.. You are the trusted advisor to the business constantly creating business impact through strategic management of the people agenda.

Performance and Talent Management

Organizational Development and Change

Workforce And Compensation Planning
  • Serve as the cross-functional partner in aligning business needs and workforce planning processes.
  • Guide leaders in making rewards decisions using performance and business data and insights and in alignment with our total rewards philosophy and market competitiveness

Employee Engagement and Retention
  • Leverage data and insights propose and track action plans to address and improve engagement.

Job Title: HR Strategy and Planning Manager| APAC
Job Description:
There is no love sincerer than the love of food ” - George Bernard Shaw

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.

foodpanda is the leading on-demand food delivery company in APAC bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest people as we continue to grow our regional footprint across food groceries and much more.

We are looking for a highly-driven HR Strategy and Planning Manager APAC to join our regional team.

In this exciting highly visible new role under the HR Strategy team you will be focusing on three main areas: 1) Developing the HR Strategy and roadmap for our People team 2) Planning and managing our People budgets and 3) Managing workforce planning for the company.

The impact you will create will be immense. If this sounds interesting to you check out the below for more details of the role and what we’re looking for.

Main Responsibilities
  • Develop and/or update the company’s HR strategy on a periodic cadence including identifying and prioritising major cross-functional OKRs and initiatives by synthesising:
    I. Internal business performance and competencies
    II. External trends (market customer competitor regulatory technological etc)
  • Provide inputs and advice to the leadership team on key issues (e.g. strategic initiatives business priorities and major investments) based on clear issue framing systems-level thinking and rigorous analyses
  • Support the design and implementation of the HR Operating Model and its associated roles processes and technology
  • Manages the HR budget setting/review process including creation and monitoring of budgets
  • Design and implement a workforce planning process in collaboration with key HR and Finance teams
  • Manages and facilitates the planning and allocation of workforce and headcount including the change and communication process for headcount targets
  • Leveraging data and reporting for headcount updates headcount budgets and ensuring data driven decisions are being made by our leaders and partners
  • Staying abreast of best practices for workforce planning (talent mix location strategy) and serving as the subject matter expert for our business leaders and HR teams


The Must Haves
  • A degree with good honours from a top tier university in any discipline with 5-10 years of experience in HR strategy planning workforce planning or management consulting
  • Ability to construct and deliver clear presentations to senior company executive
  • Experience in analysing and quantifying complex strategic issues tied to long term People operations growth
  • A love for numbers and problem-solving with strong ability to think creatively
  • Experience in managing complex cross-functional projects
  • A natural leader who displays integrity humility and responsibility with excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to empathise and collaborate with stakeholders across functions and at all levels of experience
  • A self-starter and independent learner who takes the initiative to challenge the status quo
  • Ability to perform under pressure in a dynamic fast-paced environment
  • Advanced spreadsheet skills

Background

The Human Resource Division (HRD) in the Ministry of Law oversees and manages the Ministry’s HR functions in the areas of Manpower Planning Attraction Learning Development Performance Management and Talent Management. The Division is also responsible for Rewards Management Employees’ Well-Being. Officers can look forward to job rotation opportunities across the different functional areas based on competencies and area of interest.

1) Awards

  • Ability to work independently and also a team player
  • Past working experience in the public sector is an added advantage

We are proud to partner exclusively with our client a leading global financial services organisation to appoint a Global HR Business Partner Lead (ED/MD Level) for Technology. This individual will have a background of supporting sizeable and highly innovative geographically dispersed Technology populations within matrix organisations which are going through extensive change. This is a very visible Global Tech HR BP Lead position and the organisation is in growth mode with a lot of exciting projects upcoming. Reporting in to the Global Head of HR with a dotted line in to the Global Head of Technology this individual will spearhead all HR changes related to the global technology population across the entire organisation. More specifically you will drive HR Strategy People Projects Culture and Engagement Talent Management Organisation Design / TOM (offshoring) M&A upskilling and reskilling employees building innovative capabilities across the global Technology population in an agile structure.

 

This is a largely strategic role as this person will coach and advise the global Tech leadership team on all HR / people technology and innovation related matters supported by a forward thinking global HR team. This person will operate in a strategic individual contributor position initially with a view to potentially manage a globally dispersed team longer term.

 

The successful applicant:

This is a wonderful opportunity for someone who enjoys operating in a highly matrix and international working environment managing complex strategic HR projects (supported by CoEs) building excellent relationships with the leadership team. For those at ED level this position would be a perfect stepping-stone in to a Global MD role longer-term within the organisation due to the extensive focus on Technology in areas such as; digital data science AI cyber as well as reviewing key skills of the future. This person should be highly passionate about and knowledgeable in Technology. Experience operating in a global Technology Fintech or Financial Services organisation is preferred.

Job Title: HR Business Partner - Front Office Banking
Job Description:
• HR Business Partner – Front Office Banking
  • Leading global financial services firm
  • Salary: SGD 120000 to 150000 per annum + 2 – 3 months VB
  • Location: Singapore


About Our Client

A highly regarded global financial services firm consisting of circa 400 employees across Asia is seeking a high performing and passionate HR Business Partner to join their small and collaborative HR team based in the Singapore office. You will act as deputy to the Regional Head of HR and partner very closely with the business (primarily front-office stakeholders) supporting a number of offices spread across the region to provide a high touch and pro-active HR Advisory service operating in a broad HR Business Partner role.


Job Description

Reporting directly in to the Regional Head of HR based in Singapore  and operating as the deputy for the function you will work very closely with the lean and high performing HR team in a broad HR Business Partner / HR Generalist role in a fast paced and diverse environment. 


This role is an individual contributor position and you will partner very closely with the Leadership team across the business to provide HR Advisory Employee Relations and Policy Talent & Learning Reward HR Projects support in a busy and varied position. You will be supported by a small team of HR Operations Recruitment and Payroll specialists and will work collaboratively to provide an efficient and top-tier HR service to the business end-to-end. You will be strategic and operationally strong and able to consult and advise the business building strong relationships with senior management.


The ideal candidate will be operating in a HR Business Partner role within another global financial services organisation based in Singapore. You will have ideally worked closely with Front Office stakeholders. Ideally you will have a combination of large and smaller global organisations with the benefit of being operationally strong due to the small size of the team with a track record working directly with the leadership team in a broad HR Generalist position. You will be a team player who will be able to cope with last-minute changes in a fast-paced international environment. You must be hands on with a focus on quality deliverables.


The Successful Applicant

We are looking for a HR Business Partner currently operating in another global matrix financial services organisation ideally in a regional or global capacity. You must be willing to roll your sleeves up and deliver HR strategy projects advisory and generalist tasks end-to-end due to the small team.

The Senior Manager Human Resources oversees all aspects of employee engagement and interaction with the organization including recruitment and selection; training and development; performance management; payroll and benefits; disciplinary and grievance procedures; and relations with the union.

The Manager Human Resources Is Responsible For
  • developing and directing Human Resources (“HR”) strategy and policies;
  • advising the Group Director Development and Shared Services on personnel and/or HR implications of his/her decisions and organizational development matters;
  • ensuring the availability of talent to support Montfort Care’s operations plan; and
  • ensuring that all HR practices are compliant with relevant legal and statutory requirements

HR plans
  • To work with the Group Director Development and Shared Services to execute mid- and long-term HR strategies for the organization that are aligned with the overall goals of the organization and direction of the Board of Directors
  • To manage HR for the realization of the strategic plan and achievement of long-term strategic goals and objectives
  • To execute with guidance special projects for the organization which may include
    • Group-level outreach and engagement activities
    • Organizational improvement activities
  • To supervise the monitoring of various key performance indicators for the organization as a whole

Recruitment and Selection
  • To monitor and ensure that the organization has a robust succession plan
  • To ensure that recruitment activities are compliant to local laws and fair employment practices
  • To supervise the selection process for appropriate candidates including but not limited to interviewing reference checking and testing if necessary
  • To develop and maintain a recruiting testing and interviewing program; counselling managers on candidate selection conducting and analyzing exit interviews
  • to supervise and ensure the objective deployment of staff (either new hires or internal transfers)
  • To manage the availability of talent to support Montfort Care’s operations plan

Training and Development
  • To prepare the organization training plan taking into account career progression succession planning and operational requirements
  • To forecast and manage the training budget
  • To manage learning and development of employees to develop different levels of employees; including induction on the job training internal and external courses and workshops compliance training supported external study coaching and mentoring

Performance Management
  • To manage the performance management system incorporating elements such as regular feedback meetings performance appraisals and processes to manage underperformance
  • To manage consistency of effective individual and departmental target setting


Payroll And Benefits
  • To supervise the administration of the organisation’s payroll systems
  • To conduct regular benchmark studies to ensure market competitiveness
  • To develop with guidance a non-salary rewards and benefits system that recognizes the contribution employees make in their role. This includes both tangible (bonuses allowances etc.) and intangible benefits (positive culture and climate flexible work practices etc.) which contribute to an employee's motivation engagement and retention
  • To manage the linking of performance management systems to rewards and benefits systems such that employees feel that their contributions have an impact on their rewards

Disciplinary and Grievance Procedures
  • To develop disciplinary procedures to maintain a conducive respectful and harmonious environment
  • To supervise programmes that uphold organizational values and maintain in employee morale
  • To develop with guidance grievance procedures to create an open and honest climate with effective two-way communication between staff

Workplace Health and Safety
  • To manage compliance with legislation relating to an employee's safety in the workplace
  • To manage activities and initiatives that contribute to employees’ overall wellbeing
  • To develop with guidance health and wellbeing programs to improve the organization’s employment brand

Research
  • To conduct and manage research into new/leading HR practices and to disseminate this information throughout the organization

Employee Engagement
  • To plan and manage employee engagement events such as sharing sessions town halls or retreats
  • To inform senior management on employee-relations policies as needed to facilitate and ensure alignment with company strategy
  • To communicate regularly with employees on HR matters
  • To ensure HR practices are in compliance with employment laws and regulations

HR advice to the Group Director Development and Shared Services and senior management
  • To provide advice and support to senior management and/or its sub committees on matters relating to any issue within the remit of Human Resources
  • To implement and manage succession planning initiatives as determined by leadership

Personnel Management (of HR team)
  • Provide orientation and ensure staff receive the required training
  • Provide regular feedback on staff and team performance
  • Conduct performance appraisals regularly and in a timely manner

Please submit resume to hr@montfortcare.org.sg or kasthuri.devi@montfortcare.org.sg

Happiness Hero ( StartUp - Senior HR Manager )

“You need us as much as We need You”

We are offering an opportunity for a Happiness Hero to get in on the ground floor of an early StartUp with significant growth potential in the creation of a localise Gig Economy App for Singapore by Singapore by spearheading the various human resources functions end to end.

Requirements

The Role

Our most valued asset is our human capital. That is why we are looking for a Happiness Hero to join our team. You’ll be the first HR hire and should be excited about contributing at both hands-on and strategic levels and have a proven track record of positively influencing teams and their leaders.

As our first HR hire you will have the opportunity and responsibility to shape our thinking to design our approach to HR to deliver on our responsibilities to our people and to make our team effective and productive.

The Happiness Hero will be responsible for our systems processes tools and compliance and will manage benefits and the onboarding and offboarding of new employees.

Most importantly together with the founding team you will create implement and promote a sustainable culture of a positive high performing environment.

The Successful Applicant

The Happiness Hero must be entrepreneurial pro-active and high performing Head of HR from an international service digital or technology organisation based in Singapore. You must have extensive HR Business Partner and Generalist experience and ideally have a blend of corporate and StartUp experience managing sizable and small teams. You should have experience setting up and developing People Strategy Operations and Projects from Scratch with excellent communication skills. Ability to navigate ambiguity and put in place an effective HR strategy operating in a strategic and operation HR lead position.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Working with the founding team to create and sustain a thriving performance driven culture that brings out the best in each employee and sets the highest expectations for the firm’s responsibilities and competitive performance
  • Autonomously lead the design implementation and iteration of new people programs as well as assess and improve current people programs.
  • Develop a compensation and benefits strategy that enables us to attract and retain exceptional talent and build a highly scalable business
  • Build best-in-class people programs in recruiting onboarding and learning & development
  • Lead effective and consistent implementation of performance management practices across the organization including leadership development accelerated development succession planning coaching talent reviews and terminations.
  • Direct the development and administration of proactive and progressive compensation and benefits programs to attract motivate incentivize and recognize effective performance.
  • Hire train and develop the HR team
What We Look For
  • A track record of increasing HR responsibility ideally at one or more growth-stage StartUp; you have helped scale a company from – 10 to 50-100 and can anticipate the challenges we’ll face as we grow and are willing to flex between strategic and hands-on when needed
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity in a start-up environment complex problem-solving capabilities and ability to prioritize effectively
  • Strong business acumen that can translate company priorities to HR priorities and in turn build operational excellence
  • A global mindset with the ability to balance creating consistent global processes with local requirements
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Willingness to drive results by rolling up your sleeves with a can-do approach to work
  • Bring expertise on HR best-practices (including compliance management) while driving continuous improvement for a scalable and sustainable model
  • Create and maintain effective organization of responsibility including training coaching recognition workflow patterns performance standards delineation of duties and responsibilities.
  • Exceptional planning skills and ability to manage multiple high-visibility projects simultaneously
  • Ability to deliver within deadlines and strength in facilitating change on a broad scale
  • Proven ability to deal with conflict and diffuse difficult situation
  • Strong thought leadership and best practices in HR Recruiting Performance Management Compliance and Talent Management/Development
  • Deep experience leading and scaling innovative organizations
  • A track record of investing in and developing talent on your teams
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Ability to build and maintain robust scalable systems and processes
Bonus Points
  • Familiar in WSQ ATO
  • Familiar with WSG schemes
  • Familiar with various SG Government grants
Next Steps
  • Prepare your updated resume (please include your current salary package with full breakdown such as base incentives annual wage supplement etc.) and expected package.
  • Apply through this application or send your resume to felixteo@ahr.com.sg in MS Word Copy
  • All shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

TRUST. Everything We Stand For.

Overview

Foreign Service Administration Specialists (FSAS) contribute to the success of MFA in administrative and operational roles. FSAS officers can develop along multiple career pathways to pursue a career that makes the best use of their skills knowledge and interests. After a deployment in HQ FSAS officers may be posted to any of our 50 Overseas Missions where they have the unique experience of being in diverse social and cultural environments.

No matter where you begin you can go far.

Job Scope

While at HQ you may perform one of the following roles:
  • Administration: Provide administrative secretarial or IT support; or handle information management
  • Consular: Assist overseas Singaporeans in distress
  • Corporate Services: Provide administrative support in finance procurement travel relocation or estate management
  • Human Resource: Execute various functions such as recruitment performance management and career development

Requirements
  • Singapore citizens with strong administrative planning and communication skills who are ready to take up the challenge of working overseas.

Development Opportunities

This includes milestone programmes at various stages of your career to hone your skills and prepare you for higher level appointments. Those with leadership potential can look forward to greater job responsibilities.

Job Title: Sustainability Specialist - Material Sustainability and Environmental Impact
Job Description:
Job Description

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Support the WSI Sustainability department in achieving companywide and brand-specific goals related to positive environmental impact
  • Lead WSI Preferred Material R&D team and prioritize research projects with consideration for environmental impacts and business needs
  • Implement WSI Preferred Material Framework to increase usage of materials with lower environmental impacts
  • Conduct research on alternative/sustainable materials and their application in home goods products; capture and share industrywide material trends and best practices
  • Collaborate with suppliers to develop and test alternative materials and prototype product samples
  • Manage material testing and analyze test results in context of WSI Preferred Material Framework and WSI QA product quality and safety standards (includes forensic isotope and DNA species testing)
  • Identify considerations and potential risks related to material use such as potential chemical hazards in manufacturing or long-term effects of materials in the environment (i.e. microplastic pollution)
  • Develop recommendations for the use of sustainable materials and highlight potential risks and benefits including estimated environmental impacts
  • Maintain a preferred materials library – digital and physical (where appropriate)
  • Promote the use of preferred materials within the organization
  • Collaborate cross-functionally on material goal setting and metrics to drive results
  • Develop and maintain the budget project timelines and progress reports


Skills And Requirements
  • Masters/ bachelor’s degree in Material Science or Materials Science & Engineering or equivalent (Major in or Research in Materials for Sustainability is a plus)
  • Minimum 4 years working experience in a multi-national corporation experience in working with sustainable materials (i.e. plastic) is a plus
  • Basic understanding/knowledge of:
    • Industry standards certifications and traceability mechanisms for sustainability health and safety carbon emissions etc.
    • Product and material lifecycle analysis (LCA) scientific and academic research and laboratory material testing methodologies
    • Circular economy concepts principles of green design and systems thinking
  • Experience and working knowledge of various material types for soft and hard-line products including:
    • recycled upcycled and bio-based synthetic fibers (polyester polyamide etc.)
    • manmade cellulosic fibers (viscose rayon proprietary fibers etc.)
    • plant and animal-based fibers (cotton linen leather down wool etc.)
    • wood plastic ceramic glass and metal
  • Independent and proactive in setting own goals and deadlines with the ability to manage various projects
  • Proven analytic skills with experience processing large amounts of data to derive insight and develop recommendations for action
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word Powerpoint and Excel
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Keen interest in sustainability climate change and environmental issues a plus


About Us

Founded in 1956 Williams-Sonoma Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of home furnishings in the United States Canada Puerto Rico Australia United Kingdom and the rest of the world with franchise partnerships. Our family of brands are Williams-Sonoma Pottery Barn Pottery Barn Kids PBteen West Elm Williams-Sonoma Home Rejuvenation and Mark and Graham. Our passion for high-quality products functional design outstanding customer service enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities remains as our core values.

Today we are a USD 5 billion company with a multi-brand multi-channel global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.

The Singapore regional office was set up in 2008 and we currently have 140 associates over functions such as corporate social responsibility customs & compliance finance human resource information technology inventory planning logistics sourcing and quality assurance.

The South East Asia team is an inclusive employer where we recruit and provide employees with fair opportunities on the basis of merit regardless of age race gender religion marital status and family responsibilities or disability.

Job Title: Chief of Staff- Profit-for-purpose / Agtech Venture
Job Description:
Chief of Staff- Profit-for-purpose / Agtech Venture

About BCG Digital Ventures:

BCG Digital Ventures' mission is to invent launch scale and invest in game-changing businesses in partnership with the world's most influential corporations. We bring together the speed culture and approach of a multidisciplinary team of startup operators (including designers engineers product mangers and business strategists) with the resources and industry position of our corporate partners to launch ventures with an "unfair advantage." We are the largest new business builder in the world having launched over 100 ventures over the past 5 years (including several unicorns and $200m+ val companies) including in South East Asia such as Ovo Boost and Pelago and Agtech such as OpenSC and Atfarm.

About this opportunity:

We are working to launch and scale a stealth profit-for-purpose / agtech venture with a mission to improve the lives of smallholder farmers in developing markets. Our platform will enable smallholder farmers to:

  • Grow more effectively and sustainably increasing yield and incomes through AI and satellite-powered personalised farming advice delivered through intuitive channels such as voice chat and video;
  • Buy much-needed farming inputs (such as seeds and fertilizers) at discounted prices;
  • Borrow microfinance to fund farm growth and increase financial inclusion; and
  • Sell their farming produce at the best price which involves digitising key parts of the agriculture supply chain with IoT and online-to-offline capabilities.

The venture is backed by a global agro-commodity player which has unparalleled presence in rural communities and relationships with millions of smallholder farmers. It is uniquely positioned to drive profit with purpose: disrupting the agriculture industry and generating outsized financial returns while creating real impact for some of the world's poorest farmers and their families and the planet by promoting sustainable farming practices. The company is expected to launch publicly by end-2020.

We are looking for an experienced and motivated Chief of Staff who is passionate about our mission to help shape the founding team of the venture.

What this venture offers:

  • Shape a startup and product in its early stage
  • Make a real difference for humanity and the planet
  • Work on cutting edge technology such as ML IoT satellite imagery and voice
  • Experience international adventure in frontier markets such as Indonesia India and across Africa
  • Join a talented passionate and fun team and network from Olam International BCG/DV and partners at leading NGOs and development institutions
  • Diverse and inclusive environment with colleagues from around the world
  • Sustainable and flexible working hours and support for part time models
  • Competitive compensation and benefits (including base bonus insurance and more)
  • Upsides of a dynamic startup with the financial security and strategic advantage of a global corporate backing
  • Visa and relocation support for a smooth transition to work and live in Singapore Indonesia and/or subsequent markets

What you will do:

  • CEO extension: draft CEO communication (including key proposals board investor or partner communications) manage special projects prioritize agenda facilitate flow of information to and from CEO (following up direct reports and partners etc)
  • Strategy development: work with CEO and lead business analysts to address ongoing strategy questions (eg. market entry partnership evaluation financing structure etc)
  • Growth: Lead growth into new services regions/markets and commodities. Build and lead an "MVP SWAT team" (ala Uber Launch Team) who take opportunities from idea to early product/business in market including opportunity prioritization planning/budgeting coordinating the build launch initial growth hiring and transition to permanent team
  • Partnerships: Develop strategy search evaluation negotiation and relationship management of strategic partnerships eg. insurance providers farmer lending (with primary lender KYC provider first/second loss facility etc) go-to-market partners commercial aspects of technical vendors etc.
  • Corporate finance M&A & Investor Relations: Execute finance/funding rounds grants and acquisitions (eg. with plantix) manage investor communication and relationships work with finance to prepare quarterly & annual reports.
  • Corporate PR marketing and stakeholder communications: Develop and execute communications and PR strategy secure exposure in top publications position Jiva as a high profile thought leader represent company in key forums create and update communication assets (website videos marketing fliers/slides) coordinate with external agencies if/when required (including press releases interviews media events etc).
  • Reporting & stakeholder communication: Manage measure and report on the required progress strategic plan and budget of strategy growth partnerships investor relations to the appropriate stakeholders. Represent People and Operations internally and externally.
  • Content preparation: prepare key materials for board and leadership meetings investor communications conferences employee town halls etc
  • Professional service coordination: coordinate with internal functions and external professional advisors including finance/accounting corporate secretary legal HR and IT on ongoing matters (eg. annual reports executing legal partnerships and fundraises HR contracts etc)

What we are looking for:

  • 5-10 years experience with strategy development business planning and management
  • 2-3 years experience at top-tier management consulting or professional services firm including time as a manager/project leader level or above
  • Experience in a high-pressure start-up environment
  • Experience in agriculture agtech international development social impact strategic partnerships fundraising/venture finance and/or communication preferred
  • Ability to work in an multidisciplinary teams and effectively manage multiple stakeholders including tech/product and business/commercial perspectives
  • Evidence of personal ownership and driving results
  • Fluent and excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Speed and skill driving high quality output working in text/prose slides and excel quantitative and economic modelling (eg. business models budgets cap tables etc)
  • A bachelor's degree (business psychology economics strategy or equivalent from a top-tier institution preferred)
  • Entrepreneurial curious and passionate about making a difference towards some of the world's most important problems

Note: while we are open to receiving applications now we will not be actively reviewing all applications for this position until November.

To learn more visit us at bcgdv.com

Interested applicants may apply through the careers section of the website at https://www.bcgdv.com/. Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.

BCG Digital Ventures is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color age religion sex national origin disability protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal state or local law.

Job Title: Senior Executive/Executive| Rewards & Performance Management – Human Resource Department
Job Description:
Responsibilities

You will be part of a dynamic HR team that looks into the area of Rewards and Performance Management in MOM focusing on areas such as building and strengthening the performance management culture supporting the annual ranking and promotion exercise and the performance management system and reviewing and implementing policies to strengthen the code of conduct culture.

As part of the HR team you may also be part of various HR projects to help the Ministry to identify develop and reward officers’ contributions and performance.

  • Proficient in Excel and comfortable with managing IT systems.


Other Key Attributes

i. Strong interpersonal communication and collaboration skills
ii. Meticulous with an eye for details
iii. Team player able to work well with internal and external stakeholders

ADP RPO is hiring a Recruiting CRM. Strong relationships is the foundation of our success. The Client Relationship Manager (CRM) is responsible for developing a partnership with our client accounts by working directly with the client staffing team hiring managers (Manager or Director level) or account team to develop and enhance strategies to ensure successful delivery of staffing services. Individuals must be highly consultative have the ability to perform a variety of functional tasks work within a team environment and exhibit a commitment to our peers and clients. The Recruiting CRM is responsible for managing the recruitment efforts and hiring process for complex accounts and positions requiring he/she to lead the intake process with hiring managers develop sourcing strategies and develop relationships with client contacts on a regular basis. The primary focus of the roles is to identify and select top level candidates for key openings within the assigned client(s). The role is responsible for building and managing relationships within assigned operating unit in order to fully understand the needs of the client. Other responsibilities may include but are not limited to the following: phone interviewing offer negotiation education training and managing of administrative resources to support the account.

We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise Integrity is Everything Service Excellence Inspiring Innovation Each Person Counts Results-Driven - Social Responsibility.

Responsibilities
  • Requisition Management/Pipeline Management which includes candidate screening as well as database management (consistently reviewing and assessing pipeline for each requisition and dispositioning candidates accordingly).
  • Manage profitability of Account via development of comprehensive effective and innovative sourcing and selection strategies in order to efficiently attain top level candidates.
  • Consistently consult and collaborate with hiring managers regarding expectations challenges and strategies.
  • Develop process improvements implement solutions and share best practices with account team members and client partners.
  • Lead weekly meetings with hiring managers and account teams to discuss and assess candidate and requisition status and health. Internet research and job posting responsibility and pipeline status movement.
  • Perform and/or manage passive recruiting through RMS resources as necessary to attract top level candidates.
  • Consult regarding phone interviewing strategies and analysis of completed interviews including behavioral interviews of potential candidates to select top level candidates for clients.
  • Accurately forecast and request transitional hours in a timely manner; leverage resources to maximize productivity and pipeline management.
  • Review candidate profile experience and telephone interview responses and decide final disposition of candidate (i.e.. eligible for hire not eligible for hire second round interview eligible or transfer to another requisition because of skill set match)
  • Furthermore sell identified and selected candidates to client hiring managers as well as advise top level candidates on a client's opportunity including culture fit knowledge gaps and value proposition.
  • If applicable negotiate and present compensation packages to candidate for acceptance.
  • Metric analysis interview guide development SLA adherence and report generation.
  • Interpret and analyze data and present back to client and account manager so that enhancements can be made to the hiring process such as revisions of behavioral based interview guides job descriptions compensation packages and success indicators.
  • Development and delivery of presentations to client human resource partners and hiring managers.
  • Provides back up to Account Manager in areas of reporting coaching mentoring and sharing of best practices.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications Required
  • Bachelor's Degree required.
  • 3-5 years Experience with a Thorough understanding of recruitment practices.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:
  • Demonstrated professional growth within HR Staffing and/or Talent Acquisition Skills and Abilities.
  • Proven ability to design develop and implement strategic solutions.
  • Ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization both internally and externally
  • Technical - Business Knowledge
  • Demonstrated ability to manage priorities within tight deadlines and high client expectations
  • Client Focus/Service Orientation
  • Communication Skills - written and verbal coupled with interpersonal skills.
  • People Management- embraces the concept of managing up and down.
  • Manages expectations across all levels of the organization and communicates appropriately both internally and externally.
  • ATS System - ability to report and leverage the ATS and manipulate data to share a story internally and externally.

It's an exciting time at Netflix as we continue to expand our business globally. We are revolutionizing the way people watch their favorite shows and movies and building our own library of original Netflix content for all to enjoy. Feel free to take a look at our Culture Memo to learn more about our unique Netflix culture as well as an overview of our long-term view.

The Contingent talent team is responsible for the strategy operations and guidance across the Temp-Worker Independent Contractor and Vendor space internationally. Our team makes it easy for Netflix managers to engage with the contingent workforce by providing training education and guidelines to minimize Netflix's risk. We offer data and insights on contingent worker planning hiring and strategy which enables our business partners to make informed decisions and engage the right contingent talent quickly through a great experience.

We are growing rapidly and looking for a Contingent Talent Program Manager to join our Talent organization in Singapore supporting the entire APAC region (Singapore Korea Japan India and emerging countries). You would partner closely with hiring managers supplier partners and contingent workers globally potentially working across time zones. As a member of the team (and single point of contact for the region) you will be owning program reporting including performance metrics ad-hoc requests and maintaining data integrity while utilizing various software systems and databases. Your responsibilities encompass understanding the contingent talent landscape providing strategic direction to hiring managers and embedding yourself in the Netflix culture. This is a hands-on manager level role without direct reports.

In this role you will manage by
  • Partnering closely with Hiring Managers staffing partners and contingent workers.
  • Owning and juggling multiple contingent requisitions and maintain high quality/maximum traction for Hiring Managers at all times.
  • Working closely with business leaders to influence sourcing approach strategy and determine appropriate classification of workforce needs.
  • Assisting hiring leaders with development and execution of Independent Contractor/Freelancer agreements.
  • Developing job descriptions hosts sync calls with agency partners screen resumes and drive selection of contingent personnel.
  • Ensuring that contingent workers understand and embrace our unique culture.
  • Assisting in new supplier vetting and supplier performance management.
  • Building relationships with program staffing partners by providing timely updates and feedback on their candidates.
  • Conducting contingent worker orientation on a weekly basis ensuring contingent workers have the resources they need to succeed.
  • Assisting managers with contingent worker issues feedback offboarding and assignment terminations.

You will also analyse by
  • Monitoring service level agreements with global supplier partners
  • Managing ongoing optimization of suppliers rates markups and utilization
  • Gatheriing data create reports analyze reports and be able to paint a story
  • Supporting global users with requests on contingent talent data & metrics

To be successful you are
  • Equal parts creative and analytical
  • Always actively seeking to understand the business and are energized when learning about challenging creative & technical problems
  • An expert on industry trends and can leverage data to influence
  • Dedicated and ambitious; takes initiative and follows-through
  • The first to roll up your sleeves when something needs to get done
  • Resilient in the face of change
  • Attentive to detail but able to step back and look at the big picture
  • Self-directed and autonomous yet able to collaborate effectively with a global team
  • Proactive you take initiative and you always follow through
  • Inclusive; you collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
  • Curious about Netflix’s and the initiatives of the various organizations globally
  • You thrive on offering creative solutions to challenging situations

Skills And Experience
  • 10+ years HR ATS VMS systems experience. Preferably Workday
  • You have prior staffing recruiting HR or client relationship management
  • You have intermediate experience with Google Suite (Gmail GCal Google Calendar etc) and recruiting systems. You’re also proficient in tools that help eliminate manual steps by automating and integrating to ensure greater operational efficiency.
  • Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
  • You are a good problem solver you know the right questions to ask to take on the situation at hand using the resources available to you
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • This position will require travel throughout the APAC region

Job Title: Senior Executive / Manager| Performance Management| Human Capital
Job Description:
Senior Executive / Manager Performance Management Human Capital

Work Type: Contract Position

At Sport Singapore we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative fun and meaningful sporting experiences.

Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play regardless of age gender race ability or social status. It imparts life values nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport.

Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do.

Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport Strength through Teamwork and Care for People we believe in working and playing not just as a team but as a family.

Responsibilities

You will be reporting to the team lead and be part of the Human Capital division to develop and implement a performance management framework. This framework aims to motivate and retain an engaged and committed workforce to meet the current and future needs of the organisation and to appropriately reward deserving officers.

In this role you will be part of the team to;
  • Design review and implement performance management framework and assessment to be used for the review of staff performance
  • Conduct periodic review of HR and relevant policies benchmarking and comparative studies activities with external agencies
  • Facilitate the Organisation’s performance appraisal cycle.
  • Streamline relevant processes and work with consultant to upgrade the existing Performance management system where applicable
  • Provide secretariat support to PM calibration/ranking meetings.
Requirements

We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active.

In addition an ideal candidate should possess the following;
  • At least 3-5 years of relevant experience in Human Resource and Performance Management.
  • Conceptual and analytical skills to be able to think strategically plan and apply the analytical reasoning in the area of Human Resource.
  • Good oral and written communication with good interpersonal skills.
  • Self-driven resourceful and able to work independently as well as in a team.
  • Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent attention to details
  • Proficient in Microsoft office.
Only shortlisted applicants will be notified. The level of offer will commensurate with applicants’ experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a 2/3 year fixed-term contract in the first instance.

Date Posted

Country

Raytheon Technologies (NYSE: RTX) is an aerospace and defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial military and government customers worldwide. The company was formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses and is headquartered in Waltham Massachusetts.

Collins Aerospace a unit of United Technologies Corp. (NYSE: UTX) is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Created in 2018 by bringing together UTC Aerospace Systems and Rockwell Collins Collins Aerospace has the capabilities comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.

We are currently hiring a Head of Regional Operations Airport Systemsbased out of Singapore to join our Avionics division specifically our Information Management Services (IMS) Asia Pacific team. Collins Aerospace has a global presence at more than 150 airports including half of the 20 largest in the world. As a leading provider of self-serve solutions and with a reputation as a master communication network integrator we understand that the flow of an airport is the flow of an industry.

Join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE!

Job Summary

As the Head of Regional Operations for Asia Pacific this leadership position functions in a shared service environment and is responsible for overseeing business technical and maintenance service operations. This person will be responsible for managing teams tasked with delivery and support of all projects on time within budget and in a manner that enhances Collins’ technical leadership and reputation and encourages additional business from customers.

Job Responsibilities
  • Oversee the overall operations within the region of responsibility;
  • Provide management and direction of the Project Management Systems Delivery and Managed Services teams;
  • Provide guidance for development of project schedule and budget and monitor project execution for compliance with defined strategic and financial targets and objectives;
  • Enforce standards of operations using project management tools and techniques such as MS Project critical path analysis time recording systems and other systems to manage projects;
  • Support regional business growth and development activities by maintaining and expanding current customer relationships and developing opportunities with potential customers;
  • Nurture existing customer relationships by coordinating with assigned Sales management representatives to deliver timely responses to requests for support or add-on business;
  • Ensure quality of product and services delivery by developing and continually improving policies and procedures and maintaining project documentation in accordance with ISO guidelines;
  • Deliver projects on time and within defined scope and budget;
  • Coordinate responsibilities with other functional areas within other Collins Business Units and regions to insure synergy between the different operations team;
  • Participate in bid reviews and provide subject matter advice on bid or no-bid decisions for identified opportunities;
  • Organize and lead Project Status Review meetings and cost analysis with all stakeholders;
  • Accurate management of project planning and Estimated At Completion (EACs) vigilance over expenditure invoicing and revenue recognition forecasts to meet/exceed the Annual Operating Plan goals of the business;
  • Ensure client engagements and obligations are fulfilled and delivered in a manner which meets/exceeds customer expectations;
  • Serve as escalation point for project delivery issues and operational support to the customer and/or internal stakeholders and address issues in a timely manner and/or escalate internally to ensure resolution;
  • Regular review of work processes systems and human resources to improve any inefficiencies and streamline business operations while ensuring consistency of procedures across all regions;
  • Assisting with the negotiation of terms and conditions for customer and sub-contractor contracts;
  • Contribute to sales/marketing effort by being alert to new business opportunities and assisting with related proposals customer-facing presentations and other support of the sales process;
  • Administrative and personnel management duties for a team of direct reports;
  • Up to 70% business travel.

Qualifications

Technical/Professional:
  • BS/BA degree in a Project Management discipline or equivalent.
  • Proven experience as a People Leader/Project Leader/Program Manager with a minimum of 15 years relevant work experience in an Airline/Airport environment
  • Advanced Microsoft Project and MS Office skills (Excel Word PowerPoint etc.)
  • Experience in an operational environment
  • Experience in Financial Management
  • Adaptable to work in an ever-changing and demanding operational environment including coordination with the overall global team
  • PMP or Prince2 qualification preferred
  • Proven track record of successful project delivery

People Management
  • Possess demonstrated leadership of functional and project teams
  • Ability to meet cost schedule budget and operational goals
  • Excellent customer-oriented attitude
  • Strong organizational communication (written and verbal) and administrative skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills

Location:
  • Singapore

OPERATIONS MANAGER

Full Time Position

REPORTS TO

This position requires the person to directly report to the Managing Director

Job Overview

Maintains and enhances the organization's human resources by planning implementing and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies programs and practices.

Responsibilities & Duties
  • Recruit select train assign schedule coach counsel and discipline employees
  • Communicate job expectations; planning monitoring appraising and reviewing job contributions
  • Plan and review compensation actions; enforcing policies and procedures
  • Contribute operations information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; prepare and complete action plans; implement production productivity quality and customer-service standards; resolve problems; complete audits; identify trends
  • Forecast requirements; prepare an annual budget; schedule expenditures; analyze variances; initiating corrective actions
  • Develop operations systems by determining product handling and storage requirements; develop implement enforce and evaluate policies and procedures; develop processes for receiving product equipment utilization inventory management and shipping
  • Analyze process workflow employee and space requirements and equipment layout; implement changes
  • Maintain safe and healthy work environment by establishing following and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations
  • Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations
  • Accomplish operations and organization mission by completing related results as needed
  • Meet or exceed operations labor budget expectations
  • Manage staff levels wages hours contract labor to revenues
  • Responsible for all department managers and supervisors with review/approval responsibility for all operations employees
  • Run a safe injury/accident free workplace
  • Responsible for all aspects of vehicle and heavy equipment rentals
  • Establish contracts and pricing and ensuring proper maintenance and serving as primary liaison with utilities and local government agencies such as fire police health and safety agencies
  • Manage relationships with key operations vendors
  • Track vendor pricing rebates and service levels
  • Review and approve all operational invoices and ensure they are submitted for payment
  • Serve as primary point of contact when there are customer issues related to equipment quality customer service or accidents and mishaps on-site. In particular this includes any issues on-site at client facilities such as breaking a fence or tape residue on flooring
  • Communicate customer issues with operations team and devise ways of improving the customer experience including resolving problems and complaints
  • Work closely with management team to set and/or implement policies procedures and systems and to follow through with implementation.
  • Communicate all operating policies and/or issues at department meetings
  • Work closely with the inventory manager and team to perform analysis of our inventory and ensure we are utilizing our inventory effectively purchasing the right equipment maintaining solid inventory data and reduce sub-rental expenses
  • Communicate with legal counsel and safety department to ensure all processes remain compliant with SFA AVA CID and other governmental regulations


Skills & Qualifications

Hiring Operation Management Human Resource Management Coaching Leadership Cost Management Performance Management Supports Diversity Classifying Employees Employment Law Laws Against Sexual Harassment Organization skills Planning & implementation Food & Beverage Skills Purchasing & Inventory Management.

• Applicants should be looking to work full-time in Singapore.

    Jump established a global footprint with the launch of our Singapore office in 2012. With every passing year the office has steadily grown with exceptional talent and has rooted itself as the hub for managing its Asian trading. The office is at the pinnacle of development having landed a new member for virtually every team in the organization (Trading Technology Operations Talent Acquisition Legal/Compliance and Human Resources) and functioning as a true global operation. Working in the Singapore office has the feel of a small start-up with the benefits of being part of one of the leading quantitative trading firms in the World.

    About the Role:

    We are looking for an Algorithmic Trader with a passion for the financial markets combined with exceptional technical skills to join our team in Singapore to further enhance our trading activities.

    What you'll do:

    • Be on the front line in trading the global markets through changing economic conditions and market events
    • Use your creativity to identify new trading strategies alongside industry-leading machine learning experts
    • Tackle operational challenges within our automated trading system and design robust software for continuous trading operations
    • Interweave alpha execution and cutting-edge technology while optimizing latency to maximize strategy performance
    • Other duties as assigned or needed

    Skills you'll need:

    • Degree in Computer Science Mathematics or similar with high academic achievements
    • Excellent knowledge of Python C++ or similar languages
    • Creative thinkers who are competitive and driven with a passion for trading and the financial markets
    • Strong mathematical foundations and ability to solve abstract problems
    • Understanding of Linux admin and shell scripting is a plus
    • Ability to multitask and thrive under pressure
    • Reliable and predictable availability

We are looking for team members to join our fast-growing business as we solidify our market position.

As a Business Analyst you will act as a trusted advisor to implement high value business solutions to our clients using our proprietary manpower planning products. Ultimately you will be equipped with training and mentorship in managing the entire life cycle of business solutions implementation. You can look forward to supporting our wide arrays of projects with large enterprises across Singapore promising an unprecedented opportunity to learn and gain extensive experience.

Requirements

Responsibilities
  • Gathering requirements - Understand analyse and document the clients' pain points problem statements and functional requirements
  • Solutioning - Lead the creation of solution designs based on client’s business requirements using our flagship product - WorkforceOptimizer
  • Customization - Work with client and WorkforceOptimizer technology teams to configure and personalize WorkforceOptimizer’s product suite to align with our clients' business requirements
  • Education & Training - Educate end-users on best practices for time and labour management by conducting customer training workshops
  • Testing & Review - Manage testing and deployment activities to obtain clients' feedback (e.g. user-acceptance testing)
