  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Information System Engineering or Business
  • 0-3 years of experience as a business analyst or functional/ implementation consultant
  • Background in HR Payroll or Time & Attendance functional areas is an advantage
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to apply strong analytical abilities or instincts at the right times to make the right judgment call
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills an astute listener who can pick up subtle cues that others may fail to notice
  • Able to work independently and as a team able to support multiple clients concurrently able to multi-task and stay organized in a fast-paced environment


Benefits
  • Direct exposure to leadership opportunities and project management
  • Hands-on exposure in driving solution design and consulting
  • Mentorship in managing senior stakeholders
  • Competitive salary package

Job Responsibilities
  • Facilitate and conduct classroom small group and on-the-job training for new hires and existing staff at our stores and Head Office
  • Provide assessment performance feedback and conduct training follow-ups with new and existing staff; retrain as needed.
  • Research identify and incorporate performance building activities and programs to enhance team and organisational effectiveness
  • Develop and manage the training records system and training calendar; track and communicate training attendance as required.
  • Conduct Training Needs Analysis (TNA) and develop a Total Company Training Plan (TCTP) in line with the goals of the company and conduct training in areas ranging from supervisory/management skills to selling and service as required to fill identified needs.
  • Research design and develop materials for classroom on-the-job training and online training (course outlines participant handbook guides and training resources) in line with company training needs.
  • Undertake research and implement initiatives/programs to drive technology-enabled learning.
  • Monitor training budget and expenditure including SDF SRP processing government grants claim; liaise with government on training initiatives.
  • Source and identify good external training vendors and institutions to support the implementation of company training.
  • Ensure delivery of an effective induction on-boarding program to support retention of new talent and encourage a smooth transition into the business.
  • Evaluate learning effectiveness - Analyse data to review content and trainer effectiveness and implement processes to strive for continuous improvement


Job Requirements
  • Degree in Human Resource Development or other related disciplines
  • ACTA certified with at least 3 years of relevant experience in an Approved Training Organisation(ATO) / OJT Centre (OJTC) environment in the F&B industry
  • Experience in developing and administering OJT training programmes
  • Familiar with Skills Frameworks from various funding agencies
  • Strong communication good interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Excellent planning organizing and follow-through skills
  • Ability to work independently or in teams within a fast-paced environment
  • Proficient in MS Office applications especially in Words and PowerPoint

How do you build a better tomorrow? A spirit of constant improvement has made Maxeon Solar Technologies the world-renowned leader in solar innovation and we thrive together to lead the fight against climate change.

The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight if harnessed could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced distributed and consumed on a global scale and we’re looking for talented committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals.

Maxeon Solar Technologies is a global leader in solar innovation. Built from 35 years of boundary-pushing solar DNA the company launched as an independent entity following its spin-off from US-based SunPower Corporation in August 2020.

Maxeon designs manufactures and sells industry-leading SunPower branded solar products in more than 100 countries through a global network spanning more than 1100 sales and installation partners. And Maxeon is powering positive change every day with a brilliant passionate and driven team of more than 5000 in Latin America Europe Asia and Australia.

We push the boundaries taking solar technology higher faster and farther than before. We hold ourselves to a higher standard striving for the highest integrity safety and quality. And we thrive together as a global team embracing our diverse backgrounds to make a positive impact on the world. Are you ready to power positive change?

Summary Of Role

As the Internal Communication Manager you will work to make sure employees are kept informed and motivated by developing a comprehensive internal communication strategy to deliver Maxeon's core messages. You will provide all staff with regular meaningful and consistent information about developments and activities across the organization. This is a key role working in close coordination with Human Resources Marketing Communications and the senior leadership team in communicating a sense of purpose and belonging across our global teams as well as managing change effectively.

You will report to the Global Sr. Manager of Public Relations.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Develop and execute a strategic internal communications plan: you will align internal and executive messaging with the company’s values purpose brand and product positioning.

Strategic programs and initiatives: you will develop communicate and measure strategic communication programs and initiatives with the goal to increase employee engagement across the organization ensure our values are well understood and adopted across the organization.

Produce employee communications: you will develop and author a variety of internal and executive communications including presentations announcements blogs to be delivered across a variety of internal communications channels. Draft messages or scripts from senior executives for presentation to employees in written or spoken form.

Manage the company’s internal communication channels: you will plan and maintain the editorial calendar (blogs newsletters etc) research and develop quotes from people write content and stories shoot videos and contribute to the company intranet in alignment with external communication milestones and announcements.

You will ensure internal communications messages are consistent across all mediums and for different departments geographies and roles in the organization.

Organize and lead leadership and company meetings: you will help craft the messaging and program through agenda speaker selection and logistics for Global and Regional All Hands Meetings.

Work cross-functionally across teams and regions: you will work in close partnership with Human Resources Marketing Communications Product Marketing and Leadership Team to execute communication initiatives from concept to delivery to reach direct labor and indirect labor employees. You will ensure that Internal Communication programs are rolled out across the organization and different departments effectively. You will partner with the local HR leaders for the roll-out of the communication initiatives for direct labor employees.

Manage crisis: you will formulate Maxeon’s internal response to crisis situations which can affect organizational perception and reputation.

Qualifications

Experience: 8-10 years of experience in an Internal Communication role working in a global corporate environment preferably for a manufacturing company. You’ve managed a variety of corporate communications channels including corporate intranets mobile and internal social media channels.

Strong executive communications experience: you can write and tailor content for specific audiences that demonstrates a deep understanding of messaging positioning and stakeholder needs.

Organized: with news constantly changing you’re able to adapt and change directions in an instant. You’re comfortable working at a fast pace and are able to meet deadlines.

Writing skills: you need excellent writing editing and proofreading skills as well as the journalistic ability to source stories from employees

Speaking skills: you also need strong speaking skills as you are likely to be called on to give presentations to staff.

Interpersonal skills: you need good interpersonal and relationship-building skills in order to work with different departments cultures and teams. You also need to possess the confidence to deal with senior executives and explain communication techniques to them.

Creative skills: you need the creative ability to devise communication strategies.

Digital skills: familiarity with information technology especially digital and video means of communication is essential.

Fearless when embracing technology: you’re comfortable learning new programs easily to enhance company-wide communication.

Languages: English-native preferable. Any other language is a plus.

Education: bachelor’s degree in public relations communication journalism or equivalent. MBA or Master in Communication is a plus

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
The Singapore International Foundation is a non-profit organisation founded in 1991. We aim to build a better world through shared ideas skills and experiences so as to uplift lives and create greater understanding between Singaporeans and world communities.


The Communications & Corporate Development Division provides specialist support and services to divisions including corporate communications stakeholder relations human resource development IT services and office management.


The Corporate Communications team comprises strategic communications specialists who effectively promote the work of SIF in bringing people together to share ideas skills and resources to uplift lives and effect positive change. The Citizen Ambassador Relations team comprises alumni management and marketing communications specialists who effectively build and steward our community of volunteers who enable the work of SIF.


Our people are our key to success. As a lean organisation we seek to optimise each employee’s potential and to build a high-performance culture. We will provide opportunities for you to work in different functional areas. If you are flexible responsive to change and willing to work on projects across business units to challenge yourself join us. 


We invite candidates who share our vision to make friends for a better world to apply.


Responsibilities:

  • Manage the outreach recruitment stewardship and training of volunteers
  • Manage the administrative and logistical needs of volunteers and their assignments both e-volunteering and physical (when travel permits)
  • Build capacity and synergies along the SIF volunteer growth pipeline
  • Manage and maintain the alumni database
  • Assist in organising planning and executing networking events and roadshows 


Requirements:

  • Degree holder with minimum 3 years of relevant experience in customer relationship marketing or volunteer/alumni management
  • Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
  • Good knowledge of best practices in volunteer management and stewardship
  • Good project management and database management skills
  • Proficiency in other Asian languages would be an added advantage
  • Open and willing to work in matrix team structure
  • Able to travel overseas when possible
  • Singaporean


Interested candidates are invited to send in your applications online with your resume stating your current and expected salary.


We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

We are an independent leading global provider of trust fiduciary corporate and fund services to mostly corporate but also high-net-worth clients (www.amicorp.com). We are a Hong Kong based Group with an international network of 40+ offices in over 30 countries. We aim to provide a safe and stable working environment for our employees we promote environmental consciousness and contribute positively to the communities in which we are active; we are also soundly profitable. We are proud to have our global team of 700+ specialists who contribute their individual talents to Amicorp’s broad range of expertise and experience. They implement creative innovative strategic and compliant corporate solutions to meet the challenges of today’s complex international business environment. We are international independent entrepreneurial and growing fast. We offer a fast paced dynamic international work environment we value people with initiative creativity and drive and we offer market competitive compensation.

The role requires proven sales experience and is responsible for achieving sales results by demonstrating commercial leadership and management responsibility in increasing overall sales in financial and accounting services trust and fiduciary services and tax structuring. The role is primarily accountable for increasing overall sales of Amicorp products and services with specific focus on tax compliance and solutions; undertaking sales activities to generate business and retain both clients and intermediaries; developing and executing an individual sales strategy for growing the Corporate Clients and Private Clients business from existing intermediaries as well identifying and developing new clients and intermediaries as well as drawing up and executing the sales strategy for the market.

Primary Duties And Responsibilities
  • Develop sales strategy and execute ambitious plans which identify sales opportunities as well as new products and services for identified markets/ clients;
  • - Develop expand and maintain multiple solid relationships with clients and intermediaries (e.g. Law Firms CPAs Bankers Family Offices etc.);
  • - Leverage and build relationships thus developing new opportunities and leads with existing and/or new clients through the network;
  • - Seek and recognize sales opportunities and position compliant products and services in alignment with tax advisors’ solutions and client needs;
  • - Prepare client proposals and close sales in accordance with policies and guidelines to assure business growth.
  • - Organize & represent the company at seminars and other industry-related networking events;
  • - Lead coordinate & conduct marketing activities and maintain an active and current pipeline of the prospects at all times.
  • - Adhere to the Amicorp sales discipline with respect to identifying opportunities recording contacts maintaining the required number of prospects and closing PLEs on a regular consistent basis.
  • - Collaborate with local and international colleagues with respect to all sales activities in order to achieve the Sales targets;
  • - Ensure clients/ entities are compliant with the local regulations and laws as per specific jurisdiction and services adhere to global statutory/ regulatory guidelines.
  • - Ensure that individual targets are exceeded/ achieved as well as collaborate and drive the achievement of team targets.
  • PERSONAL AND TEAM TARGETS
  • - Drive team sales by providing commercial leadership with respect to all sales activities in order to achieve revenue targets for the office by developing new business opportunities and proactively ensuring closure of prospects.
  • - Lead by example in achieving/exceeding individual sales targets consistently and increasing the Sales in identified markets.
  • - Assist colleagues in ensuring productivity and chargeability targets are met effective monitoring of transactions is done and help with pricing invoicing and collection of outstanding fees.
  • OFFICE PROFITABILITY PERFORMANCE AND GROWTH
  • - Ensure office profitability and performance aligned with the approved business plan for the office.

  • OTHER DUTIES
  • - Undertake the role of director trustee nominee manager partner secretary authorized signatory or any related position in internal entities or client entities of Amicorp Group where necessary and required by the Management.
  • - Undertake such other duties related to the position as may from time to time be agreed with Management.
CANDIDATE PROFILE
  • - Relevant Bachelor’s Degree with solid exposure to International Tax; over 15 years proven Sales experience within the financial/ legal services fiduciary/ trust industry covering intermediaries clients with proven sales success.
  • - Excellent Corporate and International Tax experience in organizations with international presence with solid understanding of BEPS CRS FATCA GAAR ESR.
  • - Fluency in a European language in order to communicate with a European client base would be highly beneficial for the role holder.
  • - Knowledge and exposure to clients in the CIS region alongside experience of clients based in Asia would be highly advantageous for the role holder.
  • - Well-informed about current legal issues regulations tax and legal developments. Demonstrate subject matter expertise credibility and effective partnering with intermediaries clients and colleagues to identify and evaluate opportunities and arrive at solutions.
  • - Commercial drive and a proven ability to penetrate the required market and ensure closure of sales. Takes initiative positive and proactive dedicated focused and revenue and target driven.
  • - Exhibits strong leadership social & interpersonal skills; a positive can-do attitude and creativity.
  • - Excellent client facing skills. Well-developed spoken and written communication skills and the ability to tailor style to relevant audiences and successfully liaise with people at different levels.
  • - Strong analytical and problem solving skills solution driven highly organized and detail-orientated with good decision making and time management skills. Independent hands-on and takes accountability to deliver solutions and results.
  • - Ability to adapt and work under pressure in a smaller dynamic local team environment; along with being part of a bigger matrix organization. Proven leadership and team player skills with ambition to excel in the role.
  • - Willing to travel within the country and outside the country when required.

The Senior Executive/Executive plays an instrumental role in VITAL’s shared services team delivering a suite of corporate services in Human Resource and Payroll & Claims to our service partners. You may be assigned to undertake a role that aligns to your work experience skills set career aspiration as well as the organisational need. There will be career opportunities to develop your skills set across the various shared service functions within VITAL.

As the Senior Executive/Executive in VITAL your role will encompass the following:

  • Provide prompt and follow-through customer service to our service partners.
  • Streamline and re-engineer business processes to enhance efficiency and heighten closer partnership with our service partners.
  • Use technology or data analysis to improve process productivity.

    • Excellent interpersonal written and oral communication skills

    • Able to work well under pressure and tight deadlines.

Opensoft Pte Ltd is a leading Payroll Software and Human Resource Management System solutions provider based in Singapore. Opensoft Payroll and HRMS has been rated among the best in Singapore being shortlisted as finalists in the HR Vendors of the Year Awards for four years running now.

With our strong range of HR applications we are expanding our operations and are currently looking for passionate and awesome Product Support Executives to join our team and educate customers on the use of OpensoftHR applications in Singapore.

As a Product Support Executive you will work with your team to ensure customers are satisfied with their experience with us during the before and after sales process. Our Product Support Team is collaborative and operationally productive with the mission of providing the best outcomes for our customers. Together with the sales team you will spearhead our efforts to position OpensoftHR as a leading provider of Payroll and HRMS applications to all businesses in Singapore.

If you are keen to be part of an innovative and forward looking tech company and are also willing to step up and contribute your ideas to improve existing customer service strategies then Opensoft may just be the place for you!

Job Description
  • Respond to incoming customer inquiries regarding the use of OpensoftHR applications via phone email chat and actively contribute to the OpensoftHR online Knowledge Base Center;
  • Multiple opportunities to forge lasting relationships with local (and eventually regional) businesses making this an excellent opportunity for a talented executive seeking to take their career to the next level;
  • Conduct User Trainings to new and existing customers ensuring to clearly communicate the use of OpensoftHR applications and clear any doubts;
  • Work closely with the Sales Team in coordinating activities such as scheduling of user trainings technical/software installations or other activities that will aid in developing opportunities and sales;
  • Participate in trade fairs exhibition or conferences on behalf of the Company to promote OpensoftHR solutions as well as extend our corporate network.


Key Requirements
  • Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in any field;
  • Highly-motivated and result-driven individual with excellent interpersonal skills;
  • Sensitive to customers' needs and try to match the company's best interest and theirs to achieve the best outcome;
  • Required language(s): English;
  • No work experience required.
  • Required Skill(s): Microsoft Office
  • Preferably Entry Level specialized in Technical & Helpdesk Support or equivalent.

Position – General Analyst Operations


Overview

We are Koru Partners a thematically driven alternative investment firm identifying attractive investment opportunities that are backed by macro-holistic themes encompassing forward-looking social economic demographic and technological changes. As a multi-asset investment manager we manage funds ranging from real asset funds in shipping to venture capital. In addition we also provide investment advice to established companies on their strategic opportunities.

We are looking for an Operations Analyst who is looking to grow with us. If you are a recent Singaporean graduate you will be enrolled into the Finance Associate Management Scheme. In this two-year structured programme you will rotate across the operational functions of a fund management firm including Accounts Human Resources Administration and Compliance.


Responsibilities

  • Accounts Management: Ensure that the accounting data accurately reflects the financial position and the performance of the firm in a timely manner.
  • Cash Flow Management: Maintain cash inflows and outflows to mitigate financial and operational risks.
  • Financial Modelling: Assist in forecasting the company financials and operational needs.
  • Effective Administrative Support: Liaise between internal and external parties in a professional manner while learning the context and building knowledge around the firm’s core activities.
  • Human Resource Management: Assist in managing the entire employee lifecycle from recruitment to retention.
  • Compliance Management: Assist in structuring and implementing frameworks that will ensure adherence to applicable laws and regulations in the relevant jurisdictions.
  • Continuous Improvement: Actively participate in the ongoing updates and enhancements of existing processes and internal controls.


Ideal Requirements

  • Less than 12 months graduate with a university degree or equivalent.
  • Basic knowledge in accounting is advantageous but not a prerequisite.
  • Independent learner requiring minimal supervision.
  • Intensely detail oriented.
  • Logical problem solver.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Xero (or any other accounting software) and quick to pick up new technologies and SaaS.
  • Singapore Citizen.


About You

We are a firm expecting collaborators to be highly aligned with our core values. Therefore you should be:

  • A Visionary: You are someone who dreams big and unconventionally possessing strong mental maps of how things should be done in order to realize audacious goals.
  • A Practical Thinker: You have a wide range of vision able to see and synergise from the macro-to-micro perspective. You are open-minded and able to hold conflicting thoughts simultaneously and look at them from different angles in order to achieve the best results.
  • Dedicated and Driven: You are passionate about what you are doing and is willing to push through any and every obstacle to go from visualization to actualization. You are undaunted by failure.
  • Ethical and Principled: You have a strong ingrained sense of professional integrity and ethics.


What You Can Expect

  • Competitive salary package
  • Health insurance and medical benefits
  • Clear career growth opportunities
  • Results not face time driven work environment
  • Dynamic fun and supportive team


Koru Partners is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that a team which is representative and inclusive of the talent clients and communities empowers and gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace. We support employee wellbeing and a balanced life providing avenues for employees to voice their concerns alongside inclusive employment policies.

IECL’s vision is for every leader to be able to access world-class coaching. We are the industry leader in applied organisational coaching with unrivalled quality scale and reach across the region.


We increase performance AND wellbeing in organisations for immediate and sustainable growth.

 

This role sits within IECL’s Operation Team who are primarily based in Sydney Australia. The purpose of the role is to provide exceptional project management and administrative support for programs across Asia.

 

You will work closely with our sales team facilitators clients and suppliers to ensure the smooth running of projects from start to finish. You are a doer who loves detail and in-depth organisation.

 

This is a busy role which requires serious planning and juggling skills to manage multiple projects of varying complexity. This role is not just about organising and delegating you will be responsible for doing much of the doing too! As IECL evolves your experience and expertise will be drawn on to help improve processes internally and for our clients.

 

 

Primary Responsibilities

  • Provide end-to-end management of 1:1 coaching engagements and other leadership programs.
  • Enter project details and financials into the project management system and ensure they are accurate and up-to-date.
  • Ensure ongoing changes to projects are reflected accurately in a timely manner.
  • Establish timelines and responsibilities for self and others.
  • Be a key point of contact for clients.
  • Coordinate program design and production of materials.
  • Develop participant communications: email communications prework feedback.
  • Oversee project logistics: travel requirements venue logistics post and couriers liaising with client on-site contacts.
  • Liaise with facilitators on project contracts briefings program design and feedback.
  • Accurate tracking of project income and expenses.
  • Client invoicing.
  • Create client reports including feedback and evaluation reports.
  • Create ad hoc reports from various data sources.
  • Assist with pulling together information for tenders RFQs and RFIs.
  • Create and maintain strong relationships with SMEs and IECL Associates.
  • Keep abreast of industry news and utilise this to educate yourself and build relationships with clients.


Secondary responsibilities

  • Participate in ad hoc internal projects as required.
  • Ongoing review of processes and process improvement.


Knowledge Skills & Competencies

Essential

  • Ability to effectively operate with a high workload with tight deadlines time-pressures and changing priorities.
  • Strong professional verbal and written communication skills in English.
  • Capability to work unsupervised and remotely.
  • Exceptional attention to detail.
  • Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Excel PowerPoint Word).
  • Intermediate to advanced Google G Suite skills.
  • Outstanding organisational skills.
  • Well-developed financial acumen skills.

 

Desirable

  • Ability to speak and write in other languages e.g. Mandarin Cantonese Bahasa Hindi
  • An appreciation of multiple cultures.


Qualifications & Experience

Essential

  • Completion of relevant qualification/degree e.g. Business Human Resource Management Project Management.
  • Up to 3 years’ experience undertaking similar tasks and responsibilities.

 

Desirable

  • Experience with Salesforce CRM.
  • Experience in the coaching industry or learning and development.

Its experienced accountants and legal HR and payroll professionals are located around the world helping clients to operate their corporate structures finance vehicles and investments in different location.

Waters Corporation (NYSE: WAT) the world's leading specialty measurement company has pioneered chromatography mass spectrometry and thermal analysis innovations serving the life materials and food sciences for 60 years. With approximately 7000 employees worldwide Waters operates directly in 31 countries including 15 manufacturing facilities and with products available in more than 100 countries.

Waters Corporation's businesses include Waters TA Instruments VICAM ERA and Nonlinear Dynamics.

Waters creates business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations by delivering ultra performance liquid chromatography (UPLC) high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) chromatography columns and chemistry products mass spectrometry systems laboratory informatics solutions and comprehensive service programs to enable significant advancement in healthcare delivery environmental management food safety and water quality.

Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. Celebrating diversity is important to us. We thrive on it for the benefit of our employees our products our customers and our community. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Job Title: Talent Management and Learning| Senior Advisor
Job Description:
At Zebra we’re reinventing how businesses operate at the enterprise edge - helping them run faster smarter and more connected than ever before.

A dynamic community of builders doers and problem solvers we each play a unique role - shaping new technologies bringing solutions to market and partnering with companies on the front line of business.

Being a part of Zebra means making your mark as we make digital transformation a reality.

It means growing into a leader at a leading company that makes a distinct difference - because together we’ve only just begun.

Build Today. Create Tomorrow.

Join a team of builders doers and problem solvers.

Join Zebra.

Overview

The Talent & Learning Senior Advisor leads and co-develops APAC organizational development strategies and activities including culture transformation leadership development talent management processes engagement talent retention succession pipeline and data analytics. This role is a thought partner to the Global Talent team establish successful HRBP relationships within the region and collaborate with the business to lead change and execute against People Strategy.
  • This role has dotted line to Regional HR Senior Director and Senior Director Global Learning.

The Role
  • Co-create and drive the overall organizational development and talent management Global strategy in alignment with overall business strategy and translate it into APAC specific tactics to execute on.
  • Drive corporate engagement surveys across the region including sustainability and integration tactics.
  • Partner with APAC HR and other business leaders to facilitate regional Talent Reviews including organizational education on definitions purpose and output facilitation of conversations and monitoring the organizational progress and growth of Talent.
  • Drive I&D strategies within the talent management process.
  • Integrate Training Learning & Development with Performance Management processes/tools so that development/career planning is tied to the goal setting and annual review process.
  • Lead organizational education and maturity on Performance Management execute against global timelines and qualitative expectations; drive the effort of building a “coaching rich culture”.
  • Leverage Leadership Assessment tools to coach and develop leaders
  • Work with Talent dashboards and metrics and influence regional decisions with data and story.
  • Identify facilitate and support Global learning programs culture workshops and processes that facilitate professional and leadership development.
  • Identify and advise team effectiveness initiatives such as team building workshops and takeaways. Support Promote and educate on Employee learning initiatives through platforms and programs while advocating 70/20/10 learning model.
  • Support the Organizational Development needs of all of the Business Units and corporate functional groups while remaining strategically aligned with the corporate objectives.
About Yourself
You should be a Talent Development expert who is Thought Influencer grounded individual and is comfortable in a matrix environment with high workplace agility and flexibility.

eer/personal growth and work/life programs to ensure that you are empowered to succeed as a member of the Zebra family!

Job Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree with at least 12 years of experience in talent management and/or Strategic HR Business Partnering
  • Able to contribute to and translate Global Talent Strategy to APAC strategy and tactics; drive execution and implementation of these actions
  • Strong business acumen understanding strategy organizational direction and how they impact tactical execution.
  • Vision and creativity in driving engagement talent development and acquisition initiatives
  • Proven interpersonal skills; ability to work with any level of business resources.
  • Excellent facilitation consulting communication coaching and influencing skills with high organization savviness.
  • Strong Project Management and tight-knit collaboration skills
  • Comfortable to travel and work flexibly to meet deadlines and respond to emergency demands.
Equal Opportunities:
Zebra is committed to offering equal opportunities and an inclusive & diverse working environment. Therefore we encourage applicants from all sections of the community!

Zebra’s culture is encouraging and collaborative where employees are encouraged to learn and grow together.
Zebra Benefit Package
We offer competitive pay bonuses benefits career/personal growth and work/life programs to ensure that you are empowered to succeed as a member of the Zebra family!

LOCATION

Singapore China or other APAC countries


ROLE PURPOSE

Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN) is seeking to hire a CXM Line of Business Chief Operating Officer to drive and support the delivery of profitable growth in APAC while overseeing all activities relating to business transformation and operational excellence working across the Sales Solutions & Account Management Brand and Business Function teams.


The business transformation includes the design and implementation of a new business model as well as the underlying operating model that clarifies the accountability and responsibility of each part of the organization as well as the primary metrics that define performance and will service as the basis of performance assessment as defined in the new business model. As the overall business strategy and brand strategy are refined evolving this model will require on-going evolutions in the day-to-day operations of the business. Additionally the brand strategy will result in significant brand consolidation and simplification of the corporate legal entity structure in each market. 


Another major accountability of the role is supporting the LoB CEO in the annual planning and day-to-day management of the business lifecycle activity across the full business lifecycle – strategy & planning marketing sales account management service delivery and the integrated support of the lifecycle activities by Finance HR Technology and Legal. Additionally the LoB COO will participate in the monthly business review of the market performance against budget and quarterly forecasts determining root cause tracking actions items and following up between reporting periods ensuring that root causes are being mitigated and recovery plans are in place.


Another major accountability of the role is ensuring that the Brands are achieving Gross Margin % by effectively managing cost-to-serve in alignment with revenue forecast when increasing or decreasing. To do this requires facilitating the annual planning process with each Market Brand lead in accordance with the Global COO and the annual plan for cost-to-serve and then delivering on the cost-to-serve budget. The cost-to-serve is the planned average hourly resource costs in accordance with every planned hour of revenue per resource which will be different by Brand Service and Sub-Service for that market. The cost-to-serve will be planned to improve quarter-over-quarter and year-over-year and the primary drives are client utilization pyramid (span-of-control) compensation management and the placement of work in cost-effective location based on the overall Line of Business delivery strategy.


As a member of the DAN CXM LoB Executive Leadership Team this position will report directly to the LoB CEO and have a dual reporting line to the Global Chief Operating Officer. This role will collaborate and proactively work with the CXM LoB Leadership team and their direct reports to implement and drive excellence in every area of business operation. This role will support the Global Chief Operating Officer in ensuring the effective execution of our business strategy and that we have the required plans metrics and targets in place to achieve our expected results.



KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Critical Role Priorities:

  • Lead in deploying the new business model operating model and organisation blueprint
  • Manage the delivery of annual budget ensuring that gross margin and operating profit % are achieved with a heavy focus on achieving cost-to-serve by achieving planned client utilization pyramid improvements effectively managing compensation and achieving planned mix of cost-effective work locations
  • Accountable for realisation of all tactical and strategic gross margin related initiatives at a LoB level as defined within the market or globally working closely with stakeholders across Operations Finance HR as well as the local executive leadership
  • Ensure all investments into Product are channelled for approval according to policy through the Global Product Investment Council
  • Implement the new business framework including the use of Salesforce for both new logo and existing client opportunities and govern the new business process in the market
  • Implement the corporate time reporting process and enforce time reporting compliance by all employees starting with client service delivery resources
  • Establish consistent repeatable and world-class services and integrated solutions that are data-driven tech-enabled and ideas-led
  • Define and rollout standard methods and estimating tools to speed time to delivery and enable dramatic productivity and quality improvement of services and integrated solutions
  • Establish world-class delivery capabilities in cost-effective “centres of excellence” strategically located ensuring consistent high quality services and integrated solutions
  • Enabling resourcing utilization management and increasing client utilization as well as implementing initial release of client profitability reporting and management to drive profit improvement on clients underperforming expectations
  • Ensure resources are mapped to the common career framework and enable basic compensation management leveraging the newly defined merit management process and guidelines
  • Improving financial forecasting using existing processes and tools as well as enabling an automated algorithm-based process as the opportunities are fully loaded and managed in Salesforce
  • Enabling resource demand and supply management and resource balance based on forecast variance to achieve gross margin %.
  • Managing line of business cost-to-serve to increasing client utilization pyramid compensation management and use of cost-effective delivery locations
  • Improving client satisfaction and retention
  • Reducing unmanaged attrition
  • Drive operational efficiencies in collaboration with the G&A function leads with a focus on identifying opportunities to improve processes eliminate redundant across the business functions imbedded in brands
  • Drive awareness and transformation change programmes using proactive communications engagement education and enablement of our people
  • Implementation of Global Contract Compliance program delivering strong governance compliance resourcing processes and tools. Harmonising and integrating all process and systems across market; this will ensure both Market Executive leadership and the Operations community is held accountable in delivering the necessary change initiatives.
  • Define and run regular governance forum for New Business Model Transformation representing all operating companies and report progress issues and risks to the CXM LoB CEO
  • Lead the definition and implementation of stronger policies for operational excellence in the market reflecting external and industry best practice and accommodating special circumstances in each market
  • Define standards for and provide input to due diligence activities during M&A transactions within the market



PERSON SPECIFICATION

Preferred Leadership Characteristics:

  • High Learning Agility - unbridled curiosity and the ability to discover trends ahead of time (“look around corners”) and glean valuable insights; not merely an effective executor of initiatives anticipatory in her / his approach and provokes senior level conversation
  • Making Complex Decisions - can solve even the toughest and most complex of problems; great at gleaning meaning from whatever data is available; is a quick study of the new and different; adds personal wisdom and experience to come to the best conclusion and solution given the situation; uses multiple problem-solving tools and techniques
  • Getting Organized - is well organized and resourceful; effective and efficient at marshalling multiple resources to get things done; lays out tasks in sufficient detail to mark the trail; is able to get things done with less and in less time; can work on multiple tasks at once without losing track; foresees and plans around obstacles
  • Dealing with Trouble - fearlessly takes on all issues challenges and people; comfortably confronts and works through conflict; delivers negative feedback and messages without hesitation; deals promptly and fairly with problem performers; lets everyone know where they stand; thrives in crises and is energized by tough challenges; not afraid to make negative decisions and take tough action; challenges the status quo
  • Focusing on Action and Outcomes - attacks everything with drive and energy with an eye on the bottom line; not afraid to initiate action before all the facts are known; drives to finish everything he/she starts
  • Inspiring Others - skilled at getting individuals teams and an entire organization to perform at a higher level and to embrace change; negotiates with skill to achieve a fair outcome or promote a common cause; communicates in a compelling vision and is committed to what needs to be done; inspires others; builds motivated high-performing teams; understands what motivates different people
  • Acting with Ethics Honour and Character - Is a person of high character; is consistent and acts in line with a clear and visible set of values and beliefs; deals and talks straight; walks his/her talk; is direct and truthful but at the same time can keep confidences
  • Being Open and Receptive - at ease and relaxed; easy to talk to and get to know; listens attentively; is an open book; has a positive sense of humour; deals calmly with stress and gives people a chance to catch up


The Person:

  • Practical pragmatic driven and resilient with high emotional intelligence
  • Confident ambitious highly professional and visible able to interact easily at all levels
  • Positive dynamic enthusiastic; capable of maintaining a high level of energy and team spirit high learning agility
  • Will live the DAN values at all times: Collaborative Responsible Agile Ambitious Pioneering

Traineeship Description: This position will allow the trainee to learn from various departments (such as HR Business Development Engineering Finance etc) and gain useful workforce skills. They will also gain awareness on which area they are keen to venture into. This position will allow the trainee to interface with various department heads and HR staff. M-DAQ is a dynamic start-up company which builds over-the-top (OTT) applications to facilitate cross-border business. It thrives on diversity and the motto of "work hard and enjoy the success"

  • Assist in conducting market research and review and document existing and upcoming product features
  • Assist in the design development and maintenance of software that powers M-DAQ systems.

  • Assist in finance and admin related matters

Job Title: Assistant VP/VP| Learning & Development| Group Human Resources
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Human Resources function balances organisational aspirations and employee needs as we accelerate and strengthen people capabilities to enable sustainable business growth at UOB. Our team of Human Resources specialists are guided by four employee commitments: do what is right build meaningful careers make a real difference and lead by positive example.

Job Responsibilities

You will be part of the Reskilling and Capabilities Development team with objective to develop and implement organization-wide initiatives in Singapore and the region. These include diagnosis developing and executing interventions. You will partner with business stakeholders as well as HR team to diagnose business performance issues and learning needs identify appropriate learning solutions to facilitate achievement of the business unit’s goals.

Specifically You Will
  • Develop group Reskilling and Core Curriculum programs.
  • Program manage Reskilling initiative
  • Drive learning culture in the organization specifically on the adoption of digital learning
  • Design develop and implement learning interventions to address the group’s development needs
  • Partner with relevant stakeholders to identify learning and development needs and develop solutions to bridge the business units’ gaps
  • Partner with regional counterparts to implement group solutions in the region


Job Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree in instructional design/technology organizational development educational psychology or a closely related field is preferred
  • Ability to develop a holistic view of performance problems identify root causes and suggest appropriate solutions
  • Deep knowledge of instructional design and content development
  • Knowledge of training and organizational development theories
  • Knowledge and experience in implementing technology-facilitated and e-learning standards (e.g. SCORM mobile OS etc.)
  • Project and Program Management skills and ability to facilitate and manage multiple priorities and/or projects including risk mitigation skills to help eliminate potential roadblocks in the design and delivery of training programs
  • Ability to integrate and act upon the diverse perspectives of business unit managers instructional designers corporate HR and external vendors
  • Communication interpersonal influencing skills and collaboration skills

  • Participate into business improvement projects support pre- engagement meeting with client and prospect client.

  • Organize and lead meetings with key stakeholders as needed to review project status and able discuss issues risk resolutions possible mitigation plan and workaround as needed.

  • Lead cross functional project teams which include implementation team members technical resources and partners.
  • To survey each country after the "go live" payroll for feedback evaluate the status of the payroll check Client satisfaction and develop an action plan to resolve any residual issues.
  • To act from time to time as a sales support agent to advise on the fit of ADP Celergo solution to client needs at the selling process stage
  • Clearly explain country specific payroll issues to clients.

III. Qualifications: 

1. Experience/Skills:

  • Five to 10 years’ experience in implementing in global payroll or HR project.
  • Proven experience in Project management project coordination
  • Perfect communications skills in Client facing context
  • Ability and enthusiasm in animating virtual meetings involving international parties
  • International culture and ability to work in a multinational environment
  • Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses


2. Education:

  • University degree or comparable education
  • Payroll (and HR) related training are an advantage
  • Project management certifications are an advantage 

IV. Key Interfaces: 

  • Manager Global implementations
  • Operations Director
  • Account Managers (client handover)
  • Partner Managers (partner issues)
  • Global Program Director. 

V. Key Performance Indicators:

  • Ability to work under tight deadlines

Job Title: Data Analyst - Organisational Effectiveness (NTUC First Campus)
Job Description:
NTUC First Campus mission is to be the thought and practice leader in the care of children in all of Singapore’s neighbourhoods. We partner with families to fulfil the promise of each child by enabling every child to have a good start in life. We give working families peace of mind by making quality child development and care services accessible. We currently have more than 20000 children across 160 preschool centres in Singapore. In the next 3-5 years we will continue to grow to be able to serve more families.


As a social enterprise we believe in fulfilling the promise of each child with special attention to families with additional needs. Driven by our Happy Yay! Organizational philosophy we believe our people are our greatest asset where we continue to invest in their personal growth while attaining high levels of well-being.


Responsibilities

You are a thought leader and evangelist to drive data adoption at all levels of our organization. You engage with the business and functional leaders across the NFC Group as the trusted partner to deliver the data analytics solutions that impact our mission. Your emphasis is on organisational effectiveness and you draw on principles from Management HR and Finance to achieve your mission. Your three areas of focus are:


Drive Data Use Cases and Impact

You engage with fellow data analysts data scientists business stakeholders and end-users to sharpen our Data use cases and deliver them successfully. This includes identifying promising data use cases proving their business value defining success criteria implementing validating and driving its organisational acceptance. Besides specific Data projects you support the organisation on its journey to becoming more data-driven through raising awareness showcasing success stories as well as executing equipping and change initiatives.


Conduct Organisational Effectiveness Analytics

Your hands-on work supports our organisational decision-making and contributes to making us more effective overall. Beyond tracking key performance indicators as part of a corporate scorecard dashboard you will look at areas of how to leverage data and models to improve talent acquisition identify talents amongst our 5000 workforce for development  lower staff attrition uplift staff engagement across all levels of staff and improve productivity.


Increase our Data Analytics Productivity

In order to serve our educational mission better we constantly seek to improve our use of data. You do not only help analysing more but analysing more autonomously. Examples are automating the assessments of observational records and of educational outcomes and automating reports and anomalie alerts. You also improve the effectiveness of our Data initiatives by contributing to a central data catalog that allows discovering all our data assets. With your intimate knowledge of organizational and business users’ needs you will work alongside the Data Scientists to develop analytics self-help tools that users can easily tap on their own for common use cases.


Qualifications & Skills

  • Minimum 3-5 years experience deriving insights from data in a business or academic environment (data manipulation statistical analytics visualisation and presentation) and applying insights into business decision-making or flows to deliver business outcomes.
  • Strong SQL or Python skills experience building data marts
  • Experience implementing clustering classification and regression models; designing and analysing experiments including hypothesis testing
  • Experience planning conducting and analysing survey-based research including sampling methods
  • Experience with cloud technologies e.g. Google Cloud Platform using CloudComposer GCE/GKE Google Data Studio and BigQuery
  • Knowledge of organisational design process optimization and measures of organisational effectiveness 
  • Previous exposure to analytics in the context of a corporate function e.g. Planning HR Finance
  • Ability to engage Director-level leaders in shaping the Data transformation journey for their department.
  • University degree (B.Sc. or M.Sc.) Business Computer Science or related discipline
  • 3-5 years work experience in a data analytics role in industry
  • Strong affinity to the education (children and/or adults)

Job Title: Change Consultants

Level: Senior Consultant

Location: Singapore


Purpose of the Role:


We are:

Talent and Organization which is a newly formed practice and one of the most exciting areas to work at Infosys Consulting because we help our clients navigate towards their workforce of the future. We co-design client digital change journey’s that create experiences employees love. As we become a Live Enterprise we teach organisations how to continuously evolve learn and innovate. We help clients navigate the future of their work new skilling talent strategy leadership employee experience and organisational change and beyond.


You are:

An experienced for a change. You know that organisations must change or be left behind and your passion is wanting to help organisations navigate the change journey. You have the right skills toolbox and experience to move organisations forward enabling them to become more agile and responsive as they transform. You are somewhat of an influencer because you’ve done this sort of work before you think a little differently and people come to you for the best change advice and guidance.

 

The work:

  • Help clients through their transformation journey by focusing on people outocmes making them much more capable
  • Develop human-centered strategies for change that are agile and ‘digital-world’ ready
  • Support the translation of strategic direction and business objectives established by clients into holistic change strategies
  • Design agile change strategies that will help companies change their culture and the way they do everything while preparing them for the future of work
  • Use leading practice change tools and methodologies including:
  • Predictive analytics
  • Engagement collaboration and facilitation tools like Mentimeter/ThinkTank
  • Experience design using personas and informed by organisational analytics
  • Help clients transform their companies into resilient organisations comfortable with redirection and ambiguity
  • Help Infosys Consulting with business development including proposals and client relationships
  • Build our Talent & Organisation community by helping with market research Points-of-View capability development thought leadership and knowledge management
  • Be flexible adaptive and ready to build those air miles with travel as needed

 

Here’s what you need:


Industry – We are interested in strong change practitionres and thought leaders who have Financial Services Telco Energy Mining or Utilities experience. We wish to speak to you if you have deep experience in one of these industries or who has demonstrated agility across one or more of these industries. We may also speak to practitioners with experience in other industries.


Capability – We are interested in strong change practitioners and thought leaders who bring experience in driving a digital culture and in the client capability required to adopt new technologies and operate in new ways of working. You ideally will have experience across with experience in change management enterprise transformation learning solutions and/or talent strategies


Consulting mindset – In addition to industry and capability skillsets you will need to be a problem solver at heart. You know how to frame problems and break them. You are able to step outside your primary skillset and be comfortable and credible in adjacent skill sets e.g. project management. In doing this you can be a transformation agent and not simply a change practitioner.


Bonus points if:

  • You've got experience working as a consultant and building centers of excellence
  • Extensive experience in 3 or more of the following the following areas:
  • Change Analytics
  • Change Tracking
  • Change Management
  • Design Thinking / Human-Centred Design
  • Change Capability
  • Agile Change
  • Agile Coaching
  • You have experience in Human Capital & Organization Effectiveness (e.g. Organisation Design Culture Transformation Leadership Effectiveness etc)
  • You have experience in Digital or Target Operating Model design or implementation
  • You know how to design develop and roll out HR processes
  • You’re familiar with digital tools like HR Automation Future Workforce Design and Analytics
  • Demonstrated experience leading teams
  • Established client relationships or the ability to build strong client relationships


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Certification in change management such as Prosci PCI etc.

  • Handle onboarding and offboarding of employees

Company Name: Asia Pacific Breweries Singapore (Part of The HEINEKEN Company)
Job Description:
The Heineken Asia Pacific Graduate Program (APGP) is an exciting two-year program for anyone who’s interested in a long-term career with HEINEKEN Asia Pacific. We are on the lookout for graduates that will raise the bar and bring Heineken to the next level. Our commitment to your development matters; enjoy an accelerated career progression filled with developmental opportunities locally and regionally.​

​

As part of Heineken’s APGP you will get to work with world-class brands and learn from some of the most experienced and talented people in the business. You will complete four assignments of six months each. The first two assignments will take place in your Home Operating Company (OpCo) followed by two assignments in one of the 20+ Heineken Asia Pacific OpCos. 

This is an experience that will shape and develop you for your future career and set you on a course to be one of tomorrow’s leaders in one of the seven business tracks (Commerce Supply Chain Finance Human Resources Corporate Affairs Legal Digital & Transformation).

The Singapore Public Service is operating in a significantly different environment than in the past. Technological disruption global uncertainties demographics shift resource constraints restructuring and transformation to meet diverse needs of varied complexity are some of the challenges faced. The public sector needs to be future-ready with public officers being efficient and effective in meeting the needs of our stakeholders in a changing environment.HR is one of the key enablers of workforce and workplace in public sector organisations. Within PSD the Chief HR Officer’s Office (CHROO) serve to professionalise HR in the Public Service and provide thought leadership to some 2700 HR leaders and officers across the Public Service. CHROO’s vision is to position the Public Service as “The Employer of Choice” to attract manage and develop our officers to contribute towards building a “Trusted Public Service with Citizens at the Centre”.

[The Programme]

Under This Programme Successful Applicants Can Look Forward To a Development Programme Consisting Of

The Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) in PSD is targeted at jobseekers who are keen to develop themselves in the Human Resource (HR) sector.
  • Orientation and foundational programmes that provides a solid understanding of HR and its function in the public sector context.
  • Domain-specific training including in-house programmes and courses to develop professional competencies in functional HR areas and to prepare applicants to attain IHRP certification at the end of the programme.
  • Hands-on experience in HR functional areas and projects including attachments to other agencies in the public sector to deliver on HR outcomes.
At the end of the WSIP you will be equipped with in-demand HR skills and will be ready to pursue more job opportunities in both the public service and the private sector.

[Key Responsibilities]
  • Oversee workforce planning and manpower deployment in the agency optimising resources for its business needs and outcomes.
  • Lead in developing recruitment strategies to support manpower needs working closely with partners like unions PSD and other government agencies.
  • Formulate and direct strategies for performance management including the management of disciplinary issues for staff in the line departments.
  • Lead the conduct of daily HR operations to support the business and ensure the optimal delivery of services via HR policies processes and IT systems.
  • Front engagements with key stakeholders like unions to ensure that policies and measures take into account their perspectives and strike a balance between the different interests at stake.
  • Build a data driven HR team who leverages on HR analytics in decision making. This includes building analytics capabilities in the team and reviewing work processes to facilitate data collection and
  • Provide oversight on project implementation status and budgetary matters.
[Competencies Required]
  • [Strategic Partner] Ability to work with line departments to develop and execute HR strategies based on sound judgement and in alignment to the organisation’s goals using appropriate tools and techniques for resource optimisation.
  • [Communications & Relationship Management] Ability to communicate effectively (both presenting and writing) and foster strong relationships with partners across the private and public sectors turning these into collaboration and partnership opportunities.
  • [Analytics] Ability to embed analytics across the organisation’s HR processes to evaluate and resolve workforce issues.
  • [Strategic Workforce Planning] Develop and establish Strategic Workforce Planning for the agency and integrate it with other organisational planning processes (e.g. strategic planning technology roadmap capability roadmap) as part of the organisation’s overall transformation efforts
  • [Recruitment] Ability to lead the development of recruitment strategies by evaluating the merits and effectiveness of strategies in alignment with the organisation’s strategy and best market practices.
  • [Performance Management] Implement and operationalise an effective performance management framework and gain buy-in from stakeholders within the organisation.
  • [Employee Engagement & Well-Being] Ability to champion the adoption of innovative employee engagement & well-being best practices across the industry.
  • [Values & Conduct] Ability to champion and share examples of how the organisation embodies the values ethos and code of conduct of the organisation and the public service.
[Other Requirements]
  • 10-15 years of relevant working experience in a large organisation with experience leading a team or project(s).
  • Retrenched or mid-careerists with the right attributes but no requisite experience may also apply
  • Passionate in being part of the team to shape the development of the Public Service HR sector
  • People Leader who cares about staff development and well-being
Retrenched or mid-careerists with the right attributes but no requisite experience may also apply.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date.

Successful candidates will be offered a role on contract basis.

As a Lecturer your contributions go beyond teaching and facilitating learning. You play a critical role in recognising and nurturing your students’ potential and their lifelong learning needs. In addition you will carry out industry or consultancy projects to help you remain relevant in your profession and to evolving changes in industry and maintain strong linkages with industry and schools. You will also have the opportunity to have industry attachments or experience on a regular basis to update your skills knowledge and practices of your profession. Those with good and relevant experience can look forward to Senior Lecturer or equivalent positions with career development opportunities to leadership positions in the Colleges or Headquarters.

Job Title: Foreign Service Officer (Functional and Corporate Services)
Job Description:
A career in the Foreign Service alternates between Singapore and in one of our 50 Missions around the world.

Always on the frontline of global developments Foreign Service Officers (FSOs) respond swiftly to events happening around the world to safeguard and advance Singapore's interests. This includes analysing geopolitical developments organising high-level visits and meetings sharing Singapore's technical expertise with developing countries as well as assisting overseas Singaporeans in distress.

Depending on your competencies and interests you will be developed in one of the following tracks:
  • Foreign Service Officer (Functional and Corporate)
  • Foreign Service Officer (Political and Economic)

To be an FSO you must have a good grasp of world affairs. You need to be able to persuade and assert as well as build and sustain relationships. You must be versatile and ready to adapt to and thrive in different environments.

Job Scope

You Are Rotated To Manage Core Functions In The Following

As a Foreign Service Officer (Functional and Corporate) you formulate review and implement policies that impact MFA's vital operations.
  • Consular: Provide assistance to overseas Singaporeans in distress
  • Protocol: Facilitate State formalities and courtesies
  • Human Resource: Attract and develop human capital
  • Corporate Affairs: Oversee organisational and resource management
  • Strategic Communications: Manage and shape media relations
  • Technical Cooperation: Share Singapore's technical expertise with developing countries

Overseas you serve as Administrative Secretary. You manage a team to ensure the smooth functioning of the Mission. Your challenges range from consular duties human resource management finance procurement facility development and maintenance to office administration.

Requirements
  • Singapore citizens with the commitment to serve in the Public Service and can adapt to the challenges of working overseas.
  • Exceptional graduates with strong analytical skills and conceptual abilities excellent written and oral communication skills strong ability to engage people at all levels and good planning and organisation skills.

Development Opportunities

You will be equipped with essential knowledge skills and diplomatic tradecraft through structured programmes courses and on-the-job training. As you progress within the Ministry a series of varied and enriching assignments and milestone programmes will groom you for future leadership roles.

Find out more/Contact Us

If you wish to find out more or hear from our officers please visit our website at www.mfa.gov.sg/career. If you have any queries please contact us at mfa_career@mfa.gov.sg

As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public you will find your niche in our big family.

Corporate Development

We have a strong corporate development team to engage our staff and support our business operations. There is a wide range of job opportunities from Finance Audit Strategic Planning Risk Management to Human Resource and Organisation Development.   • Liaise and work with external parties such as survey company academics and other government agencies in the planning execution and analysis of the study

TRUST. Everything We Stand For.

Deputy Manager/Assistant Manager (Human Resource)

The Singapore Department of Statistics is the National Statistical Authority responsible for statistics on the Singapore economy and population.

We collect compile analyse and disseminate a wide range of economic business household and population data as well as analyse and monitor trends in the economy and population.

With these vital inputs policymakers business decision makers and our data users gain valuable insights into current and emerging economic and social trends enabling them to make calculated and informed decisions in the formulation of policies and strategies for the future. Apart from public agencies and businesses our users also include researchers analysts educators students the media and the general public.

Join our team and make a difference by contributing important statistical input to facilitate policy planning and decision-making and support Singapore's present and future economic and social development.

Job Description

You will be responsible for managing and supporting the talent management and capability building for the Department including the review and implementation of related HR policies and procedures. There will also be opportunities for you to participate in ad-hoc projects.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to review workforce plans and identify strategies and interventions to close manpower and capabilities gaps.
  • Identify capability development needs and priorities and draw up learning plans.
  • Work with internal and external partners vendors and providers to develop broad-based and specialised programmes and courses.
  • Engage management and staff on learning intent evaluation of learning effectiveness evaluation and areas for improvement.
  • Apply data analytics to generate insights for planning and evaluation.
    • Job Requirements
  • 2-3 years of relevant experience and familiarity with human resource practices in the public sector will be an added advantage
  • Meticulous and well-organised
  • Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and analytical skills
  • A self-starter who can work well independently and in a team
We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Job Title: Trainee| Research Analyst in Leadership| Management and Organization [#SGUnitedTraineeships]
Job Description:
Programme Summary

In conjunction with Workforce Singapore NTU offer traineeships to support the SGUnited Traineeships Programme. The Traineeships are part of NTU's efforts to create relevant and meaningful traineeship opportunities for our nation’s new graduates entering the workforce during this difficult time.

About Nanyang Business School

Nanyang Business School has been consistently counted among the world's top-tier business schools. Being fully integrated into Nanyang Technological University it draws on the strengths of one of Asia's most comprehensive research-intensive universities to provide enriching opportunities for interdisciplinary study.

The Leadership Management and Organization Division is a community of more than 30 international scholars from 15 different countries with PhDs from research-intensive universities on four continents. We work in four major areas: leadership; organisational behaviour; human resource management; and communication management.
