Job Title: Assistant Manager to Senior Manager| F1
Job Description:
Purpose Of Job

The Singapore Grand Prix is a motor race on the calendar of the FIA Formula One World Championship. Started in 2008 Singapore’s F1 race remains the first and only night race in the entire race calendar and Asia’s only street circuit. The race experience is complemented by a collection of lifestyle events under Grand Prix Season Singapore (GPSS) which provides another unique value proposition that further differentiates Singapore F1 from others. The F1 team is responsible for leading the whole-of-government effort to execute a world class event and showcase Singapore's ability to hold a large-scale sporting event to reap tourism receipts visitor arrivals and international media value.

This role oversees the grant management of F1 and provide Finance support to the team.

Main Responsibilities

  • Manage grant disbursement to Singapore GP Pte Ltd (SGP) on a yearly basis
  • To support the term renewal discussion on finance related matters such as Cost Benefit Analysis (CBA)
  • Manage the overall budget allocation for respective Subcomm (i.e. Circuit & Infrastructure Security & Emergency Response Traffic & Transport Community Engagement GPSS
  • To review the existing procurement process for F1 and update the Terms of Reference accordingly
  • To put up IAA/DPC paper where necessary
  • To work with A&I team to conduct survey on F1 attendees
  • F1 Department Budget officer
  • Lead and manage the allocation of complimentary race tickets for STB HR balloting
  • Good writing skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good knowledge of Government procurement and compliance policies
  • Ability to manage financial reporting
  • Good understanding of P&L analysis

    • Experience
    • At least 2 years of working experience in a similar function
    • Ability to manage financial reporting
    • Project management and negotiation skills
    • Organised and meticulous
    • Self-driven individual and good team player
    • Relationship building and stakeholder management skills ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders
    • Good writing skills
    • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
    • Good knowledge of Government procurement and compliance policies
    • Ability to manage financial reporting
    • Good understanding of P&L analysis

Job Title: Assistant Manager/Manager| Office of Corporate Communications and Marketing
Job Description:
About Us

Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work plan organise and play together - building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.

Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare competitive compensation packages and generous professional development opportunities - all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder then that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.

Job Description
  • Independently project lead assigned events or work as a team.
  • Plan the entire spectrum and implementation of assigned events/allocated job responsibilities - managing the administrative operational technical and logistical aspects of the assigned event.
  • Handle necessary protocols of the different levels of guests drawing up the relevant administrative programmes with the appropriate hospitality plans for the different categories of guests.
  • Able to inject creativity and freshness into annual major events.
  • Translate briefs into video story boarding and work on the production of videos to meet the briefs.
  • Able to coordinate and work closely with the performers technical and creative crew for show production.
  • Able to propose and use where appropriate and when applicable multi-platforms for an effective marketing reach.
  • Able to effectively and efficiently organize events on virtual platforms and/or hybrid events (a combination of virtual and physical format).
  • Support other team members in the organization of thought leadership events.
  • Work collaboratively with other key offices to jointly mount major strategic events.
Qualification & Skills
  • Diploma and/or Bachelor degree.
  • Minimum 1 to 2 years of relevant working experience.
  • Experience in virtual and physical events planning and management.
  • Good written and oral communication skills.
  • Team player with good inter-personal skills.
  • IT savvy.


Other Information

Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.

Research Analyst (RHSO) – Contract

 Agency: Central Provident Fund Board
Job no.: 546022
Work type: Contract
Location: Singapore
Categories: Economics/Statistics Occupational Safety and Health Others Research and Analysis Statistics

As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public you will find your niche in our big family.

Corporate Development

We have a strong corporate development team to engage our staff and support our business operations. There is a wide range of job opportunities from Finance Audit Strategic Planning Risk Management to Human Resource and Organisation Development. If you have a passion to ensure data quality to help meet organisational objectives this is the job for you.

Responsibilities
  • Carry out data quality assurance activities for a longitudinal study
  • Involve in managing a wide spectrum of longitudinal data such as to analyse data anomalies formulate and apply suitable data edits for key data variables; and where relevant impute missing responses as well as to derive more statistical insights to support the study
  • Liaise and work with external parties such as survey company academics and other government agencies in the planning execution and analysis of the study
Requirements
  • Preferably 1 year of working experience in statistical data management will be an advantage
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to learn and apply relevant statistical and analytical tools as well as techniques for data compilation and analysis.
  • Good communication and presentation skills.
  • Able to work well independently and as a member of the team.
Find out more at page

TRUST. Everything We Stand For.

Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive digital economy that benefits everyone everywhere by making transactions safe simple smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks partnerships and passion our innovations and solutions help individuals financial institutions governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient or DQ drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths views and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

HRBP Manager

Manager People & Capability Partner Singapore

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive digital economy that benefits everyone everywhere by making transactions safe simple smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks partnerships and passion our innovations and solutions help individuals financial institutions governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient or DQ drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths views and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Overview

This position is an individual contributor role and has responsibility for facilitating human resources related activities within Mastercard Asia Pacific. It has an Asia Pacific regional remit and the responsibilities include implementation of human resources initiatives human resources strategy and core human resources activities.

The People & Capability Partner (PCP) will act as a cultural change agent consultant and business advisor in partnering with employees managers leaders to enable the execution of business strategies and initiatives.

The individual in this role will need to work in close collaboration with the regional management the Asia Pacific People & Capability team to ensure processes and initiatives are successfully implemented and effectively developed. This position reports into the VP People & Capability Partner Asia Pacific Regional Functions.

Role

These Activities Include But Are Not Limited To

The individual in this role will execute against strategic initiatives designed to enhance human resources effectiveness and delivery.
  • Partner with management and build and nurture relationships with key internal stakeholders to facilitate human resources partnership
  • Partner cross-functionally with COEs GBSC and local People & Capability Partners on the delivery and implementation of human resources programs
  • Implement human resources strategies and talent initiatives for the supported regional functions
  • Partners with management to ensure a successful performance management process and a successful change management delivery
  • Responsible for planning and implementing leadership development performance management rewards and change management initiatives
  • Work to ensure global talent and reward strategies are translated accurately and effectively to local markets
  • Delivers communication for talent planning Compensation planning and change-management processes
  • Apply knowledge of local laws and regulations to provide high-touch employee–facing support in the areas of talent management employee relations total rewards recruitment and development.
  • Manage reporting on relevant human resources metrics quantitative and qualitative data to provide summaries and recommendations for improvements regarding budgets staffing forecasts succession planning and competitive market positioning
All About You
  • Demonstrated Human Resources Business Partner experience.
  • Demonstrated success coordinating and delivering corporate human resources programs/processes (e.g. talent management year-end compensation planning) and reporting on progress
  • Experience in managing local human resources operations for a market including delivering on talent forecasts succession planning progress and talent review updates
  • Demonstrated success when advising and coaching business leaders and other stakeholders on the local human resources environment market best-practices and all day-to-day employment matters
  • Demonstrated success building relationships and collaborating with COEs and other key stakeholders
  • Bachelor’s degree required advanced degree in Human Resources and/or IHRP certification preferred
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and initiatives exercising sound judgment solutions orientation and flexibility
  • Must demonstrate the ability to work cross functionally and across multiple geographies. Previous experience managing Human Resources initiatives for business units spanning across the Asia Pacific region preferred
  • Must have good influencing skills and strong analytical presentation verbal and written communications skills
Due to COVID-19 most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.

Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender gender identity sexual orientation race ethnicity disabled or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

Job Description

This role will have a meaningful contribution to CSR and social impact at WSI. He/she will support the execution of an industry-leading factory social responsibility program in home furnishings working within the WSI sustainability team across Asia and the US.

This role will focus on a project/s that aid in the continued evolution of WSI’s social compliance program and ‘beyond compliance’ initiatives for our global suppliers. The role will also support the Singapore sustainability team on 2020 reporting and planning for 2021 as well as other priority tasks as required.

Key Responsibilities
  • Support the CSR Director to
  • Develop plan and execute specific work plan project/s related to WSI’s factory social responsibility program
  • Develop key year-end reports consolidate data and projects updates from 2020 to deliver to in-country business teams and leadership
  • Develop 2021 social compliance goals & Work plan
  • Develop 2021 country-specific roll out plans for BC initiatives
  • Support SG operations team on year-end data analysis and process improvement opportunities on key workstreams piloted in 2020 (eg equivalency MM expanded scope)
  • Contribute to developing and executing communications that educate and deepen engagement with key internal and external stakeholders.
  • Work with SG team +in country managers to support day-to-day tracking/reporting on program
  • Support development of processes protocols and tools to aid and enforce the WSI social responsibility strategy across WSI global vendor base.
Desirable Attributes Skills And Qualifications
  • 2+ years' related experience in social responsibility (developing enforcing or influencing program implementation)
  • Strong data analysis and excel skills
  • Embodies the highest level of personal and professional integrity and ethics.
  • Possesses a personally engaging style with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong information-seeking skills and a drive to make things happen
  • Ability to understand challenges or underlying concerns share ideas and develop effective responses or elevate to higher management
  • Maintains a global perspective and is culturally sensitive and aware.
  • Thrives in a collaborative team environment.
  • Possesses attention to detail while managing simultaneous projects in a dynamic environment.
  • Ability to work independently and cooperatively in a diverse group
  • Fluency in English and proficiency in Microsoft Word PowerPoint Excel
About Us

Founded in 1956 Williams-Sonoma Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of home furnishings in the United States Canada Puerto Rico Australia United Kingdom and the rest of the world with franchise partnerships. Our family of brands are Williams-Sonoma Pottery Barn Pottery Barn Kids PBteen West Elm Williams-Sonoma Home Rejuvenation and Mark and Graham. Our passion for high-quality products functional design outstanding customer service enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities remains as our core values.

Today we are a USD 5 billion company with a multi-brand multi-channel global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.

The Singapore regional office was set up in 2008 and we currently have 140 associates over functions such as corporate social responsibility customs & compliance finance human resource information technology inventory planning logistics sourcing and quality assurance.

The South East Asia team is an inclusive employer where we recruit and provide employees with fair opportunities on the basis of merit regardless of age race gender religion marital status and family responsibilities or disability.

YASH Technologies (www.yash.com) headquartered in USA has a history of growth and success. Named as of one of the “Fast 500 companies” YASH has grown organically through strategic acquisitions. We currently have over 6000 global employees and growing.

YASH has been appraised as SEI CMMI (Level 5) and recognized by Great Place to Work® Institute as a ‘Certified Great Place To Work’ and World HRD Congress 2017 ranked us 53rd in the prestigious list ‘Dream Companies To Work 2017.

We are currently looking for a talented Human Resource + Talent Acquisition personal for our Singapore office.

Role – HR + Talent Acquisition

TALENT ACQUISITION (60% of total work scope)

  • Manage the recruitment and selection process using the various tools & technologies available.
  • Partner closely with Hiring Managers to ensure sourcing and hiring strategies are aligned with company’s strategies.
  • Partner with business leader and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and fulfil recruiting needs along with business timelines.
  • Use your established networks to discover and attract experienced diverse ambitious talent to join our team.
  • Screen and select candidates effectively by assessing both their previous experience as well as culture fit with our environment
  • Provide an efficient and high-touch experience for every candidate from the application stage to offer evaluating skill level driving the interview process and offer process including reference checks salary recommendations and closing of candidates.

    • HR OPERATIONS (30% of total work scope)

  • Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
  • Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands grievances or other issues.
  • Develop and monitor overall HR strategies systems tactics and procedures across the Singapore & Hong Kong employee base.
  • Maintain pay plan and benefits program.
  • Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management
  • Provide specialized support for human resources related programs & policies.
  • Conducting Pre-onboarding activities scheduling warm up calls handling employee documentation arranging IT Assets ID card visiting cards etc
  • Handle Onboarding & Exit of employees.
  • Employee engagement - Post offer follow up with the candidates to sustain the interest and ensure that offered candidates to be on boarded on time
  • Handle EP/SP/LOC new application processing & renewals.
  • Preparation of various Human Resource letters like Letter Of Consent Offer Letter Appointment Letters Termination Letter Increment Letter Performance Appraisal communication.
  • Maintaining insurance records and co-ordinating with the vendor.
  • Maintain in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to HR and audits reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance
  • Managing Employee Information & HR systems
  • Maintain attendance and leave management and approval - HRMS System
  • Managing payroll for all employees in Singapore Hong Kong (Co-ordinate with Finance & Payroll outsourcing firm)
  • Managing HR Policy & Helpdesk Statutory compliance Benefits management Employee Communication coordinate with government agencies in Singapore and Hong Kong.
  • Timely resolution of the employee grievances & queries
  • Act as point person for all staff regarding HR matters.

    • OFFICE ADMINISTRATION (10% of total work scope)

  • Answer and direct phone calls
  • Order office supplies
  • Maintain contact lists of staff suppliers vendors etc
  • Submit and reconcile expense reports of staff
  • Provide general support to visitors
  • Act as the point of contact for internal and external clients

    • This role is open to SINGAPOREANS / PRs only.

Job Title: Office of Human Resources: Business Analyst
Job Description:
Department: Office of Human Resources

Description

This position reports to the Office of HR Shared Services and is the process and risk champion for OHR. This role will provide support to evaluate simplify and continuously improve standards and processes across the HR functions through automation utilising process excellence methodology. The incumbent will collaborate with various OHR sections and function leads to understand business challenges and identify suitable solutions to resolve them.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Conduct data profiling and develop data quality rules to ensure data accuracy of HR records.
  • Support the issues management process and root causes analysis that ultimately increase data quality.
  • Collaborate closely with team members on ongoing development of best practices surrounding data governance activities and ensuring Data Quality practices are integrated successfully.
  • Facilitate the effective deployment of innovation and productivity tools in the context of the systems used in HR.
  • Lead opportunity assessments to identify suitable processes for automation.
  • Collaborate with IT specialist and HR stakeholders to implement automation solutions to address pain areas.
  • Manage and maintain applications and tools to meet business requirements and conduct troubleshooting to resolve solution issues.
  • As this role is new and developing the incumbent is expected to undertake other appropriate duties as required for the effective operation of the team.

Qualifications
  • Degree with knowledge of enterprise cloud-based HR solutions and proven track record of successfully delivering automation solutions streamlined work processes data analysis and data quality initiatives.
  • Candidates who possess a hybrid of business and IT skills and have worked as a BA in a HR department is highly preferred.
  • Good knowledge and experience in one or more of the following areas: Lean 6-Sigma Design Thinking Smart Automation (RPA/AI) Business Process Management (BPM) and MS Sharepoint.
  • Good understanding of operational processes in the HR functions.
  • Must be a self-starter and have hands-on experience in project management tools.
  • Strong facilitation communication and presentation skills.

Job

Executive and Administrative

Primary Location

Kent Ridge

Organization

Office of Human Resources

Schedule

Full-time

About Us

We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated omni-channel women's fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010 we have grown to 250 people strong proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong China Philippines and Australia New Zealand US Canada Macau Japan Korea Vietnam Thailand Myanmar Cambodia & Brunei).

We are taking our definition of new female retail global with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.

The team

The Love Bonito team is a passionate dynamic innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers savvy marketers to tech whizzes we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer the Love Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact we could be the perfect fit for you!

*The LB 2020 Summer Internship Program will be postponed due to the current COVID-19 situation please check back here for updates. We are still currently accepting interns on an ad-hoc basis.*

The Internship

Developing Future Leaders

We have designed our internships to give remarkable students like you a real role in our business whether you join our Corporate Technology or Branding areas. We are looking for LB’s future leaders - people who are passionate driven and have outstanding potential.

Mentoring

You will be assigned a senior supervisor to guide your learning journey throughout your time here at LB. In conversation with you they will tailor an individual development plan and provide all the means necessary to help you achieve your career goals. You will also receive regular check-ins with your supervisor during the entire duration of your internship.

Make an Impact

You will be assigned an anchor project tied to LB’s 2020 business objectives. The real work you do here will have a lasting impact - on your team our organization and our global LB Community.

Create a Community

Through working with your supervisor forming relationships with other interns and engaging with internal & external teams you will create a supportive community as you pursue your personal and professional development throughout the internship.

Build Your Foundation

You will be given the opportunity to demonstrate your new professional skills and knowledge during a final presentation providing you a strong foundation to start building your career.

Our ultimate goal is to bring great talents to LB. All LB interns will have the opportunity to be considered for a full-time role with #TeamLB.

Departments and Projects

You will deep-dive into one department during the duration of your internship function as a full member of the team and achieve business objectives through your daily responsibilities and your team-specific anchor project. Projects will be shared with you in more detail during the recruitment process.

Available departments are covered below
  • Business Development
  • Commercial
  • Creative
  • Data
  • Design
  • Engineering
  • Finance
  • IT Support
  • Marketing
  • Operations
  • People & Culture
  • Product
  • Retail


Highlighted Internships

IT Support Intern

The Role

You’ll have a front seat experience in impacting women across the globe through fashion and technology. Most importantly you’ll be part of an amazing journey of building the best technology team in the region.

Main Responsibilities
  • Provide 1st level computer network and application support.
  • Support and troubleshoot software and hardware equipment needs across both HQ and retail store
  • Follow and can make a checklist for future references or documentation.
  • Investigate diagnose and resolve software and hardware issues
  • Install configure support and maintain physical security systems such as CCTV door access or any network devices.
  • Liaise with internal teams for a better resolution of problems and reducing knowledge gaps
  • Collaborate closely with the HR team to ensure a smooth and seamless onboarding and exit process from an IT standpoint

Design Intern

The role

You will be responsible for creating unique inspiring and commercial prints which reflect Love Bonito’s brand image and language. You will support the Head of Design through every aspect of the print design process; from research to design colourway proposals technical print file creation development and final approval till production. This is an exciting and varied role that requires a dynamic individual with initiative - one who thrives in a fast paced and exciting environment but can remain calm under pressure.

You should have / be
  • A strong technical understanding in fashion design
  • A proactive self-starter who enjoys autonomy and taking action
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while working with team members
  • Curiosity about how ideas and designs are translated into new collections
  • Good eye for detail as well as keen interest in fashion trend styles

Main responsibilities
  • Assisting designers in managing day-to-day administrative tasks
  • Assisting Design team during Monthly Buying session
  • Preparing line sheets and facilitate work flow during buying session as needed
  • Supporting design team post buying session with required follow-ups
  • Assisting with creating mood boards and conducting trend research
  • Responsible for organizing and maintaining fabric swatches library and trims.
  • Creating technical flat drawing and hand sketches for presentation boards and tech packs.
  • Specifying design attributes of garments and documenting the information into internal platform
  • Maintaining the archive room on weekly basis
  • Preparing garments needed for photoshoot
  • Assisting tracking shipments of sample on design submission stage
  • Performing additional duties and assignments as requested.


Requirements

General Requirements
  • Minimum commitment of 3 months with 6 months preferred.
  • Undergraduates and graduate students are both welcome to apply
  • Market level internship salary and benefits provided


IT Support Intern Requirements
  • Intermediate Networking Skills
  • Knowledgeable with both Hardware and Software
  • Basic knowledge on Operating System MS-Office 365 or Google Suite.
  • Basic understanding of systems and applications
  • IT Graduate or currently studying any Information Technology field or equivalent
  • Can work with minimum supervision
  • Willingness to learn new things


Design Intern Requirements
  • 6-month commitment
  • Must be fluent in Chinese and English.
  • Highly organized and able to multitask meticulous good follow through good time management
  • Diploma/Bachelors in Fashion Design or relevant work experience
  • Proficient in Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator and Microsoft Office
  • Strong drawing skills - both hand sketching and technical sketching
  • Good eye for detail as well as keen interest in fashion trend styles
  • Highly organized and able to multitask meticulous good follow through good time management
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills both written and verbal

The trainee will lead 1 or more projects that are related to leadership development and work process improvement. Generally the trainee will execute any required research information-gathering collaborate with diverse group of employees and external partners to review existing HR practices and provide recommendations.

Middle managers (MM) play an important role in people development and in overall employee engagement. The trainee will have the opportunity to learn about leadership development practices (related to the middle managers group) to conduct research to identify best practices in developing strong people managers; and provide recommendations on how those practices can be contextualised to PSD and aligned with our core competencies framework.

Under work process improvements the trainee will look into 1-2 specific HR work processes and review them with the aim to improve HR efficiency. Specifically the trainee will have an opportunity to work with the PSD HR team to design and craft onboarding materials for new middle managers and establish a training and engagement framework to guide middle managers’ development.

Lastly the trainee will have the opportunity to learn about leadership development practices and be part of the action in fostering strong talent development culture within PSD!

Requirements
  • Interests in HR Knowledge Management Good knowledge of excel (collation basic analysis)
  • Structured individual who can run through various documents /databases
  • Possess critical thinking skills to connect the dots


Other Information
  • Traineeship Duration: 6 months
  • Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public you will find your niche in our big family.

Corporate Development

We have a strong corporate development team to engage our staff and support our business operations. There is a wide range of job opportunities from Finance Audit Strategic Planning Risk Management to Human Resource and Organisation Development. If you have a passion to ensure data quality to help meet organisational objectives this is the job for you.

Responsibilities
  • Carry out data quality assurance activities for a longitudinal study
  • Involve in managing a wide spectrum of longitudinal data such as to analyse data anomalies formulate and apply suitable data edits for key data variables; and where relevant impute missing responses as well as to derive more statistical insights to support the study
  • Liaise and work with external parties such as survey company academics and other government agencies in the planning execution and analysis of the study


Requirements
  • Preferably 1 year of working experience in statistical data management will be an advantage
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to learn and apply relevant statistical and analytical tools as well as techniques for data compilation and analysis.
  • Good communication and presentation skills.
  • Able to work well independently and as a member of the team.

As an Associate Business Analyst the trainee will be part of a team to implement high value business solutions to our clients using our proprietary manpower planning products. Ultimately the trainee will be equipped with training and mentorship and be exposed to the entire life cycle of business solutions implementation. The trainee can look forward to supporting our wide arrays of projects with large enterprises across Singapore promising an unprecedented opportunity to learn and gain extensive experience.

Requirements

The trainee will be required to assist the Project Managers & Consultants on various end-to-end project implementation processes including
  • Gathering requirements - Understand analyse and document the clients' pain points problem statements and functional requirements
  • Customization - Work with client and WorkforceOptimizer technology teams to configure and personalize WorkforceOptimizer’s product suite to align with our clients' business requirements
  • Education & Training - Educate end-users on best practices for time and labour management by conducting customer training workshops
  • Testing & Review - Manage testing and deployment activities to obtain clients' feedback (e.g. user-acceptance testing)


Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Information System Engineering or Business
  • Background in HR Payroll or Time & Attendance functional areas is an advantage
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to apply strong analytical abilities or instincts at the right times to make the right judgment call
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills an astute listener who can pick up subtle cues that others may fail to notice
  • Able to work independently and as a team able to support multiple clients concurrently able to multi-task and stay organized in a fast-paced environment

  • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident; and
  • Graduated or graduating in calendar year 2019 or 2020 from ITEs polytechnics universities or other educational institutions (e.g. private universities and overseas institutions); OR

    • Business Needs Analysis Gain understanding in typical requirements gathering processes business requirements and business requirement documentation. This is achieved through active participation in requirements gathering requirements analysis and documentation activities such as meetings and team discussions.
    • Solutioning gain understanding of technical consideration in product solutioning through active participation in translating business requirements into software configurations.

This is achieved through active participation in executing testing procedures assessing test results for unexpected outcomes and documenting details of failures that surface from the test results in testing documents.

Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. As a Lecturer your contributions go beyond teaching and facilitating learning. You play a critical role in recognising and nurturing your students’ potential and their lifelong learning needs. In addition you will carry out industry or consultancy projects to help you remain relevant in your profession and to evolving changes in industry and maintain strong linkages with industry and schools. You will also have the opportunity to have industry attachments or experience on a regular basis to update your skills knowledge and practices of your profession. Those with good and relevant experience can look forward to Senior Lecturer or equivalent positions with career development opportunities to leadership positions in the Colleges or Headquarters.

Requirements

You should have at least 3 years of relevant experience in Finance related department of the Maritime Industry or Human Resource experience in any industry.

Knowledge and competency in any or all of the following areas will be advantageous:
  • Familiarity with shipping (or cargo) operations administration and documentation
  • Human Resource Management
  • Data Analytics hands on expertise with Business Intelligence tools (such as Tableau or QlikView)
  • Digital Commerce and Marketing
  • Customer Relationship Management
The range of work includes teaching facilitating learning activities developing and reviewing curriculum/instructional materials initiating and implementing industry networking and industry projects.

About The Job

Our PeopleDev team works hard to ensure every Googler has access to the resources they need to become their best personal and professional selves. We leverage tools technology and innovative formats to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers — from Noogler Orientation to manager training to leadership development and more. We have four key beliefs about learning — that it is personal social a process and happens in real life — and we infuse these beliefs throughout the wide array of learning and development opportunities at Google. As a PeopleDev team member you'll always be thinking about new ways to help others grow and you share a passion for empowering Googlers to unlock their full potential.

The People Development team works to strengthen Google’s performance and culture by preparing Googlers to successfully navigate their most critical challenges today and in the future. We leverage expertise engaging content tools technology and innovative design to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers. In addition to high-impact learning programs classes and resources we also provide organizational development consulting and customized solutions.

As part of the Delivery and Engagement APAC team you’ll join us on our journey to steward an excellent curated portfolio of products and services for a unified user experience across all three regions. You will deliver our portfolio in the places where people live and work by curating learning solutions to meet nuanced user needs in the region.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler refining our core programs developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse accessible equitable and inclusive Google through our hiring promotion retention and inclusion practices.

Responsibilities
  • Be accountable for the user learning journey experience determining the best approach for the APAC market and user segment.
  • Understand and represent user needs to PeopleDev partners.
  • Be responsible for end-to-end facilitation of the learning asset.
  • Manage communications strategy and user segment. Execute with support from the Interface and Delivery communications team.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know by completing this form .

The Singapore Public Service is operating in a significantly different environment than in the past. Technological disruption global uncertainties demographics shift resource constraints restructuring and transformation to meet diverse needs of varied complexity are some of the challenges faced. The public sector needs to be future-ready with public officers being efficient and effective in meeting the needs of our stakeholders in a changing environment.HR is one of the key enablers of workforce and workplace in public sector organisations. Within PSD the Chief HR Officer’s Office (CHROO) serve to professionalise HR in the Public Service and provide thought leadership to some 2700 HR leaders and officers across the Public Service. CHROO’s vision is to position the Public Service as “The Employer of Choice” to attract manage and develop our officers to contribute towards building a “Trusted Public Service with Citizens at the Centre”.

[The Programme]

Under This Programme Successful Applicants Can Look Forward To a Development Programme Consisting Of

The Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) in PSD is targeted at jobseekers who are keen to develop themselves in the Human Resource (HR) sector.
  • Orientation and foundational programmes that provides a solid understanding of HR and its function in the public sector context.
  • Domain-specific training including in-house programmes and courses to develop professional competencies in functional HR areas and to prepare applicants to attain IHRP certification at the end of the programme.
  • Hands-on experience in HR functional areas and projects including attachments to other agencies in the public sector to deliver on HR outcomes.
At the end of the WSIP you will be equipped with in-demand HR skills and will be ready to pursue more job opportunities in both the public service and the private sector.

[Key Responsibilities]

These May Include But Are Not Limited To

Depending on the agency you are attached to and your role you may be assigned to a range of HR functions during your stint.

Workforce Planning & Talent Acquisition
  • Lead in developing workforce plans to support the agency’s transformation efforts and strategies to help the workforce adapt to the changing operating environment.
  • Lead in developing recruitment strategies to support organisation’s manpower needs. This includes working closely with partners like unions PSD and other government agencies; exploring various recruitment channels to source for suitable candidates and developing a competency-based approach for hiring decisions.
Career Development
  • Drive capability building efforts for the HR community e.g. through the creation of structured job rotations and talent attachment programs in partnership with other public agencies and the private sector.
  • Lead the design review and implementation of competency-based HR management to drive training postings and talent development for officers.
Analytics
  • Drive the development of HR analytics by advising and training the team in using analytics to diagnose and address their workforce issues.
  • Develop HR dashboards systems and programs and promote the adoption of these products across HR and external stakeholders.
[Competencies Required]
  • [Forward Planner] Ability to anticipate keep abreast and distil upcoming trends into appropriate plans and follow-up actions so as to improve HR and organisation effectiveness.
  • [Communications & Relationship Management] Ability to foster strong relationships with partners across the private and public sectors turning these into collaboration and partnership opportunities.
  • [Strategic Workforce Planning] Ability to align HR strategies and policies by determining and developing the workforce capacity and capability in order to achieve organisation goals now and for the future.
  • [Recruitment] Ability to develop and implement recruitment strategies (sourcing assessment and selection) to maximise the effectiveness of the selection process by accurately identifying candidates with the desired competencies qualities and values that will help the organisation achieve its current and long-term goals.
  • [Career Development] Ability to define a career development strategy outcome and approach for the organisation balancing the organisation’s unique needs the values of the public service and the changing aspiration of employees.
  • [Analytics] Ability to embed analytics across the organisation’s HR processes to evaluate and resolve workforce issues.
[Other Requirements]
  • 6-8 years of relevant working experience. (Experience in HR is an advantage but not mandatory)
  • Interest in shaping the development of the Public Service HR sector
  • Strong data and analytical skills (both quantitative and qualitative)
  • Analytical meticulous and possess strong writing skills
  • Good leadership and interpersonal skills
Retrenched or mid-careerists with the right attributes but no requisite experience may also apply.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date.

Successful candidates will be offered a role on contract basis.

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles New York London Paris Berlin Dubai Mumbai Singapore Jakarta Seoul and Tokyo.


About the Team

TikTok is seeking an Organizational Culture Partner to support our organization within Singapore. The ideal candidate will contribute at both hands-on and strategic levels to cultivate an “Always Day 1” TikTok culture as the organization grows and scales. If tackling challenges in a fast-changing industry does not scare you work with us and challenge yourself to move the world!


Responsibilities

The role will work as part of a diverse global team developing innovative internal communications strategies clear narratives and tactics tailored to regional business needs and providing expertise and support in employee engagement & well being.

The role would suit a tenacious creative person with a passion for storytelling comfort to lead through ambiguity and agility to navigate a fast-growing complex business.

In return? You will have the opportunity to make a lasting impact on the organizational culture and have a dynamic and diverse team alongside you supporting you on your lifelong development journey.


Normally you will do:

1. Work closely with the regional leaders to develop comprehensive internal communications and employee engagement strategy for the region.

2. Provide counseling to internal stakeholders and advise them on communications tactics and strategy. Provide strategic thinking to assist leaders in the planning and execution of regional communications programs.

3. Develop original innovative editorial content for various internal channels ranging from written communications such as intranet an internal newsletter to video content and brand-driven campaigns.

4. Design and implement internal campaigns and events to boost engagement and bring our core values to life.

5. Develop and implement positive wellbeing programs to foster wellness culture at the workplace.

6. Act as point of contact/liaison between regional & global organizational culture team. Translate and adapt the global communication campaign into local programs.


Qualifications

1. 8-12 years of experience in internal communications /HR.

2. A portfolio of writing samples and communications campaigns.

3. Experience in leading organizational change and communications projects.

4. Preferably in a fast-moving global industry or start-up company.

5. A proven track record of global cross-functional partnership and relationship management.

6. Ability to multi-task working on multiple projects with minimal supervision and to tight deadlines.

7. Excellent project management.

8. A creative thinker and storyteller with the ability to create engaging employee experiences.

9. Willing to roll up one’s sleeves and get work done even when at times it’s outside the scope of the job.

Company Name: A*STAR - Agency for Science| Technology and Research
Job Description:
﻿
A*STAR Human Resource (HR) Division’s vision is to develop all staff to their fullest potential and to help them make meaningful contributions to their department to the organisation and to Singapore. A*STAR HR aspires to provide valued HR services to attract develop motivate and retain the best talent to help A*STAR achieve its mission.

The HR Division comprises the Recruitment Planning Analytics HR Comms HR Operations and HR Partner departments.

The Key Responsibilities Are As Follows
  • Partner stakeholders on strategic HR matters e.g. manpower / resource planning and succession planning
  • Formulate & advise specific solutions for RE taking into account the context & complexity unique to RE
  • Proactively identify trends & propose interventions
  • Coordinate HR related operations; enforce service delivery & standard
  • Act as resource linker for HR related support & services

Requirements
  • Preferably with at least 3 years of relevant experience in HR
  • Excellent written and communication skills
  • Strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills

Objective of the Role

We are looking for an exceptionally driven individual to develop talent pipelines to meet our current and anticipated talent needs for our business globally but initially focused on multiple countries in the APAC region. The Talent Sourcing Specialist enjoys working in a team environment and interacts proactively with various stakeholders. He/She has a service-oriented mindset and can adapt to various forms of technology within his/her work space to enhance his/her work.

Responsibilities
  • Partner with HR Leaders and Recruiters to strategize different ways to build a diverse talent pipelines based on short- and long-term staffing projections
  • Ensure that candidate pools and pipelines are filled with diverse candidates with the necessary knowledge and skills required
  • Utilize a range of channels to source talent and build diverse pipelines with the awareness and understanding of the type of channels that yield the best talent
  • Leverage social media platforms professional associations Universities and other sources of data to source potential passive as well as active candidates
  • Build and maintain successful relationships with recruitment sources such as schools professional/industry organizations job boards social media staffing agencies recruitment firms etc. in order to create a pipeline of candidates
  • Stay abreast of innovative recruiting techniques to attract and compete in markets
  • Assist with developing coordinating writing and posting job postings as needed for social and digital media postings
  • Establish and maintains internal job boards and oversees career sourcing website making frequent updates to ensure attractiveness of Black Box as a leading employer
  • The above duties are meant to be representative of the position and not all-inclusive.


Requirements
  • Degree/Diploma in Business Administration/ Human Resource Management or equivalent
  • At least 2 years of experience in recruiting information technology (IT) positions or working experience in Tech companies
  • Proven success building talent pipelines and providing recruiters with quality candidates
  • Hands-on experience with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATSs) and other Human Resources Management software
  • Strong research skills to locate potential candidates via social networks professional sites job board sites resume databases etc.
  • Independent analytical resourceful and meticulous
  • Good time-management skills with the ability to handle various open positions simultaneously
  • Good communication & inter-personal skills result-orientation attention to details

Job Title: Lead| Strategic Planning & Operations - Tech Ecosystem
Job Description:
Lead Strategic Planning & Operations - Tech Ecosystem
  • Newly created headcount
  • Chance to join an exceptional multi-cultural team

    • About Our Client

    Our client is an early stage venture in the digital technology ecosystem with solid and stable funding from reputable investment firms. They provide their partners and clients with an integrated and secure network ecosystem to deliver value across different service providers while eradicating risks arising from privacy or security of information exchanges. The current team comprises of bright and commercially savvy individuals who are looking to expand their team aggressively so as to accommodate the definite demand from rising partners and client pool. They are looking to hire a strategic operations professional who has proven experience in implementing successful operations strategies that tie in financial targets product adoption and consistent pipeline of demand. This individual would also need strong people-skills and will work closely with the HR department in talent planning ensuring a high performing team who performs at their maximum efficiency.

    Job Description

    The Lead Strategic Planning & Operations will be supporting the C-suite on annual budgeting and financial planning matters. You will also be responsible to build a culture of operational achievement and an inclusive environment across all functions. Additionally you will also be expecting to take up other generalist responsibilities which is evident in a fast-paced high-growth start up. Other responsibilities include:
    • Have a good overview of the organisational wide objectives as well as periodic targets and aligning them with the different priorities across teams
    • Lead and execute processes for budgeting financial planning and forecasting
    • Support the setting and tracking of regional KPIs and monthly reporting for the executive team
    • Identifying and execute opportunities for performance improvement
    • Drive and run processes for high-impact regional strategic and commercial initiatives
    • Determine necessary customer support to aid product and sales teams to establish more partnerships and product adoption
    • Manage P&L closely with the senior executives and finance leaders

    The Successful Applicant

    • Top academic qualification like an MBA MSc or equivalent from a prestigious university / institution
    • 5 years or more experience in management consulting investment banking private equity venture capital or a high-growth startup
    • Demonstrated experience in scaling a high-growth start up would be a plus
    • Has an understanding of multiple functions not limited to HR finance sales product marketing supply chain
    • Good understanding of legal operations
    • Superior analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on attention to detail while delivering against tight deadlines
    • Influential communicator with skills to deliver messages in a compelling manner to different groups of audiences
    • Interest in the technology industry ideally deep technology (but not a must) with knowledge of digital identities

    What's On Offer

    Our client is going full force in driving their digital ecosystem locally regionally and eventually globally. This role will offer you a challenging opportunity to start a practice with the founding team who comprises of really intelligent and high-energy individuals. If you have the hunger to be part of an early stage start-up and has strong teamwork coupled with the relevant experiences required this is most probably an excellent fit for you.

Job Title: Centre for Future-Ready Graduates: Careers Advisor (Centre for Future-Ready Graduates)
Job Description:
Department: Centre for Future-Ready Graduates

Description

Careers Advisor (Centre for Future-Ready Graduates)

The Centre for Future-ready Graduates (CFG) is established by NUS as a first-of-its kind center developing programmes that contribute to holistic education to equip students for successful future careers enable them to lead happy and meaningful lives and contribute positively to society. We adopt an integrated approach towards students’ personal and career development in partnership with faculties industry and alumni. We are committed to the wholehearted service of preparing students for a VUCA (volatile; uncertain; complex; ambiguous) world and we exemplify future-readiness by adopting a growth mindset of curiosity lifelong learning and resilience and communicating openly with respect and empathy.

Duties & Responsibilities: -
  • Conduct career coaching sessions to help undergraduates postgraduates and young alumni explore relevant curriculum and careers that match their interests values and skills.
  • Develop and implement workshops and experiential learning programmes to equip students with the relevant career and workplace competencies.
  • Conduct and facilitate workshops in career preparation and soft skills.
  • Curate and organize other career related events and activities (e.g. career talks alumni and networking sessions).
  • Establish partnerships with employers to support their internships and graduate hiring needs.
  • Partner faculty mentors and academics to provide continuous coaching for students.
  • Collaborate with faculty to organize career programmes and events to equip students with industry knowledge and obtain employment opportunities.

Qualifications
  • A Law graduate with at least 4 years of post-qualification experience preferably in Corporate Real Estate or Construction/Infrastructure.
  • Knowledge of HR hiring practices and/or experience in coaching will be advantageous.
  • A hardworking and driven individual with strong written and verbal persuasive communication skills.
  • Proven relationship management skills with a passion to engage and nurture students establish industry networks and build communities.
  • Able to work independently as well as collaboratively with partners and colleagues to meet tight timelines and achieve goals.
  • IT savvy and familiar with online social mediums.

We regret only suitable candidates will be notified.

Please only apply through the NUS Careers site at www.nus.edu.sg/careers Executive & Professional Positions.

Job

Executive and Administrative

Primary Location

Kent Ridge

Organization

Centre for Future-Ready Graduates

Schedule

Full-time

Job Summary: In this role you will be responsible for processing complex confidential and time sensitive data. You will be looking for problem trends and seeking opportunities for process improvement. You will need to collaborate across multiple business functions as well as globally to ensure team success. Other primary responsibilities will include data analysis project management skills and customer service. You will have the opportunity to work and collaborate globally standardizing simplifying and automating HR operational processes and servicesEssential Duties of the Position:
  • You will partner with management and other key stakeholders to process complex confidential and time sensitive data
    • You will make recommendations participate in UAT testing implement systems and process improvements

Department: Dentistry

Description

The National University of Singapore (NUS) Faculty of Dentistry is the first dental school to be established by a British colony in the East in 1929. Today the Faculty produces graduates well-versed in dental disciplines of Prosthodontics; Endodontics; Periodontics; Orthodontics and Paediatric Dentistry; Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery; and Oral Sciences. The Faculty works closely with departments in the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and other teaching hospitals and institutions across Singapore in healthcare delivery and education. It also partners departments in other NUS faculties other public institutions and private enterprises in multi-disciplinary research activities. In addition the Faculty caters to an increased annual undergraduate intake to train more dental professionals with an expanded teaching space and advanced simulation laboratories to promote leading-edge and experiential dental training.

The Faculty has relocated to the new National University Centre for Oral Health Singapore (NUCOHS) in 2019. Together with NUCOHS clinical services education and research facilities are now placed under one roof. With the objective of transforming oral health in Singapore NUCOHS offers a broad range of dental services catering to the Singapore public and with specific focus on the elderly and those with special needs or medically complex conditions. The Faculty and NUCOHS is part of the National University Health System which is an integrated Academic and Regional Health System that delivers value-driven innovative and sustainable healthcare in Singapore.

About The Position

Assist the Faculty HR Head with the core HR Functions. This includes the execution and management of HR services and activities to support of the Faculty's overall human resource strategies and ensure that procedures are implemented in accordance with the University’s policies and procedures.

Duties And Responsibilities

  • Manpower Planning
    • Assists HR Head in manpower planning through monitoring and analysing of Faculty’s manpower movement skills mix scholarships attrition trends manpower norms etc to meet its short and long term needs
    • Assist HR Head in the follow-up and implementation of key plans such as talent management succession planning career progression local/foreign dependency employee engagement survey follow up actions etc.
  • Recruitment & Retention
    • Liaises with Line Heads on recruitment of staff and assists with review of their manpower requirements.
    • Sources for suitable candidates using the various recruitment channels and continuously explore innovative and alternative avenues to attract the right candidate for the job.
    • Conducts interviews for selection of candidates in order to obtain the right job fit.
    • Conducts new staff orientation programme including briefing staff on the employment terms as well as oversee the co-ordination of medical check-ups including verification of CHRS data inputs by HR Asst.
    • Oversees timely processing of staff confirmation work pass pass/contract expiry and/or renewals retirement and other types of cessation.
    • Conducts exit interviews. Highlights staff issues and recommend solutions for staff retention.
  • TPM / Compensation & Benefits
    • Assists HR Head to oversee the co-ordination of annual TPM exercise ranging from preparation/distribution of TPM forms to line Heads collation of TPM summary submission tabulation and preparation of analysis data for the moderation exercise up to returns and completion of TPM forms.
    • Assist HR Head to oversee increment and bonus payments and other relevant compensation items based on policy guidelines and staff's eligibility in accordance to their employment terms.
    • Assists HR Head with annual monitoring of career progression of staff on talent management scheme.
  • Employee relations grievance handling and disciplinary issues
    • Conducts staff counselling and grievance handling. Assists with staff disciplinary issues and inquiries.

  • Proficiency in MS Office programmes.
  • Mature and able to work independently.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills.

What’s the role?

We are looking for a people-oriented Human Resources Business Partner who is able to provide support on design and development of HR initiatives in support of the business area and HR strategies.

Who is Hilti?

If you’re new to the industry you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools technologies software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage built over 75 years and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 30000 people in more than 120 countries we’re a great place for you to show us your worth as you learn grow and carve-out your career.

What does the role involve?

As a HRBP you will work in partnership with the business area to manage development of their people providing advice guidance and ad-hoc training on Personal Development Plans. You get to work with the business area to establish and introduce systems that identify employees with high potential develop career paths in consideration of key roles for succession planning and self-development. You will also take the lead on learning and development areas of Hilti team leaders in HR leadership training.

What do we offer?

We’ll give you everything you need to excel in your role including ongoing training and lots of responsibilities from the start. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie as you’ll manage your own diary while being part of a friendly team.

We’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with development and career opportunities as soon as you’re ready for the next challenge.

Why should you apply?

We have an excellent mix of people which we believe makes for a more vibrant more innovative more productive team. So if you’ve never worked in construction that’s fine with us. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability regardless of your background.

What You Need Is
  • Degree in Human Resources Management or related discipline
  • 3-5 years of experience as a senior HR Professional in a commercially driven organization
  • Proven success in driving HR topics including: employee engagement employee relations talent management and recruitment
  • Strategic mind-set with ability to partner with key stakeholders in the business while leading business stakeholder from an operational perspective
  • Superior presentation and communication skills with ability to influence and interact across all levels of management
  • Proven experience working in a complex commercial organization and/or consulting role that requires detail orientation sound judgment and strong analytical skills
  • IT skills including MS-Office and related HR systems/databases
  • Ability to work successfully in a process driven organization with courage to challenge the status quo
  • International mobility for longer term career progression

As the Associate Director for Talent Acquisition you will partner with the Senior Management and Institutions Heads to drive the talent acquisition and employer branding strategies for the organisation enabling all institutions to meet their resourcing needs more effectively.

With a Team Supporting You Your Responsibilities Include
  • Review and refine the TA Strategy that outlines the key resourcing deployment and branding initiatives for the organization.
  • Review policies guidelines and service standards for talent acquisition and on-boarding/off-boarding.
  • Facilitate the hiring including pro-actively sourcing of suitable candidates for C-suite roles.
  • Work closely with institution HR to expand on Resourcing channels including e-platforms to enable a comprehensive search for talents for the organization while remaining cost effective.
  • Plan and drive pipeline programs to attract new / re-entrants into the healthcare sector including managing campus drives and career fairs locally and overseas in collaboration with institution HR.
  • Review and enhance the TA process for institutions and put in place measures to:
    • Bring on board new joiners with the right values and fit. Meet resourcing demands by departments on a timely basis.
    • Implement a company Employee Value Proposition.
  • Put in place a Resourcing system database and processes that are effective efficient and harmonized for the organisation in collaboration with the HR Technology team.
  • Work in close cooperation with Institutions and drive any organisation procurement of recruitment agency service providers for cluster level economies of scale.
  • Monitor and report on Recruitment channel effectiveness time-to-hire and cost indicators.
  • Lead manage coach and motivate a team to ensure effective efficient and professional execution of Resourcing channels and strategies.
  • Work with Institution CHROs to up-skill and improve the direct sourcing capabilities of their HR team.


Job Requirements
  • A degree from a recognised university.
  • Preferably in human resource or business related field.
  • At least 15 years of HR working experience including in the areas of resourcing and employer branding with at least 5 years of supervisory skills. Healthcare experience will be an added advantage.
  • Good knowledge in end-to-end recruitment process including but not limited to sourcing qualifying assessing salary trends relationship management and employer branding.
  • Well-versed in Microsoft Office programs and familiarity with SAP Success Factor’s recruitment on-boarding and off-boarding modules would be advantageous.
  • Proactive self-driven resilient and ability to work independently and highly adaptable in a team-based environment.
  • Excellent project and stakeholder management writing interpersonal and communications skills.

We are seeking a People Operations Specialist who will partner closely with the Director People & Culture in driving HR operational excellence for Doctor Anywhere in Singapore and the region. You will have an eye for detail and unwavering commitment to improve and streamline processes with the aim of improving our employee experience. As our People Operations Specialist you will be part of our People & Culture Team collaborating closely with Payroll Legal Finance teams and providing HR support for our managers and employees.

You are a rising HR star with an appreciation and understanding for technology. The ideal candidate will have a mindset of continuous improvement and change and will demonstrate curiosity collaboration and the ability to deal with ambiguity especially in a start-up environment.

Prior experiences in a HR Services / Operations function supporting Singapore Malaysia and preferably other countries such as Thailand Vietnam Philippines and India will be helpful. You are passionate about providing excellent internal client support across the entire organization.

This role reports directly to the regional Director People & Culture.

Responsibilities
  • You will be an employee facing member of the People & Culture team working closely with employees across the region from onboarding to offboarding.
  • Provide HR support to the business answering employee and manager questions about people policies and processes.
  • Maintain and audit data entered in our HR system during the employee lifecycle and run reports where necessary.
  • Maintain review and continuously update DA’s people policies and templates to ensure they remain relevant to the business and various employee groups.
  • Take ownership of immigrations benefits administration and HRIS.
  • Partner with the Director People & Culture in all regulatory compliance and audit related activities for Singapore and the region where appropriate.
  • Take on People & Culture projects with the rest of the team.


Requirements
  • 4-5 years HR Operations and/or HR Generalist experience
  • Unquestioned integrity and confidentiality.
  • Genuine curiosity and strong desire to continuously learn and grow.
  • Demonstrated client-service orientation with a clear approachable and friendly communication style with a positive customer service and solutions-focused attitude.
  • Tech savvy and comfortable with any HRIS (preferably Workday) GSuite especially Excel skills.
  • Detail oriented and have patience to audit and dive deep into HR data to determine patterns and check for inaccuracies.
  • Technical curiosity and interest in evolving trends in HR products and services.
  • Experience of working within a tech startup and hyper growth environment and one where there have been acquisitions and there are multiple legal entities to be managed.
  • Comfortable with fast paced operations and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves" to get things done.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly articulate policies and programs to employees.

The Manager Employee Experience and Relations derives insights from employee engagement tools. He/She liaise with business leaders to implement corrective action plans to enhance employee experiences.

He/She designs the employee engagement programmes based on employee experience strategy in alignment with the organisation's culture and values. He/She provides support to the Head Employee Experience and Relations when engaging in key negotiations that discuss the business and associated risks. He/She also manages team operations and performance.

He/She leads by example and is passionate about analysing issues and finding creative solutions to problems encouraging innovation within the team. He/She is diplomatic and highly skilled at engaging with others thereby promoting a co-operative work environment.

Are you an experienced HR manager just wanting a change or looking for the next step within your HR career? We are looking for a dynamic and engaging HR professional to lead the Asia side of our business.

MMR is an independent global consumer and sensory research agency specialising in food drink personal and household care research. We are industry leaders guiding best in class innovation for our clients – partnering with over 50% of the top 100 global food and drink brands

Our team of over 420 highly engaged multi-disciplined employees are primarily dynamic research professionals sensory experts and data scientists. We’re a diverse bunch with backgrounds in R&D insight marketing sensory science data sciences and psychology. We also boast a true global reach with offices in the UK US China Singapore Mumbai Thailand South Africa Columbia and Brazil

We are a “people first” company that prides itself on collaboration honesty and mutual trust. A company who obtained some fantastic feedback for company engagement and team spirit in a recent employee study with 80% of employees stating they’re happy and proud to work for MMR.

And one more thing we work with 50% of the world’s food and drink brands so the chances are the last time you went to the supermarket you bought something that we’ve influenced on its way to the shelves.

MMR is expanding and this is being driven by our fantastic people across the globe. As a HR Manager – Asia you will be an extension to our global HR team who are centred in the UK. As a business we recognise that our people are everything and we genuinely care about our employees and this is proven by the excellent feedback we have received across the business.

You will be part of an exceptional team who offer unprecedented support while still operating in a truly autonomous manner. Integral to the regions development you will be working in partnership with territory leads to further expand and develop the people strategy. As such you will be truly motivated by getting things done and fully prepared to take on all the tasks that will see this happen.

As a HR generalist you will be motivated by variety and will gain exposure to the full HR spectrum including but not limited to employee relations recruitment payroll welfare policy and procurement compensation and benefits and all associated admin needs along the way.

You will be driving strategy that supports the business across Singapore China Thailand and India. The needs for each division can vary considerably and you will work in partnership with divisional leads to instil real confidence and support with regards to the HR initiative.

What You Will Be Doing
  • You will be the first point of contact for all employees and managers based in Asia providing expert advice on all day to day HR generalist matters in the region.
  • Providing comprehensive working knowledge of employment law across Asia most notably Singapore and China to provide full guidance on governmental compliance and industry trends in the region.
  • Comfortable managing and developing people from differing cultures and successfully processing all visa and work permit requirements.
  • Working in partnership with managers to ensure that employees are adequately inducted and trained to carry out their roles while working collaboratively with other divisions.
  • Working in tandem with the Global HR team to implement HR initiatives locally.
  • Prepare and process payroll successfully.
  • Support the Company’s Managing and Appraising Performance (MAPS) process to ensure employees have a clear view on their development and career progression.
  • Taking a lead on the recruitment of new talent by sourcing viable candidates through various channels assessing their suitability to the company and oversee the full recruiting cycle.
  • Providing unprecedented assistance and support to managers to drive and uphold the culture of the Company and interaction between staff and managers.
  • Providing an independent approachable and confidential welfare service to staff and managers.
  • Remain abreast of existing policies and procedures and develop new ones as and when required in line with company administration needs and ISO requirements.


Requirements

 You know you’re right for this role if…
  • You have strong knowledge of and experience with a wide array of HR programs and practices including recruitment performance management compensation coaching employee relations and organizational development in Singapore and China.
