Job Summary

The (Assistant) Manager HR Operations reports to the Chief HR Office and oversees and manages effectively the full spectrum of HR functional duties management of all employment related events activities and policies in alignment with the Group’s business strategies ensuring compliance to all legal requirements. He/she ensures HR processes are efficiently managed and policies are properly executed by all departments.

Job Responsibilities
  • Manage effectively the full spectrum of HR operational duties ensure the work processes are effective and efficient and within the operating budget. Review the efficiencies and compile for management reporting.
  • Execute employment strategies and actions meeting the business needs and in compliance to legal requirements. Formulate recruitment strategies and manage transfers and promotions to effectively recruit and retain talents to meet with manpower needs in a proactive manner.
  • Communicate and promote a performance-based work culture ensure proper performance management procedures are implemented and followed across all Group entities. Implement and administer training and development plans.
  • Coordinate and assist the line managers to identify and development of high potential employees for succession planning and to conduct regular reviews to ensure the developmental plans are properly implemented.

  • Manage all HR related files and confidential records are updated and well kept and to comply with regulatory requirements.
  • Actively participate in the business planning process and cost management initiatives. Assist in Corporate Social Responsibility work and ensure a safe work environment is in place.

  • Perform other work duties as directed by the Chief HR Officer.

Reporting to the Regional HR Manager the Talent Acquisition Manager will be responsible in delivering sourcing strategy as well as managing recruitment processes in South-east Asia and Oceania.

Specific Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with all relevant stakeholders to develop and deliver effective recruiting processes that aligns with business development objectives:

    • ­ Draft job descriptions skills requirements and specifications in coordination with hiring manager
    • ­ Organize sourcing with Asia HR networks follow up and coordinate sourcing and recruitment processes
    • ­ Conduct sourcing for all job requirements (proposals tender submissions and projects) including ‘passive’ candidates by optimizing all available tools (company careers website social media job boards employee referrals and all other recruiting tools)
    • ­ Establish and update very regularly the Egis Asia talent database.
    • ­ Conduct initial screening of candidates professional reference checks and CV scoring.
    • ­ Coordinate technical interviews and assessments and ensure that interviewers are familiar with the candidate’s profile and the required competencies per positions (basic non-negotiable and special requirements).
    • ­ Draft pre-conditional offer discuss conditions and finalize negotiations with successful candidates.
    • ­ Communicate systematically with unsuccessful candidates.
    • ­ Communicate proactively with hiring managers on recruitment progress.
  • Implement and maintain Egis Asia talent database in close coordination with Asia HR network
  • Develop and implement an effective talent pipeline and sourcing strategies to attract target talents and to create a strong pool for common critical and difficult-to-fill positions.
  • Work with local HR to deliver recruitment best practices and to enhance the overall candidate experience from sourcing to onboarding of new hires.
  • Work with Egis Recruitment Managers in other geographical zones (India Middle East France etc.).
  • Conduct periodic research of industry trends and competitions market insights and talent landscape.
  • Ensure the proper documentation of all profiles recruitment files and records in accordance with Egis policies and processes.
  • Prepare recruitment reports as required and ensure its prompt and accurate submission.

Company Overview

CapitaLand Limited (CapitaLand) is one of Asia’s largest diversified real estate groups. Headquartered and listed in Singapore it owns and manages a global portfolio worth S$131.9 billion as at 31 December 2019. CapitaLand’s portfolio spans across diversified real estate classes which includes commercial retail; business park industrial and logistics; integrated development urban development; as well as lodging and residential. With a presence across more than 200 cities in over 30 countries the Group focuses on Singapore and China as its core markets while it continues to expand in markets such as India Vietnam Australia Europe and the USA.

At CapitaLand we advocate fair employment practices and recruit talents based on merit and fit with our Corporate values. We provide equal opportunity for all qualifed persons and build an inclusive workplace regardless of race gender age religious belief or nationality.

Neuron is the fastest growing micro-mobility operator in Asia Pacific and the leading shared e-scooter company across Australia and New Zealand. We partner with cities to connect people and places in a safe convenient and fun way. We are driven to help the world build a more prosperous and sustainable future through new ways of moving and connecting.

Neuron started the world's first scooter sharing platform in Singapore in 2016. We develop our own industry-leading e-scooters which are purpose built for sharing and safety. We also set the industry standard for technology that manages them. Neuron has launched an impressive range of world firsts particularly when it comes to safety. We currently operate in ten locations including Adelaide Brisbane Darwin Canberra Townsville and Auckland and will soon be expanding to the United Kingdom.

These Are Neuron's Values

Make it happen
We are driven by results make commitments with integrity and consistently make an impact.

Be proactive
We take ownership of tasks that help us build sustainable growth.

Trust facts over opinions
Whenever possible we make the logical choice based on data and known truths.

Stay curious
We embrace the habit of asking questions challenging assumptions and revisiting convictions.

Do more with less
Profit allows us to continue serving our users. We must be efficient and resourceful.

The Role
You will be reporting to the Head of Talent Acquisition. You will have the opportunity to directly impact the company's growth by bringing the right talent on-board and be at the forefront of global expansion initiatives.

  • Work closely with the hiring managers to understand the business needs and lead high-quality end-to-end recruitment process not limited to:
  • Draft the Job Descriptions whenever needed
  • Performing phone screening and driving the interview process to qualify candidates for the role
  • Administering appropriate company assessments to candidates
  • Presenting the offers/ leading the salary negotiations/ contract preparation and signing
  • Identify source and secure the top talent in the specific cities of business operations
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on staffing plans to achieve organizational goals
  • Be creative in sourcing strategies and use boolean searches sourcing platforms to post advertisements to attract and improve the talent funnel
  • Be proactive in recommendations on how to improve on the candidate new hire and hiring manager overall experience.


What You'll Need
  • Bachelor's degree in business human resource management or equivalent
  • 2-4 years of experience in recruitment handling generalist roles in a start-up environment
  • Excellent track record of execution with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Experience with Greenhouse is highly preferabl
  • Passion for excellence
  • Agility to excel in a constantly changing and rapidly growing workplace
  • A keen interest in shared mobility and a growth mindset is essential to this role

If you are passionate about making a real-time impact and want the opportunity to play an instrumental part in our growth story we want you!

 Sentosa Development Corporation (SDC) was established on 1 September 1972 as a Statutory Board under the Ministry of Trade and Industry. As Director Human Resource Development you will define and implement corporate organizational development (OD) and learning and development (L&D) strategies plans and policies which are aligned with the delivery of the Organisation’s Strategic Plan.

You will also provide specialist expertise to the Divisional Director HR & Administration and the Senior Executive Team in the development of organisational culture competency planning talent management & succession planning leadership development employee engagement learning & development and all aspects of organisational change and development interventions.

You will lead and manage a specialist team of OD and learning practitioners in the development and delivery of aligned programmes including the provision of team and individual solutions across the organisation aligned with the Strategic Plan.

Other Key Responsibilities Include
  • Manage the implementation of OD TM and L&D Strategies Plans and Policies against agreed corporate time frames and budget and reporting based on agreed performance measures.
  • In partnership with the Divisional Director develop the corporate People Strategy and Operational Plan and support the Divisional Director in the management and development of the Division.
  • Lead the development and oversee the implementation of a culture of continuous learning and development aligned with the requirements of the company’s current and future strategies.
  • Lead the development of integrated systems to support learning needs analysis objective setting and development planning. Drive the development of effective learning for the enabling of objectives building capabilities and driving performance.
  • Design and lead Succession Planning and Talent management across the organization. Identify and strengthen bench strength for the critical positions. Identify and develop talent as well as build accelerated pipeline pathways including managed moves and targeted assignments.
  • Develop and implement the Leadership & Management Development Framework deliver key performance targets and key corporate objectives such as the implementation of learning and development solutions to support reflective leadership and management practice objective setting and personal development planning.
  • Lead and provide leadership for the development and implementation of the Organisational Capability Framework and ensure that all activities across the OD & Learning Plans are organised to ensure a coordinated approach to program delivery.
  • Lead and provide leadership for the development of a highly engaged workforce through holistic engagement strategies and an effective leadership culture.
  • Facilitate the delivery of executive coaching and high quality action learning to senior directors and service heads across the Organisation.
  • Design and facilitate the implementation of Values workshops gamifications and awards to foster and support the organizational culture. Embed and reinforce the culture through various HR processes and systems.
  • Work with the Director HRM to ensure that all implications of operational & organisational development activities are fully understood and that there is an integrated response to delivery across both functions.
  • Develop and embed an approach to the evaluation of organisational development and learning activities and ensure the delivery of key objectives and impactful or value add outcomes.

  • Responsible to updating employee information in the HRMS System (Times Software) and Biometrics.
  • Possess a high level of professionalism and integrity whilst maintaining the confidentiality of the Human Resources Department
  • Maintain understanding of current Human Resources Management practices and ensure compliance with Ministry of Manpower legislation to minimize litigation issues
  • Assist with Managing Ministry of Manpower Pass Applications and Renewals
  • Assist in a range of Human Resources Functions including but not limited to data entry reporting and filing
  • Carry out any other related duties as directed by the Human Resources Manager


Job Requirements
  • Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in Human Resource Management or equivalent.
  • At least 1-2 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
  • Preferably Junior Executive specialized in Human Resources or equivalent.

Job Title: Senior Regional HR Manager| Business Partnering (Learning & Development| Talent Management| Organisation Development)
Job Description:
Senior Regional HR Manager Business Partnering

(Learning & Development Talent Management Organisation Development)

The Senior Regional HR Manager plays a pivotal role in strategic planning policy framework engagement implementation and making things work seamlessly and to optimise emerging business needs (especially in B2B) and outcomes.

The role reports to the HR Director and shall manage a team of direct reports in HR.

A highly visible role engaging with senior leaders across the region and supporting transformation in line with HR strategy and business goals.

Responsibilities


Talent Management: Identification & development
  • Develop talent management framework to build talent for immediate and mid-term growth
  • Introduce succession planning and talent development plans
  • Develop different development tracks for talent e.g. job rotation
  • Introduce trainee and mentoring program to enhance talent development

Learning Academy
  • Develop framework to build talent and enhance competencies
  • Design relevant course curriculum to train and equip employees
  • Introduce bite networking sessions to engage and motivate employees
  • Identify and implement customized training programs according to different categories of employees
  • Coach managers to better motivate their employees

Drive Employee Engagement
  • Implement appropriate interventions based on employees’ feedback from Employee Engagement survey
  • Introduce virtual tech savvy programs for enhanced collaboration among employees in the region
  • Improve employee communication for stronger alignment with Corporate Vision
  • Build stronger team spirit and trust with all the sales subsidiaries in the Asean region

HR Competitiveness with the Market
  • Introduce and implement best practice and relevant strategies to raise HR standards. Have good external network to be able to conduct adhoc benchmark.
  • Communicate with conviction to gain buy-in from all levels of employees.


Requirements
  • Degree or equivalent
  • Able to apply HR strategy to realise the Company vision
  • 15 to 20 years of strong HR transformation experience in MNC environment
  • Led in digitization efforts in employee engagement talent management learning and development
  • Strong facilitation skills to conduct and facilitate stand up training
  • Strong operational person who is detailed in handling end to end project implementation
  • Seasoned and very experienced HR Sr Manager who has strong leadership skills (i.e. must have direct reports preferably at manager level)
  • Exposure / Experience with the full spectrum of HR Functions
  • Good to have regional experience (a plus)
